Description:
About the role:

 Join our talented team as a React.js developer
 Become a valuable contributor to an exciting greenfield project
 Join a company with more than 20 years of experience building software
 Contribute to our existing products which already cater to thousands of users
 Option to work from home or at our Chatswood-based office (Sydney, NSW)
 Position available to developers Australia-wide. If you are located in another state you will periodically be flown to Sydney for company events
 Join an environment that will constantly be offering opportunities for career development, with clear pathways to more senior positions

Essential

 1+ years working with JavaScript and React
 Ability to take designs and wireframes produced by the product team and turn them into high-quality code
 Familiarity with RESTful APIs and how to call them
 Experience working with Git, a version control repository like Bitbucket / Github
 Experience working in a goal-orientated team, with strong collaboration skills
 Great communication, comfortable working with internal product stakeholders and other engineers
 Australian citizen or PR currently residing in Australia

Desirable

 Experience working with MUI / Material UI libraries
 Experience converting Figma wireframes into production-ready code
 Experience working with Storybook for testing and reviewing components
 Experience using Jest, other React Testing Frameworks
 Experience working with Swagger or equivalent RESTful API documentation
 Experience working with the Atlassian product suite: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket
 Experience writing React Native applications

Fixed Term, full-time appointment (to 30 June 2025) 
  Flexible/remote working arrangements available 
  Level 6/7: $83,130 - $102,937 + 17% Superannuation 
 
 The Faculty of Science, Medicine and Health (SMAH) is positioned to be a major force in connected and science-embedded education and translational science, medical and health research in Australia. Empowered by first-class teaching and driven by active research and discovery towards being in the top 1% of Universities in the world, this Faculty combines the very best of science, with strong capacity for translation to our global communities’ needs and aspirations. 
 Dementia Training Australia (DTA) is funded by the Commonwealth Government as part of its Dementia Training Program initiative. DTA is a University of Wollongong-led consortium which is currently entering its 7th year of operation, bringing together the expertise of Australia’s leading dementia educators from four Australian universities and Dementia Australia. 
 The role will be responsible for carrying out analysis, development and maintenance of Dementia Training Australia’s (DTA) business systems, applications and the technologies that underpin operational requirements. You will also contribute to the development and implementation of software solutions that enable DTA to deliver and report on web-based services that are both efficient and secure. 
 You will be prompted to respond to a selection criteria questionnaire as part of the application process. For further information about this position, please contact Paul Erickson, Technical Lead/Senior Developer via email perickson@uow.edu.au
  
 Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Only candidates with valid work rights in Australia are eligible to apply 
 Closing Date: Sunday 7 May 2023, 11:59 PM 
 The University of Wollongong is committed to workplace equity, diversity and inclusion. We value and acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures that they bring to work with them each day. Embracing diversity and creating inclusion is a key component of attracting and retaining talent in our workforce. The creation of a diverse and inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential, enhance our success and achieving our vision of being in the Top 1% of universities globally. 
 The University of Wollongong is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, and a recognised leader in gender equality, we encourage and welcome applications from a diverse range of backgrounds and people including: culturally and linguistically diverse, women, disability, LGBTIQ+, and Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Description:
Company Description
  i-Motor, as part of carsales, provides website solutions both here in Australia and internationally, to automotive OEM's & dealers, as well as dealers in other industries including caravans, bikes, boats, trucks and equipment.
  It has achieved excellent growth since its creation twelve years ago and currently has a team of 40+ employees managing 1,700+ websites.
  What’s on offer:
 
   A place where you can move your career forward, where you’ll be continuously backed to make new ideas happen, and the chance to do work that makes real, significant impact in the world.
   Hybrid working arrangements.
   We’re a certified Great Place to Work, Family Friendly Workplace and WGEA Employer of Choice.
   The support of a highly engaged, high-performing team including a leadership team that’s you’ll actually have face time with.
 
 
 

 Job Description
  What you’ll do:
  As a junior front-end developer, this 12-month fixed term contract will allow you to build on your existing skills, joining our talented development team at i-Motor, you'll work across various projects that will challenge and excite you.
 
   Maintain responsive websites for our dealership customers.
   Assist with quality control and performance optimisation.
   Provide well documented, reliable and maintainable code.
   Research development improvements and keep up to date with best software practices.
   Collaborate and connect with our team of FE, BE and Full-Stack developers.
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  What are we looking for?
 
   Knowledge and experience with HTML, CSS (sass) and JS manipulation of the DOM
   Some knowledge of server-side scripting in any platform
   Experience with performance, optimisation and validation of HTML CSS and JS
   Understanding of browser developer tools
   Keen eye for visual patterns and UI component modularity
   Any experience with AWS, Lambda functions, Node JS or React JS a bonus.
 
  Additional Information
  A few other things we want to let you know about...
 
   i-Motor is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on
   fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage everyone of all ages, genders and backgrounds to apply. If you’re a candidate with a disability or you’ll need some adjustments to be at your best, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.
   We are a proud Circle Back Initiative Employer which means we are committed to responding to every job applicant.
   Successful candidates joining the i-Motor team are required to undergo
   a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis

Growing startup on the beach seeks experienced frontend developer full time! 
  About Us. 
   Tyroola is an exciting, dynamic new start-up specialising in the online retail of automotive tyres, operating from Sydney and the Sunshine Coast. Our mission is to become market-leader in the industry through innovation, and optimisation of market processes to provide our customers with the accessibility, and value they deserve. 
   Our business is now expanding at pace, and we are now looking for additional individuals to grow with us. 
   About You. 
   You are a senior frontend developer experienced in designing, developing and maintaining large-scale web applications. We're looking for a team player who loves solving problems in an agile and creative way. 
   Our system is built from scratch to meet the business requirements without compromise, so you should have demonstrable experience in modern JS and CSS frameworks (React, Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation) and their related backend services. We make use of the newest open source technologies where possible to develop best-in-class products - so be very comfortable working with and on open source software. Above all, you should share our desire to create great software! 
   Role requirements. 
   We are looking for someone: 
   
   with several years experience designing, developing and maintaining complex web applications, preferably involving e-Commerce 
   who can create, and test your Cross-browser solutions 
   focusing on clean, Responsive and mobile-first implementations 
   with extensive knowledge with either REST APIs or GraphQL-Backends 
   who is familiar with Gulp, Webpack, Bower 
   with excellent communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to self-manage 
  
  From a senior frontend developer we would like to see some of the following as well: 
   Demonstrable experience in: 
   
   OOP in the ECMAScript 6 stack using a modern frontend framework such as React or Flux 
   Unit Testing (Mocha, Jasmine) 
   Integration Testing (CasperJS or Selenium) 
   designing and implementing RESTFul APIs 
  
  Nice to haves: 
  
   good PHP OOP knowledge 
   working with cloud systems like AWS, Digital Ocean 
   experience with CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins) 
   experience in using any virtualization software (e.g. VirtualBox with vagrant), experience with working with production systems 
   Big Plus: Worked in a Start-up before! 
   
  You’ll take ownership of all things front-end in our products and projects, working as part of our engineering teams. 
   The main focus will be the development of our e-commerce framework, which includes a highly extensible and scalable system, spread over several cloud based servers. 
   We implement designs under the clean code principle and make use of all the tools out there helping, measuring and tracking to improve the code quality. 
   Exciting projects in the coming months will be for example new white-label solutions like we did with Supercheap Auto, our international expansion and deeper integration with our offline partners. 
   About Our Offer. 
  
   The role remote 
   Relaxed environment, working with a small team of dedicated, passionate individuals 
   A flat hierarchy and transparency. You have a chance to directly influence the technology and business. 
   
  Send your application to careers@tyroola.com.au.

Junior Front End Developer Full Time Opportunity  The Junior Front-end Developer role will support the wider Front-End Development team to maintain, update and enhance the web assets Greenstone manages, including websites, landing pages, and online application forms.  They will work closely with stakeholders, the Development Lead and other Developers to deliver timely, high-quality outcomes by ensuring the level of design and development delivered to the business enables Greenstone to continue to lead the market with innovation and agility.  What are we looking for? 
  
  Up to 1 years professional working experience in the Front-End Web Development space or freelance work experience 
  Working knowledge and understanding of JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3 skills 
  Experience developing responsive websites for mobile devices 
  Experience using Git for version control, and familiarity with Gitflow 
  Experience using automated task runners and bundlers, such as Gulp, or Rollup 
  Ability to translate creative concepts and design templates into flexible code templates 
  Analytical skills as well as being in touch with the latest developments in search strategy and the latest trends in online behaviour 
  Ability to work as part of a team 
  High level attention to detail and the ability to produce organised, tidy, and well-documented code 
  Ability to manage workflow under pressure 
  
 Desirable 
  
  Tertiary level qualifications (e.g., bachelor's degree or higher) in a relevant computer science discipline 
  Excellent understanding of website usability, accessibility, security and information architecture 
  Understanding of SEO requirements and techniques 
  Understanding of Web Performance and Googles Core Web Vital scores 
  Corporate web design/development experience ideally within the financial services space 
  Experience working with Content Management Systems 
  Experience with one or more server-side languages 
  Experience working in ASP.Net Razor and C# 
  JavaScript library experience such as Svelte or React 
  Wireframing/Design skills 
  Experience working with a headless CMS such as Kontent.ai (formerly Kentico Kontent) 
  Experience using Jira or other products in the Atlassian suite 
  Understanding and appreciation of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) 
  Experience working in an Agile environment 
  Ability to code efficiently and effectively 
  Strong communication and organizational skills 
  Ability to develop websites which are cross-browser and cross-platform compatible
 
  
  
  
   
    
     
      
        Our Promise to Our People  We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. We recognise that our colleagues are the key to our success. That's why you can expect to be rewarded for the hard work you put in through job satisfaction, career development and the fantastic range of benefits we offer:
        
        
        Fantastic employee benefits including flexi days, flexible working, annual $1200 travel/parking allowance & more 
        State of the art building facilities including a dedicated & subsidised on-site company café (weekly free lunch) & on-site gym 
        Health & well-being initiatives and programs 
        Opportunity to take part in in-house leadership & emotional intelligence workshops 
        Quarterly award functions and a grand annual conference to recognise our people 
        Retail discounts e.g. movie tickets, Taronga Zoo entry, live shows + more 
        Morsl market (a fully automated self-serve, food and drink marketplace with a wide variety of meals, snacks and drinks) 
        
       Who We Are  We are an innovative company with diverse brands and operating divisions, who work together as one team. We strive to be the best provider of direct financial products by placing customers at the heart of everything we do. We care about what we do and we care about making a positive impact on our community.  We have an inclusive and diverse culture. We work in a positive and energetic environment where you can expect to find professional colleagues, driven to achieve results.  Location  Great central location in Norwest Business Park, Norwest, only a short walk from Norwest Metro station and also direct bus access from Parramatta and Blacktown.  Apply Now

July 28, 2021
 
 
   We are hiring! We’re looking for a Web Developer to join our team. While you may not have heard of our name, there’s every chance we’ve powered at least some of your online payments in the past decade. We’re going through an exciting growth period, and are seeking team members to join work on our Acquiring, Billing, Merchant Services and Risk platforms.
   We are a small team who believe that a workplace should be relaxed, friendly and flexible. We are based Australia-wide, with an established remote-first culture. Sydney based staff may make use of the Surry Hills office (a short walk from Central train station).
   About Fat Zebra
   Fat Zebra - A payments platform for today's internet economy - is a Sydney-based Payment Services Gateway which connects merchants across the APAC region to Banks, Fraud Tools and billing platforms to simplify how they accept payments. We specialise in high volume, real time processing for ecommerce and mobile transactions. 
  Ideal candidates will have:
  
    Experience working alongside designers to turn UX / Design templates into working web applications
    Strong TypeScript / JavaScript experience.
    Proficiency with modern tools like React, Redux, TypeScript and webpack.
    Strong knowledge of modern HTML & CSS
    Experience with at least one front end framework, preferably Bootstrap or Bulma
    Experience building graphs & charts using Highcharts, D3 or similar.
    Experience with Node
    Experience in refactoring / modernising legacy front end code
  
   Note: Fat Zebra engineers come from a varied set of backgrounds. If you’re deeply interested in or passionate about payments, and can demonstrate how you could help us deliver world class web experiences, reach out, even if you have not worked with the specific technologies listed.
   Working At Fat Zebra
   As a Fat Zebra web developer, you will work on delivering exceptional experiences for our merchants. You will have the opportunity to deep dive into cutting edge payments technologies and learn to become a subject matter expert.
   Software Development
  
    You will be responsible for the implementation and extension of our customer-facing products, including PayNow, Merchant Dashboard and Reseller Dashboard.
    Work alongside designers and back-end engineers to produce work according to requirements
    Deliver high performance / scalable solutions
    Design end-to-end solutions when delivering features.
    Submit High Quality PRs
    Review PRs to a high standard
    Take part in business hours support duties
  
   Our Principles
   At Fat Zebra we believe in behaving in a professional & supportive manner. The payments industry is full of complex jargon and overloaded terminology. Mistakes are easy to make. We support both new and existing staff by working to the following principles:
  
    Be polite. Interactions with peers are always kind. Argue against an idea - never against the person.
    Be pragmatic. Seek to deliver on the bigger picture of generating value for our customers over perfection in code.
    Be helpful. We believe the best work-places are ones where we know there is always someone available to help if we need it. Respond promptly when someone asks for help.
    Be bold. Strive to go outside your comfort zone. We are a small team - and we frequently go into uncharted territory. Even if failure is possible, learning is guaranteed.
  
   To apply
   Please send your cv (.pdf, .txt, .doc) to jobs@fatzebra.com. Make sure to put the position you are applying for, along with your full name in the 'subject' of the email.

Job Title: Front End React Developer-Sydney HQ Digital Analytics Company
Location: Remote in Sydney Central Business District NSW
Description:
The Company:
  Elida is working alongside a great digital analytics tech-start up on their search for a Mid-level Front End Developer (React) to join them at an incredibly busy and exciting time to contribute to their Software Engineering effort in 2021. These guys driven forward in leaps and bounds over the last couple of years and, having built an established Dev outfit of some very talented React/Node enthusiasts in Sydney, are now looking for another talented Front End Developers to join them.
  The role:
  As part of a software development team, you will create complex, enterprise-transforming business applications by writing quality software code and, simultaneously, focusing on continual learning and development.
  This is an excellent opportunity for a developer with strong technical skills, a passion for quality and experience of creating and supporting mid-sized web applications. The culture is fit for developers who excel in a fast paced, dynamic, DevOps environment and who relish the opportunity to further their career working as part of an agile energetic scale up.
  What we are looking for:
  You will be an experienced and proactive developer with solid skills in ReactJS. You will have a strong focus on delivering quality through effective design, and experience using modern software practices such as, BDD, TDD, process automation, test automation and Agile. You should hold a basic understanding of relational databases. In addition you will hold the following skills:
  Essential:
 
   Proficient in ReactJS
   HTML and CSS (Sass)
   Comfortable working with JSON and integrating with system back end (developed by our back end development team)
 
  Desirable:
 
   React Native experience or knowledge
   Experience in another frontend framework (Angular)
   Experience working in sprints
   Experience of Agile development approaches and use of Jira or equivalent
   Exposure to AWS technologies
 
  Benefits:
 
   Working from home 5 days a week option
   Operational bonus scheme
   Pension scheme
   Healthcare and Dental
   Subsidised Canteen
   On-site Gym
   Cycle to Work Scheme
   Free fruit everyday
   Summer Party, Winter Party, Christmas Party

Mable is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. 
  People with lived experience of disability or personal experience with the aged care system are strongly encouraged to apply. 
 
 
  
 
  Our interview processes are inclusive and will accommodate additional needs when required.
 
 
 
   A little about us...
 
 
   Founded in 2014, Mable has become one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech marketplaces. Our platform is an online community of independent support workers who offer their services directly to people who are seeking aged care or disability support.
 
 
 
   We’re thrilled to have been recognised within AFR’s Fast 100 list in 2021, Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 2021 Awards and we won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award 2020! This is an awesome opportunity to join a thriving scale up whose profit for purpose mission is transforming the aged care and disability support sectors.
 
 
 
   Mission: We’re redefining support for disability and aged care in Australia by helping people who are aging or living with disability to connect with independent support people in their community.
 
 
 
   Watch this - 
  What we do
 
 
 
   About the positionAs our WordPress Developer, you will be responsible for development tasks relating to our mable.com.au WordPress website. You will be responsible for both back-end and front-end development including the implementation of WordPress themes and plugins as well as site integration and security updates.
 
 
   We are on a journey of improving our website experience, so this will be a mix of tactical maintenance tasks and long-term strategic development. You’ll be accepting briefs from our team through Jira, but also provide best practices and guidance to us in terms of execution.
 
 
 
   How you will make an impactWe take user experience very seriously at Mable and as such, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional user experience through your implementation and problem-solving skills. We take great pride in making our experience as accessible as possible for a wide range of users and you will contribute towards making sure that our website delivers an exceptional user experience.
 
  What will I be doing?
 
   Designing and building the website front-end to best practice principles
   Work with UX/UI designers and QA to make sure our WordPress website is designed and developed purposefully and meets high accessibility standards
   Designing and managing the website back-end including database and server integration.
   Meeting with stakeholders to discuss website design and function.
   Mentoring junior developersGenerating detailed documentation of the processesBuilding and maintaining WordPress themes and plugins.
   Conducting website performance tests.
   Continuously optimising infrastructure to ensure site speed is maximised. Troubleshooting content issues.
   Conducting WordPress training on new features.
   Monitoring the performance of the live website.
 
  What are we looking for?
 
   Proven work experience as a WordPress developer
   Proven experience mentoring junior developers
   Proven experience leading teams
   Knowledge of front-end technologies including CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, Bootstrap framework, HTML5, and jQuery.
   Ability to work autonomously and proactively seek solutions
   Knowledge of GIT including feature branching, and merge conflicts
   Experience working with debugging tools such as Chrome Inspector and Firebug.
   Good understanding of website architecture and aestetics.
   Ability to manage projects.
   Experience using JIRA and Confluence.
   Good communication skills.
 
 
   Life at Mable
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFE2 
  Sydney CBD Office - Two minutes walk from Town Hall Station, we’ve recently taken over an entire floor of the Hilton Hotel building with state-of-the-art facilities and tools you need to get the job done (hello, #scaleup life).
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFE0 
  Hybrid working model - We love to encourage a healthy balance between team collaboration and home/ family commitments.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCBB 
  WFH Set Up Allowance - A generous $800 to help you kit out your home office.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCB5 
  Competitive Remuneration - Everyone at Mable contributes to the bigger picture mission so we want you to feel financially rewarded.
 
 
   ❤️‍\uD83E\uDE79 
  Wellbeing & Mental health - We offer floating public holidays and access to our Employee Assistance Program (App + counselling).
 
 
   \uD83C\uDF82 
  Time away from our desks to recharge - Enjoy additional days off to celebrate your birthday, support your community by tapping into our ‘volunteer day’ or just have a day to yourself through our ‘wellbeing day’.
 
 
   ✈️ 
  Explore the world - You have the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for up to 4-weeks each year.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDC68\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC69\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC67\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC66\uD83C\uDFFB 
  Family comes first - Make the most of our Paid Parental Leave - a gender neutral policy for primary (14 weeks + super) and secondary (6 weeks + super) carers.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCAA\uD83C\uDFFE 
  Stay fit - Discounted gym memberships and classes.
 
 
   \uD83E\uDD6A 
  We love to eat - Our pantry and fridges are fully stocked for your convenience.
 
 
   \uD83E\uDEF6\uD83C\uDFFE 
  Diversity & Inclusion - We are constantly empowering our employees and creating a culture of greater inclusion. We are endorsed by Work180 as an accredited employer for women in tech.
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFC6 
  Anniversary Awards - Be rewarded through our recognition program with awesome goodies and rewards to celebrate your successes and tenure at Mable.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDC97 
  Accelerate your career - Be a part of one of Australia's fastest growing Marketplaces. We are a scale-up tech-co and our people are a huge part of this. We want all of our Mablers to feel supported in their careers and for Mable to be the place where they can grow to their full potential.
 
 
 
   Culture within the Mablehood - Our values
 
 
   All About People - We put our customers at the centre of everything we do.
 
 
   Better Together - We are stronger, better and faster when we work together.
 
 
   Challenge Openly - Speak up. Candid discussion helps us make better decisions.
 
 
   Do The Right Thing, Always - We hold ourselves to the highest standard. What we say and do matters.
 
 
   Cr
  Eate Impact - We are passionate about having an impact.
 
 
 
   We are one
 
 
   We’re endorsed by Work180 which showcases our commitment to our policies, flexible working and inclusion practices for women in tech - visit our page here.
 
 
 
   If this role has stood out to you but you don’t feel like you ‘’tick all the boxes’’, we strongly encourage you to apply nonetheless. We value diversity across experience and you might well just bring something to the Mablehood that we are looking for!
 
 
 
   We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
 
 
 
   Where to find us online

Junior Front End Developer Full Time Salary Movie World, Oxenford, Gold Coast 
  Explore the possibility of creating memories that last lifetimes with a career at Village Roadshow Theme Parks! Our company comprises of Warner Bros. Movie World, Wet ’n’ Wild, Paradise Country, Australian Outback Spectacular, Village Roadshow Studios, Topgolf, Sea World and Sea World Resort. Apply today to see what employment opportunities await and find your dream job at one of the most exciting tourist attractions on the Gold Coast! 
 
   About the Perks!
   
  
   Unlimited free entry to our amazing theme parks
   Earn complimentary passes for family and friends
   Enjoy discounts on food & beverage, retail and animal experiences 
   Enjoy a wide variety of discounts throughout our properties and access to our Village Employee Benefits App which is partnered with more than 65 major retailers! 
   Exclusive and unique team member events and awards 
   Reward and Recognition incentives and prizes
   On site Wellbeing Team and access to our EAP with 24/7 support
   Opportunity for professional development & internal training, we strive to grow our talent!
  
  
  The opportunity: We are looking for an enthusiastic graduate/junior front end Web Developer, you will be hands on within the development team and represent an integral member of the team, delivering quality, timely updates and enhancements to ensure business needs and user requirements are met. You will report to the Digital Delivery manager and work closely with all areas of the business. Your responsibilities will include working on updates and new features to existing web sites and internal web-based business systems to support the day to day running of all areas of the business. 
 
   Your day to day:
   
  
   Work closely with end users, designers and business management to ensure that our web solutions meet the business and user requirements.
   Responsible for delivering quality code with specific emphasise on testability.
   Learning and developing your skills on the job.
   Contributing to the success of the digital delivery team responsible for driving digital transformation within the business.
   Working in an Agile environment that aims to deliver continuous software improvement using scrum and sprint cycles.
  
  
 
   What you’ll bring:
   
  
   Looking for a graduate with a passion for Software Development and a can do attitude
   Some experience of web development in the past, maybe some personal projects
   A desire to work with and learn new tools and frameworks, such as, React, Bootstrap, Sass, Javascript
   If you’ve ever contributed or published anything to a public Github repo or other similar source code repo, we’ll be very impressed
   Team player that is also capable of working independently and autonomously.
   Excellent communication and documentation skills you should possess a willingness to contribute to team meetings and discussions.

Cover Genius is a Series D insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Hopper, Skyscanner, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee. Our partners integrate with XCover, our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year.
 
 
 
   Our team and products have been recognised with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times who ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commits itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.
 
 
 
   Our People are
 
 
   Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired
 
 
 
   Our People are not
 
 
   Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious
 
 
 
   The Front End Developer will play a pivotal role in contributing to the look and feel of our products and enhancing the user experience. This will involve utilising modern front-end technology (e.g. React) to fully represent users’ needs and architect, develop and release user-facing features to sustain and enhance the quality of our products. Your versatility and openness to responsibility, despite how difficult the task is, will enable you to contribute to the continuous enhancement of the user experience. 
 
 Main Duties & Responsilities;
 
   Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers and Senior members of the team to identify the needs of our users and design and implement the next generation of products that meet these needs
   Architect, build, and test new features with the aim of enhancing the user experience
   Work with backend teams to help shape API endpoints
   Constantly on the lookout for enhancing the user experience by staying up-to-date with current best-practices
 
  Attributes & Experience
 
   Proven track record with Javascript, preferably React, TypeScript, ES6 or other common JS frameworks (such as Vue.js)
   Experience in building SPA
   Familiarity with browser testing and debugging
   Desire to learn and use new technologies
 
 
 
   Bonus
 
 
   Experiences in building client side libraries with vanilla JS
   Keen eye for design and a strong understanding of UX
   Familiarity with performance debugging and bench-marking Ideally, experience contributing to open source projects
   Experience working with Python on backend side would give you a good bonus
 
  Educational Qualifications
 
   Bachelors or higher degree in related field is required
 
 
 
   Why Cover Genius?
 
 
 
   Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?
 
 
 
   Flexible Work Environment - we are outcome focussed and understand that for our people to perform at their best flexibility is critical. Soon after the declaration of the COVID-19 global pandemic the entire CG team was granted an extra 15 days of Wellness Leave to take throughout 2020.
 
  
 
 
  Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.
 
 
 
   Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
 
  
 
 
  Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!
 
 
 
   Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!
 
 
 
   Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

Job Title: Frontend Software Engineer, TikTok LIVE- Australia
Description:
Responsibilities 
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

 At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. 

 
About TikTok Live Engineering Team:
 TikTok Live revenue engineering team is responsible for building the cutting-edge revenue ecosystem which includes gifting and other revenue features that are innovative, secure and intuitive for our users. As an important member of the engineering team, you will build solutions that affect millions of users and live streamers. 
TikTok Live Campaign Team explores the potential needs of users, building new operation scenarios, and through short-term incentives/guidance and other means, campaigns can attract user attention, encourage user contributions, and strengthen user awareness, therefore leading to noticeable business metric increase. Efficiently support activities through front-end technology and explore diverse ways to play. 

 We are looking for passionate and talented engineers to join us to build up and optimize a real-time, high-performance, large-scale distributed infrastructure for live streaming at TikTok. We will be deeply involved in the developmental lifecycle of critical product features, and collaborate closely with product managers to deliver the best live streaming experience for live streamers and viewers. 

 
Responsibilities:
 1. Responsible for the construction of international live broadcasting, including but not limited to the front-end research and development of middle and background, user-side products and activities of various scales in mobile/desktop scenarios 
2. Responsible for the development of infrastructure, such as engineering schemes and platform efficiency tools for international live broadcasting business support 
3. Create ultimate user experience and support rapid development of international live streaming ecology with high-quality designs and codes 
4. Explore and practice efficient multi-end division of labor and cooperation mode, improve the efficiency of remote and cross-regional communication, and escort the business iteration 
Qualifications 
1. Minimum 3 years relevant work experience preferably from a large-scale internet business 
2. Solid computer foundation and high proficiency in front-end technology, as well as good experience in solving multi-browser compatibility problems as well as front-end performance optimization 
3. Excellent understanding of engineering, componentization and other development ideas; have certain design ability with familiarity with at least one front-end MV* framework 
3. Good sense of service and great learning ability, as well as excellent team collaboration skills 
4. Strong communication and problem solving skills 
5. Preferred to have experience in multi-end (such as React Naitve, Flutter, PC, Node Server, etc.), 3D WebGL or low code development 
6. Preferred to have participated in or led large-scale projects, good open source projects, good technical blog. 

 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. 

 In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

Full Stack Software Developer Fotomerchant comprises many teams that all come together to make the lives of our customers better & faster. As a company, we believe that we always need to adapt and grow and our people have a direct impact on helping shape the direction of our platform and the culture of the company.
The engineering team at Fotomerchant comprises a diverse range of individuals located in both Australia and the US. We combine our experience and skills in building industry-leading hardware and software using a hybrid of Agile and Kanban-based methodologies. We partner closely with product and customer teams to create solutions that help deliver a better & faster experience for all.
Fotomerchant operates on AWS and takes advantage of services such as EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, SQS, DynamoDB, Rekognition, and OpsWorks to name a few. Our solutions are built utilising a broad mix of modern technologies, including;
Symfony JavaScript ES6, NodeJS, TypeScript React, Angular Electron and more.
We’re currently looking for a new Full Stack Software Developer to join our team and kick-start their career with a fast-growing company. About You. You love immersing yourself in a coding task or solving complex problems. 1-4 years of software development experience in the industry. Have a passion for software development and can demonstrate your skills through projects and experiences. Industry experience with either Symfony, JavaScript ES6, NodeJS, TypeScript, React or Angular with an interest and open mind to learning the rest on the job. Comfortable working with mixed fidelity UI/UX designs to implement user interfaces and the backends to power them. Awareness and understanding of open source libraries, tools, and frameworks (e.g. for logging, testing, building). Some industry experience with public clouds (e.g. AWS). Interested in learning new programming languages, frameworks, and paradigms. Self-starter and able to work independently in a remote environment. About The Role. Join a remote international team in creating innovative solutions for the high-volume photography industry. You will be given the opportunity to up-skill in JavaScript, React, and Symfony to develop and ship new features to clients and end-users. Work on software-as-a-service platforms that use modern Cloud, API, Web, and Desktop (Electron) technologies. Participate in various team activities such as planning, estimating, and retrospectives. Collaborate with our Customer Success team to support our local and international clients, investigate issues, and work on patches. Assist in supporting the operational requirements of platforms. Work with a supportive and inclusive development team to brainstorm solutions, pair-program, conduct code reviews, test and release new features. Assist in supporting the operational requirements of platforms. Contribute to a growing software development team and work on solving platform scale-up challenges to support our growth and global expansion plans. Work where you are. Great work can get done anywhere, so that’s where our team works.
Fotomerchant is a fully remote company distributed across the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand & the UK. And we’re continuing to grow.
We provide a flexible work arrangement which means you can find the right work/life balance to suit your individual needs. We support you with salary-sacrificing options, financial support to set up your home office, and all the tools you need to get the job done.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $120,000.00 – $200,000.00 per year
Expected Start Date: 27/03/2023

Full Time - Remote
 
 
   Rex is a 80-person product company based in Tenerife, Brisbane. Rex develops products for the real estate and property management industries in Australia, New Zealand and the UK, with thousands of customers using our CRM, digital advertising suite and website builder.
 
 
  
   
     We’re a design-driven company with a passionate, young team. Together we use our abilities to take complex problems and untangle them into simple, usable products. Ownership is one of our core values, and so we like to give people responsibility and discretion. Our Brisbane office is located in Newstead, close to the Gasworks precinct, surrounded by great cafes, eating areas, and microbreweries.
   
  
  
   
    
     
       About the role
     
     
       As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you are an experienced full-stack developer who will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining various products and parts of our shared technology infrastructure. The role requires a lot of independence, as the Platform team is small and you will be expected to have a greater-than-average level of autonomy. You must be comfortable and capable of challenging ideas and assumptions, as we interact with people in the C-suite more than other teams might.  In this role, you will be working on a variety of architectural and exploratory projects, as well as providing mentorship and guidance to our product teams. Your expertise will be critical in greenfield projects, where you will be responsible for establishing the technological foundations of new products. You will also work on products early in their lifecycle, providing guidance and support to ensure that they are scalable, reliable, and maintainable.
       ‍
       Our tech stack includes TypeScript/React and PHP/Laravel, deployed on the Google Cloud ecosystem. Whilst you may be more of a frontend or backend specialist, you’re comfortable in moving through all parts of the stack to deliver a successful outcome.
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Key Responsibilities
     
     
      
        Mentor product teams and collaborate with the CTO and Product teams on scoping solutions & building proof of concepts.
        Provide technical leadership and foster a culture of growth.
        Proactively identify and mitigate risks, valuing incremental delivery.
        Identifying areas of opportunity to reduce tech debt, and supporting the product teams to modernise legacy projects
        Drive focus on architectural and exploratory projects.
        Communicate cross functionally to ensure productive collaboration between teams
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       What you'll bring
     
     
      
        At least 5-7 years of experience working in software engineering or related fields
        Experience with TypeScript/React and PHP/Laravel (or closely related stacks).
        Experience working in an agile environment and collaborating with cross functional teams.
        You’re a nice person who genuinely enjoys uplifting the spirits and skills of those around you.
        You’re passionate about engineering and you love self development.
        You are approachable and make the team feel able to contribute ideas in a safe working environment.
        You think pragmatically and lean towards using reliable, trusted technology that does the job, rather than introducing new shiny things just for the sake of it
        You effectively communicate in clear language suitable for your audience, in both written and verbal communication. You’re not afraid to ask questions! We don’t expect you to know everything.
        Willingness to enthusiastically tackle any part of the stack as needed for the successful shipping of an engineering project, even if it means learning a new skill or being out of your comfort zone.
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Nice to haves
     
     
      
        Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field (or equivalent experience).
        Prior experience working within a B2B SaaS organisation
        A history of open-source contributions
        Experience with any of the following technologies:
        AI/ML
        Data analytics
        Kubernetes
      
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
    Our Culture
  
  
    Our Brisbane warehouse office, which is lush with tropical plants, a fully stocked kitchen and specialised private work booths, is located in Newstead, close to the Gasworks precinct, surrounded by great cafes, eating areas, and microbreweries.
    In London, we’re in the heart of Shoreditch, close to the travel network and at home in WeWork.
  
 
 
  
   
    
      Hybrid work policy
    
    
     
       We have a range of design and developer teams working remotely, with business services staff working in both a hybrid and in-office approach. Work fully remote or 3/2 days working from home.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Learning budget
    
    
     
       We provide our staff with a $3,000 annual learning budget to invest in their own professional growth, along with 2 weeks of paid learning leave to attend seminars and conferences.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Health & wellbeing
    
    
     
       A healthy mind and body support us in finding the joy in what we do personally and professionally. We provide on-site yoga in Brisbane each week plus free corporate massage service, and subsidised gym membership. We also provide an amazing EAP service to staff and their families for financial, legal and psychological support.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Complimentary snacks and comfortable environment
    
    
     
       We are a busy business and to ensure we are fuelled and ready to go we like to provide our staff with in-office snacks and a comfortable work environment where they can connect in booths, meeting rooms couches or our comfy loft space.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Modern workplace and equipment
    
    
     
       We’re a tech company first and foremost and as you would expect we offer our employees excellent equipment to get the job done. Including a Macbook Pro and high-quality monitor.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Paid parental leave
    
    
     
       Family is at the core of how Rex came to be and providing parents the time with their newborn after the birth or adoption of their child is important to us. Paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers is available to our team members along with superannuation contributions throughout that paid leave period.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Flexible work policy
    
    
     
       A flexible approach to work is supported greatly at Rex. We aim to support team members with their family and individual needs to ensure the work/life balance is practical and sustainable.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      LGBTQIA+ friendly
    
    
     
       Respecting the unique needs, perspectives and potential of all team members is at the core of what we believe at Rex.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Work from anywhere
    
    
     
       As a Rex employee you get access to 4 weeks of work from anywhere leave where you can work from the beach, the comfort of your sofa or even another country.

Growing startup on the beach seeks experienced frontend developer full time! 
  About Us. 
   Tyroola is an exciting, dynamic new start-up specialising in the online retail of automotive tyres, operating from Sydney and the Sunshine Coast. Our mission is to become market-leader in the industry through innovation, and optimisation of market processes to provide our customers with the accessibility, and value they deserve. 
   Our business is now expanding at pace, and we are now looking for additional individuals to grow with us. 
   About You. 
   You are a senior frontend developer experienced in designing, developing and maintaining large-scale web applications. We're looking for a team player who loves solving problems in an agile and creative way. 
   Our system is built from scratch to meet the business requirements without compromise, so you should have demonstrable experience in modern JS and CSS frameworks (React, Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation) and their related backend services. We make use of the newest open source technologies where possible to develop best-in-class products - so be very comfortable working with and on open source software. Above all, you should share our desire to create great software! 
   Role requirements. 
   We are looking for someone: 
   
   with several years experience designing, developing and maintaining complex web applications, preferably involving e-Commerce 
   who can create, and test your Cross-browser solutions 
   focusing on clean, Responsive and mobile-first implementations 
   with extensive knowledge with either REST APIs or GraphQL-Backends 
   who is familiar with Gulp, Webpack, Bower 
   with excellent communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to self-manage 
  
  From a senior frontend developer we would like to see some of the following as well: 
   Demonstrable experience in: 
   
   OOP in the ECMAScript 6 stack using a modern frontend framework such as React or Flux 
   Unit Testing (Mocha, Jasmine) 
   Integration Testing (CasperJS or Selenium) 
   designing and implementing RESTFul APIs 
  
  Nice to haves: 
  
   good PHP OOP knowledge 
   working with cloud systems like AWS, Digital Ocean 
   experience with CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins) 
   experience in using any virtualization software (e.g. VirtualBox with vagrant), experience with working with production systems 
   Big Plus: Worked in a Start-up before! 
   
  You’ll take ownership of all things front-end in our products and projects, working as part of our engineering teams. 
   The main focus will be the development of our e-commerce framework, which includes a highly extensible and scalable system, spread over several cloud based servers. 
   We implement designs under the clean code principle and make use of all the tools out there helping, measuring and tracking to improve the code quality. 
   Exciting projects in the coming months will be for example new white-label solutions like we did with Supercheap Auto, our international expansion and deeper integration with our offline partners. 
   About Our Offer. 
  
   The role remote 
   Relaxed environment, working with a small team of dedicated, passionate individuals 
   A flat hierarchy and transparency. You have a chance to directly influence the technology and business. 
   
  Send your application to careers@tyroola.com.au.

 What is on offer for you.

 What to do next?

 Marcus | marcus.ooi@dmcgglobal.com if you’re keen on learning more about this opportunity and would like to have a chat.

 Job Description 
 
  This is a remote position. 
  
   Job Brief
    
  
  
   We are looking for a FULL TIME WordPress Developer and coder to join our team. To be successful in this position you must not only be a very capable developer, you should also enjoy coding, you will need to be punctual, reliable and a good communicator. We are not looking for a WordPress “Developer” that only has experience with basic WordPress sites, ie installing themes and plugins, we want someone that can code and can make plugin customisations, can troubleshoot plugin conflicts, has experience solving WordPress related problems and has solid experience supporting and maintaining them according to best practices.

At TTEC Digital, we coach clients to ensure their employees feel valued, and fully supported, because an amazing customer experience is an employee first process. Our vision is the same, a place where employees know they can thrive.
 
 
 
   Our is a team of industry experts in artificial intelligence (AI) & natural language processing (NLP) automation, computer telephony integration (CTI), enterprise integration, user experience design (UX/UI), analytics and workforce optimization.
 
  
 
 
   Our global technologists specialise in the design and delivery of all things AWS, are implementation experts of Amazon Connect, and recipient of the Amazon Connect 2021 Partner of the Year (UKI) award.
 
  
 
 
   We are a consulting partner focused on helping clients design and deploy intelligent and dynamic customer experiences across all channels, and we are relentless in the pursuit of customer success.
 
 
  The Role;
 
   The Role;
 
 
   As the backbone of our delivery teams, our new Application Developer will build and deploy TTec Digital designed solution for our clients. This strong Application Developer will work to refine the process of delivering projects by building internal tools, suggesting new methods of designing and building a system, and providing feedback to their team leads on issues they are experiencing.
   
 
 
  
 
  What you will bring to us, is your self-starting know-how, expert JavaScript, React and Node (AWS/Cloud exp an advantage) and you’re creative and passionate about developing various applications including web apps, backend systems integrations and AI functions such as conversational bots and analytics tools.
 
 
 
   Required Skills:
 
 
   To be successful in the role, you will need a strong understanding of the key technologies that VoiceFoundry/TTec Digital work with such as Typescript, React, Node and the AWS server less tech stack. Those are the primary tech skills. This includes Amazon Connect and the AWS ecosystem that forms our contact center solutions, but also complementary workforce optimisation applications and integration to CRM and case management systems.
 
 
 
   Functional Responsibilities:

Growing startup on the beach seeks experienced backend PHP developer full time! 
  About Us. 
   Tyroola is an exciting, dynamic new start-up specialising in the online retail of automotive tyres, operating from Sydney and the Sunshine Coast. Our mission is to become market-leaders in the industry through innovation, and optimisation of market processes to provide our customers with the accessibility, and value they deserve. 
   Our business is now expanding at pace, and we are now looking for additional individuals to grow with us. 
   About You. 
   You are a Senior PHP developer experienced in designing, developing and maintaining large-scale web applications. We're looking for a team player who loves solving problems in an agile and creative way. 
   Our system is built from scratch to meet the business requirements without compromise, so you should have demonstrable experience in modern PHP frameworks (Phalcon, Symfony or Yii) and their related backend services. We make use of the newest open source technologies where possible to develop best-in-class products - so be very comfortable working with and on open source software. Above all, you should share our desire to create great software! 
   Role requirements. 
   We are looking for someone with: 
   
   Several years experience designing, developing and maintaining complex web applications, preferably involving e-Commerce 
   Strong MVC skills using a modern PHP framework (or be able to very quickly pick that up to a professional standard) 
   Extensive knowledge with key value storage systems like Redis or memcached, have worked with NOSQL databases like 
   MongoDB or CouchDB and have professional experience with RDMS systems like PostgreSQL or MySQL 
   Good communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to self-manage 
  
  Nice to haves. 
   Some things we think would be good if you were also into: 
   
   You’re keen to do TDD and BDD (e.g. PHPUnit, Codeception, Behat) 
   You’re familiar with CI/CD (esp Jenkins) 
   You can design and implement RESTFul APIs 
   You’re using any virtualization software (e.g. VirtualBox with vagrant), experience with working with production systems 
   You’re able to work and configure a LAMP stack and know the pitfalls 
  
  About The Role. 
   You will be supporting the IT team, development, and maintenance of the application's frontend, backend and order processing engine (our so called "State Machine"). 
   The main focus will be the development of our e-commerce framework, which includes a highly extensible and scalable system, spread over several cloud based servers. 
   We implement designs under the clean code principle and make use of all the tools out there helping, measuring and tracking to improve the code quality. 
   Exciting projects in the coming months will be for example new white-label solutions like we did with Supercheap Auto, our international expansion and deeper integration with our offline partners. 
   About Our Offer. 
  
   The role is remote 
   Relaxed environment, working with a small team of dedicated, passionate individuals 
   A flat hierarchy and transparency. You have a chance to directly influence the technology and business. 
   
  Send your application to careers@tyroola.com.au.

Full Time - Remote
 
 
   Rex is a 80-person product company based in Tenerife, Brisbane. Rex develops products for the real estate and property management industries in Australia, New Zealand and the UK, with thousands of customers using our CRM, digital advertising suite and website builder.
 
 
  
   
     We’re a design-driven company with a passionate, young team. Together we use our abilities to take complex problems and untangle them into simple, usable products. Ownership is one of our core values, and so we like to give people responsibility and discretion. Our Brisbane office is located in Newstead, close to the Gasworks precinct, surrounded by great cafes, eating areas, and microbreweries.
   
  
  
   
    
     
       About the role
     
     
       As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you are an experienced full-stack developer who will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining various products and parts of our shared technology infrastructure. The role requires a lot of independence, as the Platform team is small and you will be expected to have a greater-than-average level of autonomy. You must be comfortable and capable of challenging ideas and assumptions, as we interact with people in the C-suite more than other teams might.  In this role, you will be working on a variety of architectural and exploratory projects, as well as providing mentorship and guidance to our product teams. Your expertise will be critical in greenfield projects, where you will be responsible for establishing the technological foundations of new products. You will also work on products early in their lifecycle, providing guidance and support to ensure that they are scalable, reliable, and maintainable.
       ‍
       Our tech stack includes TypeScript/React and PHP/Laravel, deployed on the Google Cloud ecosystem. Whilst you may be more of a frontend or backend specialist, you’re comfortable in moving through all parts of the stack to deliver a successful outcome.
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Key Responsibilities
     
     
      
        Mentor product teams and collaborate with the CTO and Product teams on scoping solutions & building proof of concepts.
        Provide technical leadership and foster a culture of growth.
        Proactively identify and mitigate risks, valuing incremental delivery.
        Identifying areas of opportunity to reduce tech debt, and supporting the product teams to modernise legacy projects
        Drive focus on architectural and exploratory projects.
        Communicate cross functionally to ensure productive collaboration between teams
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       What you'll bring
     
     
      
        At least 5-7 years of experience working in software engineering or related fields
        Experience with TypeScript/React and PHP/Laravel (or closely related stacks).
        Experience working in an agile environment and collaborating with cross functional teams.
        You’re a nice person who genuinely enjoys uplifting the spirits and skills of those around you.
        You’re passionate about engineering and you love self development.
        You are approachable and make the team feel able to contribute ideas in a safe working environment.
        You think pragmatically and lean towards using reliable, trusted technology that does the job, rather than introducing new shiny things just for the sake of it
        You effectively communicate in clear language suitable for your audience, in both written and verbal communication. You’re not afraid to ask questions! We don’t expect you to know everything.
        Willingness to enthusiastically tackle any part of the stack as needed for the successful shipping of an engineering project, even if it means learning a new skill or being out of your comfort zone.
      
     
    
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Nice to haves
     
     
      
        Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field (or equivalent experience).
        Prior experience working within a B2B SaaS organisation
        A history of open-source contributions
        Experience with any of the following technologies:
        AI/ML
        Data analytics
        Kubernetes
      
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
    Our Culture
  
  
    Our Brisbane warehouse office, which is lush with tropical plants, a fully stocked kitchen and specialised private work booths, is located in Newstead, close to the Gasworks precinct, surrounded by great cafes, eating areas, and microbreweries.
    In London, we’re in the heart of Shoreditch, close to the travel network and at home in WeWork.
  
 
 
  
   
    
      Hybrid work policy
    
    
     
       We have a range of design and developer teams working remotely, with business services staff working in both a hybrid and in-office approach. Work fully remote or 3/2 days working from home.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Learning budget
    
    
     
       We provide our staff with a $3,000 annual learning budget to invest in their own professional growth, along with 2 weeks of paid learning leave to attend seminars and conferences.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Health & wellbeing
    
    
     
       A healthy mind and body support us in finding the joy in what we do personally and professionally. We provide on-site yoga in Brisbane each week plus free corporate massage service, and subsidised gym membership. We also provide an amazing EAP service to staff and their families for financial, legal and psychological support.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Complimentary snacks and comfortable environment
    
    
     
       We are a busy business and to ensure we are fuelled and ready to go we like to provide our staff with in-office snacks and a comfortable work environment where they can connect in booths, meeting rooms couches or our comfy loft space.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Modern workplace and equipment
    
    
     
       We’re a tech company first and foremost and as you would expect we offer our employees excellent equipment to get the job done. Including a Macbook Pro and high-quality monitor.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Paid parental leave
    
    
     
       Family is at the core of how Rex came to be and providing parents the time with their newborn after the birth or adoption of their child is important to us. Paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers is available to our team members along with superannuation contributions throughout that paid leave period.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Flexible work policy
    
    
     
       A flexible approach to work is supported greatly at Rex. We aim to support team members with their family and individual needs to ensure the work/life balance is practical and sustainable.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      LGBTQIA+ friendly
    
    
     
       Respecting the unique needs, perspectives and potential of all team members is at the core of what we believe at Rex.
     
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      Work from anywhere
    
    
     
       As a Rex employee you get access to 4 weeks of work from anywhere leave where you can work from the beach, the comfort of your sofa or even another country.

About the role 

 
Job Title: Engineer 

Location: Melbourne 

 Do work that matters on a large scale 
Collaborate with talented teams of engineers and leaders in their field 
Forget the suit stereotype – we encourage our people to dress for their day 

 At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Engineer to join our Trade & Supply Chain (Institutional OACB) tribe. The tribe aims to delight customers by simplifying and automating the Operations, Middle Office, Credit Lending, Research and Core Banking services of Institutional. 

 As an Engineer you will work as part of an agile squad whose mission is to design, build, test and support applications and/or core banking platforms. You will work closely with other squad members to ensure the quality of our outcomes meets customer expectations. 

 What will your day look like 
Works in collaborative teams to build innovative solutions 
Utilises tools and best practices to build, verify and deploy solutions in the most efficient ways, enhancing tech division capabilities 
Provide ongoing support for platforms as required e.g. problem and incident management 
What will you bring? 

 We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work. But back to some of the skills: 

 Good knowledge in Software Engineering combined with broad capability and a proven ability to innovate and adapt to the latest developments 

Fluent in one or more software development areas eg: Front/Back-end Engineer, Integration Engineer, full stack developer etc 
Have a thirst and willingness to expand knowledge with new technologies and techniques bringing benefits into the Technology Area 
Work closely within a team implementing application solutions 
Understand customer needs to make sound judgments 

 
The following skills/experiences are highly regarded:
 We are looking for T-shaped individuals (expert in some, novice in others) across these skillsets: 

 Strong Object Oriented Programming skills 
Core Java 8+, Spring 
Knowledge of Java testing techniques, including mocking and JUnit, Cucumber, code coverage 
React JS / Redux 
Restful API 
Docker Containerization, Open-shift, Kubernetes 
AWS/GCP Cloud 

 In this role, you will deal with many other technologies (examples below) so an openness to learning is the most important attribute 

 Spring Boot 
Spring Data JPA 
SQL, NoSQL 
Kafka Messaging 
Websphere/IBM MQ 
So, why join us? 

 There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers. 

 But it’s not just our customers who will feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future. 

 We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements. 

 You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

What’s On Offer! - We Are Going To WOO You!
Are you a focused professional that can deliver? What do people say about your code?

Full-Stack Developer
Can you manage multilingual codebases? Are you a big picture person? Can you leap codebases in a single bound? You might be Desygners, next super developer.
The Role:
As a full-stack Developer at Desygner you will be working closely with Desygner’s Chief Information Officer & Chief Product Officer to organise, manage and deliver technical solutions. You will play an active role in the development of our product and assist Desygner to reach its full potential (PLG). You will be responsible for:

 Maintaining and improving multiple APIs, with thousands of queries by the minute;
 Constant improvement in user interface and experience;
 Overseeing other developers' work and helping our team to reach its full potential;
 Assist us with internal practices to standardise development as we grow

Required Skills:
The perfect candidate would have experience with MVC backend frameworks (Symfony), Node.js building tools, CI (Jenkins), testing, JavaScript and CSS experience. Ideally you will posses the following:

 More than 6 years of software development experience

 Basic understanding of component-based frontend applications

Desired Skills:

 Experience with Symfony framework
 Familiarity with SysOps, DevOps
 Knowledge of Amazon Web Services
 In-depth knowledge in PHP (MVC, ORMs, Cache, services), SQL and networks

Senior Frontend Developer

The Role:
As a Front-End Developer at Desygner you will be working closely with Desygner’s Chief Information Officer & Chief Product Officer to organise, manage and deliver technical solutions. You will play an active role in the development of our product and assist Desygner to develop it to its full potential.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist with the development, maintenance and enhancement of Desygner's graphic design editor to support various media types and formats, such as video and animation.

 Work with our design team in order to implement a beautiful UX for our video and animation features

 Template engines, node, modern frameworks, ES6, transpilers, building tools
 Independent in English

 Experience with TDD

 Basic PHP or MVC backend frameworks experience
 Basic AWS knowledge

Benefits & Perks
We nurture a creative, focused & fun environment where people look forward to coming to the office. Our team is diverse in both culture and talent which makes for a superbly unique work environment without politics and hierarchy.

 Work on the Gold Coast with views over the beaches and canals from your desk

Desygner is one of Australia’s top 3 startups (232 in the world). Desygner is focused on building solutions that make design, branding, and marketing better through automation, AI, and adaptive technologies without needing a designer. There is no better opportunity to be part of something big than this and now is the chance to join our HQ leadership team on the Gold Coast with 80 people already and rapidly growing to 100 globally!
Our users’ success is our success and we’re on a mission to deliver solutions that make marketing better and easier for them.

 B2C and B2B solutions
 Blue-chip corporate clients that rely on Desygner
 Global audience with over 30 million users (25,000+ new signups every day)
