At Upland Software, you’ll find smart, creative teams who love working together to deliver value for our customers, and a global culture of growth and possibility. Our operating model has always supported remote work—and as we keep growing and evolving our workplace, that won’t change. We’re passionate. We’re proactive. We take pride in our work, and we love a good challenge. Sound like you?
  Opportunity Summary:
  We are looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic individual to join Upland as a Software Engineer II (Full Stack) for our Upland Panviva product. The individual will work with our development team.
  Upland Panviva is a knowledge management platform built for customers and industries which are compliance driven, highly regulated and often, with complex business processes. Shifting knowledge into the digital age, Panviva also enables organizations to take an omni-channel approach in integrating IVR, chat bots, self-service portals, and many other channels. Most recently, we’ve added Nugget to our product which is a self-service bot empowering remote employees with instant answers, giving them extra time to deal with more complex issues for their customers.
  Our R&D team is primarily located in Melbourne Australia with our customers being enterprise level around the world. The team is small enough for employees to play a pivotal role in the development of our product, but we’re supported by a large global business meaning it’s also big enough for you to learn and develop your skills within an experienced team.
  As a Software Developer, you will be working both across and within our agile development teams and be involved throughout the full development lifecycle with particular responsibility to ensure the development & maintenance of our software platforms. You'll be involved in all aspects of the team including the creation and elaboration of business requirements, functional/design specifications, development and maintenance of our software and driving innovation into our product suite. You will have a particular focus on backend technologies and their continued development.
  Primary Responsibilities:
 
   Develop and maintain scalable and robust enterprise applications
   Work as part of cross functional, passionate agile (SCRUM/Kanban) project teams ensuring high quality delivery is at the heart of the development process from requirements definition through to delivery
   Participate in scrum ceremonies and participate on development projects and implement solutions in partnership with development managers and teams.
   Resolution of performance or security issues.
   Provide relevant, honest and accurate feedback to management.
   Research, recommend and implement tools as needed with the goal of continually increasing our development productivity
   Demonstrable working knowledge of design patterns
   Proactively bringing issues and problems to the attention of the team; generating, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to solve them
   Be an advocate of automation, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
   Maintain exceptionally high standards of design and code quality at all times, including but not limited to adherence to architectural, security and scalability standards and principles
   Updates job knowledge by researching new internet/intranet technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
   To be enthusiastic, fearless and boundary-less with the ability to coach and mentor
 
  Requirements:
 
   A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent will be required for this role.
   Around five years software development experience with recent experience of developing Enterprise .Net applications within an Agile environment
   Experience with Test driven / behavior driven (TDD/BDD) .Net software development
   Experience building C# and .NET Core applications on the Azure Cloud.
   Working knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery methods and toolsets
   Working with enterprise SQL databases (preferably SQL Server)
   Evangelist of modern .Net programming and development practices
   Familiarity with web based SaaS
   Comfortable with absorbing new technologies quickly; highly self-directed and able to manage and prioritize concurrent and competing/conflicting challenges
   Innovator; ability to work collaboratively and a demonstrated team player with a results-oriented track record
   Follow recommended software development methodology standards, championing evolution as appropriate
   Pro-active customer service attitude
   A technical mindset with good understanding of algorithms, data structures, design patterns.
   A willingness and an ability to share best practice and improve processes.
   Experienced in issues of Scaling and an understanding of optimising web-based applications.
   Experience working across multiple platforms and technologies
   Strong demonstrable experience of Object Oriented Analysis & Design and accompanying design patterns with a commitment to Software Craftsmanship and Clean Code.
   Ability to work with Distributed Version Control Systems
   Performance tuning
   Experience of web interfaces and working with databases.
   Scaling and optimising web-based applications
   Designing high availability systems
   Knowledge of Agile development practices and experience working in a cross-functional Scrum team
   Ability to work collaboratively and a demonstrated team player
   A willingness and an ability to share best practices and improve processes
 
  Advantagous:
 
   Experience with NoSQL databases such as MySQL / DynamoDB.
   Experience with Front-end technologies such as React, HTML/CSS, Javascript.
   Experience or understanding of enterprise systems deployed as micro-services through code pipelines utilizing containerization (Docker)
   Experience of working with SaaS based software architectures within a multi-tenanted cloud hosted deployment model
   Experience with systems and IT operations operating within an ISO27001 environment
 
  This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the Company.
  Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. To learn more, visit www.uplandsoftware.com. 
 Upland Software is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status.

Growing startup on the beach seeks experienced frontend developer full time! 
  About Us. 
   Tyroola is an exciting, dynamic new start-up specialising in the online retail of automotive tyres, operating from Sydney and the Sunshine Coast. Our mission is to become market-leader in the industry through innovation, and optimisation of market processes to provide our customers with the accessibility, and value they deserve. 
   Our business is now expanding at pace, and we are now looking for additional individuals to grow with us. 
   About You. 
   You are a senior frontend developer experienced in designing, developing and maintaining large-scale web applications. We're looking for a team player who loves solving problems in an agile and creative way. 
   Our system is built from scratch to meet the business requirements without compromise, so you should have demonstrable experience in modern JS and CSS frameworks (React, Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation) and their related backend services. We make use of the newest open source technologies where possible to develop best-in-class products - so be very comfortable working with and on open source software. Above all, you should share our desire to create great software! 
   Role requirements. 
   We are looking for someone: 
   
   with several years experience designing, developing and maintaining complex web applications, preferably involving e-Commerce 
   who can create, and test your Cross-browser solutions 
   focusing on clean, Responsive and mobile-first implementations 
   with extensive knowledge with either REST APIs or GraphQL-Backends 
   who is familiar with Gulp, Webpack, Bower 
   with excellent communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to self-manage 
  
  From a senior frontend developer we would like to see some of the following as well: 
   Demonstrable experience in: 
   
   OOP in the ECMAScript 6 stack using a modern frontend framework such as React or Flux 
   Unit Testing (Mocha, Jasmine) 
   Integration Testing (CasperJS or Selenium) 
   designing and implementing RESTFul APIs 
  
  Nice to haves: 
  
   good PHP OOP knowledge 
   working with cloud systems like AWS, Digital Ocean 
   experience with CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins) 
   experience in using any virtualization software (e.g. VirtualBox with vagrant), experience with working with production systems 
   Big Plus: Worked in a Start-up before! 
   
  You’ll take ownership of all things front-end in our products and projects, working as part of our engineering teams. 
   The main focus will be the development of our e-commerce framework, which includes a highly extensible and scalable system, spread over several cloud based servers. 
   We implement designs under the clean code principle and make use of all the tools out there helping, measuring and tracking to improve the code quality. 
   Exciting projects in the coming months will be for example new white-label solutions like we did with Supercheap Auto, our international expansion and deeper integration with our offline partners. 
   About Our Offer. 
  
   The role remote 
   Relaxed environment, working with a small team of dedicated, passionate individuals 
   A flat hierarchy and transparency. You have a chance to directly influence the technology and business. 
   
  Send your application to careers@tyroola.com.au.

In your career, will you tick all the right boxes or think outside them?
  
 At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.
 
  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.
 
  What’s in it for you?
 
  As a Full Stack Developer within our Digital & Emerging Technology team you’ll work with our team of highly experienced technologists to deliver cutting edge technology solutions to our clients.
 
  Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
 
 
   Demonstrated professional experience in Software Development/Engineering with expertise in at least one backend technology such as Java, Python, Spring Boot and Node
   Front-end skills in React.js, Angular, Typescript, HTML &/or CSS
   Database experience with DynamoDB, MongoDB, Postgres and/or Oracle
 
 
  Extra points if you also have
 
 
   Experience working in Agile teams and thrive on collaboration

  The Digital Delivery and Assurance team is responsible for planning, scheduling and supporting software delivery from development through to production as well as ensuring software solutions are reliable and accurate. The responsibilities of this section are as follows: 
 
  The management of application deployments from development through the continuous delivery pipeline (CDP) to Production.
   Environmental support and troubleshooting.
   The constant development, implementation and review of release governance processes
   Administration of the Digital Change Authority (formerly known as CAB).
   Automated testing and quality assurance governance.
   Continuous refinement and innovation of DevOps tools and processes.
  
 As a member of the Digital Delivery & Assurance Team the successful candidate will be required to: 
 
  Maintain Jenkins and Digital.ai (Xebia) pipelines for CI/CD.
   Work closely with developers, testers and release management staff.
   Integration of ITIL change management into DevOps processes.
   Performing source code management operations using IP Australia's version control tool, Subversion, GitHub ensuring adherence to IPA code management policies.
   Automate and orchestrate deployment and provisioning tasks into containerised and cloud environments.
   Analysing and resolving software configuration issues in environments you are responsible for.
   Providing software configuration support for development and test environments.
   Building release kits, including all relevant documentation, and managing distribution and deployment to pre-Production and production environments in accordance with corporate Change Management processes.
   Develop, maintain and ensure compliance with configuration management plans, Policies and/or Standards for all of the above responsibilities.
   Maintenance, support, and upgrades of DevOps tools including Jenkins, Digital.ai, and SonarQube.
   Support Continuous Improvements to the automation of the Continuous Delivery Pipeline.
  
 Applicants must be highly motivated with a strong work ethic and able to work effectively across multi-discipline teams. Applicants are expected to be proactive and motivated to build their corporate knowledge of the complex business and technical areas at IP Australia, relevant to their role.
  
  Essential Criteria 
 
  Demonstrated experience with Continuous Delivery Pipelines and DevOps implementation. Including provision of support for Developers and other stakeholders. With demonstrated experience building, integrating, and deploying application software. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Digital.ai (Xebia) - Jenkins (Admin level): plugin, slave and tool configuration/management - Jenkins Pipelines as Code
   Demonstrated experience with maintaining and implementation of containerisation. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Red Hat Openshift - Kubernetes
   Demonstrated experience maintain scripts to support deployment of application software. Experience with scripting/programming languages sufficient to support the environment in many of the following. - Red Hat Ansible - Bash - Python - Groovy - Java
   Demonstrated ability to provide software configuration support for development and test teams and to analyse and resolve environmental software configuration issues in a timely manner. Experience with the following applications or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Red hat (Linux) - ORACLE Database - Openshift - Cloud – AWS and/or Azure
   Demonstrated experience in application support, log file analysis, code repository branching strategies and exposure to AWS/Azure. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Git/GitHub (Admin level): Branching strategies, user management, processes

Symfony JavaScript ES6, NodeJS, TypeScript React, Angular Electron and more.

WHAT YOU’LL DO AS A C++ SOFTWARE ENGINEER 
 At IMC, technology is not a department; it’s at the heart of everything we do. Developed in-house, our innovative software makes millions of trading decisions daily, and we win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. 
 IMC’s Sydney based C++ Execution development teams work on software that sits directly in the latency-critical loop of our technology stack and touches every part of our organisation. From ensuring our connectivity to the market and handling massive amounts of data, to implementing complex trading algorithms and integrating advanced hardware solutions. 
 As a software engineer, you’ll work in multidisciplinary teams alongside other engineers as well as traders to deliver challenging projects, while taking ownership for end-to-end product development – from requirements gathering to production. You’ll write reliable, high-performance software whilst balancing time to production with quality and testability. Advanced automated testing and daily deployments will allow you to achieve agile and incremental benefits. 
 Within a complex landscape of varying systems and technologies, you’ll be constantly challenged to consider trade-offs between latency, throughput, simplicity, scalability and maintainability. 
 OUR TECHNOLOGY STACK 
 Our tech stack includes an ever-evolving range of systems and technologies, and our engineers have the freedom to choose the best solution for the problem at hand. If a new technology has the potential to add value, we’ll actively invest in exploring, adopting and developing it. 
 These are just some of the technologies our C++ software engineers are currently working with: C++20, linux, git, bazel, gerrit code review, jira and teamcity for our core workflow. A lot of our C++ code also interacts with FPGAs and our Java trading platform. 
 WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT 
 At IMC, no two projects or any two days are the same. You can expect a dynamic, fast-paced environment that delivers a steady stream of challenges. One of the most exciting aspects of the job is our quick feedback loop. 
 Our workforce is just as varied. IMCers are drawn from a broad range of nationalities and backgrounds; what they have in common is their deep technical expertise, extraordinary smarts and highly collaborative approach. We give people lots of responsibility and the support they need to make an impact from day one. As a software engineer, you’ll have the chance to learn everything you need to know about financial markets – it’s just one of the things that make this job more interesting than other tech roles. 
 We promise you a flat structure and an open, collaborative culture that stimulates the sharing of ideas, knowledge and technology between our different teams and offices. 
 OUR HIRING PROCESS 
 To set you up for success, you can find details of our hiring process – including tips on applying and interviewing with us – on our website. Now it’s up to you! Apply today to begin your amazing journey with IMC.

Software Engineer (Data & Integration)
Who are we?
Drive Yello helps businesses efficiently manage last-mile delivery and connects them to gig economy drivers so they can meet the ever-increasing demand for convenience. We have ambitious growth plans and are looking for a passionate engineer to help drive the scaling of our business through data. We work with some of the largest retail clients here in Australia which include Woolworths, BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Coles, Terry White Chemmart just to name a few.
We have the opportunity to solve great technical challenges every day in an environment where every commit is adding value for our customers. We’re a great bunch of people working to help retailers provide the convenience customers are demanding.
Who are you?
As a Data and Integration Engineer, you will be empowered to help make the most out of our data here at Drive Yello. You understand the importance of data, and having the right data available in the right environments to the right people. Security and privacy will be at the heart of what you do, so you are comfortable identifying and managing sensitive information.
Working closely with our business intelligence team, you will be responsible for the preparation and transportation of our data to our data warehouse while also staging the data for our BI reporting. In parallel, you will be responsible for integrating with other internal and external systems to transport our data to where we can make the best use of it. You will build up a deep understanding of our data, and act as an interface between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
This position is key to unlocking our data and driving our future business decisions. The ideal candidate will be passionate about data, delivering clean solutions and thriving in a start-up environment.
You will work closely with the Head of Software Engineering while also working cross-functionally with our internal departments (Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Community Experience) to further scale data at Yello.
What we are looking for:

 A minimum of 2 years of software engineering experience within an Agile development environment
 Experience with Python and Node.js
 Experience in SQL databases, MongoDB is a plus
 Solid experience working with 3rd party APIs, data pipelines and moving data across internal and external platforms
 Experience with AWS or Google Cloud
 Ability to interact with a range of stakeholders, with strong written and verbal communication skills
 A proactive can-do attitude, an appetite for learning, and a passion for data!

What we use:

 Google BigQuery
 MySQL, MongoDB, Redis
 AWS and Google Cloud

What you should do
If this sounds like it could be you, hit the apply button, we would love to hear from you!

Our Purpose
 
 
 
   We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a 
  
   culture of inclusion
   for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
 
 
 
   Job Title
 
  Software Engineer (2024 Launch Program)
  Overview:
  Mastercard works to connect and power a sustainable and inclusive global economy. Software engineers at Mastercard build the systems that process transactions, analyze data and detect fraud to gain insight into the direction of the economy on behalf of our customers. We are focused on building simple, safe and smart solutions that instill trust in every interaction. Our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world and to doing well by doing good.
  
  Mastercard relies on our global workforce to help us achieve our goal of building a sustainable, inclusive global economy. We cultivate an environment for all employees that respects their strengths, views, and experiences through a global and collaborative culture of inclusion and a sense of belonging.
  
  Mastercard software engineering teams are obsessed with security, reliability, and performance and driven to deliver solutions that delight our customers. We are looking for talented software engineers to develop advanced technologies and applications that are revolutionizing payments.
  
  
 
  Are you passionate about software engineering?
  Do you enjoy seeing your code have real-world impact on a wide range of customers and important problems?
  Do you want to join a company that offers a competitive benefits program that attracts and retains the most talented engineers around the world?
  Do you want to work for a company that offers additional benefits that match our values such as flexible work hours, paid volunteer days, charitable matching, and tuition assistance?
  Do you thrive in a place where you are continuously learning more while growing your skills and career?
  Do you want to join an inclusive culture where employees, in all their diversity, feel valued, respected, and who can bring their authentic selves to work? Learn more at Mastercard’s Corporate Sustainability Report.
 
  The Software Development Engineer I is a full time role within Mastercard Launch, a cohort based, graduate development program designed to build the skills you’ll leverage most as an innovator in the payments space. Eligibility requires that you currently be a graduating senior, pursuing a relevant degree.
  
  Role:
  
 
  A hands-on engineer who writes high-quality code with a focus on security, design, and maintainability.
  Contribute to all phases of software development from design through rollout.
  Have strong ownership of your team’s software including monitoring, dependencies, build, and deployments.
  Communicate, collaborate and work effectively in a global environment.
 
  About You:
  
 
  Currently enrolled in your final year of a bachelor’s or accelerated master’s program
  Strong foundation in algorithms, data structures, and core computer science concepts.
  Proficiency in one or more general-purpose programming languages such as Java, JavaScript, C#, Python, etc.
  Strong written and verbal English communication skills.
  Strong analytical and excellent problem-solving skills.
 
 
 
   Corporate Security Responsibility
   All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
 
 
   Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
   Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
   Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
   Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

At Upland Software, you’ll find smart, creative teams who love working together to deliver value for our customers, and a global culture of growth and possibility. Our operating model has always supported remote work—and as we keep growing and evolving our workplace, that won’t change. We’re passionate. We’re proactive. We take pride in our work, and we love a good challenge. Sound like you?
  Opportunity Summary:
  We are looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic individual to join Upland as a Software Engineer II (Front End) for our Upland Panviva product. The individual will work with our development team.
  Upland Panviva is a knowledge management platform built for customers and industries which are compliance driven, highly regulated and often, with complex business processes. Shifting knowledge into the digital age, Panviva also enables organizations to take an omni-channel approach in integrating IVR, chat bots, self-service portals, and many other channels. Most recently, we’ve added Nugget to our product which is a self-service bot empowering remote employees with instant answers, giving them extra time to deal with more complex issues for their customers.
  Our R&D team is primarily located in Melbourne Australia with our customers being enterprise level around the world. The team is small enough for employees to play a pivotal role in the development of our product, but we’re supported by a large global business meaning it’s also big enough for you to learn and develop your skills within an experienced team.
  As a Software Developer, you will be working both across and within our agile development teams and be involved throughout the full development lifecycle with particular responsibility to ensure the development & maintenance of our software platforms. You'll be involved in all aspects of the team including the creation and elaboration of business requirements, functional/design specifications, development and maintenance of our software and driving innovation into our product suite. You will have a particular focus on backend technologies and their continued development.
  Primary Responsibilities:
 
   Develop and maintain scalable and robust enterprise applications
   Work as part of cross functional, passionate agile (SCRUM/Kanban) project teams ensuring high quality delivery is at the heart of the development process from requirements definition through to delivery
   Participate in scrum ceremonies and participate on development projects and implement solutions in partnership with development managers and teams.
   Resolution of performance or security issues.
   Provide relevant, honest and accurate feedback to
   Research, recommend and implement tools as needed with the goal of continually increasing our development productivity
   Proactively bringing issues and problems to the attention of the team; generating, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to solve them
   Be an advocate of automation, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
   Maintain exceptionally high standards of design and code quality at all times, including but not limited to adherence to architectural, security and scalability standards and principles
   Updates job knowledge by researching new internet/intranet technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
   To be enthusiastic, fearless and boundary-less with the ability to coach and mentor
 
  Requirements:
  
 
   A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalentwill be required for this role.
   Around five years software development experience, with recent experience of developing applications within an Agile environment
   Experience with Front-end technologies such as React, HTML/CSS, Javascript.
   Experience with developing code and unit tests with Angular JS
   Experience with Test driven / behavior driven (TDD/BDD) software development
   Working knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery methods and toolsets
   Familiarity with web based SaaS
   Comfortable with absorbing new technologies quickly; highly self-directed and able to manage and prioritize concurrent and competing/conflicting challenges
   Innovator; ability to work collaboratively and a demonstrated team player with a results-oriented track record
   Follow recommended software development methodology standards, championing evolution as appropriate
   Pro-active customer service attitude
   A technical mindset with good understanding of algorithms, data structures, design patterns.
   A willingness and an ability to share best practice and improve processes.
   Experienced in issues of Scaling and an understanding of optimising web-based
   Experience working across multiple platforms and technologies
   Strong demonstrable experience of Object Oriented Analysis & Design and accompanying design patterns with a commitment to Software Craftsmanship and Clean Code.
   Ability to work with Distributed Version Control Systems
   Performance tuning
   Experience of web interfaces and working with databases.
   Scaling and optimising web-based applications
   Designing high availability systems
   Knowledge of Agile development practices and experience working in a cross-functional Scrum team
   Ability to work collaboratively and a demonstrated team player
   A willingness and an ability to share best practices and improve processes
 
  Advantagous:
 
   Experience building C# and .NET Core applications on the Azure Cloud.
   Working with enterprise SQL databases (preferably SQL Server)
   Experience or understanding of enterprise systems deployed as micro-services through code pipelines utilizing containerization (Docker)
   Experience of working with SaaS based software architectures within a multi-tenanted cloud hosted deployment model
   Experience with systems and IT operations operating within an ISO27001 environment
 
  This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the Company.

Application closing date: Tuesday, 02 May 2023 • 11:59pm, Canberra time (in Canberra) 
 Estimated start date: Saturday, 01 July 2023 
 Location of work: ACT 
 Length of contract: 12 Months 
 Contract extensions: 2 x 12 months 
 Security clearance: Other - Applicants must have a Baseline Security Clearance. No permanent residents (PRs) can apply for the role, each candidate must be an Australian Citizen. 
 Rates: $100 - $125 per hour (inc. super)
  
  The Digital Delivery and Assurance team is responsible for planning, scheduling and supporting software delivery from development through to production as well as ensuring software solutions are reliable and accurate. The responsibilities of this section are as follows: 
 
  The management of application deployments from development through the continuous delivery pipeline (CDP) to Production.
   Environmental support and troubleshooting.
   The constant development, implementation and review of release governance processes
   Administration of the Digital Change Authority (formerly known as CAB).
   Automated testing and quality assurance governance.
   Continuous refinement and innovation of DevOps tools and processes.
  
 As a member of the Digital Delivery & Assurance Team the successful candidate will be required to: 
 
  Maintain Jenkins and Digital.ai (Xebia) pipelines for CI/CD.
   Work closely with developers, testers and release management staff.
   Integration of ITIL change management into DevOps processes.
   Performing source code management operations using IP Australia's version control tool, Subversion, GitHub ensuring adherence to IPA code management policies.
   Automate and orchestrate deployment and provisioning tasks into containerised and cloud environments.
   Analysing and resolving software configuration issues in environments you are responsible for.
   Providing software configuration support for development and test environments.
   Building release kits, including all relevant documentation, and managing distribution and deployment to pre-Production and production environments in accordance with corporate Change Management processes.
   Develop, maintain and ensure compliance with configuration management plans, Policies and/or Standards for all of the above responsibilities.
   Maintenance, support, and upgrades of DevOps tools including Jenkins, Digital.ai, and SonarQube.
   Support Continuous Improvements to the automation of the Continuous Delivery Pipeline.
  
 Applicants must be highly motivated with a strong work ethic and able to work effectively across multi-discipline teams. Applicants are expected to be proactive and motivated to build their corporate knowledge of the complex business and technical areas at IP Australia, relevant to their role.
  
  Essential Criteria 
 
  Demonstrated experience with Continuous Delivery Pipelines and DevOps implementation. Including provision of support for Developers and other stakeholders. With demonstrated experience building, integrating, and deploying application software. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Digital.ai (Xebia) - Jenkins (Admin level): plugin, slave and tool configuration/management - Jenkins Pipelines as Code
   Demonstrated experience with maintaining and implementation of containerisation. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Red Hat Openshift - Kubernetes
   Demonstrated experience maintain scripts to support deployment of application software. Experience with scripting/programming languages sufficient to support the environment in many of the following. - Red Hat Ansible - Bash - Python - Groovy - Java
   Demonstrated ability to provide software configuration support for development and test teams and to analyse and resolve environmental software configuration issues in a timely manner. Experience with the following applications or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Red hat (Linux) - ORACLE Database - Openshift - Cloud – AWS and/or Azure
   Demonstrated experience in application support, log file analysis, code repository branching strategies and exposure to AWS/Azure. Experience with the following tools or sufficient demonstrated transferable skills are required in; - Git/GitHub (Admin level): Branching strategies, user management, processes

Specialist Data Engineer – Perth
 
   Diverse and challenging projects with our Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team
   Engineer and support complex systems to manage BIG data compute tasks
   Turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions
   Utilise your hands-on coding skills in Python and/or R
   Work in a flexible work environment where we prioritise a healthy work/life balance
 
  About the Role
  Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs. 
 We have an opportunity for a Specialist Data Engineer to work with challenging and exciting analytics problems and positively impact the business while engaging with a team of technology experts and data scientists. This role will involve gaining substantial experience working with our data systems to develop state-of-the-art data solutions for our business’s data problems. The Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team is courageous in the pursuit of innovation, curious in the development of emerging technologies and caring of our people and relationships. You will be regularly challenged but given the support to drive your innovations!
  Reporting to the Senior Data Engineer, you will support the Advanced Data Analytics team to design and continually improve services that solve business problems and provide insight to making improved decisions for our Iron Ore business. You will utilise your hands-on solid coding skills in Python, R and/ or Scala to
 
   Ensure best in class processes and techniques to develop and deploy data analytics solutions to the business
   Collect, aggregate, and analyse structured/unstructured data from multiple internal sources and provide patterns, insights, and trends to the business decision-maker
   Utilising the latest available technologies to flexibly manage and scale data pipelines and analytics models
   Developing platforms and processes that support the reproducibility of results
   Foster an innovative and “disruptive” technology culture to identify and drive value-creating opportunities
   Help the broader Rio Tinto Iron Ore function by advising technical complexity of identified opportunities
   Provide training and knowledge transfer to support the deployment and continuity of the analytics products developed
 
  This role will suit applicants residing in or willing to permanently relocate to Perth, Western Australia.
  About You  Ideally, you will have a postgraduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, or a related field, combined with extensive experience as a data engineer in Machine learning projects, preferably using agile methodologies.
  You will also have experience with some or all of the below:
 
   Proficiency in exploring and manipulating large datasets through applications or programming interfaces.
   Demonstrated experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning using heavy industry data sets (structured and unstructured)
   Ability to write and optimise SQL queries and create efficient data extract/transform/ load (ETL) programs and tasks
   Pipeline development, across different data architectures, (transactional, time series, streaming, unstructured) and storage solutions including use of APIs
   Cloud based solution design using containerisation and serverless architectures in AWS and/or Azure (Cloud Formation/ARM)
   Knowledge in Change control using Git and release pipeline experience using Azure DevOps
   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and logically resolve technical problems
   Agile delivery and project management
   Proficiency in SQL, Python/ R, Linux (Bash), Scala and Go (desirable)
   Software engineering experience desirable
   Knowledge and skills in one or more of the big data frameworks, i.e., Spark, Hive, Hadoop (desirable).
 
  Where you will be working
  This role is based in Perth, Western Australia, out of our Central Park office, working Monday to Friday, with ad hoc travel to sites in the Pilbara. We support and encourage flexible working arrangements.
  What we offer
  Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
 
   A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
   A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
   A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
   Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
   Attractive share ownership plan
   Company provided insurance cover
   Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
   Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
   Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
   Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
   Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
   Possible domestic relocation assistance.
 
  About Rio Tinto
  Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers. 
 For 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
  Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
  Every Voice Matters
  At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
  We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
  Applications close on 28 April 2023 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

Transform the business from old to new Software Architecture
   Highly flexible, mature working environment focused on outcomes
  
 About Our Client
  As a leading technology product solutions company in Australia, you will be joining a SME business with around 150 staff who are part of a much larger Global company. 
  The culture is one of trust, maturity, accountability, teamwork and fun. With a hybrid working arrangement where you will typically work from home 3 days a week and will not be clock watched. 
  The current tech stack is varied and includes both old and new products, with some legacy systems still in use, with the future state still wishing to be Microsoft focused, and opportunities to use fit for purpose technologies and tools for different bushiness needs. These include considerations such as Serverless/Microservices/Python/React/API Gateways/Cloud/DevOps. 
  This role will sit across all the product teams, reporting directly to the CTO and will be focused both on internal systems and software, as well as external API design and the leveraging of data for business intelligence purposes. 
 Job Description
  Due to the business being an SME, you will be a hands-on Software Architect, who is happy to assist with coding, quality reviewing and testing code. This in addition to driving the strategic roadmap of the adoption of a new Software Architecture and associated technologies and tooling. 
 
  Designing and developing software architecture that aligns with business goals and technology standards
  
 
  Reviewing and evaluating technical requirements to create a solution that meets the needs of the project
  
 
  Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, refine needs and establish project objectives
  
 
  Creating technical specifications, prototypes, and diagrams that document the architecture, design, and functionality of the solution
  
 
  Ensuring the quality and consistency of the software design by establishing coding standards and practices
  
 
  Identifying technical risks and proposing solutions to mitigate them
  
 
  Overseeing and coordinating the work of developers and engineers involved in the implementation of the solution
  
 
  Testing and debugging the software to ensure that it is functioning as expected
  
 
  Providing guidance and support to the development team throughout the development life-cycle
  
 
  Evaluating third-party tools and technologies to determine their suitability for use in the project.
  
 The Successful Applicant
  You will have expertise in the following: 
 
  Software architecture design and implementation
  
 
  Legacy system modernisation
  
 
  Enterprise/Complex software development
  
 
  Object-oriented programming languages (such as C#)
  
 
  Cloud computing platforms (such as AWS or Azure)
  
 
  Best practice DevOps usage
  
 
  Data Engineering principles
  
 What's on Offer
  In return for your hard work and dedication, a highly competitive salary package, a supportive and collaborative team culture, and opportunities for career advancement within the company are offered. 
  If you are passionate about technology, and specifically product development and want to work on cutting-edge tech & tooling that you lead and champion the adoption of, then we want to hear from you.

Job Title: Network Intelligence Optimisation Chapter Type Lead Principal
Description:
Employment Type
  Permanent
 
 
   Closing Date
  29 Apr 2023 11:59pm
 
 
   Job Title
  Network Intelligence Optimisation Chapter Type Lead Principal
 
 
   Job Summary
 
 
   Job Description
 
 
   We're an iconic Aussie brand with a global footprint. Our purpose is to build a connected future so everyone can thrive. We're all about providing the best experience and delivering the best tech on the best network.
 
 
   This includes making Telstra the place you want to work.
 
 
   For you, that means a having career that grows with you, and working with a team powered by the human connection that prioritizes well-being and choice.
 
 
 
   Make a difference!
 
 
   As part of Global Networks & Technology, your mission will be to lead a high performance Agile chapter of data and network engineers engaged in the development of automation, observability and AIOps capability to manage our world-class network covering the Australian population and connecting businesses globally. Work with leading tech and change the way we do network automation engineering to meet our critical business needs.
 
 
 
   This role will be reporting to the Technology, Development & Innovation Executive, Channa Seneviratne in Global Networks & Technology
 
 
 
   What you'll do
 
 
   As a Network Domain Engineering - Chapter Type Lead-Principal, you use your extensive experience and very well-developed business, interpersonal, and technical skills to deliver against the following responsibilities:
 
 
   Interact with your key stakeholders to synthesise requirements and develop strategic initiatives to deliver effective capability and resourcing plans.
   Collaborate with other Chapter Area Lead peers and your chapter leads to grow and develop your chapter members’ areas of expertise in data engineering and network engineering. Ensure alignment on the “being” and “doing” of the work they perform in teams. You manage organisational people leadership activities as required.
   Drawing on your deep expertise and experience in data engineering and /or network engineering and people leadership to coach and mentor your chapter leads and chapter team members, identifying and developing their skills, as well as helping support with any business challenges and opportunities being solved in the team.
   Actively maintaining the talent pipeline for your chapter type, to meet team demand, including recruitment and selection of new chapter leaders and chapter members in collaboration with Product Owners and Chapter Area Lead.
   Ensuring that all your chapter leads, and members have clarity on performance, behavioural goals, and expectations. You gather and share feedback so that your chapter leads are clear on their performance and contribution to both missions and the chapter. You manage performance-related issues as required.
   You are a role model in maintaining and developing your own expertise and knowledge to ensure you bring the latest thinking to your role and helping to empower others with that knowledge.
   Translating customer needs and requirements, into realisable and commercially viable, services, or systems and/or platforms by drawing on your deep expertise in multiple fields/verticals of network, data and software engineering and utilising agile and/or lean ways of working.
   Taking an active role in managing vendor performance and technology delivery to ensure that agreed technical functionality, time, and cost outcomes are met.
   Contribute to technology investment advice and recommendations
   Managing Chapter Team resource allocation to ensure that capital and operational expenditure goals are met or exceeded across the chapter and in line with Group Executive targets
   Modelling Telstra and best practice standards and actively developing less experienced engineers through coaching, mentoring, and collaboration.
   Proactively modelling resiliency mindset in people, process, and systems to ensure that single points of failure are identified, mitigated, and are not built-in to new capability planning, implementation, or delivery
   Ensuring architectural solutions are reusable, scalable, reliable, manageable, and operable and align with the Telstra technology strategic directions and meet any specific OKR’s.
   Ensuring application of engineering best practices, including up-to-date security principles and best practices so that chapter leads, and members are providing and maintaining technical expertise across proposed solutions to contribute to the delivery of potential for the customer.
 
 
 
   What you need to succeed
 
 
   To be successful in the role, you'll bring skills and experience in:
 
 
   Essential
 
 
   Experience in hiring, mentoring, and coaching people managers
   Strong leadership experience and ability to strategically lead a team and drive outcomes
   Strong stakeholder management, collaboration, and ability to communicate with influence
   Very good knowledge of data engineering techniques
 
 
 
   Highly Desirable
 
 
   Broad knowledge of fixed and mobile networks T Telstra engineers and operates
   Good knowledge of DevOps
   A good knowledge of current requirements and emerging trends in advanced network automation using AI/ML
   Strong experience in the intersection of applied data engineering in networks
 
 
 
   This role will be reporting to the Technology, Development, and Solutions Executive, Channa Seneviratne. If you’re keen to express your interest and know more about the role, you may reach out to him via 
  
   LinkedIn
  .

Job Title: FX - Production Support Engineer - FIX/ET exp
Description:
The Production Support engineer acts as a professional in the Global FX IT support team, providing front line support to the trading and sales business community and external clients for the FX applications (Pricing and Trading) and their associated applications used by the Global Foreign Exchange business.  The team is responsible for management of the company's premier FX trading platforms providing execution, market data and post-trade services to external and internal clients.  You will be expected to balance between fast response (e.g., electronic trading monitoring and incident management) and longer-term activities (e.g., DevOps, release planning, security and audit reviews). A single day or even a single hour is likely to see a mix of both.  Working in Production Support means you'll use both creative and critical thinking skills to maintain application systems that are crucial to the daily operations of the firm. You'll work collaboratively in teams on a wide range of projects based on your primary area of focus. While learning to fix application and data issues as they arise, you'll also gain exposure to software development, testing, deployment, maintenance and improvement, in addition to production lifecycle methodologies and risk guidelines. Finally, you'll have the opportunity to develop professionally -and to grow your career in any direction you choose.  Key Responsibilities:  Act as a Production Support engineer in the Global Foreign Exchange IT front office production service team, providing first and second level support to the Trading, Sales, and business community for the suite of applications and their associated components.  Serve as single point of contact to the business, acting as the prime liaison for the application suite into the incident, problem, change, release, capacity, and continuity functions.  The role also includes but is not limited to:
 
   The providing of technical advice around the applications
   Ensuring that all issues are recorded and tracked in accordance with policy
   The reviewing and ownership of all outstanding issues
   Management and communication of major production incidents
   Oversight into the release of change into the production environment
   Active participation in regular capacity and continuity reviews
   User queries and Training
   Liaising with development teams on new application handover and 3rd line escalation of issues
   Application rollout activities (may include some weekend activities)
   The role also demands an early start (4 AM) on Mondays (including on Public Holidays) and working on public holidays
 
  Skills and experience required:  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
 
   Bachelor's degree in a technical subject or equivalent experience
   Basic knowledge of application development lifecycle
   Experience of at least 2 years supporting front office trading applications
   Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
   Familiarity with job scheduling/job dependencies
   Familiarity with production management i.e., capacity management, incident management, change management
   Ability to work under pressure and still deliver
   Understand business fundamentals of FIC electronic trading including FX (spot, forwards), Rates (cash, futures), and commodities.
   Written and verbal communication skills sufficient to communicate directly with business and technical partners at all levels.
   Systematic, fact-based decision making and problem solving.
   Unix: 
   
    Basic Linux command line and process management
     Some exposure to shell scripting (e.g., bash), Perl and/or python
   
   Networks: Basic understanding of TCP/IP, UDP, DNS
   Databases: 
   
    Required - Intermediate: Oracle SQL reporting, query profiling
     Optional - KDB
   
   Networks 
   
    Required - Intermediate: TCP/IP, UDP, network monitoring
     Beneficial - Low latency networks, multicast, routing
   
   Messaging: One or more of - LBM (Informatica Ultra Messaging), Tibco EMS, Solace
 
  This role offers an ambitious and proven Product Support Engineer, the opportunity to join a global bank and really make an impact through their own technical understanding and ability.  To learn more about this exciting new role please contact Simon Payne on 0401 334 612 or to apply please send your resume to email - simon.payne@marsrecruitment.com.au

Application DevOps Engineer 
  
  Join our Enterprise Application Services team and help us modernise and transform our global enterprise scheduling platform based on BMC Control-M. 
  
  
 We are looking for a mid-level DevOps engineer with the following core responsibilities: 
 
  deliver initiatives that improve the customer experience and automate manual processes 
  maintain and enhance use of configuration management and deployment automation tools to conduct system upgrades and apply patches 
  collaborate with product subject matters experts and developers to enhance the current service offering 
  champion adoption and good customer practices 
  participate in an on-call rota. 
 
 To be successful in this role you will ideally have: 
 
  3+ years of experience working in a large enterprise technology environment (preferably in a financial services organisation) 
  A minimum of 2 years' experience in providing application support, delivery or as DevOps engineer 
  experience in Unix scripting, Databases as well as general management of the platform infrastructure 
  knowledge on integrations using Control-M plugins and API based connections with other infrastructure services 
  maintain high availability of the platform of a large infrastructure environment 
  familiar with various DevOps, Source Code management and Automation tools 
  ability to work autonomously and with a diverse range of stakeholders to deliver an outcome 
  a development background with exposure to public cloud will be an advantage. 
 To join our passionate technology team, apply online via the link. 
  
  Find out more about Macquarie careers at" http://www.macquarie.com/careers

Excellent Data Engineer opportunity working on Data Transformation 
 Your new company 
  A leading profit-to-members super fund based in Melbourne providing competitive and cost-effective superannuation services to members. Our client is looking for a Data Engineer to join their small team on a permanent basis to support the ongoing delivery of data transformation. 
  
 Your new role 
  Reporting to the Lead Data Engineer, you will play a key role in supporting the end-to-end design, development, delivery, and operation of solutions that enable trusted, consistent and timely information to the business. 
  You will be responsible for: 
 
  Providing data provisioning expertise in project support activities including aligning data warehouse and other development work, document implementation plans, review BRD's and business cases 
  Undertake research and development on new data provisioning capabilities, functionality and emerging technologies as required, 
  Produce the design and development of scalable and testable software using modular object-oriented principles, design patterns and practices 
  Ensuring data warehouse data is correct and available through ongoing monitoring, troubleshooting, and remediation of issues 
  Drive continuous improvement across data provisioning processes and technologies 
  Maintain and manage documentation for ongoing data requirements including interface contracts, code versions, data lineage and rules and business requirements 
  Liaise with internal and external stakeholders 
 
 What you'll need to succeed 
  The successful candidate will have 3-5 years' experience in Data Engineering with experience in: 
 
  Demonstrated experience with ETL tools, MS BI stack, MS Azure, SQL Server (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) 
  Designing and developing with MOLAP/ROLAP/OLAP tools 
  Designing and developing with reporting tools - Tableau/ PowerBI 
  Demonstrated experience and knowledge in SDLC, Agile, Kimball and DevOps 
  Experience working in the superannuation industry (preferred) 
  Strong communication and stakeholder influence abilities 
 
 What you'll get in return 
  You will be part of a fantastic small knit team in an organisation with excellent work culture. You will also get: 
 
  Permanent opportunity with great career perks 
  Competitive salary up to $155k package 
  Hybrid and flexible work arrangements 3 days WFH 
 
 What you need to do now 
  If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. 
  If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job Description:
  ControlUp is transforming the way IT manages systems, troubleshoots and remediates issues. We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our physical end-point products division in the Asia Pacific Region who will also be involved in Tier 3/3rd level product support escalation of our web-based enterprise SaaS products. The ideal candidate would be able to split their day between 3 rd level support and resolving customer tenant issues. This is a full-time, permanent home-based position. 
  
  
 Description of Work: 
  
 
  Deploy and operate a large-scale cloud platform on Microsoft Azure comprising single and clustered customer tenant VM’s running Linux, NGINX, NodeJS, OpenSearch and Redis. 
  Develop and implement SysOps tools and processes to support and automate ControlUp’s monitoring, patch management and software lifecycle infrastructure. 
  Work within a geographically dispersed team of professionals in the US, Canada, UK, Romania and Israel. 
  Provide 3rd level (inside R&D) support escalation for the Edge DX product line. 
  Create bug tickets and test hotfixes for our web-based enterprise SaaS products. 
  Work with ControlUp Customer Support teams to provide technical support escalation and hotfixes for customer incidents. 
  Work with customers to troubleshoot incidents. 
  Maintain Support FAQs for known issues. 
  Help produce deep-dive technical training materials for Edge DX product. 
  Continuously develop knowledge and skills on pertinent systems. 
  Demonstrate strong oral and written communication skills. Must haves: 
  Strong scripting abilities, ideally cross-platform (Windows, Linux, Mac), including languages such as PowerShell and Bash. 
  Strong experience with Azure and optionally AWS; troubleshooting webservers, databases, and applications running on Linux. 
  Knowledge and experience of troubleshooting tools such as Process Explorer (Windows), MITM proxies (such as Charles, MITMProxy, TCPDump or similar) 
  Experience with and ability to troubleshoot TLS certificate issues, network difficulties (such as being able to identify when traffic is blocked by a proxy), OS permissions issues etc – i.e., strong troubleshooting skills. 
  Experience troubleshooting RESTful services/APIs – understanding HTTP response codes (such as 200, 401, 500). Be able to monitor REST calls (such as using browser debugging tools) and be able to troubleshoot failed RESTful calls. 
  Platform knowledge – excellent Windows is essential, strong Linux is required; Mac is preferable. 
  3+ years of experience developing or maintaining Web applications. 
  Experience consuming RESTful APIs with Axios, Fetch API or other similar libraries. 
  Experience using distributed version control such as Git/Bit Bucket. 
  Experience deploying software to the cloud, preferably CI/CD. 
  Experience as a self-starter. Organised, self-motivating, team player, reporting into the DevOps manager on the US East coast. 
  Must be eligible to work in Australia. 
  Must hold a valid passport and be willing and able to fly within North America (USA and Canada) for quarterly meetings and occasionally internationally. 
 
  
 Preferred: 
  • Experience dealing with technicians in IT departments and working with them to resolve problems. • Knowledge of NoSQL databases, ideally ElasticSearch/OpenSearch. 
  
 
  Microservices architecture and design principles and scalability best practices. 
  Experience with CI/CD pipeline and tools ideally Azure DevOps Pipelines, experience with YAML 
  Asynchronous programming experience using JavaScript. 
  Knowledge of NodeJS and commonly used components, classes and associated technologies. Pre-qualify yourself, so we’re not wasting your time: 
  If we asked you to obtain a JSON payload from a RESTful API call and decode it, would you be able to? 
  If we asked you to figure out which certificate in an TLS chain was causing a problem, would you be able to? 
  If we asked you to create a script to run on all Windows-based machines to set a registry value, would you be able to? 
  If we asked you to troubleshoot why a Windows service was not starting would you be able to? 
  If we asked you to intercept WebSocket traffic to analyse the traffic, would you be able to? 
  If we asked you to lookup the DNS record for a given URL to make sure it was going to the right place, would you be able to? 
  Can you bring up your own proxy server and set devices to use it? 
  Can you identify when processes are having CPU issues, memory issues, or disk IO issues? 
  Can you handle automating configuration changes to 1000+ servers at a time? 
  Can you be an efficient worker when having to context switch often? 
 Staying on top of tasks and following up with other team members where needed. 
  
 
  Can you identify the bottleneck of specific resources in a cloud hosted VM? About our team: 
 • Our team has a startup culture – anything is possible, we wear multiple hats when necessary to get the job done. • Our number one focus is delivering new customer value (fixes and features) every week. 
  
 
  The team from top to bottom are/were developers and testers, so we make decisions based on sound engineering principles. We hate technical debt and like to keep our code base tidy, but we don’t indulge ourselves in endless refactoring. 
  We are a super agile team; we practice Feature Driven Development - Agile Scrum is not agile enough for us. 
  We are a permanent remote team, but we get together with colleagues from around the world every 3 months for face-to-face meetings and team building.
  
  
 To thrive here:
  o You must enjoy iterative development of features - we get something in front of customers as soon as possible, then iterate until it’s right. 
  o You must enjoy light-touch, lean process. 
  o You must be a self-starter and think for yourself, we don’t have time to micromanage team members. 
  o You must like working in a small team where you can make a difference. o You must be a doer who is practical and pragmatic. 
  o You must fully embrace real-time digital communications with colleagues over Slack and Zoom.

In the Enterprise Digital team, you will be a member of an Agile squad empowered to build and operate Macquarie's group wide digital platform that powers over 20 public facing sites including macquarie.com. Enterprise Digital is an Agile squad empowered to build and operate Macquarie's group wide digital platform. We have full ownership of the digital platform, so you will be involved in managing and supporting the entire technology stack including Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), AWS, microservices and the Google Marketing Platform. 
  
  As an AEM Engineer, you will have experience delivering high-quality digital platforms based on the Java umbrella of technologies. Encompassing the skills and experience of an AEM Engineer, we expect you to have at least 1+ years AEM or 3+ years Java development experience. As a technically excellent programmer, you'll have a deep understanding of software engineering principles."" 
  
  Technical Skills: 
 
  Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Development skills to design solid end-to-end solutions 
  Knowledge of DevOps processes around CI/CD practices and tools. 
  Development of components, templates, and workflows for AEM 
 
 
  Develop and design content-driven solutions using AEM, Java, OSGI, Sling, etc. 
  Experience with integration of RESTful APIs for rich systems integration with in-house and 3rd party services 
 To be successful in this role you will have: 
 
  AEM expertise, ideally with exposure to the AEM Cloud Service. 
 
 
  Demonstrated experience using full stack web developer technologies including Java, JSP, Servlets, ReactJS/AngularJS, HTML/CSS AJAX, XML and JSON 
  Hands on experience in creating Sightly Components and Templates, Sling Models, Java Services, Scheduled Jobs, Event Listeners, Workflows, Servlets in Adobe AEM 
  Good communication, teamwork and customer interaction skills 
  SOLID principles practitioner

The Role 
      We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our software engineering team. The ideal candidate is an exceptional problem solver who can enable our team to continue to deliver a top class code base at scale. 
      Bookipi has grown 10x in the last year and we need your skills to continue to scale. 
      We are a Remote First company and allow full Work From Home. 
      As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our AWS infrastructure, including monitoring and maintenance of our MongoDB instances. 
      You should have extensive experience with AWS services, as well as proficiency with Terraform/CloudFormation or CDK. Bonus points for experience with ECS. 
      Key Actions & Duties 
      
       Design and implement our AWS infrastructure, including monitoring and maintenance of our MongoDB instances 
       Automate deployment and management of services in AWS using infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform/CloudFormation or CDK 
       Ensure high availability, security, and scalability of our infrastructure 
       Collaborate with development teams to ensure smooth integration of new applications and features into our existing infrastructure 
       Manage and maintain backup and disaster recovery plans for our AWS environment 
       Monitor system performance and respond to issues and incidents as they arise 
       Identify opportunities for cost optimization and implement cost-saving measures 
       
      Skill & Experience Requirements 
      
       Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field 
       Minimum of 3 years of experience in DevOps or related field 
       Proficiency in AWS services, including EC2, S3, and VPC 
       Strong understanding of infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform/CloudFormation or CDK 
       Experience with monitoring and maintenance of MongoDB instances 
       Bonus points for experience with ECS 
       Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills 
       Excellent communication and collaboration skills 
       
      About you 
      This is an opportunity to bring your software engineer skills and experience to an environment where you will make a difference and accelerate our delivery process. You are encouraged to take an innovative and proactive approach to your work with the support of a great team. 
      You have proven experience in all phases of the testing process including planning, implementation, and execution. 
      You have a desire to share the great things we have built to make a positive impact on our users. 
      You have the ability to independently create effective communications and run campaigns. 
      You possess strong communication skills and work well with diverse teams.

  Flexible work options, including working from home

As an Information Security Technologist for IT Security’s Capability team, you will work with teams from across the organisation to ensure interoperability of systems so that a variety of security incidents and risks across all Defence Intelligence networks are appropriately detected, addressed, and reported on to enable the security of ASD’s IT systems and missions.

  The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is looking for EL1 Information Security specialists to lead its Capability, Security Operations Centre, Advice and Assistance, Continuous Assurance, and Incident Response teams. We are looking for applicants who have the ability to think critically and to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and who are motivated to learn and develop their leadership skills.

Specialist Data Engineer – Perth
 
   Diverse and challenging projects with our Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team
   Engineer and support complex systems to manage BIG data compute tasks
   Turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions
   Utilise your hands-on coding skills in Python and/or R

  About the Role
  Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs. 
 We have an opportunity for a Specialist Data Engineer to work with challenging and exciting analytics problems and positively impact the business while engaging with a team of technology experts and data scientists. This role will involve gaining substantial experience working with our data systems to develop state-of-the-art data solutions for our business’s data problems. The Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team is courageous in the pursuit of innovation, curious in the development of emerging technologies and caring of our people and relationships. You will be regularly challenged but given the support to drive your innovations!
  Reporting to the Senior Data Engineer, you will support the Advanced Data Analytics team to design and continually improve services that solve business problems and provide insight to making improved decisions for our Iron Ore business. You will utilise your hands-on solid coding skills in Python, R and/ or Scala to
 
   Ensure best in class processes and techniques to develop and deploy data analytics solutions to the business
   Collect, aggregate, and analyse structured/unstructured data from multiple internal sources and provide patterns, insights, and trends to the business decision-maker
   Utilising the latest available technologies to flexibly manage and scale data pipelines and analytics models
   Developing platforms and processes that support the reproducibility of results
   Foster an innovative and “disruptive” technology culture to identify and drive value-creating opportunities
   Help the broader Rio Tinto Iron Ore function by advising technical complexity of identified opportunities
   Provide training and knowledge transfer to support the deployment and continuity of the analytics products developed
 
  This role will suit applicants residing in or willing to permanently relocate to Perth, Western Australia.
  About You  Ideally, you will have a postgraduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, or a related field, combined with extensive experience as a data engineer in Machine learning projects, preferably using agile methodologies.
  You will also have experience with some or all of the below:
 
   Proficiency in exploring and manipulating large datasets through applications or programming interfaces.
   Demonstrated experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning using heavy industry data sets (structured and unstructured)
   Ability to write and optimise SQL queries and create efficient data extract/transform/ load (ETL) programs and tasks
   Pipeline development, across different data architectures, (transactional, time series, streaming, unstructured) and storage solutions including use of APIs
   Cloud based solution design using containerisation and serverless architectures in AWS and/or Azure (Cloud Formation/ARM)
   Knowledge in Change control using Git and release pipeline experience using Azure DevOps
   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and logically resolve technical problems
   Agile delivery and project management
   Proficiency in SQL, Python/ R, Linux (Bash), Scala and Go (desirable)
   Software engineering experience desirable
   Knowledge and skills in one or more of the big data frameworks, i.e., Spark, Hive, Hadoop (desirable).
 
  Where you will be working
  This role is based in Perth, Western Australia, out of our Central Park office, working Monday to Friday, with ad hoc travel to sites in the Pilbara. We support and encourage flexible working arrangements.
  What we offer
  Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
 
   A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
   A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
   A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
   Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
   Attractive share ownership plan
   Company provided insurance cover
   Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
   Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
   Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
   Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
   Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
   Possible domestic relocation assistance.
 
  About Rio Tinto
  Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers. 
 For 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
  Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
  Every Voice Matters
  At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
  We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
