Job Title: FX - Production Support Engineer - FIX/ET exp
Description:
The Production Support engineer acts as a professional in the Global FX IT support team, providing front line support to the trading and sales business community and external clients for the FX applications (Pricing and Trading) and their associated applications used by the Global Foreign Exchange business.  The team is responsible for management of the company's premier FX trading platforms providing execution, market data and post-trade services to external and internal clients.  You will be expected to balance between fast response (e.g., electronic trading monitoring and incident management) and longer-term activities (e.g., DevOps, release planning, security and audit reviews). A single day or even a single hour is likely to see a mix of both.  Working in Production Support means you'll use both creative and critical thinking skills to maintain application systems that are crucial to the daily operations of the firm. You'll work collaboratively in teams on a wide range of projects based on your primary area of focus. While learning to fix application and data issues as they arise, you'll also gain exposure to software development, testing, deployment, maintenance and improvement, in addition to production lifecycle methodologies and risk guidelines. Finally, you'll have the opportunity to develop professionally -and to grow your career in any direction you choose.  Key Responsibilities:  Act as a Production Support engineer in the Global Foreign Exchange IT front office production service team, providing first and second level support to the Trading, Sales, and business community for the suite of applications and their associated components.  Serve as single point of contact to the business, acting as the prime liaison for the application suite into the incident, problem, change, release, capacity, and continuity functions.  The role also includes but is not limited to:
 
   The providing of technical advice around the applications
   Ensuring that all issues are recorded and tracked in accordance with policy
   The reviewing and ownership of all outstanding issues
   Management and communication of major production incidents
   Oversight into the release of change into the production environment
   Active participation in regular capacity and continuity reviews
   User queries and Training
   Liaising with development teams on new application handover and 3rd line escalation of issues
   Application rollout activities (may include some weekend activities)
   The role also demands an early start (4 AM) on Mondays (including on Public Holidays) and working on public holidays
 
  Skills and experience required:  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
 
   Bachelor's degree in a technical subject or equivalent experience
   Basic knowledge of application development lifecycle
   Experience of at least 2 years supporting front office trading applications
   Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
   Familiarity with job scheduling/job dependencies
   Familiarity with production management i.e., capacity management, incident management, change management
   Ability to work under pressure and still deliver
   Understand business fundamentals of FIC electronic trading including FX (spot, forwards), Rates (cash, futures), and commodities.
   Written and verbal communication skills sufficient to communicate directly with business and technical partners at all levels.
   Systematic, fact-based decision making and problem solving.
   Unix: 
   
    Basic Linux command line and process management
     Some exposure to shell scripting (e.g., bash), Perl and/or python
   
   Networks: Basic understanding of TCP/IP, UDP, DNS
   Databases: 
   
    Required - Intermediate: Oracle SQL reporting, query profiling
     Optional - KDB
   
   Networks 
   
    Required - Intermediate: TCP/IP, UDP, network monitoring
     Beneficial - Low latency networks, multicast, routing
   
   Messaging: One or more of - LBM (Informatica Ultra Messaging), Tibco EMS, Solace
 
  This role offers an ambitious and proven Product Support Engineer, the opportunity to join a global bank and really make an impact through their own technical understanding and ability.  To learn more about this exciting new role please contact Simon Payne on 0401 334 612 or to apply please send your resume to email - simon.payne@marsrecruitment.com.au

Software Engineer (Data & Integration)
Who are we?
Drive Yello helps businesses efficiently manage last-mile delivery and connects them to gig economy drivers so they can meet the ever-increasing demand for convenience. We have ambitious growth plans and are looking for a passionate engineer to help drive the scaling of our business through data. We work with some of the largest retail clients here in Australia which include Woolworths, BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Coles, Terry White Chemmart just to name a few.
We have the opportunity to solve great technical challenges every day in an environment where every commit is adding value for our customers. We’re a great bunch of people working to help retailers provide the convenience customers are demanding.
Who are you?
As a Data and Integration Engineer, you will be empowered to help make the most out of our data here at Drive Yello. You understand the importance of data, and having the right data available in the right environments to the right people. Security and privacy will be at the heart of what you do, so you are comfortable identifying and managing sensitive information.
Working closely with our business intelligence team, you will be responsible for the preparation and transportation of our data to our data warehouse while also staging the data for our BI reporting. In parallel, you will be responsible for integrating with other internal and external systems to transport our data to where we can make the best use of it. You will build up a deep understanding of our data, and act as an interface between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
This position is key to unlocking our data and driving our future business decisions. The ideal candidate will be passionate about data, delivering clean solutions and thriving in a start-up environment.
You will work closely with the Head of Software Engineering while also working cross-functionally with our internal departments (Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Community Experience) to further scale data at Yello.
What we are looking for:

 A minimum of 2 years of software engineering experience within an Agile development environment
 Experience with Python and Node.js
 Experience in SQL databases, MongoDB is a plus
 Solid experience working with 3rd party APIs, data pipelines and moving data across internal and external platforms
 Experience with AWS or Google Cloud
 Ability to interact with a range of stakeholders, with strong written and verbal communication skills
 A proactive can-do attitude, an appetite for learning, and a passion for data!

What we use:

 Google BigQuery
 MySQL, MongoDB, Redis
 AWS and Google Cloud

What you should do
If this sounds like it could be you, hit the apply button, we would love to hear from you!
Drive Yello is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  The UX Designer needs to understand business requirements, the product vision and any technical limitations when designing solutions. They are also responsible for gathering customer feedback and translating these into user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and/or prototypes. Using agile methodology the UX Designer partners with product and engineering through the build/learn/iterate framework to continually enhance the product to solve customer pain points.
  Responsibilities
 
   Closely partner with assigned squad Product Managers, Tech leads and UI lead to plan and deliver on their roadmaps, having a clear understanding of the product vision and business objectives.
   User Research – collaborate closely with PMs to conceive user research. Conduct research using relevant methodology such as interviews, focus groups, surveys to inform design and product roadmap. Use a pre- defined approach to document the output of the research.
   Voice of Customer – leverage all available means, from existing customer insight channels (sales, on-boarding, customer support) as well as user research to design product solutions that are useful, usable and delightful to our customers. Be the voice of the customer throughout product design discussions.
   Facilitation - lead or help facilitate white-boarding sessions, workshops and design jams with multidisciplinary teams during product ideation.
   UX artefacts – express your product thinking through Information Architecture, user journeys, personas, wireframes and interactive prototypes. Design and develop intuitive experiences that can be mapped directly to our customer needs. Optimise for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
   Delivery – uses agile best practices to ensure squad has a clear understanding of the user experience and design, delivering artefacts that align with product requirements and ones that can be used by engineering.
   Actively work with designers across squads to ensure there is alignment in the customer journey/ experience where relevant; create transparency into design backlog, the progress being made and to identify/ manage dependencies as well as risk.
   Contribute to, and helps shape, our Design System (HXUI) to establish consistent design aesthetics throughout the product.
   Communication – use established channels of communication to create transparency with key stakeholders on progress
   Educate stakeholders about research principles and the process of driving the integration of UX research data into everyday activities.
   Communication – uses established channels of communication to create transparency with key stakeholders on progress
 
  Knowledge & Experience Required:
 
   3+ years experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments
   A solid grasp of user-centred design and design thinking, planning and conducting user research, user testing, rapid prototyping, and heuristic analysis
   Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas and solutions
   Experience using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
   Proficient in standard UX software such as Sketch, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Zeplin or a similar tool
   Highly proficient in wireframing and prototyping
   Has an appreciation of web technologies: HTML, CSS, and browser capabilities
   Up-to-date with the latest UX trends, techniques and technologies
   Tertiary qualification in user interaction, user experience, visual design and/or software development or related field
 
  Benefits
  As a leading health software company we take pride in building an inclusive and supportive working environment with opportunities for growth and development to help each employee reach their potential. Together, we can positively impact our customers to enable ideal healthcare!
 
   Flexible working environment- Hybrid work
   Attractive referral bonus programmes
   Career progression and learning and development opportunities
   Generous parental and annual leave schemes
   Telstra Rewards program- assess a number of employee discounts and benefits including discounts on shopping, gym memberships, movie tickets and health insurance
   Free Telstra mobile phone and plan for eligible employees

Since 2003, IDE has grown over 100 medical technology businesses and realised over 500 projects across the medical technology landscape, including diagnostics, drug delivery, respiratory care, radiology, radiotherapy, surgical tools and equipment, wearable therapeutic, and diagnostic monitoring devices.

  We are seeking a UX/UI Designer with a passion and desire to create great new products with our clients. 
  The purpose of the role is to 
 
   Collaborate with project teams to effectively plan out assigned activities/tasks to achieve defined goals. This will entail gathering user insights, researching, and evaluating user needs to deliver intuitive designs that provide an outstanding user experience.
   Plan and implement new designs and optimize existing user interfaces.
   Generate digital assets that combine creativity and awareness of design requirements.
   Understand and apply usability engineering principles to optimize user interface designs.
   Conducts assigned activities/tasks following prescribed methods, seeking appropriate review and supervision to achieve appropriate quality.
   Co-ordinate and complete effective reviews of assigned tasks.
   Manage assigned activities/tasks and expectations of relevant stakeholders.
   Communicate effectively and timely on the status of assigned activities.
   Adjust to meet goals and commitments made.
  
  Desired Skills and Experience 
 
   Prerequisites for this position include a university qualification in Visual Communication, Industrial Design or similar discipline, and a minimum of five years’ experience working in new product development, preferably in medical device.
   Ability to work on multiple projects, presenting design concepts, and consulting with your stakeholders on how to improve it.
   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to design solutions and achieve business outcomes.
   Ability to stay current with technology and design tools.
   Can conduct user research and testing.
   Exceptional digital design UX/UI skills applicable on wireframes, websites and apps.
   Ability to organise and hold meetings on Microsoft Teams.
   Ability to work autonomously and as part of an agile team.
   Excellent time management, organisational and communication skills.
   A demonstrated ability to apply original thought in solving open problems by utilising a methodical and logical approach to identify the root cause of an issue, developing a design direction and vision, and delivering solutions that are fresh and novel.
   A demonstrated ability to carry out and/or manage user/stakeholder/market research, and an ability to understand, interpret and utilise results to produce great design.
   Proven product development skills and experience from concept right through to delivery
   Ability to communicate design approach from requirements through to execution
   Understanding of new product development under design controls as specified by a Quality Management System (ISO9001, ISO13485, GMP or similar)
   Computer Skills (required): Microsoft Office suite (inc Powerpoint & Project), Adobe Suite (Xd, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects. CAD software (preferably Solidworks and/or Creo/Pro-e). Employment Type
  Permanent
 
 
   Closing Date
  29 Apr 2023 11:59pm
 
 
   Job Title
  Senior UX Designer
 
 
   Job Summary
  As a Senior UX Designer you are passionate about designing revolutionary digital products and services, that transform customer’s experience. You thrive in a creative and agile team environment, and working closely with your stakeholders to define and implement cohesive innovative solutions that meet the needs of customers. You are a trusted advisor that guides product decisions through user research, customer development, rapid prototyping and iterative feedback loops. Your ability to quickly incubate, test and implement solutions that deliver improved customer and business outcomes, is what makes you outstanding in your role.
 
   Job Description
 
 
 
   First Nations First
 
 
   We acknowledge the First Nations Peoples of Australia as traditional owners and custodians of the land and waters. Australia’s First Peoples are the oldest continuous culture on the planet. We humbly pay respects to their Elders past and present.
 
 
 
   Program overview
 
 
   Given recent data breaches at major Australian companies, Belong is undertaking a program to determine how we identify customers and secure their information. This service design led program is uncovering attitudes, perceptions, and behaviours regarding identity and security, and are we looking for 2 Senior UX Designers to lead workstreams owning the design and delivery of recommendations from this program. This ownership spans problem identification and shaping, all the way through to production ready designs.
 
 
 
   Typical duties
 
 
   While this role will be responsible for the entire product design lifecycle, a typical day will see you partnering with our service design team and a Principal Designer to facilitate discovery workshops and design concepts based on the insights from these workshops. You'll also facilitate customer research activities such as semi-structured interviews and evaluative usability tests to identify unmet customer needs and test concepts.
 
 
 
   You'll be hands on in Figma, using our robust UI Kit, to create screen flows, wireframes, and prototypes of new digital experiences across web and app. You'll also provide mentorship and guidance to a mid-weight UX Designer assisting with the creation of design artefacts.
 
 
 
   Experience required
 
 
   Activities - workshop facilitation, problem framing, generative / exploratory research methods, stakeholder management, low to mid fidelity wireframing, prototyping (in Figma), experience working in and contributing to a design system
 
 
   Tools - Figma, Miro, familiarity with Askable
 
 
 
   Nice to haves
 
 
  
   
     Consulting / agency experience
   
  
   
     Financial services experience
   
  
   
     Native app design experience
   
 
 
   Fun fact: research has shown that women usually think they need to meet 100% of a job’s criteria before they apply. Men often apply if they meet 60% of the criteria.
 
 
   We want as many people from as many backgrounds as possible to apply for all our jobs. Send us an application even if you don’t tick every box.
 
 
 
   We’re flexible
 
 
   We’re all about flexibility and choice at work. Will you choose to work from home, in our office workspace, or on the go? Somewhere regional or the city? We want you to work where, when, and how you're most engaged, safe, and productive – wherever in Australia that may be.
 
 
 
   About Belong
 
 
   It feels good to bring people together.
 
 
   As a telco, we’re making our world a more inclusive place. That means giving Australians the tools they need to get things done in the digital world. Oh, and we’re doing that while being 100% carbon neutral.
 
 
 
   As an organisation, we're focused on having a customer-first mindset and delivering effortless customer experiences.
 
 
 
   As a workplace, we’re building a community of people who bring their whole selves to work. Workplaces can be brutally bland and that’s not good for anyone. Difference makes us all better and we’re always trying to get better.
 
 
 
   Our values
 
 
   We’re here to make our world a more inclusive place. That’s reflected in our four values:
 
 
  
   
     We care.
   
  
   
     We’re better together.
   
  
   
     We make it simple.
   
  
   
     We’re change makers.
   
 
 
 
   They help remind us that we care about the work we do and that, if we do it together, we can make our world a better place for our team and our customers.

User Experience Designer
    
     Here at Maitland City Council, we are going through an exciting period of change with a focus on Customer Driven Transformation, where it’s our vision to ‘deliver un-Council like services’. As part of this we’re seeking a User Experience Designer, to join the team and help shape Maitland’s future.
     Your challenge  Your challenge will be to design reimagined digital experiences, that deliver on our transformational vision and make things easier for our customers. You will be responsible for designing our user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) for all current and future customer facing digital experiences at Council (websites, portals, intranet, phone, mobile, apps), with a particular emphasis on the introduction of new or redesigned self-service options for our customers.
     You will take validated customer needs and use your creativity and skills to craft amazing designs, while continuously responding to an ever-changing digital landscape. The UX Designer will take ownership of Council’s Digital Design System, have the ability to undertake user research, and develop design artefacts that guide their thinking.
     While you are doing all that you will partner and build relationships across the organisation with key stakeholders including Service Designers, Digital Transformation team members, developers, and delivery teams to design, test and validate fit for purpose solutions that deliver on Council’s digital experience ambitions.  
    This is an exciting opportunity where great work gets noticed, and it will have a real impact on both our fast-growing community and Maitland City Council.   About You
     You will have a design thinking mindset, coupled with previous experience as a UX/UI Designer with an exciting portfolio that showcases your talent.   You will be a creative, curious, empathetic, willing to roll your sleeves up, have fun along the way and deliver at pace. You will have the ability to undertake iterative design, apply heuristics and design principles and complete user testing with your design work.   You will be experienced with design tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud with the ability to coach, mentor and guide others whilst increasing the organisations digital prototyping and UX/UI capability.  Living and breathing our Guiding Principles, your main focus will be the customer experience. You will work with stakeholders to bring about improved digital services and experiences that lift digital uptake and makes it easier for our customers to engage with Council.  You will champion the latest design trends and best practice and inspire others within the organisation about what great design looks and feels like.  If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.   
    Benefits
     This is a permanent full time role, working 35 hours per week with a competitive salary on offer.  Council also offers a range of other benefits for its employees including:
    
      Flexible work arrangements with a range of options to suit.
      Great leave entitlements including long service leave after five years, Health and Wellbeing leave and Paid Parental Leave
      Ongoing training and development including access to Council’s Educational Assistance Program, that can provide financial support for study costs and up to 6 study leave days per year.
    
     If your seeking a great team, progressive culture, rewarding work and career development opportunities than this is for you.
    
     Questions?  Should you have any questions, please contact Bridget Wilks, Coordinator Customer Experience, on 02 4939 1024.
    
     To Apply
     To apply for this opportunity, submit your resume and cover letter. In the application process for this role you will be required to address targeted questions, with each response limited to 400 words, in place of addressing the entire essential criteria.  Applications close: Sunday 30 April 2023  Please note, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates will be required to undertake a medical assessment (including drug and alcohol testing). Council also completes a range of other pre-employment checks which may include reference checks, psychometric testing or a criminal history check. For more information about the recruitment process, visit our website and search ‘work with us’.  We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant

It is an exciting time at Macquarie Bank as we look to expand our team of experienced designers, Business Analysts and Subject Matter Experts. 
  
  As a UX Designer you will drive design activities for major features but also work incrementally to optimise and enhance the customer experience. Collaborating with a dynamic team of designers, researchers, business analysts, you will build a shared user research platform, facilitate ideation, research and validation and then share this with the wider team. Finally, you will collaborate closely with developers to understand the feasibility of your ideas and then bring them to life. 
  
  
 In this role you will: 
 
  Gather ideas from stakeholders, such as UX, UI and Service Designers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Architects, Engineers and other experts across the business, through workshops, kick offs and feedback sessions 
  Collaborate with developers from early stage to pre-launch to generate feasible concepts and solutions 
  Design and facilitate workshops and co-creation sessions for ideation and iteration 
  Identify insights from customer research through unmoderated and moderated techniques, interviews, surveys and assist with research recruitment 
  Bring your research to life through personas, customer journeys, service blueprints, stories or scenarios and wireframes 
  Iterate your designs with feedback from user research and testing 
  Work with the team to identify an incremental way to build out designs in a way that can be measured and learned from 
  Synthesise and communicate your findings and recommendations to stakeholders in the team and across the company 
 
 What we're looking for: 
 
  Designers who thrive in a collaborative team, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  Passionate design advocates, committed to best practice, process improvements and sharing ideas and inspiration within the team 
  Problem solvers who love big challenges, tackle them using a collaborative workflow, with the customer front of mind 
  If this sounds like you, please send a CV and portfolio. We'd like you to be able to show your abilities to us in an interview, through your portfolio showcasing experience where you have previously shipped UX design for digital products. 
 
 Design at Macquarie Bank 
  
  The design function and Macquarie, headed by our Chief Design Officer, helps envision and deliver how customers experience our various products and services across multiple digital channels. We span across the full design spectrum, from early-stage conceptual design and research to delivering pixel-perfect interfaces on our digital platforms. We follow a human-centered, data-led approach to design and seek to win by collaborating with our partners and helping deliver exceptional customer experiences as a team. 
  
  
 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
  
  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. 
  
  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

UX Product Designer - Remote (APAC)
  
  Description:   
 Hi! We're amazee.io, a ZeroOps application delivery hub for engineering teams to deploy applications more easily. Our developer-centric, open source platform makes developers’ lives and jobs easier, minimizing the stress of managing infrastructure or operations. amazee.io supports organizations across the globe to accelerate their cloud and container adoption, along with providing easily managed Kubernetes for developer teams. We run anywhere in the world, with 24/7/365 dedicated support.
 
  We’re looking for a UX Designer to drive improvements to how we assess, develop, and improve user experience and interactions with our ZeroOps delivery platform Lagoon. From a largely internal tool, Lagoon has grown to be a core product in its own right. We are growing a design and development team around Lagoon, to drive it into becoming a world leading platform for application deployments, for both technical and non technical users. You'll work alongside a UI Designer, and a Front End Developer in a product development team. We’ve got some exciting new directions to take our interfaces and integrations, and in delivering a more complete experience for all our users.
  
  
  If you feel like this could be the role for you, then come and join a team of open source enthusiasts, committed to providing flexible web solutions in an open and transparent work environment, and having fun doing it.
   Location: As a fully remote company, your exact location isn't so important. For this role we require that you're based in an Australia or New Zealand Time Zone
  
  What you’ll be doing: 
  
  Working with our internal teams, external partners and users to identify opportunities to improve our Lagoon product suite 
  Conducting user research to uncover user’s pain points, needs and opportunities 
  Developing our user journey maps and personas 
  Working closely with developers to develop the look and feel of our products, and ensure a high level of quality and usability 
  Producing sketches and prototypes to test functionality and formalise design requirements 
  Shaping a culture of design at amazee.io to help define the interactions users at all levels have with our products and tools.
 
  
  
  What you’ll bring: 
  
  Demonstrated work experience as a digital Product Designer or similar role 
  Previous experience designing technical products 
  Experience in digital interface design for web/admin interfaces (and maybe even CLI!) 
  Experience with design programs (Inkscape, Illustrator and Sketch) and prototyping tools (Invision, Figma etc) 
  Understanding of how to conduct good UX research to obtain truly meaningful insights (quantitative and qualitative) 
  Strong focus on customer and user advocacy 
  An eye for aesthetic design and customer appeal 
  Comfort communicating design and technical topics in English, both verbal and written
 
  
 amazee.io is dedicated to providing a work environment of trust, transparency, and inclusion for everyone. As a fully remote company we offer flexibility when it comes to working hours and location. Here’s some other things you can expect from us.
 
  What we’ll bring: 
  
  A fully distributed team of creative colleagues in a flat, open and transparent organization - Meet the team, read our handbook, or check out what our team have to say about working at amazee.io on Comparably! 
  Flexible working hours, and time off in lieu when you work overhours 
  Fully remote working 
  5 paid days off a year for conference attendance or education related commitments 
  An annual education benefit of $2,300 AUD or equivalent to dedicate to your professional development 
  An annual wellbeing benefit of $750 AUD or equivalent to dedicate to your physical or mental health 
  A connectivity benefit of $150 AUD or equivalent a month, to help with internet/data costs 
  Your own tech budget with the freedom to choose your setup 
  Sweet, sweet Swag - Hoodies and other goodies 
  amazee.io Quest! - After 3 years, you’ll get 3 weeks paid off work to undertake a profound personal goal, or undertake a bucket list type challenge
 
  
 So what’s next?:
 
  Apply! Send us your CV showcasing who you are, your experience, and anything else you think we should know!  The amazee.io Team

Our growing UX team is on a mission to disrupt the gift card market through intuitive experiences and gifting moments that ignite human connections. As the UX/UI Designer for our apps, you will report to the UX Chapter Lead with the primary focus will be on creating rich and delightful experiences for our customers. Additionally, you will support our app squad in an agile environment to collaboratively design and deliver experiences across our native apps.
  
  
  The Role You'll Play 
  
  Utilise your expertise in native app design to ensure the designs translate seamlessly across a wide range of phone sizes, including folding phones. 
  Use your UX knowledge and creativity to design unique experiences that stand out on a global scale 
  Collaborate closely with our UX researcher to validate design decisions. 
  Develop seamless and easy to use customer journeys. 
  Utilise Figma to create wireframes, high-fidelity designs and prototypes. 
  Establish and maintain our app's design system by creating a set of standard, reusable design components. 
  Use your animation skills to create beautiful interactions that delight our customers. 
  Create detailed documentation and Figma files that are readily available to developers. 
  Work effectively as part of a team and be receptive to feedback. 
  Collaborate closely with the app squad to uplift the quality of our app in an agile manner. 
  Be able to clearly communicate your design rationale to senior stakeholders in the business.
 
  
  
  What are we looking for? 
  
  A portfolio showcasing completed app UX projects, which demonstrates your design style, what you can contribute to the role, your career journey, and aspirations. 
  Extensive experience in taking products from concept to launch. 
  Strong skills in visual user interface design and user experience design. 
  Strong aesthetic and animation skills. 
  In-depth knowledge of Figma and proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud. 
  Experience in responsive design and creating designs for the latest phone sizes, including foldable phones. 
  Knowledge of mobile usability and accessibility standards. 
  Knowledge in creating wireframes, visual mockups, graphics, user workflows, and low and high-fidelity prototypes. 
  Knowledge of mobile development design guidelines for both iOS and Android.
 
  
  
  Benefits: 
  
  We run an incentive scheme based on both company-wide targets because we are all in the same boat, as well as individual KPIs 
  There are generous benefits including employee referral program and staff discounts 
  You will work alongside an experienced team who will challenge you every day (and expect you to challenge them back) 
  We have regular virtual and face-to-face events to help us bond and maintain our community vibe. 
  Prezzee Flex -genuine flexibility is our natural norm with our hybrid work environment. We also offer flexible hours, monthly half day FriYays!, Culture Swap Days & 30 day work from anywhere* opportunity 
  Self led online learning to formal Leadership Development programs, as well as industry specific learning opportunities, and Lunch & Learn sessions. 
  Company wide FIRE Hackathons and Fortnight FIRE Fridays where teams come collaborate to spark with Formative Ideas, Research and Experiment in tech improvements 
  Be an advocate or ally and create connection and belonging in our employee Resource Groups such as EmpowHer and Pride. 
  Global Value Ambassador Program creating value inspired initiatives for our Prezzee People. 
  Lifeworks Wellbeing platform to support your mental, social, financial and physical wellbeing.
 
  
  
  The Prezzee Story 
  Prezzee is a global digital gifting platform that creates human connections through remarkable gifting moments. We create leading digital gift solutions for consumers, businesses and 800+ brand partners across the world. Founded in 2014, Prezzee has evolved from a two person Australian start-up to a global business with a 300+ team and operations in North America, United Kingdom, Australia and New Zealand.
  
  
  Oh, and if you're wondering about our culture? 
  Whilst our growth is compelling, we know it's our people and culture that set us apart, and we're equally proud of being recognised in Australia & New Zealand and in the UK as a 2022 Great Place to Work®. 
  At Prezzee, every team member plays an important role in the business, leaving a unique footprint on Prezzee's journey. Our team may be spread out across multiple time zones, but our core values remain the same no matter where you are in the world. As a future employee of Prezzee, you're signing up to give openness, give greatness, give magic, and most importantly, always give a damn. 
  Prezzee is an Equal Opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is the key to building the best products for our customers, team culture and growing our global business. Our diversity mission is for our people to be their most authentic selves, to inspire, innovate and celebrate within a culture of belonging. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. 
  We are looking for people to help create human connections, make magic and shape the future of gifting so even if you don't think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you! 
  Please let us know if you require any adjustments as part of the application and recruitment process, We also encourage you to let us know of pronouns at any point of the process.

 WHO YOU ARE

   Our mission is to help utilities future-proof their infrastructure and prepare for anything — from systematic risks to severe weather and a clean energy future, so that they can protect their assets, teams, and communities. Utilities count on our 3D digital network model to simulate hundreds of variables to help them understand how their network will respond to any scenario and prepare accordingly. 
   We're proud to be helping utilities accelerate their clean energy transition by removing some of the biggest blockers to their decarbonization goals. With Neara, utilities can 2x their network capacity to make room for more clean energy, accelerate new transmission design by 85%, and reduce their carbon footprint by replacing field visits with stunningly accurate digital network surveys.

WHY
  
  To create elegant, seamless and user-friendly experience and designs for our customers so that they continue to use our products with ease and achieve their business goals
  
  
 JOB DESCRIPTION 
  You are responsible for the design and implementation of all the experiences a user has when interacting with Soprano products. You will work closely with our product team and/or development team to ensure seamless UI design and the successful implementation of UI/UX best practices and principles across all our Soprano products.
  
  You will liaise within the product team to ensure that the requirements are being met, achieving a deep understanding of customer needs, and engaging with the software development team to understand what is possible with the technology. Key element of the delivery includes wireframes, screen renders, screen text, navigation designs, artwork, and CSS to name a few.
  
  As a position of responsibility, it is expected that the duties of this role are conducted with limited direct and day to day supervision and are executed meeting Soprano quality, functional and schedule expectations.
  
  
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
 
   Partner and collaborate with the product and engineering teams to build experiences and features which lead to customer success and delight.
   Investigate and develop a deep understanding of customer needs to craft product changes that really have an impact to improve customer experience through UI.
   Move quickly, iterate rapidly, and expertly strike that important balance between art and data-driven decision-making.
   Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
   Prototyping, iterating designs based on feedback from customers and business stakeholders
   Use paper, InVision and Sketch to create concepts and prototype product ideas to be able to test with customers and gain feedback from business stakeholders.
   Iterate designs based on feedback to ensure product changes have real impact
   Carrying out user testing, synthesising results to form design guidelines
   Deeper understanding of designing UX considering Accessibility requirements adhering to WCAG 2.0 and other similar global standards. Prepare and perform WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 testing when required
   Provide advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyze and predict user behavior.
   Participate in and validate usability testing.
   Conduct usability labs if required.
   Visual thinking and problem-solving.
   Qualitative and quantitative research methods and know how to apply them in a Design Thinking-like process Understand how to navigate cognitive biases to drive the best outcomes for the business
 
  SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  
 
   A bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2+ years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services
   You're a strong all-rounder. From discovery and envisioning right through to working with engineering to get the product built.
   Design thinking is built into your DNA, but you also know how to execute and get things done. You'll be thinking about some of our trickiest and most interesting challenges, and constantly driving to improve the way we do things and improve our processes.
   You like to deliver real results and work fast. You know how to iterate quickly on concepts, and think in terms of “hours and days,” not “weeks and months
   You should be comfortable with an evidence-based approach to product design.
   Experience designing and testing WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 compliant software
   A strong working knowledge of HTML, CSS and experience in using design software such as Sketch, InVision, Visio, iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite
   Proficiency in relevant testing software (AMP, ANDI, aXe, WAVE, NVDA, JAWS)
   Excellent written and oral communication skills.

It is an exciting time at Macquarie Bank as we look to expand our team of experienced designers, Business Analysts and Subject Matter Experts. 
      As a UX Designer you will drive design activities for major features but also work incrementally to optimise and enhance the customer experience. Collaborating with a dynamic team of designers, researchers, business analysts, you will build a shared user research platform, facilitate ideation, research and validation and then share this with the wider team. Finally, you will collaborate closely with developers to understand the feasibility of your ideas and then bring them to life. 
      In this role you will: 
      
      Gather ideas from stakeholders, such as UX, UI and Service Designers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Architects, Engineers and other experts across the business, through workshops, kick offs and feedback sessions 
      Collaborate with developers from early stage to pre-launch to generate feasible concepts and solutions 
      Design and facilitate workshops and co-creation sessions for ideation and iteration 
      Identify insights from customer research through unmoderated and moderated techniques, interviews, surveys and assist with research recruitment 
      Bring your research to life through personas, customer journeys, service blueprints, stories or scenarios and wireframes 
      Iterate your designs with feedback from user research and testing 
      Work with the team to identify an incremental way to build out designs in a way that can be measured and learned from 
      Synthesise and communicate your findings and recommendations to stakeholders in the team and across the company 
      
     What we're looking for: 
      
      Designers who thrive in a collaborative team, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
      Passionate design advocates, committed to best practice, process improvements and sharing ideas and inspiration within the team 
      Problem solvers who love big challenges, tackle them using a collaborative workflow, with the customer front of mind 
      If this sounds like you, please send a CV and portfolio. We’d like you to be able to show your abilities to us in an interview, through your portfolio showcasing experience where you have previously shipped UX design for digital products. 
      
     Design at Macquarie Bank 
      The design function and Macquarie, headed by our Chief Design Officer, helps envision and deliver how customers experience our various products and services across multiple digital channels. We span across the full design spectrum, from early-stage conceptual design and research to delivering pixel-perfect interfaces on our digital platforms. We follow a human-centered, data-led approach to design and seek to win by collaborating with our partners and helping deliver exceptional customer experiences as a team. 
      Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
      The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. 
      We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.
    
     
     
     
    
   
   
    
     
      About Macquarie 
      
      A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. 
      Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 19,200+ employees and offices in 34 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation. 
      You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference. 
      Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Company Description  It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 47 million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible. This is our mission, and it’s why working at Cash App means so much more than a job.  Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.  Check out our locations, benefits, and more at cash.app/careers! 
 

 Job Description
  As a Mobile QA Engineer on Cash, you'll be responsible for the planning, design, development, and execution of manual and automated test suites for Cash. You'll work collaboratively with members of the release management organization, and product & engineering teams to create smoke, regression & feature test suites, and plan for automated solutions to execute and validate against every build.
  You will:
 
   Review PRDs, functional and design specifications and prepare test plans
   Work closely with cross-functional peers to develop manual and automated test suites for existing & new features
   Strategically introduce and optimize testing processes by defining testing standards and leading scalable solutions to testing bottlenecks
   Integrate with CI systems, parallelize automated test execution, including execution in device cloud
   Work with QA & Release Managers to certify a release and investigate issues from Early Access Program
   Be a strong quality advocate on behalf of Cash App members, working closely with software engineers, DevOps, designers, and product managers to release high quality products
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  You have:
 
   Manual and automation testing experience across modern technology stacks
   A deep understanding of test plan creation, test suite development/execution and defect debugging/tracking/management
   A commitment to creating clear and concise test suites from specifications or test case
   Proficiency with manual testing at different layer of the application (web, app, API, backend) across both desktop and mobile surfaces
   Experience developing and maintaining automated tests using UI and/or API based test frameworks, development environments, and CI/CD tools
   A proven record of prioritizing and coordinating work across a large number of product teams (including Engineering, QA, Product Management and Design teams)
   Experience in code/scripting language such as Python or Ruby or Java
   Experience working with CI systems in an Agile / Scrum development environment
 
  Technologies we use:
 
   Jira and TestRail for test/defect management
   Java, Selenium WebDriver, Appium, JUnit, TestNG, and Gradle for UI test automation
   Jenkins/CircleCI, GCP, Docker for infrastructure and CI/CD integration
   SauceLab and AppliTool for cross platform and visual validation
   PAW/Postman, Cucumber, Gherkins, Hemcrest for API-based testing
   Charles Proxy, Android Studio, XCode, iOS/Android simulator/emulator for native testing and debugging
 
  Additional Information
 
  We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace.
  Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.
  Learn more about our efforts to promote inclusion and diversity at block.xyz/inclusion
  Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

An outstanding opportunity exists to join a global market leader and dominant force in the Australian gaming market. IGT is the world leader in the design, development and manufacture of gaming products and systems. IGT Australia provides a range of gaming products, systems and services to the Club, Hotel and Casino industries. 
  IGT is searching for a Software Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Sydney based team. In this role, you will be responsible for game QA testing, game submissions and in-house technical support. 
  The role 
  
  Undertake product functional and quality assurance testing according to test plan. 
  Review and verification of product issues reported from external third-party test lab. 
  Collaboration with other test engineers – both internal and external. 
  Assist with testing of new game features during the development process. 
  Prepare technical documentation and submission of products to third-party test lab. 
  Provide in-house technical support to internal development teams such as, set up and configuration of gaming machines and peripherals. 
  
 The successful candidate will enjoy working within a collaborative team environment and value supporting others. They will be a keen to learn person who also has a high level of thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing tasks. 
  What additional skills will help you stand out? 
  
  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar technical field. 
  Experience in QA roles with a passion for quality and continuous improvement of product. 
  Ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional and cross-geography teams. 
  Knowledge of software testing life cycle. 
  
  An extra bonus if you have: 
  
  Gaming industry experience. 
  Experience with hardware setup and testing of gaming machines and/or systems. 
  Knowledge of test plan development, technical documentation and software test tools. 
  Exposure to Jira and Confluence. 
  
  IGT offers in return: 
  
  An opportunity to participate in a creative, fun and exciting industry. 
  A competitive remuneration package. 
  Flexible work arrangements. 
  An inclusive and informal work environment. 
  Active lifestyle subsidy program. 
  Opportunities for career growth and development in a large global organisation.
 
  
  
  If you feel you possess the necessary attributes for this full-time opportunity or know someone who may, please send cover letter and resume to ozcareers@igt.com

Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer, TikTok LIVE- Australia
Description:
Responsibilities 
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

 At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. 

 The TikTok Live QA team has been focusing on the high quality and the best user experience of TikTok Live products. Our team uses advanced autotesting tools and comprehensive quality assurance methods to continuously control the delivery of products. We are looking for passionate Quality Assurance engineers to join this fast growing industry. 

 
Responsibilities:
 1. Responsible for the quality assurance of TikTok's Live revenue products. 
2. Deeply involved in the product development process, coordinate with global R&D Center to continuously deliver products with high quality. 
3. Improve product quality and efficiency through technical means such as tool platform development, automated testing and performance testing. 
4. Prospective technology research and application, applying appropriate technology to improve business quality. 
Qualifications 

 
Qualifications:
 1. BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent majors, with at least 3 years of native or backend testing experience. 
2. Good computer foundation, master at least one of the programming languages: Java/Objective-C/Python/Golang. 
3. Abilities to design and execute complete testing plans for complex projects; 
4. Good logical thinking and team communication skills; 
5. Having systematic work experience in automated testing, performance testing, and quality system construction is preferred. 

 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. 

 In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to their Elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.

Be part of a growing health tech company that does meaningful work. 
   T-shirt is a house of health technology brands with a central focus on forging pathways for people with disability and long-term health needs. We craft innovative, digital solutions intended to make a genuine difference to people seeking convenience, accessibility and inclusion. 
   Part of T-shirt's business is Provider Choice, a high touch Plan Management business that allows us to focus on what is most important; the human connection and supporting our participants in achieving their goals. In addition to the Plan Management business, we've recently launched HeyHubble, a technology platform, that helps NDIS participants find quality providers who match their individualised needs through our easy-to-use online marketplace.
 
  The role 
  We're looking for a QA Tester (Salesforce) to drive best practice quality standards in the delivery of user-centric software solutions for our business. 
  In this role you'll collaborate with our Tech & Product team which includes software engineers, a salesforce engineer, a Head of Product, a Delivery Lead, a Head of Engineering, machine learning and data experts, product managers and product designers.
  
  
  In this role you will: 
  
  Be a key voice in helping us deliver high-quality software solutions at T-shirt 
  Make a significant contribution to our Salesforce implementation within the business 
  Collaborate with the wider Tech and Product team as well as other key business stakeholders to identify and implement quality improvements needed across our digital product offerings 
  Establish quality assurance criteria and measure quality improvements 
  Report risks and issues that might impact quality 
  Develop test objectives, test approaches, and test plans. 
  Measure and report on test progress and test results 
  Understand when test automation is appropriate and when it is collaborate effectively with engineering team members 
  Create and execute test cases to ensure optimal performance of our digital products 
  Review operational requirements and design specifications 
  Lead and conduct UAT sessions with the business 
  Prepare, update and maintain user guides and training materials.
 
  
  
  About you 
  
  4+ years of experience as a QA Tester 
  Must have experience working in a Salesforce environment 
  You champion quality software delivery and you have a continuous improvement mindset 
  You're a team player – you take pride in working with others to build 'high quality, high performance' products at scale 
  You get a kick out of developing tools and practices that enable quality and make the engineering process better 
  Excellent communication skills – you have the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with all stakeholders 
  Ability to work in a fast paced environment while maintaining quality standards. 
  You are passionate about customer experience when it comes to digital products 
 
 
  Our Values 
   
  Why join us? 
  
   Our mission is big and meaningful. It's about using smarts and heart to transform the lives of some of the most vulnerable Australians. 
   We're a certified Great Place to Work - 2 years running! 
   You'll be joining a startup that is shifting into scale up mode so it's a time of rapid and exciting growth! We have experienced 1,765% growth as a business since our first capital raise and our team grew 294% in 2021 and 118% in 2022! 
   The NDIS is a part of the core government funding budget and is awarded over $30 billion annually. 
   With strong backing from venture capitalists and high-net-worth investors, we have recently closed off our Series A funding round of $11 million. 
   And that doesn't even measure the impact that we're having. We've helped over 15,000+ families navigate the NDIS and in some cases, it's life-changing. 
   You'll be joining an amazing values and purpose driven team who are highly engaged (we have a eNPS of 57%) and love what they do! 
  
  Balanced and inclusive team 
   At T-shirt, we're from all over the world (17+ countries and counting), women make up more than 60% of our workforce and 68% of our leadership team. We see the diversity in our backgrounds, identities and beliefs as our greatest asset. We're looking for values aligned people with passion, grit, and integrity. 
   We consider a diverse range of experience and skill-sets for our roles and you're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. 
   More about T-shirt
   
   In our world, everyone has the right to dream, hope and live the life they want. 
   T-shirt is an innovative health tech company that helps people living with disability and long-term health needs to overcome their challenges, achieve their goals, and improve the quality of their everyday lives. 
   Learn more about our story and we're excited to meet you!

About WooliesX 
  At WooliesX, our people believe in creating better everyday experiences for our community. 
  
  With 1,800+ team members, multiple practices and over 100 chapters, there’s a home for everyone here. Whether your interests lie in data driven insights and product engineering, digital media, ecom, operations, customer advocacy, commercial, agile or more, you can find your squad across all kinds of capabilities. 
  
  Our squads live their “one day”, every day. We work on Australia’s most innovative tech, design, engineering and more to transform the way that millions of Australians live and shop. Physically, you can find us in Surry Hills, but virtually, we can be anywhere. 
  
  Our culture combines the support, care and freedom that comes with being part of the Woolworths Group. We are an agile team embracing diversity of thought and positive change. We thrive on pragmatism, mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. As a team we continually seek ways to support and learn from each other.  
  
  About The Role  WooliesX are seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer to join one of the squads in the Digital Experience Tribe. The Digital Experience Tribe primarily focuses on consumer facing platforms such as Website Ecommerce, Content and Mobile Apps. 
  Software Engineers will work in a team of 4-5 engineers, a Product Manager and a QA to uplift an Ecommerce Web platform that generates more than a billion dollars in revenue a year. 
  The candidate will also be expected to raise the standard of Engineering at WooliesX by actively participating in Technical chapters and guilds. 
  
  About You 
  
   You’re an Engineer with years of experience dealing with complex problems at scale 
   You ‘Get’ Agile and feel comfortable giving input on team processes 
   You know what best-in-class Engineering looks like and want to help drive the journey 
   You’re involved in the Software Engineering community. You either attend meetups, conferences, have a Blog or GitHub portfolio 
   You enjoy being part of every part of the Software development lifecycle - own the code from inception through to Production 
   You want to be part of a Digital Transformation and enjoy working in a fast paced environment 
  
  
  Competencies 
  
   Strong .NET skills 
   Strong engineering practices and disciplines 
   Demonstrable experience with modern CI tools 
   Great Agile experience and sensibilities 
   Able to communicate effectively with stakeholders 
   Desirable: Strong experience with Angular, but experience with any modern Javascript framework will be highly regarded 
  
  
  What You’ll Do 
  
   Develop high quality, scalable and performant solutions 
   Involved in all aspects of the Software development lifecycle from design, development, testing through to deployment 
   Work in a small Agile team 
   Mentor and coach junior to mid level engineers 
   Not afraid to speak up in cross squad and tribe conversations about engineering best practices 
  
   Required Skills 
  
   Significant .NET experience 
   Ability to stay calm in challenging circumstances and work through problems methodically 
   Ability to question decisions and challenge the status quo 
   Ability to mentor and coach junior engineers 
   Good understanding of engineering practices 
   Details oriented 
   Good understanding of Agile & Lean delivery principals, and can provide input to team processes 
   Understanding of modern development paradigms 
   Desirable: experience with Elastic Search (or perhaps with a similar Lucene based platform) 
  
  
  What's in it for you 
  
   An attractive remuneration package 
   Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too 
   Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative 
   An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people 
   DevX day - quarterly event with high profile guest speakers, prizes, and loads of fun around digital technology 
  
  
   
   
  Grow with the Group  
  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  
  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  
  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  
  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  
  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  
  We’d love to hear from You  
  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.

Employee Duties and Position Description
Role: Payment Test Engineer
Reporting to: QA Manager
Employment: Permanent, Full-time
Location: NSW
Who is Till?
Till Payments is on a mission to create seamless customer payment experiences globally. Powered by technology, Till’s belief is that payments and merchant acquiring should be technology-led, agile and flexible.
Till simplifies the way businesses accept payments across online, in-store, mobile, unattended and point of sale systems. The payments game is evolving and Till are staying one step ahead, building world class technology paired with local service to support customers.
Who do we need on the team, and what will you be doing?
We’re looking for a Payment Test Engineerto join Till Payment applications for terminals. You are experienced in testing smart payment applications with a focus on delivering the quality at scale. You are a passionate to drive quality and enjoy payment testing, that is in pursuit of high-quality results.
You’ll work closely with a range of QA Engineers and Leads. You’ll be engaged all aspects terminal payment journey i.e., scope, requirements, testing, reporting and help in understanding production issues.
Who are you, and what experience will you bring?
We’re a payments business, so experience of the payment’s domain testing is key for success. On top of that, it’s important that you’ll have:

 Experience in working in Agile and waterfall projects.


 Well-versed in ISO8583/AS2805 payment messaging standards.


 Hand-on experience with POS terminal testing.


 Experience with scheme simulator for MasterCard, Visa, and other major schemes.


 Experience of working through requirements of scheme certifications.


 Strong manual functional testing experience i.e., Test cases writing, review, Test strategy, Test plan and TSR preparation.


 Working through issues, engage with the right stakeholders to help solve issues.


 Defect management experience on JIRA.


 Strong technical skills in Card present and Card Not present domains.


 Desirable to have API experience and understanding API test tools (Postman).


 Ability to work independently in fast paced environment.


 Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management.

What will you get from Till?

 We’re proud of our collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant culture and we have a ‘One Team, One Family’ mindset. We take care of ourselves, our teams, our customers, and our community.
 We have a range of benefits and perks that include 14 weeks paid parental leave for those growing their families, paid volunteering leave to give back to our communities, flexible work arrangements, great social and cultural events, and a kitchen full of goodies to make sure you never get hangry.

  hummgroup (ASX-HUM) is one of Australasia’s most successful and enduring fintech organisations with a proud legacy of rewriting the playbook for digital spending. We help people buy everything, everywhere, every day. Our product ecosystem of Buy Now Pay Later, credit cards, and business financing products has been designed around the core needs of today's shoppers, retailers, and small and medium enterprises.
  About this role?
  With a strong business focus on the technology portfolio, the hummgroup currently has a, exciting opportunity for Graduate QA Engineer. You will gain exposure to our suite of products and work with a team of like-minded and hard-working individuals that enjoy and have pride in what they do. You will join an environment that is fast paced but also knows how to have a good time at work.
  Responsibilities within the role:
 
   Conduct testing and QA activities on web applications, APIs, and integrations with our Global BNPL platform.
   Develop, maintain, and review manual and automation test plans and scripts for new features.
   Contribute to building new test automation frameworks for mobile/web UI and APIs and improve existing automation artifacts.
   Create and maintain regression and smoke tests to ensure test coverage across our Global BNPL ecosystem.
   Work closely with Humm business and product teams to review business requirements and designs for upcoming features and new products.
   Identify and manage production defects and work closely with Production Support team on resolution.
   Actively involved in adopting and improving Humm Scrum Framework and QA best practices.
 
  Key Requirements in the role:
 
   Bachelor's or master’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
   Proficiency in at least one programming language (i.e. Java, C#, Python, Groovy).

   Fast learner with a willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
 
  Desired Requirements

   Familiar with Agile and DevOps processes and practices

Who are you?We are looking for a person with a true desire to learn and the motivation to improve yourself and your skills every day. You love the idea of immersing yourself in data to drive meaningful insights and create jaw-dropping outcomes. You’ll need creativity to deliver those outcomes in meaningful, digestible forms
Who we areAt the Data School, we don’t look at what’s on your CV or your experience. We want to create the next generation of first-class data analysts and data scientists. If you are passionate about data, we have the best way for you to get into a new career in data.
How does it work?Successful applicants will be immersed in 4 months of intensive training using market-leading technologies – Tableau and Alteryx.
In addition, you will hone all the soft skills needed to become an outstanding consultant.
The training is followed by four 6-month client engagements with Australia's leading organisations to give you real-world experience to kick-start your new career.
Do I get paid?Yes. The Data School offers you a competitive salary while you gain valuable industry experience.
More details

 $60,000 per annum that will increase in the second year
 28-month, fixed-term contract to start your new career as a data consultant
 When you finish the contract, you can stay on as a consultant and continue to work on some fascinating projects or go it alone. Either way, we are here to help every step of the way. On completion, you will also become part of our Alumni network
 We’re sorry – we can’t sponsor you, so make sure you have full working rights
 Work from our office in the CBD
 For more information about us you can read here: https://www.thedataschool.com.au/school/

Application Process

 Join Tableau - Join the community and download Tableau Public
 Find your data - Choose a dataset that you are passionate about; from politics to sport, TV and popular culture.You can find dataonsites likeKaggle, Data.world, data.gov.au, or the Tableau resources page
 Create your Viz - Once you have your data set, you can begin creating your winning viz! Find insights and use interactivity to tell a compelling story
 Share it with us - Once your work is live on Tableau Public, send it to us using the application form on our website: https://www.thedataschool.com.au/apply/apply-now/
 The Interview - If you impress us with your passion, innovation and understanding of data, you will be invited to an interview

Key datesFor all of our applications closing dates look here:https://www.thedataschool.com.au/apply/
We are taking applications at all times. If you have an inquisitive nature, and a passion for getting to the truth by way of data, then we’d love to hear from you!
