About the Organization:
 This leading Federal government agency supports Australian’s in achieving their goals and helps them to live a better life. Their work has an impact on a significant area in the social sector, and you can contribute to the difference that they make in this role. This agency is known for having a great culture across different teams and have excellent office locations in Melbourne or Geelong. 

 
About the role:
 The EL1 Business Analyst (Digital Delivery) will be responsible for developing and improving digital solutions to enhance the experience and objectives of Participants of the Agency. You will be part of the Digital Division, responsible for implementing enhanced digital applications on the Salesforce platform to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of providers, to support greater outcomes for participants. It enables the effective management of plans through digital platforms that interact with the Agency and relevant providers. 

 
Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
 
 
 Facilitate the identification of digital system related business needs and processes, monitor and collate data, identify competing demands, organisational changes and new responsibilities 
 Evaluate effectiveness of proposed solutions and design in conjunction with stakeholders and subject matter experts 
 Provide project level analysis and producing required analysis documentation. 
 Work with stakeholders to capture business needs and translating requirements into User stories in a simple format that all stakeholders can understand. 
 Document end user journeys, process mapping from as-is analysis to future state processing and improving end user experience. 
 Use and work with software platforms such as Jira, Salesforce, Mulesoft and SAP 
 MANDATORY 

 
 
 Experience working in a similar role under Australian rules and regulations 
 Ability to synthesise and analyse information, prioritising of Application Program Interface (API) requirements, ability to manage competing priorities while maintaining high work standards and accuracy 
 High level engagement skills including planning, communication (written and oral), presentation, facilitation, evaluation and requirements writing. 
 Ability to be self-motivated, responsive and flexible in an environment with time pressures and multiple priorities. 
 Experience in coordinating and assisting in the management of complex cases 
 Excellent written and oral communication skills, and proficiency in the use of IT systems including Microsoft Office 
 Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development 
 The Agency Worker Screening Check. This is only applicable to some positions within the Agency that require the occupant to have access to classified Australian Government information. 
 Current Police Check, o ability to obtain one 
 
Desirable skills to have for the role:
 
 
 Competent with IT systems including knowledge of Application Programming Interfaces 
 Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders 
 
What you will bring to the role:
 
 
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
 Experience in building relationships both with internal and external stakeholders. 
 Ability to work within and across teams, the ability to adapt quickly to a changing environment 
 Ability to manage confidential and sensitive information. 
 Ability to prioritise and allocate tasks in an efficient manner while also maintaining high work standards and accuracy.

BizVision is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team. In this role, you will work with our data team to learn how to develop a mathematical model and apply machine learning techniques.
Do you have a passion for commercial business data? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Sydney team. The position is a hybrid role, which will allow you to learn both remotely and on-site.
About You:
The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter with a strong work ethic and a desire to learn. You should be comfortable working independently and as part of a team, and have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. You should also have a strong interest in:

 Reviewing academic literature.
 Working on mathematical models.
 Optimisation and machine learning techniques.

Requirements:

 Advanced degree in a relevant field, such as Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science.
 Extensive experience with Matlab or Python for modeling and data analysis.
 knowledge of machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning.
 Familiarity with common machine learning libraries, such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
 Experience with data visualization and interpretation of results.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
 Excellent communication skills to clearly explain complex concepts to others.

This is a vocational placement internship position, but we are happy to work with your institution to provide credit or other forms of recognition for your work. For successful candidates, there is the opportunity to move into a part-time/full-time data analyst position within 6 months. If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to hearing from you!
About Us:
BizVision is a small business buying consultancy dedicated to helping entrepreneurs and small business owners achieve their goals. Our team of experts has years of experience in business valuation, financial analysis, and deal structuring, lease negotiations, franchise valuations, and we are committed to providing personalised, client-focused service to each and every one of our clients. At BizVision, we believe that small business buyers are under-represented, and we are proud to support our clients and small business owners in their business acquisition journey helping our economy, and boosting employment in different regions.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.
At BizVision, all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people, and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people.

Job Title: Data Analyst - Work from Home (AUS or NZ)
Description:
Full Time - Working from home or Hybrid role - your choice! 
  Gain experience working for an industry leading global company! 
  MUST be located in Australia or New Zealand to support business in this time zone. 
 
 THE ROLE
  This position will play a significant part in generating workforce reports and identifying people data trends for our managers and key stakeholders. In this role, you will be responsible for preparing reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information. Use statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and actionable results. To excel in this role, you will need experience in generating, analysing and presenting data.
  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  Partner with Key Stakeholders to understand and define their data and reporting needs. 
  Prepare reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information. 
  Use statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and actionable results. 
  Review data security requirements and identify any data security concerns or data anomalies. 
  Support and assist in the maintenance of RI data. 
 
 To be creative and curious about new technologies, embrace digital tools and look for new innovative ways of doing things.
  EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
  
  Experience in generating and manipulating data to generate appropriate reports or outputs for senior management and teams in the business. 
  Moderate experience in data analysis, data cleansing and data reporting. 
  Understanding of data security, data quality and data integrity. 
  Experience with Microsoft Office / Google G Suite applications. 
  Experience in PowerBi or equivalent would be advantageous. 
  Sound problem solving skills to identify data anomalies. 
  Proven high level of organisation, prioritisation, and time management skills. 
  A good communicator who simplifies complex data, engages proactively with stakeholders and builds rapport at all levels. 
 
 BENEFITS
  
  Being a global company there are multiple pathways for career progressions. 
  Employee Rewards programs & Employee discount programs. 
  Flexible Working and a strong work life balance culture 
  Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
  Discounted Pest Services 
  Employee Referral Program – Find a successful candidate and receive cash bonus*. 
 
 ABOUT US
  We’re a local company with an international reach across 90 countries and over 56,000 employees. Rentokil Initial is committed to be a world-class Employer of Choice. We aim to attract, recruit, and retain the best people from the widest possible pool of talent. Our customers range from the local supermarket and restaurant to large-scale industrial plants and food production companies. This is a fast-growing company and over the last five years we have expanded significantly. Our growth story continues with market-leading innovations, the latest digital tools and great training for colleagues.
  OUR VALUES
  Our values are Service, Relationships, Teamwork and Responsibility. These are at the heart of our business. Grounded, down-to-earth values, just like the people who wear our uniforms across the world. You get to build relationships with your customers and colleagues - most are with us for years, so you get to know them; and they get to know you.

Are you a sports fanatic with a passion for Australian Rules Football? We have the perfect opportunity for you! As an Australian Rules Football Data Collector (analyst), you will have the chance to immerse yourself in the world of sports performance analysis while working from the comfort of your own home. In this role, you will be responsible for accurately collecting and inputting data from state-level Australian Rules Football games and other relevant sources. As a member of our team, you will also have access to exclusive perks such as training in the use of industry-leading sports performance software, the opportunity to network with industry professionals, and the chance to make a meaningful contribution to coaching practices at state-level Australian Rules Football. The best part? You will have the flexibility to work around your schedule and commitments. Most work will need to be completed by 4pm Sunday of a weekend but how you structure your time will be up to you. All you need is a serviceable laptop/computer.
Key Responsibilities:

 Review Australian Rules Football games and record statistics and other relevant data using iSports' Video Analyser software
 Gather data from online sources such as team websites and sports news outlets
 Complete data collection in a timely and accurate manner (ie by 4pm Sunday)
 Perform quality checks to ensure accuracy
 Assist with the creation of reports and analysis based on the collected data

Requirements:

 Strong attention to detail and ability to work accurately under tight deadlines
 Excellent organisational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
 Open and honest communication skills
 Excellent capacity to learn new software
 Previous experience in data entry or sports performance analysis a plus (but not required)
 Passion for Australian Rules Football and strong knowledge of the sport and its rules and statistics

We offer a competitive rate per game and the opportunity to work around your schedule. If you are a self-starter with a strong work ethic and a love for Australian Rules Football, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Application Question(s):

 Have you played or do you regularly watch Australian Rules Football?
 Do you have an ABN?
 Do you have your own laptop?
 Do you have a strong understanding of the rules of Australian Rules Football and the statistics that are captured in a game?

Who are Pobl Group? Pobl Group are a proud employer of over 2,300 colleagues providing diverse services and making a difference in communities throughout Wales. Pobl is more than just a Housing Association, it’s a multi-faceted business whose range of provision varies from care and support to individuals, through to commercial development activities. Our team provides services for all these business areas, so you’ll get involved with a very diverse customer base.What is the role?You will support in the development and maintaining of the Group’s web applications across the organisation. Supporting our internal and external teams by providing high quality and efficient web applications, along with testing to ensure they meet the requirements from the business.The typical technologies you will be working with daily are; React, Next.Js, Tailwind CSS and Git. Along with web development essentials such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.What skills and experience do you need? We’re ideally looking for someone that has the following:Experience in developing API in either JS/.NET/C#Exposure to Power Platform Technologies (PowerApps etc)You are familiar with Database structures and language.You have worked in a small agile software delivery environment.Our values are positive, connected and considerate. At Pobl, you will share these values and be motivated to work in an environment that is driven by them.What are the pay and benefits?The salary for this role is £34,576 for a 37 hour full time permanent position. The role will primarily be remote working with some location flexibility mainly at our Newport and Swansea Offices26 days holiday entitlement plus Bank holidays , rising to 30 days with length of servicePension scheme Up to £250 for office equipment to help set up with working from homeSick Pay  Colleague Referral Scheme (£250 per referral) Time for Talking – a free counselling service Health Cash Plan Savings Scheme Electric Vehicle Lease Schemes Mileage paid at 45 per mileLong service awardsCycle to work scheme Eyecare plan Give as You Earn charity donation scheme Gym and shopping discounts Pobl socks and Pobl Bobl hats! Training and progression opportunities One of our core values is “considerate”. We have recently offered our colleagues additional support with cost of living increases which includes shopping gift cards and additional salary payments throughout the 2022/ 2023 winter. As an employer we are committed to our values and to supporting our colleagues as much as possible with their income. We also regularly review our salaries.What’s FREDIE?At Pobl Group we are guided, in all that we do, by a group of principles that we call FREDIE, these are: Fairness, Respect, Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, Engagement. This means that whatever your background, you will have an equal opportunity at Pobl Group and we encourage you to apply now.If you would like any support with your application or to discuss any adjustments that you may require to support you to application process, please contact talent@poblgroup.co.uk or 0300 3735262How do you apply? If you have the skills, experience and enthusiasm required to be our next difference maker, please follow the prompts to apply now. We just need an up-to-date CV, short/ focussed cover letter along with a few contact details so that we can get back in touch with you. Interviews are planned for week commencing 8 th May. We will be shortlisting week commencing 1 st May and following this, successful candidates will be invited to interview.Further information on the role can also be found on the Job Description

Can't be bothered with a long and frustrating interview process? Our Software Engineer recruitment process is simple, fast and efficient consisting of a one question offline test, for you to complete in your own time, which shouldn't take you more than 20 mins!. From there it is a one round technical and behavioural interview with two team members from our development team. From start to finish you can expect to have a result within a week!Launching in Australia in 2017, we are dedicated to providing our customers with the ultimate betting experience. We're on a mission to make racing and sports betting easier to understand, fun to use and faster. After kicking off in New Jersey in January 2019, we are also quickly expanding across the United States and are now operating in 14 states. We place no limits on our team’s ability to create software and customer experiences that reimagine the status quo and always strive to offer the fastest betting experience in the world.We’re on the look out for a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our Technology team. Reporting to one of our Principal Leads, this role will be responsible for end to end ownership of key features in a microservices environment.What you’ll own!Work closely with members of software engineering and product teams to build new features and enhancements.Adhere to best practices in terms of code quality, test and development practicesDesign and implement efficient, intuitive, modular and testable code.Learn, adhere and contribute to solution design, coding practice, testing and other processes all throughout the SDLC.Identify and present technical trade-offs and risks of different development approaches in a meaningful way.Act as your own DevOps, planning and executing deployments, as well as ensuring everything is running smoothly once it hits production through logging, metrics collection and alertsContribute comprehensive understanding of current and emerging technologies and modern software architecture, and sharing with others.Play an active part shaping the way we do things by following and encouraging others to adopt best practices in development, CI/CD, and other processes all throughout the SDLC.Work with other members of the development team to review and improve code quality.Mentor members of the development team, guiding them through complex challenges and championing improvements to current ways of working.The skills we seek!Proficient in React + Typescript, knowing React Native is a plus.Proficient in SQL.Azure Cloud Platform Experience Preferred.Minimum 5-year real world demonstrable experience building distributed applications.Experience in queueing solutions and event driven architecture is a plus.Understanding of best coding practices (SRP, DRY, decoupling, TDD, BDD).Experience In CI/CD Process Preferred.Ability to learn and adapt on the go, working autonomously and as part of a team, in a fast-paced environment.Passionate about software development, modern software architecture, and sharing the passion with others.The PB Perks!PointsBet Flex Program – Filled with Hybrid Working, Work from Anywhere weeks, Sabbatical Leave to name a few.Game Plan – Our PointsBet Employee Share Scheme.PointsBet Day – Get your PointsBet anniversary off.Annual Bonus Scheme – We reward great work, earn even more on top of our competitive salary packages.Parental Leave – 18 weeks for Primary Carers and 4 weeks for Secondary Carers.Daily breakfasts, sporting event tickets, a range of wellness programs.So you don’t tick every requirement on the job description but are still interested? Please apply anyway! We are built different at PointsBet, because we think different. We promote diversity of thought and would love to hear from a wide range of applicants as we believe that any unique skillset adds value to the PointsBet team. Once you're in the door, your talents will be fostered and acknowledged, with 42 Australian promotions in 2022 alone, we are truly committed to career development at PointsBet.

About UsSubaru Australia is the exclusive Australian importer and distributor of Subaru vehicles manufactured by Subaru Corporation.Subaru has been part of Australian family life since 1973 forging a proud history of getting families to where they need to be, no matter how rough the road. The brand has experienced impressive growth in Australia and now commands one of the greatest market shares of any major Subaru market worldwide. Subaru Australia vehicles have been exclusively All-Wheel Drive since 1998, except for the ultimate joy ride, rear-wheel drive BRZ that joined the range in 2012. Subaru has long been highly regarded for its performance technologies. From the rally stages to the highway, Subaru’s engineering and driving characteristics are focused on delivering a driving experience unlike any other, handling all road and weather conditions with ease, control and comfort. On the rally stages, conditions can change in an instant and a driver’s confidence in their car is paramount. While Subaru rally cars proudly carried the scars of uncompromising terrain, the lessons learned from their adventures inform the design philosophy for every Subaru – and it is this philosophy that has earned Subaru an enviable reputation for high-quality engineering, active and passive safety, reliability, a fun driving experience and value. To find out more, visit https://www.subaru.com.au/Why should you make the move to Subaru?Explore the range of benefits Inchcape offers its employees in recognition of their contribution to our success. A few are listed below and you can also go to www.inchcape.com/en-au/find-a-career/employee-bene... to learn more on our website.Where possible, our flexible work policy helps support you in achieving a genuine work-life balance.Enjoy more time doing that you love with additional days off including an extra 3 days of paid Family Leave every 3 years, plus 1 day each year of paid Volunteer Leave.Access to our employee benefits program including company car rental program, discounts on vehicle purchases and services, free annual flu vaccination, corporate health care plan with Bupa, financial services support, company-paid salary continuance, Death and TPD insurance, and a comprehensive employee wellbeing program.Want to know more about what it is like to work at Inchcape? To discover more about our workplace culture please visit https://www.inchcape.com/en-au/find-a-career/our-c...What’s the opportunity?An exciting opportunity to build and innovate across Subaru Australia’s web assets, this role will involve bringing to life a ‘best-in-class’ customer experience for the brand in 2021 and beyond. Working closely with both the IT and Marketing groups, you will become part of a fun and exciting team in a dynamic and rapidly changing automotive business.We are looking for a Junior Full Stack Developer that can design and take ownership of the full solution, implement tools and practices that are industry standard and is constantly challenging themselves and the team to keep improving.Reporting directly to the Customer Journey Manager, your duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:Design and code the back end and front-end components of the application.Monitor the quality and performance of the application.Help build/improve the dev-ops pipeline.Propose and implement new tools, best practices and methodologies.Conduct code reviews.Write Unit and Integration tests for the front and back end.Help configure and manage the cloud environments.Use of Jira and Confluence to keep work status and technical documentation updated. About you:Software development experience (ideally 12 months or more commercial experience) in .Net Front end development experience (React preferred) Experience with cloud environments preferred but not essential(AWS or Azure) Sound knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 and a CSS pre-compiler (e.g. SASS / LESS) Ability to diagnose and solve application performance problems.Experience with version control tools like Git  Experience working in an Agile environment Desirable: CMS experience (Umbraco or similar)Be responsible and committedBe a team playerBe someone with a curious mindHave the ability to problem solve and find the best solutionInclusion and DiversityAt Inchcape, we believe the true power of diversity cannot be realised without an inclusive culture and that talent is equally distributed across society. Inchcape is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where the power of our differences can be embraced and everyone feels they can belong, be themselves and succeed. As an equal opportunity employer, Inchcape actively encourages applicants from all identities, backgrounds, and experiences, helping ensure our workforce is representative of the global communities we operate in. To learn more about our commitment to Inclusion and Diversity please visit www.inchcape.com/en-au/find-a-career/inclusion-div...If you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single requirement, we encourage you to apply so we can have a conversation to see if you could be a great fit. If you have individual adjustments required to participate in the recruitment process, please notify us in your application or contact inchcaperecruitment@inchcape.com.au.We’re part of InchcapeBy joining Subaru Australia you are joining Inchcape. Inchcape Australasia employs over 1,200 team members across Australia and New Zealand. As part of a global company, our purpose is to bring mobility to the world’s communities - for today, for tomorrow and for the better. Across Australia and New Zealand, we have a diverse portfolio spanning distribution, where we hold the custodianship for some of the worlds most recognised brands; fulfilment, where we are the market leader in integrated, omni-channel automotive fulfilment solutions; retail, where we deliver an exceptional experience at every stage of the customer journey and financial services, where we deliver the right financial services solution to our distribution brand networks, retail businesses and customers.Our diverse and rich history inspires us to adopt a longer-term perspective contributing to a more sustainable and responsible automotive industry while generating a positive impact for our customers and community. Discover more about Inchcape at www.inchcape.com.auApply now!If you this sounds like the role and company for you, we warmly invite you to apply today and take advantage of this great opportunity to be part of a leading global automotive company!Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We take this opportunity to thank you for your interest in working with us.

DataMesh Group is focused on revolutionising the payment systems available to merchants and retailers, delivering integrated payment capabilities and valuable customer insights through bespoke payment and data processing solutions. Our financial switching software has resolved payments technology and compliance issues for major retailers and their customers while maintaining robust relationships with banking and regulatory partners. Our suite of financial payment systems software, infrastructure and data analytics products provide streamlined, low cost and flexible payment solutions across point-of-sale (POS) systems and various next gen payment devices. Importantly, we enable retailers to design the experience they deliver to customers, providing the technology they wish to deploy, creating a hub for commerce and data that merchants, acquirers, card schemes and third parties can use to achieve better business outcomes. With a highly experienced Board and Executive team, we are a fast-growing company embarking on an international expansion. DataMesh - delivering the world's smartest commerce and data analytic products.Position OverviewWe are seeking an experienced Back End Node Developer. The digital payments landscape continues to evolve at a rapid pace, and DataMesh Group remains on the cutting edge with innovative payment solutions for acquirers, payment service providers and major merchants. We’re looking for Back End Developers to join our team of creators consistently raising the bar on user experiences. Working behind the scenes, the ideal candidate has a unique blend of technical expertise and insatiable curiosity, with a methodical, analytical mindset. You should be comfortable working alongside a team as well as independently in the design and development of mission-critical websites, applications, and layers of the infrastructure. Can't be bothered with a long and frustrating interview process? Equal Access to High-Quality Education Moves Our World ForwardMeet Cadmus!At Cadmus, we believe every student should have equal opportunity to achieve academic excellence; that’s why we’re changing how the world learns!Cadmus is a global EdTech company purposefully built for the higher education sector to break down global learning barriers by providing educators and diverse student cohorts with access to high-quality learning and assessment. Built on rich, student-centric values, Cadmus empowers individuals to achieve their highest potential and graduate with the critical skills and knowledge to profoundly impact our workforces, communities, and evolving world.A Bold Plan for Global ImpactAt Cadmus, we’re working hard in pursuit of an ambitious, world-shaping goal: to provide 1 billion students with access to high-quality education by 2050.That’s why we need a Full Stack Development superstar to join our team and help us maintain a high-quality experience for our users worldwide — ensuring our cloud infrastructure is reliable, performant and set up to scale. With countless opportunities to make an impact, you’ll help us solve exciting engineering challenges and deliver improved functionality to take Cadmus even further.About The RoleAs a Full Stack Developer, you'll work across multiple codebases with a small team of cross-functional developers to solve a wide range of product engineering and architectural design challenges. You'll apply your software engineering skills to build performant, modern front-end applications with functional paradigms in React and Typescript. You'll also implement the backend GraphQL APIs (Elixir) and the micro-services which furnish the product features.You will have strong ownership across the development cycle and in addition to implementing new features, you'll focus on improving performance and reliability, and polish existing features. You love exploring new technologies in order to solve problems and want to make constant improvements to our users’ experience. You have an eye for UI design and an interest in applying product development methodologies to boost the user experience. You thrive working in a team, love end-to-end ownership, obsess over details, and use data to help make the best choices for the wider business.In this role you'll:Develop complex front-end applications in React, in Typescript, and the GraphQL and REST APIs servicing themImplement features for our web-based rich-text Editor and the surrounding architecture for a complete online editing environmentWrite code and services for the backend systems in Elixir, Haskell, and other languages to implement business logicImplement the testing, performance, and telemetry processes for the product features to ensure a high-quality experience for our usersPlay an active role in designing and improving the overall product architecture to support massive growth in users and productsCollaborate with product designers and other developers to scope and plan new features, translating requirements for a feature into technical designWe’d love to hear from you if you have:2-4 years industry experience in software developmentExperience developing rich front-end applications in React and using the frameworks in the React ecosystemExperience with Typescript and Browser DOM APIsExperience in creating and working with front-end design systems, CSS-in-JS and CSS layouts with Flexbox and Grid systemsBack-end programming experience with languages like Elixir, Typescript (NodeJS), Ruby, Haskell, or similar in building web serversKnowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures and design patterns, and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutionsWe'd really love to hear from you if you have:Startup DNA; you’re flexible, comfortable with ambiguity, and have experience scaling systems to support rapid growthExperience with Functional Programming languagesBenefitsA remote-friendly, flexible working culture; where you can work from any global locationLearning allowances; because we don’t just have words on a website, we genuinely do what we say and provide educational opportunities to all (including the Cadmus team)A diverse and inclusive workplace where there are no barriers to anyone succeedingA surrounding team of mission-driven individuals who genuinely love what they doEquity incentives; that way, we all share in the success of CadmusMentoring and succession planning for your careerVirtual pats from Homer, our resident (and super cute) dog!We're a remote-friendly company, and this role is open to candidates based in Melbourne or remote from anywhere in Australia.Hiring ProcessApply online with your resume only.Instead of a cover letter, we’d love for you to answer a few questions alongside your application.Our interview process is normally a recruiter interview, a hiring manager interview, a programming task, and 2-3 hours of onsite interviews that will be held via Zoom.While we review your application, get to know us by visiting cadmus.io or following our social channels.Inclusivity at CadmusAt Cadmus, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. About UsSubaru Australia is the exclusive Australian importer and distributor of Subaru vehicles manufactured by Subaru Corporation.Subaru has been part of Australian family life since 1973 forging a proud history of getting families to where they need to be, no matter how rough the road. The brand has experienced impressive growth in Australia and now commands one of the greatest market shares of any major Subaru market worldwide. Subaru Australia vehicles have been exclusively All-Wheel Drive since 1998, except for the ultimate joy ride, rear-wheel drive BRZ that joined the range in 2012. Subaru has long been highly regarded for its performance technologies. From the rally stages to the highway, Subaru’s engineering and driving characteristics are focused on delivering a driving experience unlike any other, handling all road and weather conditions with ease, control and comfort. On the rally stages, conditions can change in an instant and a driver’s confidence in their car is paramount. While Subaru rally cars proudly carried the scars of uncompromising terrain, the lessons learned from their adventures inform the design philosophy for every Subaru – and it is this philosophy that has earned Subaru an enviable reputation for high-quality engineering, active and passive safety, reliability, a fun driving experience and value. Location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Description:
Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAbout the role:FinClear is looking for a Software Engineer to join us on our journey as we continue to build functionalities across our FCX platform that leverages the power of Distributed Ledger Technology. This role will be working within a team of 4 in Sydney that collaborates with other squads across Perth & Melbourne. These squads form part of a larger cross functional technology team of 60 and growing.At FinClear, the team of Software Engineers come from diverse backgrounds and have a passion for their craft. With feedback from both internal and external users, our Software Engineers are equipped to make better decisions on how to enhance, build and optimize a suite of products that delights our customers. You will work alongside industry experts and talented senior engineers, building a new financial platform with modern technology and tools, where your contributions will have a strong impact on the success of the platform.Based on the current composition of the squad, we believe a passionate Software Engineer who enjoys working with a team of seniors across the Full Stack would really enjoy the opportunity.Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Contributing to product features that reach beyond the UI, into our ecosystem of Microservices. Producing code that is well written, maintainable, security conscious and performant. Developing stunning, professional User Interfaces with React, Next.JS and MUI. Maintaining the platform and resolving issues as they arise. Collaborating with other specialists in the team as you work together on Epics and Sprints. Working with other squads on business objectives as opportunities ariseCode reviewsMentor and share your knowledge with other Software EngineersParticipate in learning and development sessionsThe Tech Stack:React, Next.JS, MUI, JavaScript, TypescriptDAML Smart Contracts & Ledger TechnologyMicroservice Architecture, Consul, VaultGRPC MessagingJava EE, JPA, GuicePostgreSQLGit, Maven, Jira, Confluence QualificationsRequired:Minimum of 3+ years working experience in React3+ years experience working within a Java environmentBonus points for:Proven experience working with Next.JSAdditional InformationWhat are the ingredients to our secret sauce?That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!Benefits:A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leaveA flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for allPrioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologistsE-Vehicles – Salary SacrificeReady to apply?If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".Alternatively :To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend"For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careersAny additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note :Applications will be reviewed w/c 13/03/2023Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)

About UsFoundr is the go-to digital resource for the growing ranks of craft, self-made entrepreneurs – at every level of experience. We’re a multifaceted digital business, independently published, with the muscle of a traditional media company, minus the corporate BS. We share learnings from start-up visionaries through our magazine, podcast, blog, and online courses.About YouYou are a Senior Full-stack Developer with 8+ years of experience, well-versed in front-end and back-end systems, have strong attention to detail, and enjoy coming up with new features and automation to optimize processes.About The RoleThe Senior Full-Stack Developer at Foundr is responsible for leading all technical projects, builds & maintenance to help fuel our current growth.The Senior Full-Stack Developer will be responsible for:Building new tech systems to be integrated into Foundr’s current tech stack ongoingMaintaining and updating the existing tech stack at Foundr, ensuring consistent uptime with all online assets, including website, checkout systems, and online platforms.Working with and scaling remote development team to cohesively work as 1 unit, building all necessary front-end and back-end assets via SaaS agile methodologies, based on the Marketing calendar and quarterly KPI dashboard.Working closely with the remote customer success team to identify and solve any technical bugs/issues being reported by our audience.Coordinating timeframes to meet deadlines for key tech asset deliverablesCreating and maintaining software & website documentation for maintenance & debuggingArchitect and design in-house software solutions and integrations to replace off-the-shelf software being used in a tech stackEnsuring our website stack is up to date, including plugins.Providing mentorship to developers to skill up in their respective specialisations.RequirementsEssential skills, qualifications, and experience8+ years of software development (backend and frontend)8+ years of backend development using PHP, or NodeJS8+ years of database knowledge, MySQL / SQL8+ years of various javascript frameworks, including NodeJS, React8+ years of API integration.Knowledge in functional or object-oriented programming.Adept at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts.Confident in your Git and Github skills.Able to write well-documented, clean code.A confident communicator in English.Proactive about ideas and confident enough to speak up when you have an opinionAble to give constructive criticism about the work of others and can receive it about yoursUnderstands how to stay focused on deliveringLove to be challenged, in and out of your day jobDesirable Skills And ExperienceWordPress / WordPress plugins developmentExperience in JS Framework, NextJS / Gatsby / AngularExperience in NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB)Cloud computing is a bonus, ideally AWS, but not limited to Azure or Google Cloud.BenefitsEXTENSIVE TRAINING AND FULL SUPPORT – One of our core values is “curious,” and we take training very seriously. You’ll get access to cutting-edge training with a generous training budget, support from your fellow peers who are constantly leveling up, and be surrounded by highly successful entrepreneurs who we interview or who are Foundr instructors. You’ll get the environment and knowledge needed to perform at your highest level.YOUNG, DRIVEN, AND A-PLAYER TEAM – Daily, you’ll be surrounded by some of the most “switched-on” people you’ve ever met. There’s a reason we’re one of the fastest growing online media companies, and that’s because our team is full of serious weapons (who actually walk the walk).GET YOUR CONTENT AND WORK SEEN BY MILLIONS – Our content is consumed by millions of founders every single week. The projects and things you work on will directly contribute to shaping the future generation of entrepreneurs - Maybe even the next Elon Musk that will drive humanity forward.AMAZING GROWTH OPPORTUNITY – At Foundr, there’s no absolute ceiling to where you can go, what you can do, and what you can earn. As we grow, so too do the opportunities.WORK HARD PLAY HARDER – We have yearly off-sites in exotic locations around the world, work-sponsored lunches and drinks every Friday, and monthly team outings where we go out and celebrate the wins.

Equal Access to High-Quality Education Moves Our World ForwardMeet Cadmus!At Cadmus, we believe every student should have equal opportunity to achieve academic excellence; that’s why we’re changing how the world learns!Cadmus is a global EdTech company purposefully built for the higher education sector to break down global learning barriers by providing educators and diverse student cohorts with access to high-quality learning and assessment. Built on rich, student-centric values, Cadmus empowers individuals to achieve their highest potential and graduate with the critical skills and knowledge to profoundly impact our workforces, communities, and evolving world.A Bold Plan for Global ImpactAt Cadmus, we’re working hard in pursuit of an ambitious, world-shaping goal: to provide 1 billion students with access to high-quality education by 2050.That’s why we need a Full Stack Development superstar to join our team and help us maintain a high-quality experience for our users worldwide — ensuring our cloud infrastructure is reliable, performant and set up to scale. We want to do everything we can to ensure our users enjoy their experience and love our platform. With countless opportunities to make an impact, you’ll help us solve exciting engineering challenges and deliver improved functionality to take Cadmus even further.About The RoleAs a Full Stack Developer, you'll work across multiple codebases with a small team of cross-functional developers to solve a wide range of product engineering and architectural design challenges. You'll apply your software engineering skills to build performant, modern front-end applications with functional paradigms in React and Typescript. You'll also implement the backend GraphQL APIs (Elixir) and the micro-services which furnish the product features.You will have strong ownership across the development cycle and in addition to implementing new features, you'll focus on improving performance and reliability, and polish existing features. This is a truly unique opportunity to help shape our technology stack, processes, and contribute to the culture of the engineering team.About Our TechReact (Typescript) front-end web applications (SPA)Elixir backend with GraphQL APIsHaskell web services and Typescript (NodeJS) lambda functionsAWS cloud infrastructureWe also use and love to experiment with other languages for various tooling to ensure we find the best tool for the job. If you want to know more about what it’s like to be a developer at Cadmus, check out our blog post.RequirementsWe want to hear from developers with a passion for building modern web applications. You love exploring new technologies in order to solve problems and want to make constant improvements to our users’ experience. You have an eye for UI design and an interest in applying product development methodologies to boost the user experience. You thrive working in a team, love end-to-end ownership, obsess over details, and use data to help make the best choices for the wider business.In this role you'll:Develop complex front-end applications in React, in Typescript, and the GraphQL and REST APIs servicing themImplement features for our web-based rich-text Editor and the surrounding architecture for a complete online editing environmentWrite code and services for the backend systems in Elixir, Haskell, and other languages to implement business logicImplement the testing, performance, and telemetry processes for the product features to ensure a high-quality experience for our usersPlay an active role in designing and improving the overall product architecture to support massive growth in users and productsCollaborate with product designers and other developers to scope and plan new features, translating requirements for a feature into technical designWe’d love to hear from you if you have:2-4 years industry experience in software developmentExperience developing rich front-end applications in React and using the frameworks in the React ecosystemExperience with Typescript and Browser DOM APIsExperience in creating and working with front-end design systems, CSS-in-JS and CSS layouts with Flexbox and Grid systemsBack-end programming experience with languages like Elixir, Typescript (NodeJS), Ruby, Haskell, or similar in building web serversKnowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures and design patterns, and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutionsWe'd really love to hear from you if you have:Startup DNA; you’re flexible, comfortable with ambiguity, and have experience scaling systems to support rapid growthExperience with Functional Programming languagesBenefitsA remote-friendly, flexible working culture; where you can work from any global locationLearning allowances; because we don’t just have words on a website, we genuinely do what we say and provide educational opportunities to all (including the Cadmus team)A diverse and inclusive workplace where there are no barriers to anyone succeedingA surrounding team of mission-driven individuals who genuinely love what they doEquity incentives; that way, we all share in the success of CadmusMentoring and succession planning for your careerVirtual pats from Homer, our resident (and super cute) dog!We're a remote-friendly company, and this role is open to candidates based in Melbourne or remote from anywhere in Australia.Hiring ProcessApply online with your resume only.Instead of a cover letter, we’d love for you to answer a few questions alongside your application.Our interview process is normally a recruiter interview, a hiring manager interview, a programming task, and 2-3 hours of onsite interviews that will be held via Zoom.While we review your application, get to know us by visiting cadmus.io or following our social channels.Inclusivity at CadmusAt Cadmus, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital, or disability status. If you share our values and enthusiasm for education, you will find a home at Cadmus.If you need assistance or accommodations made due to a disability, please let us know.

About UsExo Digital is a high growth digital agency leading the charge in technological innovation. Our DNA is in experience design and we have a diverse team of designers, content strategists and technical wizards. Our goal is to produce memorable digital experiences for our clients and create a high impact working environment for our team.The RoleWe are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions for our clients and exciting internal projects. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team that’s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.RequirementsWhat you have5+ years of experience of web and application development experience with at least 3+ years working in a development teamDemonstrated excellence in front and backend development using languages and frameworks such as React, TypeScript, Node, Next.js and other technologiesWorked with popular CMS platforms such as WordPress, Sanity, Contentful, Shopify and moreSolid understanding of test-driven development, hosting and domain management.Experience with cloud systems such as AWS and Terraform (bonus!)Have a strong understanding of architectural design patterns and be able to articulate the pros and cons between architectural choicesGreat time management skills with excellent written and verbal communicationA full understanding of end-to-end product & feature delivery and managing multiple stakeholders (merchants, 3rd party developers, designers)Fast-paced agency experience is highly desirableA passion for software development and insatiable hunger for learning new skillsWhat You’ll DoWork closely with our developers to anticipate and resolve day to day issuesUsing microservices, API design and implementation and web development using UI design patternsIdentifying templates, starter-kits, shared libraries or approaches for delivering efficiencies and improving qualityContribute to ongoing process and tool improvements to maintain our internal integrations and core servicesUnderstanding the business cases, function and nonfunctional requirements supported by your feature(s) and solution(s)Perform code reviews of peer code contributions and provide clear and meaningful feedbackMentor junior members of the teamApply your advanced problem-solving skills to solve interesting customer issuesWorking with non-technical stakeholders to understand overall project requirementsAssist the commercial team with project estimation and proposalsNice to haveExperience building or using web animation librariesExperience with mobile development using React NativeExperience with TerraformBenefitsWhat we offerFlexible work arrangements - we really mean this! We’re outcome driven rather than clock watchers. We’re here to accommodate different working styles to ensure you are being your most productive self.Treats on your birthday.Hybrid working.Coworking space available whenever you need a change of scenery - available in our Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane co-working spaces.Up-skilling and hackathon events - we upskill our team in Web3 technologies, ideation, project management and much more.Fun and vibrant culture - the best team! But we might be biased. We promise you won’t be disappointed.Incentives for those who go above and beyond.Discretionary annual bonus.

DescriptionWho we areSidekicker is one of Australia’s most exciting home-grown startups! Launched in 2013, Sidekicker is Australia and New Zealand’s largest online staffing platform, using technology to radically improve how businesses hire and manage casual, temporary and contract staff.Sidekicker is dedicated to ensuring every worker finds the right job, and every job finds the right worker. We employ over 15,000 casual staff, or ‘Sidekicks’, seamlessly connecting them with businesses across the healthcare, hospitality, events, industrial and promotions industries.How You’ll Make An ImpactAs a member of Sidekicker Engineering, you'll utilise your technical skills to build products revolutionising the temp industry. As a senior software engineer, you'll ship architecturally sound code at regular intervals and participate in technology decisions with the potential to grow into a leadership role.What You’ll DoHone your craft through engineering best practices like code reviews and testing.Collaborate with Product and Design to help shape product specifications.Work collaboratively to arrive at pragmatic and architecturally-sound engineering decisions.Contribute to work breakdown, design, evaluation, planning and estimating product features.Take on challenging and complex technical problems.Contribute to project improvements, process improvements, and proactively initiate and facilitate team conversations around these areas.About YouCritical CompetenciesRobust experience in full-stack development and a desire to expand your skill set.Experience in building and deploying in NodeJS, JavaScript and/or PHP.Working knowledge of MySQL.A keen interest in modern technologies such as GraphQL and React.A sound understanding of web application development and MVC frameworks.Great communication skills, both written and verbal.A reasoned and pragmatic approach to software development and testing.A love of problem-solving, investigating problems and determining the appropriate fix.Open to working in an agile development environment.A willingness to contribute and help others on the team improve their craft.Experience5 or more years of relevant industry experience.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.As a part of being at Sidekicker, you will have the tools and support to thrive at work:A MacBook and flexible working arrangements - so you have a good experience working from home or the office. We additionally have a work-from-anywhere policy for up to 8 weeks in a year.An annual learning and development budget - so you can focus on building the skills required for the roleWeekly team lunches and monthly team eventsWhat You'll Love About Working At SidekickerWe do meaningful work every day - we move fast, break barriers and focus on what matters.We are empowered to make decisions - we don’t let processes and approval hierarchies get in the way; we trust our team to show good judgement.We are obsessed with solving Customer and Sidekick problems - we are always getting involved, testing, learning and improving what we’ve done before.We have fun - we celebrate our successes & don’t take ourselves too seriously.Apply today!We don’t expect you to check every box listed here, so we encourage you to apply if you’re at all interested – what we care about is that you have a strong foundation and you’re committed to building skills that help you be successful in your role.Diversity and Inclusion StatementWe stand out because we invest in our entire ecosystem, from staff to business customers and Sidekicks. We run an amazing platform, but we know that the secret sauce to success is ensuring everyone has a voice and is represented and respected.At Sidekicker, we are committed to an inclusive culture that values the diversity of thought, opinion and background and where all employees have equal access to opportunities. We love that our current team comprises more than 20 different cultures, and we are excited for this representation across our business to continue to grow.If you need any modifications, please let our talent team know; they will gladly assist.

About UsAccess Telehealth is a business built by medical professionals, designed to enhance and improve health outcomes by supporting medical practitioners and communities across Australia.Access Specialist provides rural and Indigenous Australians with specialist video appointments via referral from their GP. We work with clinics to manage and facilitate consults using our purpose-built software and operations team.Access Aged Care provides Nursing Home residents with a co-managed clinical care team, including nurses and GPs, Geriatricians and other specialists resulting in an enhanced service and industry-leading clinical outcomes. We partner with nursing homes at a corporate level and directly to build resident numbers and grow this innovative care model to support the aged care industry at all levels.Access Therapist provides participants with Allied Health services via video conference, allowing for care to be received from the safety and comfort of their homes. We work with clients from children through to adults and pride ourselves on connecting people and improving health outcomes.Our Values Connecting and Caring Access Through Teamwork Results EmpowermentKey Responsibilities Enhance, Support and Maintain internal systems, including but not limited to:DMS (Demand Management System)TMS (Triage Management System)SMS (Scheduling Management System) Includes integration touch points – API Management et al, as directed Provide technical and architectural advice to teams Respond to mission critical aspects of the internal systems Design and build (per stack) modules and functions from specifications Share know-how with team members Produce documentation as requiredKey selection criteria Demonstrated experience working in a similar role within the healthcare industry with previous experience/knowledge of Aged Care Sector desirable Excellent organisational and time management skills Ability to manage multiple/ competing priorities and deliver to agreed timelines Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work with people from a variety of backgrounds and experiences Ability to work independently, with limited supervision Action oriented with a can-do attitude Ability to maintain thoroughness and accuracy with high attention to detail Courteous, with high levels of professionalism, confidentiality, and discretion Positive and collaborative team player working in line with our Purpose and Values Adaptability and flexibility to changing work environments and requirements Demonstrated capabilities with some or all of the following stack components:Backend C# (.NET 6.0) PostgreSQL GraphQL EF Core - database management as an ORMFrontend React (NextJS)Other CI/CD GitHub DockerHow To ApplyIf you feel this is the right opportunity for you and you would love to be a part of making a difference in people’s lives, click apply now and follow the prompts.Further any queries please to contact Jessica Vainer at Access Telehealth at recruitment@accesstelehealth.com.auVideo

Company DescriptionEvery person at Leidos plays an important and valued role bringing science, engineering and technology together to produce practical solutions for our customers’ most complex problems. It’s how we help to make the world safer, healthier and more efficient - work that matters and a mission, like those of our customers, we are passionate about. We’re open minded, ambitious and committed to enabling our people to do their best work, to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have.Here in Australia, we’re agile and growing fast. Our 1,600 employees are busy building an enviable reputation for innovation and delivery. And, as part of a US-based organisation with 37,000 people and a 50 year history, we are able to draw upon world-leading technical expertise to help us provide the best solutions to our customers.Job DescriptionYour New RoleWe have multiple opportunities available for Software Engineers to join our Melbourne based team working on exciting and nationally significant bespoke software engineering projects. The roles are multi-faceted as we are looking for unique individuals with varying experience levels whom are able to contribute broadly across the software development lifecycle in a range of ways, including but not limited to: Agile Software Development; DevOps; Real-Time Data Processing; User Interface Design; Full-Stack Development; Testing and Release Management; Mission Support and Sustainment.Successful candidates will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, solid software engineering fundamentals, multiple programming language experience, clear communication skills and a desire to tackle complex problems in a unique environment.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringThe individuals we are looking for are highly motivated software engineers with a passion to make a difference to the security of Australia. You will excel working in a dynamic on-site team environment, with a desire to be part of a long term mission solution. Ideal candidates would have previous experience of working on Defence projects and already hold an NV-1 or higher security clearance.You will also have:A Bachelor Degree (or higher) in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (with software engineering experience)Strong ability to problem solve and troubleshootGood knowledge and application of a broad range of skills involved in the software engineering lifecycleDemonstrated ability in supporting the delivery of software products on time, and to a high standard of quality and focusWillingness to document and improve software development processesAptitude and values that align with the requirements of holding a national security clearanceThis role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and be willing to obtain and hold a NV-1 or greater security clearance. Additionally the successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, which may place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be.Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

Making Mobility SeamlessVix is a global leader in automated fare collection, transit information and transit analytics solutions. Trusted by over 200 city and regional transport authorities around the world, we have been driving change in fare collection for over 35 years.We offer a genuinely flexible working environment – customer outcomes and commitment to delivery is the focus at Vix. Work from the office, work from home, work from the local café – you’ll be able to manage your personal and professional commitments seamlessly at Vix. In fact, HRD gave Vix the excellence award in 2021 for our MyFlex program.AboutOur core values are a statement of intent about the type of business we strive to be and describe the way we work and how we interact with each other, our customers and our partners#Think like a customer#Focus on what matters#Do great things together#Be smart, stay curiousFind out more about your new workplace here!We are a diverse and dispersed organisation at Vix and are actively looking to grow our team with individuals from diverse backgrounds, cultures, ages, genders, neurodiversity, religions, sexual orientations and experiences.We understand that many people only apply if they meet 10 out 10 requirements for a role; however, our approach is to hire for behaviours, growth and capability, not just experience and merit. So, if you think you have what it takes, but you don’t meet every single requirement please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit for our team. #connectingpeopleandplacesWe're on the hunt for a passionate Full Stack Developer to help build our new Assure product. Description:
About uswelcome is a digital agency with dedicated in-house technical development teams.We deliver full-service solutions for our clients from Design, UX to custom development and technical solutions using market-leading platforms and technologies.We have just been awarded the 2022 Agency of the Year. Due to continued growth, we are looking for smart, passionate and dare-to-be-different people to join our award-winning team. You’ll be working with a stellar line-up of clients, including tech giants, large multinationals, start-ups and boutique businesses across a variety of industries, so no one day is the same, it’s always exciting and ever-changing. If you are seeking a career that will both support and challenge you and provide opportunities for you to push boundaries and challenge the norm, then a career at welcome is what you are looking for.About the RoleWe are seeking a skilled Full-Stack React Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing and maintaining complex web applications using React, Redux, Babel, Webpack, Redis, Sockets, and Sequelize. Responsibilities:Develop and maintain web applications using React, Redux, Redis, Sockets, and Sequelize.Have a good grasp on the tools Babel, Webpack,Develop server-side components using Node.js and Express.Use Git for version control.Write clean and maintainable code, ensuring high performance and scalability of the applications.Collaborate with other team members to develop and deliver high-quality solutions.Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in web development and recommend new technologies and frameworks when appropriate.Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure they are running smoothly.Work with the QA team to ensure the applications are fully tested and meet the quality standards.Use Git for version control.Requirements:Strong experience with React 16/17, Redux, Redis, and Sockets.Good grasp on the tools Babel and WebpackStrong experience with Node.js and Express.Experience working with databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.Understanding of RESTful API design and implementation.Familiarity with Git for version control.Ability to write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.Strong collaboration and communication skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a teamIf you meet the above requirements and are passionate about developing high-quality web applications, we would love to hear from you.welcome ValuesOur people are our number one focus. We believe everyone – no matter their role – should be nurtured and heard, and have the opportunity to influence our work, our environment and our agency. We want our people to be the most knowledgeable and confident in the room. We aim to recruit, retain and engage the most talented people by adopting inclusive work practices and investing in our people so that they can do great work for our clients. At welcome. Our mission is to build and foster an inclusive culture of belonging, one that is equitable and respectful of diverse thought and individual expression. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and a safe and healthy work environment. Those aren’t just words. Our values underpin the whole business. We believe that we are in the best position to support our clients, your team and the agency, if we support you.We believe in a holistic approach to well-being that helps our people to live a balanced life.We also offerCompetitive salaries, lots of freebies, fantastic social events, flexible work options, and excellent headquarters on the city fringeYou would be working with a team of inspired, motivated and fun co-workersGenuine opportunities for career growth and promotionA growing agency, with ambitious global expansion plansHow To ApplyPlease reply to this LinkedIn AdPlease be advised that welcome or any related or controlled entities do not accept unsolicited contact or resumes from Recruitment Agencies. Only candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered for this role.

Job Title: Software Engineer - Full Stack - Experienced Engineer
Description:
We continue to grow our team at Webjet.com.au. As #1 Australia and New Zealand's leading online travel agency, and we’re leading the way in online travel tools and technology. As a recognised Great Place to Work, 93% of our people recommend Webjet as a great place to work.Our IT Dev team has four product teams: Flights, Land, Services and Payments. We operate a sophisticated IT platform deployed in hybrid Azure cloud environment and are currently engaged in a series of substantial ongoing development projects.Webjet strives to be at the leading edge of technology, developing solutions to meet the travel needs of our customers. We have evolved our architecture into cloud native microservices hosted on Azure. Our product focused delivery teams are self-contained and have end to end ownership of their product. “You build it, you ship it and you own it” is core to the Webjet way. You will be working in a small self-managed team consisting of developers, business analyst, QA, UI, UX and people from across the business. We don’t expect you to just read the requirements and code, but rather understand the business and customer drivers for the feature you and your team have been asked to build. You will be empowered to challenge the status quo and come up with innovative solutions.Our tech stack is pretty appealing to most software engineers:* .NET Core* React* Microservices* Azure Cloud* CI/CD* Azure DevOps* Agile* Docker* KubernetesWho are you?Agile: Commercial experience in an agile environment.Net / .NET Core but more importantly a strong desire to learn and develop in more than oneExperience in React or AngularNot just a coder: You're interested in the overall business context and creating great user experiencesOpen to learning the latest tech in Docker, and Docker orchestration systems (K8S, DC/OS)Ideally you have experience in cloud technologies Azure, AWS or GCPLife at WebjetYou can learn more at our careers page: https://careers.webjet.com.au Our Hybrid Working Model is currently two consecutive days in the office on Tuesday & Wednesday. We believe this provides us all the balance of collaboration and meets the work life balance of our people. We plan to extend this to three days in the future.In our most recent pulse engagement survey in November 2022 via Culture Amp, we scored 85% engagement and 96% of our people said they would recommend Webjet as a great place to work.Every employee received a free $800 travel voucher to say thank you in March 2022We’re a travel company, so we offer travel benefits… free travel insurance and discounted travel via webjet.com.au and $250 egift voucher annually We offer $5K Employee Referral BonusParental Leave providing up to 12 weeks paid primary and 2 weeks paid secondary carer leaveWe offer Purchased Additional Annual LeaveWebjet is an equal opportunity employer and fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace.We’re always learning… our people take 10% of their time to focus on their learning & developmentOur people can access our Microsoft Enterprise skills initiative subscription, which provides ongoing learning and development support via the portal. Including access to Pluralsight or cloud guru subscription. Along with Microsoft training and certification programs and interest-based conferences online and in personAs an ASX 200 company, you can learn more about us at ASX:WEB and read more about our growing companyWhat to expect?We want to move as quickly as possible to find great talent. We will contact you to discuss your application more, then have a technical chat and introduce you to our Engineering Managers. If that's a fit, we'll move through the checks and references to get you onboard.Know someone you might be a fit? If you refer someone who comes onboard we'll give you a $500 Webjet Travel Gift Voucher.No agency candidates will be accepted at this time.

Join the Access Family and see how we make software ideas become a reality!Our core value of ‘Love Work, Love Life, Be You’ has been central to our success and so we’re looking for people to join us who share our passion for making things better every day and help us continue to grow.We are the number one UK headquartered software provider in the UK and are forecasted to grow to a global population of over 12,000 employees by 2026.What are we all about?At Access, we love software and how technology never stays the same. It's this passion that drives us to work closely across sectors to understand the business needs of our customers - from the Hospitality sector, to Manufacturing industry, to Not for Profit’s to Construction, and many more.We're passionate about helping our customers stay one step ahead of the challenges facing their industry and business, currently helping over 60,000 customers to have the freedom to do more.About You:As Full Stack Developer, you are expected to have about 5+ years of experience in the Software Development across the full stack such as UI, API, Middleware, Databases and Integrations.You will be part of the Product Team, working closely with Lead Developers/Senior Developers and Developers on Implementing the technical design/requirements provided by the busines.Day-to-day, you will:Design and build product deliverables according to specifications, escalates technical design or specification issues to Technical Lead, Product Manager and works within a given time frame to complete coding.Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.Follow FastTrack’s development practices and software development life cycle methodologies.Investigation and suggestion of solutions to defects and problems that may have been detected during testing including troubleshoot, debug and upgrade to existing systems. Assist in the research, implementation, and promotion of appropriate leading-edge technology for FastTrack.Assist in improving training and development of the technical team.Working within a Feature Teams that comprises of a Tech Lead, Test Lead, Developers and Testers supported by Product Owners, Product Leaders and Business Analysts, IT Operations, Outsourcing Partner (Radix),Customer Support Team and occasionally, Sales and Professional Services Teams.Skills and Experience:5+ years of hands-on software development experience as a Full Stack Developer using the tech stack - Angular (and AngularJS), .NET and SQL Server.Proven experience working within an Agile and/or Lean team.Experience with SQL Server specifically with Stored Procedures, Database Design and Query TuningCompletion of Computer Science or Business including IT degreeMicrosoft .NET (C#)Microsoft SQL Server Angular / AngularJS REST API and WCFGIT (Bitbucket)Unit Testing (XUnit, Jasmine)Work Management Tools – JIRA Project / ConfluenceWhat does Access offer you?We are a growing software company, and we deliver on what we say we do! We take the development of our people very seriously and we will work with you to carve out your success plan and an opportunity to accelerate your career and make a real difference.On top of a competitive salary, our wellbeing days taking you to 25 days leave a year (rules apply) and a health contribution you’ll also be able to choose from a range of benefits to suit you. We pride ourselves on being an organisation that gives back so you’ll also have 3 charity days you can take to support something that matters to you.At Access we’re all about helping everyone Love Work and Love Life. Why? Because we believe people can only be their best when they can be themselves. So, if you are excited about this role, but your past experience doesn’t match perfectly, we’d still love to hear from you. You might just be whom we are looking for.We love the fact that we’re all different. We believe by having more diverse perspectives at work improves how we run our business, helps us to better support our customers, and when you think about it, it’s just more fun!What’s holding you back? Come and be part of our Amazing Access Family! Love Work. Love Life. Be You.
