Job Title: UI/UX Designer (up to 12 months fixed term)
Description:
Islamic Bank Australia has been granted a restricted banking licence, making us the first Islamic Bank in Australia and bringing financial inclusion to Australia’s rapidly growing Muslim population.We are focus on launching to market interest free, Shariah compliant personal banking products and achieving our full banking licenceAbout the roleWe are seeking a highly skilled and motivated UI/UX designer to join our team for up to 12 months (with potential for permanancy). The successful candidate will be responsible for creating innovative and user-friendly designs for our digital banking platform, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user experience. Working in close collaboration with the product owners, tech and vendor partners within Australia and overseas, this role may involve some international travel for several weeks at a time.Responsibilities•	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, conduct user research, create wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity designs.•	Design intuitive interfaces that align with the brand and meet the needs of our customers.•	Code front-end applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.•	Test and iterate designs based on user feedback, ensuring a high level of usability and lead ideation with product team to find solutions.•	Stay up to date with the latest UI/UX trends and technologies.•	Ensure designs are accessible and meet industry standards for accessibility.About youWe are building a new Australian bank from scratch that will support the community and treat customers with respect, so you will be contributing to our long-term vision, celebrating wins (and learning from misses) at the forefront of our customer experience. You’ll thrive in this role if you bring the following skills and experience;•	Bachelor’s degree in design, human computer interaction or a related field.•	Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer with a portfolio of work showcasing your skills.•	Excellent understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.•	Experience conducting user research and testing.•	Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.•	Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills demonstrating you can bring together tech, design and customer experience teams.•	Ability to operate in a fluid environment, with changing demands and developing ways of working.•	Understanding of Islamic banking principles is a plus.Islamic Bank Benefits•	Whether working from our first class facilities in Parramatta or in a hybrid pattern, you’ll have the opportunity to work flexibly.•	As a small team, you’ll work in a collaborative, fun and innovative environment with a high degree of team and personal accountability as we bring new banking products to the Australian market. •	22 Days of annual leave a yearImportant information•	You will be required to undergo background checks and other regulatory checks.•	We are a small team building a bank from scratch. You will need to be hands on initially and comfortable working at both a strategic and operational level as needed.•	We take diversity and inclusion seriously, and welcome both Muslim and non-Muslim applicants. Candidates of any gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation or with a disability are warmly welcomed. If you are a creative and driven UI/UX Designer looking for an exciting opportunity to join a growing startup, we would love to hear from you.

Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAt FinClear, the UI Designer’s key purpose is to translate complex requirements, create intuitive interfaces and continual improvement of experiences across our suite of products and platforms that our customers love and rely on!UI Designers at FinClear collaborates with Engineers, senior UX, and UI designers leveraging design skills creating complex UI. Portfolio of professional designsExcellent Knowledge of modern best practice UI standards. High skilled with interface design tools, preferably Figma. Job DescriptionThis is your opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking, change-making individuals transforming healthcare experiences. Operating at the intersection of two fast-growing industries – health and tech – you’ll play an active role in shaping the future of healthcare in Australia.We're proud to share that Healthengine is certified as a Great Place to Work and ranked #19 in Australia’s Best Places to Work (medium category).Our MissionHealthengine is a purpose-led business, and Australia’s largest consumer healthcare platform, helping people navigate the complex world of healthcare. We’re on a mission to transform humanity’s health, one care experience at a time. Healthengine’s platform brings together a leading range of healthcare practices, healthcare specialties and health ecosystem partners in a suite of integrated offerings to help people get a better experience across each step of their healthcare journey.We’re all patients, right? So, it’s easy to get behind a mission that seeks to improve the healthcare experience for all Australians.The GigAs a UI Designer, you’ll shape the direction of our products, turning insights into innovative, transformative experiences. We understand that delivering positive user experiences is one of the key measures of digital maturity and is therefore at the heart of our business. We know that all good digital experiences are the result of delightful user centric designs and intuitive concepts which guide users to quickly and simply fulfil a specific need in a highly engaging way.(Some of) the responsibilities:Work closely with product managers, engineers, growth specialists, and business stakeholders to distil user insights, business requirements, and development needs. Plan and implement new web and app user interface designs. Optimise existing user interface designs. Move through sketching, wireframing, prototyping, and UI design with an emphasis on an iterative, collaborative design process. Take wireframes and concept designs through to finalised UI design to deliver delightful, functional product interfaces. Help to embed and drive the brand identity throughout our products. Ensure the maintenance and improvement of our design language. About YouYou flourish in a fast-moving, agile environment and thrive in a tech culture where growth is inevitable. You are smart, strong and passionate and always lead with head and heart. You are balanced; knowing how to have fun but how to focus and get things done. You speak openly, candidly and authentically to challenge yourself and others. You’re impact and results driven, with a ‘done is better than perfect’ attitude. You are a creative problem-solver, always seeking to find unique and valuable solutions.Experience you’ll bring:3+ years of design experience Demonstrable experience delivering positive results within a fast-moving environmentA folio of work demonstrating a track record of delivering high-quality user interface designs. Previous experience using Figma and Adobe Creative SuiteThe ability to deliver cross-platform design, including working knowledge of responsive design and grid principles, and experience designing for mobile with strong understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines & Google’s Material Design GuidelinesStrong typography, layout, and visual design skillsProficiency in design libraries, style guides, sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, lo-fi and hi-fi outputs, and visual prototypesAdditional InformationThe perks behind the workHealthengine is where you’ll be your best self. You’ll collaborate with smart, interesting people who will challenge you to be better. In addition to an array of growth opportunities, we also offer:Freedom and flexibility to work the way you want, with remote and hybrid opportunitiesGood mix of virtual and on-site events and celebrations, because we know how to have funFully stocked kitchen including coffee on tap and subsidised vending machine in our Perth spaceDiscounts, salary sacrifice and packaging options through our benefit partnersExtra leave so you can recharge and focus on your wellbeing Support for you when it comes time to grow your family with paid parental leaveDiversity and inclusionHealthengine believes in the power of a diverse work environment and are fully committed to building and maintaining an inclusive culture. We believe that our differences can create new ideas, offer unique perspectives and speak on behalf of all of our customers and consumers. If you think you have what it takes but don't check all the boxes, reach out anyway - we’d love to hear from you.We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Tryzens is an international digital commerce agency and our mission is to accelerate client success and growth across all channels, leveraging our expertise, insights, and digital-first principles, to deliver compelling experiences that delight and engage their customers.We are People First and believe that empowered happy people achieve more. We're Customer-Centric and our customers’ growth is our success. We believe that Collaboration and Innovation drive the greatest results and Integrity, Trust & Transparency build lasting relationships. We started in London, but have expanded to have operations in Melbourne, Sydney, Sofia, and Trivandrum with 200+ team members serving 45+ international brands.We are on the lookout for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team and work across the spectrum of UX / UI on e-commerce-focused websites and applications. This role can be based in either of our locations in either Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane. Tryzens is a hybrid workplace, so we're happy for you to work from our offices or from home.As a Senior UX/UI Designer at Tryzens, you will contribute to the initial discovery and planning phase of projects, collaborating with project managers, business analysts, developers and clients to engage in a range of activities – from user research to producing deliverables such as personas, user journeys, and wireframes right through to final hi-fi designs that are ready for development.It’s a collaborative role where you will have the chance to work closely with developers, business analysts, and of course, the client to craft engaging and high-converting experiences.The type of experience you’ll need should be in these areas:UX audits – reviewing existing sites and content and making justified recommendations on how to make them better, based on usability and eCommerce best practices, and online retail experience.Ability to define customer and business needs: Communicating with clients to gather requirements and advising on UX solutions.Knowledge of different UX research methodologies including qualitative and quantitative research.Working with project managers to help define the plan for the design project to align with scope - being confident about the time required for work and sticking to it.Wireframing, sketching, and prototyping user experiences in tools like Sketch, Figma, and Invision.Be able to produce UX deliverables such as UX audit reports, personas, synthesized insights, competitor analysis, and user journeys/flows.Be able to produce UI deliverables such as Design systems, style guides, and component libraries.Following best practices, usability, and accessibility for online shopping experiences. Keeping up to date with the latest UX trends and best practices.A great understanding of branding. Able to follow brand guidelines and apply them to an online shopping website, but also help clients to better communicate their brand online through the effective use of graphic design and branding principles.Working with task management and timesheet tools like JIRA and Trello.Handoff of annotated designs to developers using predominantly Figma but with some instances of using Zeplin.Quality assurance – reviewing the implementation of design and providing feedback to developers to ensure high-quality delivery to clients.Ideally, you will also have experience in these areas:Talking to and helping manage the relationship with the client.Be comfortable contributing to pitch work and presenting your ideas.Workshopping ideas and co-creating solutions and new ideas with the client.Be able to create customer journeys illustrating the requirements a customer has when facing a specific task, such as finding a product.Have experience working with eCommerce clients – preferred but not mandatory.Understanding benchmarks and best practices.Strong understanding of front-end code (HTML & CSS) to design viable responsive UI designs which utilise the inherent functionality and technology of the eCommerce platform.Be able to prioritise and manage your own time and highlight as soon as possible any ideas that you feel might improve the solution for the client.CRO experience is preferred but not mandatory.RequirementsBeautiful portfolio of digital design preferably in luxury & premium eCommerce brands.Passionate about design and customer experience and always keeping up to date with the latest design and UX trends.Excellent creative problem solver, always trying to come up with the best solution to a problem.A high level of attention to detail and accuracy. You take pride in the quality of your work from the research through to the implementation.Self-motivated and proactive. Keen to learn and continually improve workflow and team productivity, sharing your ideas with the team.Great communication skills for explaining ideas and discussing solutions with developers, clients, and other team members.BenefitsFlexible working hours.Flexibility to work hybrid - either from home or in our offices.Opportunities for training and development.Team social events.2 charity/volunteer days per year.25 annual leave days per employment year.Day off for your birthday.Enhanced parental leave policy.Client discounts.EOFY and Christmas parties each year.More info about Tryzens here: http://tryzens.com/We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity and encourage everyone to respond. Tryzens is an equal opportunity employer and every applicant will be considered without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity.

Location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Description:
WHYTo create elegant, seamless and user-friendly experience and designs for our customers so that they continue to use our products with ease and achieve their business goalsJob DescriptionYou are responsible for the design and implementation of all the experiences a user has when interacting with Soprano products. You will work closely with our product team and/or development team to ensure seamless UI design and the successful implementation of UI/UX best practices and principles across all our Soprano products.You will liaise within the product team to ensure that the requirements are being met, achieving a deep understanding of customer needs, and engaging with the software development team to understand what is possible with the technology. Key element of the delivery includes wireframes, screen renders, screen text, navigation designs, artwork, and CSS to name a few.As a position of responsibility, it is expected that the duties of this role are conducted with limited direct and day to day supervision and are executed meeting Soprano quality, functional and schedule expectations.Key ResponsibilitiesPartner and collaborate with the product and engineering teams to build experiences and features which lead to customer success and delight.  Investigate and develop a deep understanding of customer needs to craft product changes that really have an impact to improve customer experience through UI. Move quickly, iterate rapidly, and expertly strike that important balance between art and data-driven decision-making. Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes. Prototyping, iterating designs based on feedback from customers and business stakeholdersUse paper, InVision and Sketch to create concepts and prototype product ideas to be able to test with customers and gain feedback from business stakeholders. Iterate designs based on feedback to ensure product changes have real impactCarrying out user testing, synthesising results to form design guidelinesDeeper understanding of designing UX considering Accessibility requirements adhering to WCAG 2.0 and other similar global standards. Prepare and perform WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 testing when requiredProvide advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyze and predict user behavior. Participate in and validate usability testing. Conduct usability labs if required. Visual thinking and problem-solving. Qualitative and quantitative research methods and know how to apply them in a Design Thinking-like process Understand how to navigate cognitive biases to drive the best outcomes for the businessSKILLS AND EXPERIENCEA bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2+ years UI/UX design experience for digital products or servicesYou're a strong all-rounder. From discovery and envisioning right through to working with engineering to get the product built. Design thinking is built into your DNA, but you also know how to execute and get things done. You'll be thinking about some of our trickiest and most interesting challenges, and constantly driving to improve the way we do things and improve our processes. You like to deliver real results and work fast. You know how to iterate quickly on concepts, and think in terms of “hours and days,” not “weeks and monthsYou should be comfortable with an evidence-based approach to product design. Experience designing and testing WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 compliant softwareA strong working knowledge of HTML, CSS and experience in using design software such as Sketch, InVision, Visio, iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative SuiteProficiency in relevant testing software (AMP, ANDI, aXe, WAVE, NVDA, JAWS)Excellent written and oral communication skills.

At Honeywell Sine, we're committed to being a part of a mission that matters. Striving to develop innovative, industry-leading solutions to everyday workplace challenges. We want to make our customers’ operations safer, simpler and more secure.That’s what gets us moving every day — we thrive on helping the largest corporations through to a local school find easier ways to streamline their workplace through visitor, contractor, staff and asset management.Sine has been rolled out to thousands of companies around the world and is used at locations such as schools, sports stadiums, offices, industrial, medical, retail and commercial facilities.Sine is a part of Honeywell Connected Enterprise. From our head office in Adelaide, South Australia we’re growing globally!As a UX Product Designer at Sine, you'll be responsible for designing exceptional digital experiences that meet the needs of our customers. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will contribute to the development of user-centered solutions that solve real problems and provide value to our users. With a focus on creating intuitive and accessible design, you will help to maintain and evolve our design system to ensure consistency across all of our products. Your ability to think critically and creatively will be a valuable asset as you work to design effective and engaging experiences for our users.This position is suitable for Junior to Mid-weight candidatesWhat you'll doLead the design process for key features and experiences from ideation to launch Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create development-ready UI and visual designs that differentiate our brand in the market Create user journey diagrams, low fidelity mockups, wireframes, and prototypes to communicate design concepts and solutions Participate in the development and maintenance of design systems and component libraries to ensure consistency across all products Develop a deep understanding of users' needs through user research and testing Collaborate with product leaders to align design solutions with business and customer goals Advocate for user-centred design practices and executing UXD best practices throughout the product development process Design and validate user interfaces for scalable programs and applications across desktop and mobile platforms Document functional user requirements to communicate design decisions and rationale Work collaboratively with other members of the design team to promote a culture of design excellence. What you'll have2-5 years of UX or related design experienceA Bachelors degree in Design, Interaction Design, Graphic design, a related discipline or equivalent professional experienceStrong knowledge of user-centred design principles and practices, including design thinking and agile methodologies. Proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and their impact on the design process. Experience conducting user research, testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and validate solutions. Familiarity with accessibility and inclusive design best practices. Solid understanding of design systems, component libraries, and design patterns and their role in creating consistent and scalable products. Proficiency in creating user journey maps, low fidelity mockups, wireframes, and prototypes to communicate design concepts and solutions. Experience with multi-platform development, including Native Mobile, Responsive Web and Desktop ApplicationsAbility to balance user needs with business requirements and constraints to deliver effective and valuable design solutions. Previous work within a SaaS and/or B2B organisationApplication requirementsA portfolio that demonstrates your experience in end-to-end product design must be submitted with your application to be consideredWhy work for us?We’re a diverse, global team committed to a product and mission we believe in. We have teams and offices in Australia, the US, UK, India and the Philippines!We’re now a Honeywell company (Fortune 100), growing quickly and expanding into countries all over the world. You’ll have the opportunity to play a key part in our global growth!We believe that everyone should love coming to work. There’s plenty of work to do, but we love to have fun along the way. Join us for Wednesday yoga, weekly team drinks on the deck, or a game of pool, foosball and ping-pong!We encourage innovation and creativity. We understand there’s more than one way to do things and encourage you to come up with new ideas and approaches.Like to work in a central & accessible location close to great food, coffee, parks and bars? Our new head office is located in the heart of Adelaide - the most liveable city in Australia! Enjoy our outdoor deck, unlimited coffee and snacks, and take advantage of reserved parking right next door!Value work-life balance? So do we! Our office hours are Monday to Friday, 9-5 and we offer both flexibility and hybrid working optionsIf you’re looking for a great working culture at a company building a cool product in the cloud - please apply!

**Please only apply if you currently have Eligibility to work in Australia**Here at DotDev, we think creatively about technology and eCommerce; delivering innovative digital solutions of all shapes and sizes. We love envisioning how people will experience eCommerce, allowing for more personalised; socially connected and smooth experiences.After launching in 2016, we’ve built hundreds of eCommerce sites for some of the best in the business - partnering with Australian and global retailers such as Decjuba, Aje, Incu, Tony Bianco, Scanlan Theodore, Viktoria & Woods and more. We’re passionate about creating amazing, pixel-perfect and meaningful digital experiences. Sounds exciting? That’s because it is! And it’s where you come in…Who is a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev?As a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev, you are excited by establishing brands as industry leaders in eCommerce through well-produced and intelligently designed stores.Working closely with the Design Lead and UI Designer or sometimes solo: you’ll help transform user insights into smart, innovative and creative concepts. You will thoughtfully design experiences that are clear, accessible and delightful; using data to make meaningful design choices.With your UX Design thinking, clients & the team at Dotdev will rely on your ability to think outside of the box. You are someone who can draw various sources of data to paint an empathetic picture of the customer and their user journey navigating through a website.As a senior, you’ll also naturally mentor other designers and share knowledge on design methods, tools and trends with the rest of your team. You’ll help our team navigate ambiguity; negotiate decisions and support our designers when they feel out of their depth in the space.You also enjoy taking an active role in contributing to our design culture and practices - with a 'here to help' attitude. You absolutely, fundamentally believe that we're better together.So, that all sounds nice, but what will you be doing day-to-day?RequirementsAs a Senior UI/UX’er you will be responsible for:Orchestrating what best practice design looks like within the teamCreating beautiful and functional websitesPartnering with our UX Lead and Tech Leads to come up with the best solutions to user problems and client needsUnderstanding user data to empathise with the end userJumping in UX/customer research to better understand how a customer navigates a websiteDeveloping high-quality and organised design systems and creative concepts (prototypes)Turning client brand guidelines and objectives into tangible on-brand designs, even when they don’t necessarily fit with your own personal aestheticLeading creative & UX workshops as well as reviewsAs the subject matter specialist, help educate clients on best practice UI & UX practicesHelping others’ in the team where necessary and also asking for help when you don’t know something yourselfWhat skills do you need?Eligibility to work in AustraliaMust be at a senior designer levelA user-centred, solution and result mindsetBe flexible in the face of changing requirements throughout the design processExpert knowledge of FigmaBenefitsWhy work with us?A career at DotDev stretches you in all the right places. That’s because we’re always looking forward – future-proofing ecommerce requires futuristic skills! You’ll flex and grow, here – we don’t believe in boxes. We’ll help you design the kind of role, career, and work-life where you can be your best.Also, when we say flex, we mean it. Work-from-home is here to stay. Which means if the world outside calls your name, you can plug in from anywhere – Melbourne, Rome, or Tokyo.We’re remote-first (and loving it!). But we also have co-working offices in Melbourne & Brisbane, so when you do want that face-to-face time we have a space ready to go.Do work you're proud of. Apply today.

Hello. We’re Bilue.Bilue is an Australian design and development consulting company. Our founder and CEO, Cameron Barrie, an app developer himself, originally started the company in his living room, with the vision of helping Australian companies design and deliver cutting-edge and innovative digital experiences. Twelve years later we now have offices in Sydney and Melbourne and a growing team of 65+. Over the years we’ve partnered with some of Australia's leading brands to deliver innovative and human-centred digital solutions.Quality Assurance Engineers at Bilue play an important role in our company’s engineering process. They are responsible for the creation of manual and automated tests to identify any bugs and errors found during the test phase, alongside providing data validation and documentation for review. QA Engineers are passionate about supporting the development team in creating the best possible ‘end user’ experience. They are genuinely excited to help create great products that make a real difference in people’s lives.We develop clean quality code that matches our client's vision.We iterate constantly to get the best possible outcome for all parties.We deploy products that add real value and that we are proud of.Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe QA responsibilities will vary from project to project but may include the following;Work collaboratively with developers, designers, product managers and clients in an agile environmentLiaise with internal teams and external stakeholders to identify system requirementsDesign and implement both manual and automated testing programs throughout the lifecycle of various projects at BilueCreate detailed, comprehensive and well structured test plans and test casesEstimate, prioritise, plan and coordinate testing activitiesDesign, develop and execute automation scripts using open source toolsIdentify, record, document thoroughly and track bugsPerform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolvedMonitor debugging process resultsDevelop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needsInvestigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutionsTrack quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect countsHandle agile QA activities (ie define user stories, define and estimate QA activities within the sprint, ensure TDD by creating test scenario for functional, black box, grey box as well as white box testing and share them with developers, plan testing activities and agree on acceptance and exit criteria for the sprint for each functionality)Inform and support the development team's approach to testing and encourage better practices to improve overall product qualityStay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategiesSkillsExperience testing code under development in mobile applications (Must have!)Minimum 3-4 years commercial experience creating automation frameworksUnderstanding of feature testing, regression testing and exploratory testingUnderstanding of mobile app-specific issues and different platform testing requirementsBasic understanding of stress, performance and load testingFamiliarity with end-to-end and integration testingAbility to document and communicate business logic requirementsAbility to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirementsFamiliarity with cloud message APIs and push notificationsExperience using a range of testing tools (ie Postman, Charles, Cucumber, Appium, Selenium)Proficient understanding of Jira & Trello or similar project management toolsFamiliarity with Unit TestingFamiliarity with continuous integration and continuous deliveryFamiliarity working with Agile Framework principles (Relative Estimation, Task breakdown, Sprint cadences)Benefits To thank our employees for the value they bring to our business, we offer a wide range of perks and benefits including;Flexible work from anywhere approachAnnual personal and professional development budgetsRegular social eventsCareer growth & developmentSubscription to the Centr Fitness and Wellness AppAccess to Counselling support | Financial coaching | Well-being and nutritional coachingBirthday leaveCandidates must be located in Sydney or Melbourne and have unrestricted working rights.Did you know… Bilue = Big + Blue OceanAre you ready to set sail? Our client’s success is our success. And you make it happen.We are an established market leading brand who are focused on driving client growth. We’re at the forefront of innovation punching above our weight. We’re enabling the future for our clients through tech as open banking.We are an unlisted public company and one of five licensed banks in Australia with full direct connectivity and production capability across all domestic payment systems. Whilst the major banks leverage this capability for their consumer and business clients, our B2B model focuses on enabling other banks, fintech’s and corporates to deliver innovative and competitive payment and digital solutions to their clients and customers.We are looking for a QA Engineer to join our Open Banking domain.Reporting to the QA Manager, the main purpose of this role is to ensure: Speed in quality assurance outcomes using principles as intelligent stubs and easy automation. Performance and resilience of the system are thoroughly evaluated.You must have testing experience with API’s to be considered for this roleAs Cuscal’s QA Engineer – Open Banking your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following: Participate in grooming sessions and defining/refining the acceptance criteria. Provide detailed estimates for building mocks, automating the tests, updating the regression automation suite, designing, and maintaining the performance scripts based on acceptance criteria of the requirement and impact assessment of the functions. Define the scenarios that can be run with mocks and the test that must be run end to end. Prepare mocks to align to the requirements to support early verification. Integrate the automation code to develop automation scripts that can be used for end-to-end verification. Define environment requirements for execution of performance and infrastructure resilience tests. Prepare and maintain scripts for verification of the performance against the NFR’s. Prepare tests and execute them to validate the infrastructure resilience.About YouThis is highly observable role within Cuscal, and it requires the ideal candidate to have thorough knowledge in API test automation and performance testing (minimum of at least 4 years as a guide) to be considered for this role. Your technical competencies in API testing and IAM testing will see you go far in this role.As a QA Engineer, you will bring with you your ability to create mocks for API using Lisa, mocklabs. Furthermore, you will have an ability to write cURLS based on swagger. You will be able to design, configure and execute performance scripts using tools as Jmeter and Loadrunner. Knowledge of codeless testing automation tools would be beneficial, and your understanding of CI/CD integration will be vital.As the ideal candidate, you will have strong analytical skills with the ability to grasp systems, processes, and operations effectively. Furthermore, your high level of accuracy and attention to detail will be essential to this role. With the ability to communicate effectively within a multi-layered stakeholder environment, you will be confident in building and maintaining positive relationships with key stakeholders internally and externally. Your ability to coach, mentor and guide other members of the team will see you reinforce your seniority in the team.Your knowledge of defect tracking process, JIRA and Confluence will be highly desirable. Likewise, a degree in Information Technology will be looked upon favourably.Why Cuscal?We are in the rapidly evolving world of payments, and we are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. We support our colleagues with flexible work arrangements through our hybrid model whilst also offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits.Next StepIf you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of payments sector. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.Cuscal does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any Cuscal employee, location or address.

Company DescriptionMake a difference in the world, be part of a software start-up that positively impacts our communities. Acusenus was founded in 2018. Our team is committed to using AI, software and in-house R&D to build and offer solutions that create behavioural change on the roads, reduce the instances of dangerous driving, and the deaths and serious injuries that result from it.Work in a company surrounded by first class engineers who want to make the world a better place. In 5 short years we’ve grown to a team of over 100, and now we are looking to onboard our first IT manager as part of the R&D Leadership team. Consider this role your blank canvas to establish the practice and principles that suit your expertise.You can learn more about Acusensus here.Job DescriptionWhat we offerThe opportunity to wake up each day and know that the work you are doing is impacting the lives of real people and increasing safety on the roads. Financial stability; we have long term contracts in place with government bodies. Competitive salary based on market data - We also want you to be part of the financial growth of the company so we grant annual shares and bonuses. Hybrid working model that supports work life balance. What We ValueIntegrity We pride ourselves on conducting our business ethically and responsibly. We keep our word; we deliver on our promises and we strive to earn the trust of our clients to support them in delivering on their unique public policy and business objectives.Collaboration We believe that solutions to any big challenge are best discovered through collaboration. We know we are more effective and innovative when we encourage and value different ideas, skills and perspectives allowing us to deliver customer-centric, tailored solutionsCare Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of our employees, our customers and the community drives us to deliver innovative and superior solutions.Impact We are driven by our mission to develop and deliver solutions that make a positive and sustainable impact, creating safer communities across the globe.What You’ll DoAcusensus have achieved significant growth and currently house a team of high quality engineers. We are looking to make our first QA hire as these responsibilities are currently shared amongst the developers. We are excited about bringing in a dedicated resource who can embed themselves and improve the production cycle.Our QA Engineer is primarily responsible for ensuring overall quality of our software products. This role plays a crucial part in the business by establishing appropriate quality control processes, procedures and strategies.This role will be a key contributor to Acusensus strategy to exceed customer expectations and be a pioneer in markets it chooses to pursue.We have identified several career path options for this role; either people management or individual contributor roles. We are also looking for a junior QA for you to manage, therefore people leadership opportunities are part of this role.Your day to day:Collaborate with Software Engineers to deliver quality products aligned to our strategic road map. Provide technical guidance and expertise on testing automation to other Engineers. Design and manage automation test frameworks and architecture, develop repeatable testing and application performance automation. Design testing scenarios and test cases that will demonstrate conformance and traceability to functional and non-functional requirements. Define and execute end-to-end testing of our detection and processing solutions, for each customer release, across all test cycles, including Integration, Verification, Regression and Validation. Description:
Full Time - Working from home or Hybrid role - your choice!Gain experience working for an industry leading global company!MUST be located in Australia or New Zealand to support business in this time zone.THE ROLEThis position will play a significant part in generating workforce reports and identifying people data trends for our managers and key stakeholders. Company DescriptionWe are a customer-obsessed, “one stop shop” for all things data-related. We are deliberately narrow in our focus areas but we go deep in each of them. We provide solutions, services and training in the data strategy, data governance, data security, data management, data classification, data wrangling, data lake, data analytics, data visualisation, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT areas. Our solutions and services help transform customer organisations by teaching them how to turn their data into insightWe build on AWS, using the latest AWS services, best practices and reference architectures. We deliberately focus on large public sector customers that are data-heavy but insight-light – federal & state government departments, universities, public sector agencies, public health organisations, and public utilities.We are an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner and an AWS Public Sector Partner, working towards our Data & Analytics and Government competencies. We are also a registered technology supplier to the Federal, New South Wales, Victorian and Western Australian governments and we have a Master Services Agreement in place with AWS Professional Services.Job DescriptionYour impact As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in working with customers to understand their business requirements, map these to their data capabilities, liaise with our internal Data Engineers to design and build elegant solutions, then partner with our customers to deploy those solutions in a way that allows them to turn data into insight. You will have 2-3 years’ experience working as a Data Analyst (or similar role) on data-related solutions, preferably using AWS, and will be comfortable working with business analysts, data visualisers, data engineers and data scientists, to enable customers to solve their data-related challenges.You will relish the opportunity to innovate, evolve and challenge existing assumptions and to develop the data-related requirements that feed into the design of solutions that solve real-world problems for customers. Your experience with large-scale data challenges and ability to analyse them as input into reliable, scalable cloud-based solutions, will see you thriving in this role!ExpectationsEnjoy honing your data-related analysis skills and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to solution discussions. Regularly take part in further education and training to help you hone and extend your data analysis skills. Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business, product, and technical challenges. Possess an innate awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT. Strong Analytics skills to collect, analyze and generate insight using data. Have a basic understanding of IT security and governance including security standards, access policies, and data classification schema. Love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun. Be dynamic, creative, and willing to take on challenges that have the potential to make a big impact. Relish a ground floor opportunity to work in a small, agile, friendly startup environment. A Graduate degree (or Masters) in a data or technology-related discipline is preferred.  An AWS Associate Solutions Architect certification is a bonus. QualificationsTechnical Requirements:2+ years of: Hands on, practical experience, in and around data-related solutions AWS experience (Desired) A basic understanding of software development tools and methodologies Data analysis experience Experience producing quality documentation and written communications Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jenkins or Ansible Some experience with both writing and interpreting SQL queries.  Experience building reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight.  A basic understanding of Infrastructure as Code, especially AWS Cloudformation.  Some programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, Node.js, .Net, PHP.  A basic understanding of data ingestion and transformation pipelines.  A basic understanding of fundamental data concepts including databases, data schema, data classification, data security, data governance, data analysis, data transformation, data engineering and data science.  A basic understanding of fundamental networking concepts. Additional InformationWe’re passionate about the technical community we are a part of, and believe in contributing to open source and AWS initiativesWe care about climate change and are always looking at ways to reduce our carbon footprintWe support and contribute to a different cause each quarterWe’re committed to developing your career with customised individual growth and development plansWe’re committed to ensuring all our staff feel welcome, included and respected every day they work for The Data Foundry

About us: Easygo is a global tech start up leveraging cutting edge technologies to disrupt the gambling and streaming industries. We offer gaming, streaming, crypto casino and sportsbook platforms which use cutting edge technologies aimed at ensuring provably fair outcomes for users. Our products are used by millions of people around the world including Drake and Sergio Agüero! You’ll see our logos in the Premier League, the UFC, the F1 and advocated by e-gamers and in a number of other sporting stadiums and arenas.As well as our revolutionary casino games and crypto sportsbook platforms we recently launching Kick.com a streaming platform which was number 1 on the app store in the UK & US after the first week! Our core focus is in the online gaming space, building well-designed casino games, crypto platforms, and a huge sports book offering.The last 2 years have been huge for us, we have grown from 20 to 150+ team members. Whilst the products that we build are global, the majority of the team sits in Melbourne at our Australian headquarters in the heart of the CBD where we have 3 amazing offices in the same building with all the bells and whistles you could ever want. Including an in-house barista, pool and table tennis tables, PS5 and Nintendo Switches, a meditation room, help yourself drinks fridge and snack wall, catered breakfast daily, weekly massages and pub lunches.About you: Attention all data wizards and number nerds! We are seeking a Data Analyst extraordinaire to join our Business Intellignece team of data lovers. Are you passionate about dissecting complex data sets and turning them into meaningful insights? Do you dream about pivot tables and Excel formulas? Do you love working on large data sets on a huge sportsbook platform which processes over 150 million bets per day? Well look no further as we have the job for you!As our Data Analyst, you will be responsible for diving headfirst into our data pool and making sense of the chaos. You'll be the master of all things data, from analyzing user behavior to predicting future trends. It won't just be crunching numbers, reading and coding in Python and running SQL queries, you'll be providing data insights to business units who are looking to harness the power of data to benefit our cutting edge crpto sportsbook website stake.com.We're looking for someone who brings their own unique quirks and personality to the table and add to our team, which is made up of outgoing and driven individuals who are passionate about what they do and thrive in a high-energy and collaborative environment. So if you're a data-loving human who is ready to take on the challenge of making sense of our data universe, apply now! Heyyyyy! We're Cashrewards, Australia’s most loved cashback platform.Shoppers love us, but not just shoppers, our team think we’re pretty awesome too. So much so that they recently voted and now we’re a certified Great Place to Work. As they say, the proof is in the pudding socheck out this role to see if you fancy a slice yourself. About The RoleAs a Data Analyst you will work to create the best practice in delivering insights to support the end-to-end direct marketing campaign process, critical strategic insights. This includes discovering insights to support the marketing team in making strategic campaign decisions, developing customer segments to personalise communications to customers, measuring the impact of merchant campaigns and uncovering hidden treasures for our product and strategy decisions.You will work closely with internal business stakeholders such as the Marketing team, Client Services, Product Marketing and Strategy teams.Your FocusProviding data support, quality control and oversight for end-to-end campaign / direct marketing executionProactively engage and collaborate with key stakeholders to understand key business problems Translate business problems into data requirementsPerform complex data and commercial analysis to understand how customer behaviour and product changes affect the businessDeliver actionable insights and recommendation in the form of ad-hoc analysis, reporting or ongoing requests for multiple teams across the business (Product, Finance, Marketing, Operations, Member services, Board, CEO, etc.)Delivering actionable insight in the form of customer segmentations, propensity models, campaign targeting & evaluations and any other analysis required to improve marketing performanceLeverage analytics techniques to build models and segmentations to support more personalised direct marketing and optimise campaign activity About YouHighly proficient in SQL and querying relational databases, specially MS SQL. Experience in a similar role or delivering data insights and reportingPreferred experience/exposure to reporting platforms such as Tableau & PowerBIKnowledge of data analytics tools such as Python, R and Matlab is a nice to haveStrong understanding of customer databases and/or complex data sets, including segmentation, clustering, and predictive modellingAgile - ability to handle non-routine problems and situationsA team player - we have a great collaborative and open culture In the fast moving cashback category, Cashrewards has powered ahead of its rivals and taken the lead, serving over 1.8 million members with an enticing range of cashback offers from more than 2000 brand partners including Apple, Amazon, Myer, Liquorland, Adidas, Bonds, Target, Booking.com and The Iconic. As if that isn’t impressive enough, we’re fully Australian owned and operated, and backed by 1835i, one of Australia's leading venture funds. Plus, we support the Starlight Children's Foundation by donating 1% of all cash redeemed to the foundation.Another cool thing, we're right smack-band in the middle of Sydney CBD (next to the QVB) so we're easy to get to. There's Lots More To Love About Working Here, Like Flexible working Friday hours (finish at 3pm on Fridays) Double cashback Free access to Headspace Discounted fitness classes and wellness offering with Class Pass Birthday leave 16 weeks paid parental leave Ability to work up to 90 days a year from anywhere in the world Awesome people who you'll get to know at some of our awesome celebrations and social eventsWe’ve grown so much in the last few years and as this ad proves, we’re still growing. So if you’re keen to jump on board and help us steer this fine ship into the future, don’t let this opportunity pass you by. So jump in, forget FOMO. Join the Cashrewards team today.Check out our careers page https://www.cashrewards.com.au/careers

Who is QAL?Queensland Airports Limited (QAL) is an accomplished airport operator which owns and operates Gold Coast, Townsville, Longreach and Mount Isa airports – connecting the Gold Coast and northern NSW, along with regional Queensland, to the rest of the country and beyond. We are an Australian-owned company with a vision to engage customers, connect communities and deliver exceptional experiences – and a commitment to delivering for the communities where we operate. QAL is formally recognised as a ‘Great Place to Work – Certified’ organisation – currently the only airport operator in Australia with this certification. QAL is dedicated to a target of net zero Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions by 2030. With strong passenger numbers, and terminal upgrades underway - there has never been a better time to join QAL. What you’ll contribute to:An exciting opportunity has become available for a Data Analyst to join the QAL team!This role is a permanent opportunity and will be reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence and Data. The successful candidate will assist the Queensland Airports Limited Group in achieving its corporate objectives in relation to data analytics and interpretation. This role is also required to assist with broader business insights, and passenger forecasting & reporting.Finance & Capital Manager Cameron Molenda, who joined QAL in 2016 shares his unique experience working at QAL:“At QAL, I work with a diverse group of people who are committed to enhancing the customer experience for the Airport. We make a difference by working closely with both internal and external stakeholders. As a business enabling function, it’s important that we provide value to other departments, assisting decision-making processes in enabling better financial outcomes. I joined QAL due to the location initially, and I stayed because we have a great team. I can take up QAL’s flexible working offerings and this arrangement directly enables me to volunteer to coach my kid’s soccer team on two afternoons each week. I love the game and being able to transfer my passion to my kids, and their teammates, gives me significant personal reward/pride.In my role, I contribute by bringing both professionalism and humour to our team. I work closely with several areas of the business; I enjoy the relationships I have with many departments. QAL has provided me with challenging scenarios and significant opportunities to continually learn and grow. It’s a great company (and industry) to be a part of. We touch on the lives of many people yet strive to continually achieve the best commercial outcomes. The company has strong ethical foundations, the team is hard working and individuals are respected.”We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who has strong skills in interpreting large data sets and a high level of presentation skills while collaborating with multiple levels of the business.The successful candidate will have:A minimum of 2 years experience, preferably connected to the aviation industryKnowledge of BI Data Analysis tools such as Microsoft PowerBI and SSRS, or similar data visualisation tools.Exposure to Data Warehouse environments and analytical modelling An advanced understanding of Microsoft Excel.Experience with SQL Server Management Studio will also be highly regardedA qualification in /Data Science/Analytics is highly regarded, but not essentialKey deliverables/responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Provide BI Support to all areas of the QAL Group, including dealing with ad hoc requests.Manage the overall passenger reporting for QAL, to ensure accurate and timely Monthly passenger reporting to the business.Identify trends in passenger movements for forecasting.Monitor general aviation industry trends and report on significant issues, updating management on changes that impact the QAL Group.Seek to continuously improve processes and build strong working relationships with internal and external customers.What we offer you?This is an opportunity to be part of a progressive organisation with a great culture and assist in the transformation and growth of the business. Flexible working options are available for all employees. At QAL, we uphold the philosophy that the smooth integration of life and work benefits all. We call it ‘Living Well’.QAL supports an inclusive approach and values diversity within the workplace. We aim to provide opportunities that allow individuals to reach their full potential regardless of their background, gender, age, work status, religious or cultural identity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.The successful candidate will be required to adhere to QAL’s Drug and Alcohol Management Plan (DAMP, which includes pre-employment Drug and Alcohol Testing and have the ability to obtain an Aviation Security Identification Card (ASIC).Please obtain the Position Description by copying this location into your browser: https://qal.elmotalent.com.au/careers/QALcareers/jobs

Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what’s possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.Let's Talk About The TeamOur Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Strong software engineering process and practicesSupport the design and development of dashboards, reports and cubesFamiliar with most of the Databases such as MS SQL server and OracleLet's talk about what's in it for you!We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it’s also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. Company Description
  i-Motor, as part of carsales, provides website solutions both here in Australia and internationally, to automotive OEM's & dealers, as well as dealers in other industries including caravans, bikes, boats, trucks and equipment.
  It has achieved excellent growth since its creation twelve years ago and currently has a team of 40+ employees managing 1,700+ websites.
  What’s on offer:
 
   A place where you can move your career forward, where you’ll be continuously backed to make new ideas happen, and the chance to do work that makes real, significant impact in the world.
   Hybrid working arrangements.
   We’re a certified Great Place to Work, Family Friendly Workplace and WGEA Employer of Choice.
   The support of a highly engaged, high-performing team including a leadership team that’s you’ll actually have face time with.
 
 
 

 Job Description
  What you’ll do:
  As a junior front-end developer, this 12-month fixed term contract will allow you to build on your existing skills, joining our talented development team at i-Motor, you'll work across various projects that will challenge and excite you.
 
   Maintain responsive websites for our dealership customers.
   Assist with quality control and performance optimisation.
   Provide well documented, reliable and maintainable code.
   Research development improvements and keep up to date with best software practices.
   Collaborate and connect with our team of FE, BE and Full-Stack developers.
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  What are we looking for?
 
   Knowledge and experience with HTML, CSS (sass) and JS manipulation of the DOM
   Some knowledge of server-side scripting in any platform
   Experience with performance, optimisation and validation of HTML CSS and JS
   Understanding of browser developer tools
   Keen eye for visual patterns and UI component modularity
   Any experience with AWS, Lambda functions, Node JS or React JS a bonus.
 
  Additional Information
  A few other things we want to let you know about...
 
   i-Motor is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on
   fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage everyone of all ages, genders and backgrounds to apply. If you’re a candidate with a disability or you’ll need some adjustments to be at your best, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.
   We are a proud Circle Back Initiative Employer which means we are committed to responding to every job applicant.
   Successful candidates joining the i-Motor team are required to undergo
   a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis

Growing startup on the beach seeks experienced frontend developer full time! 
  About Us. 
   Tyroola is an exciting, dynamic new start-up specialising in the online retail of automotive tyres, operating from Sydney and the Sunshine Coast. Our mission is to become market-leader in the industry through innovation, and optimisation of market processes to provide our customers with the accessibility, and value they deserve. 
   Our business is now expanding at pace, and we are now looking for additional individuals to grow with us. 
   About You. 
   You are a senior frontend developer experienced in designing, developing and maintaining large-scale web applications. We're looking for a team player who loves solving problems in an agile and creative way. 
   Our system is built from scratch to meet the business requirements without compromise, so you should have demonstrable experience in modern JS and CSS frameworks (React, Angular, Bootstrap, Foundation) and their related backend services. We make use of the newest open source technologies where possible to develop best-in-class products - so be very comfortable working with and on open source software. Above all, you should share our desire to create great software! 
   Role requirements. 
   We are looking for someone: 
   
   with several years experience designing, developing and maintaining complex web applications, preferably involving e-Commerce 
   who can create, and test your Cross-browser solutions 
   focusing on clean, Responsive and mobile-first implementations 
   with extensive knowledge with either REST APIs or GraphQL-Backends 
   who is familiar with Gulp, Webpack, Bower 
   with excellent communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to self-manage 
  
  From a senior frontend developer we would like to see some of the following as well: 
   Demonstrable experience in: 
   
   OOP in the ECMAScript 6 stack using a modern frontend framework such as React or Flux 
   Unit Testing (Mocha, Jasmine) 
   Integration Testing (CasperJS or Selenium) 
   designing and implementing RESTFul APIs 
  
  Nice to haves: 
  
   good PHP OOP knowledge 
   working with cloud systems like AWS, Digital Ocean 
   experience with CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins) 
   experience in using any virtualization software (e.g. VirtualBox with vagrant), experience with working with production systems 
   Big Plus: Worked in a Start-up before! 
   
  You’ll take ownership of all things front-end in our products and projects, working as part of our engineering teams. 
   The main focus will be the development of our e-commerce framework, which includes a highly extensible and scalable system, spread over several cloud based servers. 
   We implement designs under the clean code principle and make use of all the tools out there helping, measuring and tracking to improve the code quality. 
   Exciting projects in the coming months will be for example new white-label solutions like we did with Supercheap Auto, our international expansion and deeper integration with our offline partners. 
   About Our Offer. 
  
   The role remote 
   Relaxed environment, working with a small team of dedicated, passionate individuals 
   A flat hierarchy and transparency. You have a chance to directly influence the technology and business. 
   
  Send your application to careers@tyroola.com.au.

Junior Front End Developer Full Time Opportunity  The Junior Front-end Developer role will support the wider Front-End Development team to maintain, update and enhance the web assets Greenstone manages, including websites, landing pages, and online application forms.  They will work closely with stakeholders, the Development Lead and other Developers to deliver timely, high-quality outcomes by ensuring the level of design and development delivered to the business enables Greenstone to continue to lead the market with innovation and agility.  What are we looking for? 
  
  Up to 1 years professional working experience in the Front-End Web Development space or freelance work experience 
  Working knowledge and understanding of JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3 skills 
  Experience developing responsive websites for mobile devices 
  Experience using Git for version control, and familiarity with Gitflow 
  Experience using automated task runners and bundlers, such as Gulp, or Rollup 
  Ability to translate creative concepts and design templates into flexible code templates 
  Analytical skills as well as being in touch with the latest developments in search strategy and the latest trends in online behaviour 
  Ability to work as part of a team 
  High level attention to detail and the ability to produce organised, tidy, and well-documented code 
  Ability to manage workflow under pressure 
  
 Desirable 
  
  Tertiary level qualifications (e.g., bachelor's degree or higher) in a relevant computer science discipline 
  Excellent understanding of website usability, accessibility, security and information architecture 
  Understanding of SEO requirements and techniques 
  Understanding of Web Performance and Googles Core Web Vital scores 
  Corporate web design/development experience ideally within the financial services space 
  Experience working with Content Management Systems 
  Experience with one or more server-side languages 
  Experience working in ASP.Net Razor and C# 
  JavaScript library experience such as Svelte or React 
  Wireframing/Design skills 
  Experience working with a headless CMS such as Kontent.ai (formerly Kentico Kontent) 
  Experience using Jira or other products in the Atlassian suite 
  Understanding and appreciation of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) 
  Experience working in an Agile environment 
  Ability to code efficiently and effectively 
  Strong communication and organizational skills 
  Ability to develop websites which are cross-browser and cross-platform compatible
 
  
  
  
   
    
     
      
        Our Promise to Our People  We are passionate about our core values of Customer First, We Care, One Team, and Results Driven, which define how we approach our work. July 28, 2021
 
 
   We are hiring! We’re looking for a Web Developer to join our team. While you may not have heard of our name, there’s every chance we’ve powered at least some of your online payments in the past decade. We’re going through an exciting growth period, and are seeking team members to join work on our Acquiring, Billing, Merchant Services and Risk platforms.
   We are a small team who believe that a workplace should be relaxed, friendly and flexible. We are based Australia-wide, with an established remote-first culture. Sydney based staff may make use of the Surry Hills office (a short walk from Central train station).
   About Fat Zebra
   Fat Zebra - A payments platform for today's internet economy - is a Sydney-based Payment Services Gateway which connects merchants across the APAC region to Banks, Fraud Tools and billing platforms to simplify how they accept payments. We specialise in high volume, real time processing for ecommerce and mobile transactions. 
  Ideal candidates will have:
  
    Experience working alongside designers to turn UX / Design templates into working web applications
    Strong TypeScript / JavaScript experience.
    Proficiency with modern tools like React, Redux, TypeScript and webpack.
    Strong knowledge of modern HTML & CSS
    Experience with at least one front end framework, preferably Bootstrap or Bulma
    Experience building graphs & charts using Highcharts, D3 or similar.
    Experience with Node
    Experience in refactoring / modernising legacy front end code
  
   Note: Fat Zebra engineers come from a varied set of backgrounds. If you’re deeply interested in or passionate about payments, and can demonstrate how you could help us deliver world class web experiences, reach out, even if you have not worked with the specific technologies listed.
   Working At Fat Zebra
   As a Fat Zebra web developer, you will work on delivering exceptional experiences for our merchants. You will have the opportunity to deep dive into cutting edge payments technologies and learn to become a subject matter expert.
   Software Development
  
    You will be responsible for the implementation and extension of our customer-facing products, including PayNow, Merchant Dashboard and Reseller Dashboard.
    Work alongside designers and back-end engineers to produce work according to requirements
    Deliver high performance / scalable solutions
    Design end-to-end solutions when delivering features.
    Submit High Quality PRs
    Review PRs to a high standard
    Take part in business hours support duties
  
   Our Principles
   At Fat Zebra we believe in behaving in a professional & supportive manner. The payments industry is full of complex jargon and overloaded terminology. Mistakes are easy to make. We support both new and existing staff by working to the following principles:
  
    Be polite. Interactions with peers are always kind. Argue against an idea - never against the person.
    Be pragmatic. Seek to deliver on the bigger picture of generating value for our customers over perfection in code.
    Be helpful. We believe the best work-places are ones where we know there is always someone available to help if we need it. Respond promptly when someone asks for help.
    Be bold. Strive to go outside your comfort zone. We are a small team - and we frequently go into uncharted territory. Even if failure is possible, learning is guaranteed.
  
   To apply
   Please send your cv (.pdf, .txt, .doc) to jobs@fatzebra.com. Make sure to put the position you are applying for, along with your full name in the 'subject' of the email.

Job Title: Front End React Developer-Sydney HQ Digital Analytics Company
Location: Remote in Sydney Central Business District NSW
Description:
The Company:
  Elida is working alongside a great digital analytics tech-start up on their search for a Mid-level Front End Developer (React) to join them at an incredibly busy and exciting time to contribute to their Software Engineering effort in 2021. These guys driven forward in leaps and bounds over the last couple of years and, having built an established Dev outfit of some very talented React/Node enthusiasts in Sydney, are now looking for another talented Front End Developers to join them.
  The role:
  As part of a software development team, you will create complex, enterprise-transforming business applications by writing quality software code and, simultaneously, focusing on continual learning and development.
  This is an excellent opportunity for a developer with strong technical skills, a passion for quality and experience of creating and supporting mid-sized web applications. The culture is fit for developers who excel in a fast paced, dynamic, DevOps environment and who relish the opportunity to further their career working as part of an agile energetic scale up.
  What we are looking for:
  You will be an experienced and proactive developer with solid skills in ReactJS. You will have a strong focus on delivering quality through effective design, and experience using modern software practices such as, BDD, TDD, process automation, test automation and Agile. You should hold a basic understanding of relational databases. In addition you will hold the following skills:
  Essential:
 
   Proficient in ReactJS
   HTML and CSS (Sass)
   Comfortable working with JSON and integrating with system back end (developed by our back end development team)
 
  Desirable:
 
   React Native experience or knowledge
   Experience in another frontend framework (Angular)
   Experience working in sprints
   Experience of Agile development approaches and use of Jira or equivalent
   Exposure to AWS technologies
 
  Benefits:

   Operational bonus scheme
   Pension scheme
   Healthcare and Dental
   Subsidised Canteen
   On-site Gym
   Cycle to Work Scheme
   Free fruit everyday
   Summer Party, Winter Party, Christmas Party

Mable is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. 
  People with lived experience of disability or personal experience with the aged care system are strongly encouraged to apply. 
 
 
  
 
  Our interview processes are inclusive and will accommodate additional needs when required.
 
 
 
   A little about us...
 
 
   Founded in 2014, Mable has become one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech marketplaces. Our platform is an online community of independent support workers who offer their services directly to people who are seeking aged care or disability support.
 
 
 
   We’re thrilled to have been recognised within AFR’s Fast 100 list in 2021, Deloitte’s Tech Fast 50 2021 Awards and we won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award 2020! This is an awesome opportunity to join a thriving scale up whose profit for purpose mission is transforming the aged care and disability support sectors.
 
 
 
   Mission: We’re redefining support for disability and aged care in Australia by helping people who are aging or living with disability to connect with independent support people in their community.
 
 
 
   Watch this - 
  What we do
 
 
 
   About the positionAs our WordPress Developer, you will be responsible for development tasks relating to our mable.com.au WordPress website. You will be responsible for both back-end and front-end development including the implementation of WordPress themes and plugins as well as site integration and security updates.
 
 
   We are on a journey of improving our website experience, so this will be a mix of tactical maintenance tasks and long-term strategic development. You’ll be accepting briefs from our team through Jira, but also provide best practices and guidance to us in terms of execution.
 
 
 
   How you will make an impactWe take user experience very seriously at Mable and as such, you will be responsible for delivering exceptional user experience through your implementation and problem-solving skills. We take great pride in making our experience as accessible as possible for a wide range of users and you will contribute towards making sure that our website delivers an exceptional user experience.
 
  What will I be doing?
 
   Designing and building the website front-end to best practice principles
   Work with UX/UI designers and QA to make sure our WordPress website is designed and developed purposefully and meets high accessibility standards
   Designing and managing the website back-end including database and server integration.
   Meeting with stakeholders to discuss website design and function.
   Mentoring junior developersGenerating detailed documentation of the processesBuilding and maintaining WordPress themes and plugins.
   Conducting website performance tests.
   Continuously optimising infrastructure to ensure site speed is maximised. Troubleshooting content issues.
   Conducting WordPress training on new features.
   Monitoring the performance of the live website.
 
  What are we looking for?
 
   Proven work experience as a WordPress developer
   Proven experience mentoring junior developers
   Proven experience leading teams
   Knowledge of front-end technologies including CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, Bootstrap framework, HTML5, and jQuery.
   Ability to work autonomously and proactively seek solutions
   Knowledge of GIT including feature branching, and merge conflicts
   Experience working with debugging tools such as Chrome Inspector and Firebug.
   Good understanding of website architecture and aestetics.
   Ability to manage projects.
   Experience using JIRA and Confluence.
   Good communication skills.
 
 
   Life at Mable
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFE2 
  Sydney CBD Office - Two minutes walk from Town Hall Station, we’ve recently taken over an entire floor of the Hilton Hotel building with state-of-the-art facilities and tools you need to get the job done (hello, #scaleup life).
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFE0 
  Hybrid working model - We love to encourage a healthy balance between team collaboration and home/ family commitments.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCBB 
  WFH Set Up Allowance - A generous $800 to help you kit out your home office.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCB5 
  Competitive Remuneration - Everyone at Mable contributes to the bigger picture mission so we want you to feel financially rewarded.
 
 
   ❤️‍\uD83E\uDE79 
  Wellbeing & Mental health - We offer floating public holidays and access to our Employee Assistance Program (App + counselling).
 
 
   \uD83C\uDF82 
  Time away from our desks to recharge - Enjoy additional days off to celebrate your birthday, support your community by tapping into our ‘volunteer day’ or just have a day to yourself through our ‘wellbeing day’.
 
 
   ✈️ 
  Explore the world - You have the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for up to 4-weeks each year.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDC68\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC69\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC67\uD83C\uDFFB‍\uD83D\uDC66\uD83C\uDFFB 
  Family comes first - Make the most of our Paid Parental Leave - a gender neutral policy for primary (14 weeks + super) and secondary (6 weeks + super) carers.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDCAA\uD83C\uDFFE 
  Stay fit - Discounted gym memberships and classes.
 
 
   \uD83E\uDD6A 
  We love to eat - Our pantry and fridges are fully stocked for your convenience.
 
 
   \uD83E\uDEF6\uD83C\uDFFE 
  Diversity & Inclusion - We are constantly empowering our employees and creating a culture of greater inclusion. We are endorsed by Work180 as an accredited employer for women in tech.
 
 
   \uD83C\uDFC6 
  Anniversary Awards - Be rewarded through our recognition program with awesome goodies and rewards to celebrate your successes and tenure at Mable.
 
 
   \uD83D\uDC97 
  Accelerate your career - Be a part of one of Australia's fastest growing Marketplaces. We are a scale-up tech-co and our people are a huge part of this. We want all of our Mablers to feel supported in their careers and for Mable to be the place where they can grow to their full potential.
 
 
 
   Culture within the Mablehood - Our values

   Better Together - We are stronger, better and faster when we work together.
 
 
   Challenge Openly - Speak up. Candid discussion helps us make better decisions.
 
 
   Do The Right Thing, Always - We hold ourselves to the highest standard. What we say and do matters.
 
 
   Cr
  Eate Impact - We are passionate about having an impact.
 
 
 
   We are one
 
 
   We’re endorsed by Work180 which showcases our commitment to our policies, flexible working and inclusion practices for women in tech - visit our page here.
 
 
 
   If this role has stood out to you but you don’t feel like you ‘’tick all the boxes’’, we strongly encourage you to apply nonetheless. We value diversity across experience and you might well just bring something to the Mablehood that we are looking for!
 
 
 
   We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.
