Location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Description:
Company DescriptionAt Shift, we’re passionate about disruption, transformation and positive change. Our goal is to shift perceptions and expectations of what is possible. We’re here to help make business unstoppable. Enablers by nature, we love to solve problems and innovate. As part of the team, you’ll approach new challenges with a clean sheet of paper, reimagine possibilities and deliver results that are 10x better than before.As one of Australia’s fastest-growing technology companies, Shift is changing the way businesses access finance. Enabled by streaming data, we provide credit and payments platforms that help businesses trade, pay and access funds, when they need it.Winner of the IDC 2020 Digital Disruptor and Omni Experience Innovator awards for Australia and New Zealand, Shift has also been named to the Deloitte Fast50 list four years in a row, the Smart50 awards, the AFR Fast 100 List and voted by LinkedIn as one of the Top 25 Australian Start-ups to work.Job DescriptionWe are looking for a Data Engineer to support a quickly growing analytics and strategy team. The role is data! With a focus on, but not be limited to, the development of data analytics solutions (e.g., warehousing and data streaming), assisting with of complex data tasks (e.g., training sets for ML and journey mapping), and management of our auto-decisioning logic (i.e., the magic that drives automation).This role is highly dynamic, and like the company, is growing quickly. The perfect candidate will be excited to take on new challenges and be ok with stretching their skillsets and learning on the go!QualificationsHow you will make a difference:Strong data engineering skills supported by deep experience in Python and SQLKnowledge of cloud systems (we use Azure)Working knowledge of Databricks and PySparkExperience building data warehouse (focus on access)Experience with ETL pipeline development and robustness / resilienceHelpful, not vital - Knowledge of Salesforce and ability to support in moving ML models through testing and into production Additional InformationAt Shift, we’re proud of our rich diversity and culture of inclusion. We have an amazing culture geared towards helping you make the most of your career. We love our fast-paced, energetic environment where no two days are alike. Our values firmly guide the exciting work we do, solving problems and always looking to deliver better outcomes. At Shift you won’t find politics or egos: just one team, with shared successes and shared learnings.Shift offers competitive remuneration and the opportunity to make your mark in a fast-paced, energetic environment. Centrally located in North Sydney CBD, we’re close to transport, restaurants, cafes and shops. You’ll enjoy free breakfasts and healthy snacks, and a friendly social atmosphere. There are also plenty of staff-led social events, Leadership series, Lunch & Learns and other initiatives for you to participate and grow. And best of all, on your birthday, you get the day off!

It relies on a sophisticated approach to and deployment of modern technology, backed by a mindset of continuous improvement.But let’s put things into perspective.One of the largest private irrigation companies in Australia, Murrumbidgee Irrigation serve over 3,000 landholdings covering more than 378,000 hectares of the one of the most diverse, productive agricultural regions in Australia.The region they serve is home to over 50,000 people, with the majority employed in jobs reliant on water.Your impact will be felt by tens of thousands, and it will flow on for years to come.Your ImpactThe Data Engineer at Murrumbidgee Irrigation drives the efficiencies and brings grand ideas to light.Your experience in the design and implementation of cloud-based enterprise architecture will enable a connected and integrated systems environment. You’re a natural at looking at the bigger picture and understand how you and the team can better integrate systems and platforms for high level data driven decisions.You can expect to:Take the lead role in developing a centralized data warehousing capability that supports data-driven decision making through BI reporting, analytics and data science.Scope and develop relevant procedures, documentation, monitoring and control to maintain information integrity, privacy, and security requirements.Implement data models, schemas, and structures to support integration and warehousing.Your AlignmentAt Murrumbidgee Irrigation, your focus is to bring this transformation to life. Short term, the changes you lead will make long term impacts.You’re an expert in building and maintaining strong relationships with every corner of the business, to understand the needs and identify opportunities for enhancing operational efficiency.As the Data Engineer, your contribution and delivery of projects is vital. Your approach will need to be agile, but you will need to architect and enable a single pane of glass, illustrated by:Senior experience in Microsoft Azure Data Stack, AWS, Data Lake, Pipeline, Power BI, SQL/SSIS and ETL.Relevant experience developing project management plans with the ability to think laterally.Your FutureA company that employs more than 160 people knows that this is a two-way street. The best people need to be engaged and supported, in an environment where they can thrive. People aren’t an after-thought.Here’s why you’ll stay:Invest in your family with a rich salary packaging model that includes remote area housing and novated leasing.Invest in yourself with structured Professional Development Programs, in an environment that supports lateral progression.A fluid approach to work that balances life’s demands, so you’ll never have to compromise. You can even purchase additional leave when you need an extra break.  Your Next StepsClick ‘Apply’ to be immediately considered and sent an Information Pack for the role.Looking for more information? Don’t have an up-to-date CV?Connect with me, Olivia Ellerman, at oellerman@rarekind.com.au, or via LinkedIn at linkedin.com/in/oliviaellerman/. Everyone will get a response.

Job Title: UI/UX Designer (up to 12 months fixed term)
Description:
Islamic Bank Australia has been granted a restricted banking licence, making us the first Islamic Bank in Australia and bringing financial inclusion to Australia’s rapidly growing Muslim population.We are focus on launching to market interest free, Shariah compliant personal banking products and achieving our full banking licenceAbout the roleWe are seeking a highly skilled and motivated UI/UX designer to join our team for up to 12 months (with potential for permanancy). The successful candidate will be responsible for creating innovative and user-friendly designs for our digital banking platform, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user experience. Working in close collaboration with the product owners, tech and vendor partners within Australia and overseas, this role may involve some international travel for several weeks at a time.Responsibilities•	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, conduct user research, create wireframes, prototypes and high-fidelity designs.•	Design intuitive interfaces that align with the brand and meet the needs of our customers.•	Code front-end applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.•	Test and iterate designs based on user feedback, ensuring a high level of usability and lead ideation with product team to find solutions.•	Stay up to date with the latest UI/UX trends and technologies.•	Ensure designs are accessible and meet industry standards for accessibility.About youWe are building a new Australian bank from scratch that will support the community and treat customers with respect, so you will be contributing to our long-term vision, celebrating wins (and learning from misses) at the forefront of our customer experience. You’ll thrive in this role if you bring the following skills and experience;•	Bachelor’s degree in design, human computer interaction or a related field.•	Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer with a portfolio of work showcasing your skills.•	Excellent understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.•	Experience conducting user research and testing.•	Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.•	Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills demonstrating you can bring together tech, design and customer experience teams.•	Ability to operate in a fluid environment, with changing demands and developing ways of working.•	Understanding of Islamic banking principles is a plus.Islamic Bank Benefits•	Whether working from our first class facilities in Parramatta or in a hybrid pattern, you’ll have the opportunity to work flexibly.•	As a small team, you’ll work in a collaborative, fun and innovative environment with a high degree of team and personal accountability as we bring new banking products to the Australian market. •	22 Days of annual leave a yearImportant information•	You will be required to undergo background checks and other regulatory checks.•	We are a small team building a bank from scratch. You will need to be hands on initially and comfortable working at both a strategic and operational level as needed.•	We take diversity and inclusion seriously, and welcome both Muslim and non-Muslim applicants. Candidates of any gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation or with a disability are warmly welcomed. If you are a creative and driven UI/UX Designer looking for an exciting opportunity to join a growing startup, we would love to hear from you.

Location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Description:
Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.We’vet tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAt FinClear, the UI Designer’s key purpose is to translate complex requirements, create intuitive interfaces and continual improvement of experiences across our suite of products and platforms that our customers love and rely on!UI Designers at FinClear collaborates with Engineers, senior UX, and UI designers leveraging design skills creating complex UI. We believe in exploring, experimenting, and failing fast to discover innovative, disruptive & purposeful solutions to delight our customers.With the launch of a new platforms and numerous enhancements, we anticipate these opportunities to require a high level of stakeholder engagement and UI design capabilities. Ideal for someone who has the foundations of UI Design looking to take their skills to the next level!FinClear are looking for 2 x UI Designers to join us on our journey. One at a graduate level and the other with approximately 3 years of experience.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Deliver high fidelity user interface designs. Translating requirements into style guides, design systems, design patterns to screen design that will delight our users. Work closely with engineers to deliver the final product. Presenting ideas and design to stakeholders incorporating feedback into your designs. Collaboratively work with our broad client base to ensure platform solutions result in meaning problem solutions and operational efficiencies for our clients. FinClear’s Design Stack:MiroFigmaJiraConfluence QualificationsRequired:Willingness & Commitment to growth & delighting customers. Certification in Interaction Design or Human-Computer InteractionDesire to take their skills to the next level in UI with an opportunity to expand in UX. Strong interaction design skills and attention to detail. Ability to translate complex requirements into intuitive interfaces.  Portfolio of professional designsExcellent Knowledge of modern best practice UI standards. High skilled with interface design tools, preferably Figma. Bonus points for having experience:Familiar with accessible and inclusive design best-practicesJira/ ConfluenceIn the Financial Services domainWorking on complex digital platforms & products3 years of learnings, leveraging relevant UI skills in an agile environment. Additional InformationWhat are the ingredients to our secret sauce?That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!Benefits:A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leaveA flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for allPrioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologistsE-Vehicles – Salary SacrificeReady to apply?If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".Alternatively :To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend"For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careersAny additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note :Applications will be reviewed w/c 04/04/2023Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)

We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.Location: Perth/BrisbaneShort Description: In the role of UI/UX Designer, you will be expected to deliver UI/UX services in the mining domain. Roles and Responsibilities:For you to be successful in obtaining this role you will need to possess the following:Experience in executing the delivery of UX services in a complex stakeholder environmentWell versed with UX principles, best practices and frameworks (including human-centred design and design thinking)Hands-on experience and ability to work across the full design lifecycle, from research activities through to designExperience in user interviews, usability testing, wireframing, prototyping and workshopsProficiency in design applications such as Figma (Sketch, AdobeXD or similar)Ability to implement practical, actionable plans and autonomously drive themAbility to present and communicate UX research and design outputsSkills /Competencies:Essential: Tertiary Qualification in IT / Computer Science / related discipline.At least 12 years of relevant experience as a UI/UX designerExtensive experience in UI/UX design and developmentFigma (Sketch, AdobeXD or similar) (8+ years’ experience)AngularJS (10+ years’ experience)HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, SQL, XML (8+ years’ experience)jQuery, AJAX, JSON (8+ years’ experience)Tools like GitHub, JIRA and Confluence Preferred: Prior application development experience in mining operations.Ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment.Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.Knowledge of Agile software development and project managementAdditional Skills: Excellent customer interfacing skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation. At Infosys, we recognize that everyone has individual requirements. If you are a person with disability, illness or injury and require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Recruitment team for adjustment only on Infosys_ta@infosys.com or include your preferred method of communication in email and someone will be in touch. Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. In the absence of a signed agreement, any submission will be deemed as non-binding and Infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department. “All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence, and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.”

Dabble is an online sports and racing bookmaker (licensed by the NTRC), formed in 2020 and embracing the scaleup journey. Our aim is to disrupt the game with a truly immersive socialized betting experience designed to provide evolutionary entertainment to our punters via genuine interaction and engagement. Our brand ethos, “share the experience”, means we believe in community and celebration - both in the app and in the office!We have office hubs in Darwin, Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney, Adelaide and Albury - and expansion is in our sights. We believe in remote-first work, though in the spirit of our community encourage our people to take advantage of our national network, with cross-office sponsored flights on offer all year round. We are a team of highly driven enthusiasts, and we are looking for our next Dabbler to join us as we continue in our journey.Dabble CultureDress for your day so you can focus on what mattersSwitch up your office, work from home, work from wherever helps you to deliverGenuine, like-minded team of visionaries. We welcome ideas big and small!Scheduled focus time to encourage deep thoughtOur annual convention, DabbleCon, brings us all together to celebrate our successes and plan continued evolution over the coming yearEach day is led through upholding our core Values: Fun, Celebratory, Community, EvolutionaryDabble PerksA minimum of five weeks of paid annual leave for all DabblersPaid parental leave for both primary and secondary caregiverWe encourage you to visit our network of offices: sponsored flights available to staff and spouse/immediate familyFlexibility with working hours to accommodate our cross-country employee base: you are free to manage your own timeYour mental health is our genuine concern: we keep a dedicated psychologist on the booksUp to 10% annual cash bonus based on Company performance metricsDabble Day Dividend: all Dabblers split the day’s revenue evenly on our birthday each year. You share the workload, why shouldn’t you share the reward?Safety first: your ride home from company sponsored events and your flu jab is on usOverviewThe UI/UX Designer (Mid-Senior) is responsible for shaping and enhancing the user experience of Dabble’s app through outstanding design and user-centered solutions. This role will work closely with the Product and Development teams to create seamless, visually appealing and highly functional experiences across the app. If you are passionate about creating the best possible experience for users in an innovative, fast paced, mobile-first environment - this role is for you!Primary LocationThis role is currently open to all locations within Australia, however candidates based in Melbourne may be preferred.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement innovative UI/UX solutions for product direction, visuals, and experience within the appExecute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering teamsConceptualise original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design problemsCreate wireframes, storyboards,user flows, and process flows, to effectively communicate interaction and design ideasPresent and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholdersConduct user research and evaluate user feedback to continuously iterate and improve designsChampion design guidelines, best practices, and standards for the appMentor junior UI/UX designers and contribute to the growth of the design team within the Product departmentSkills & QualificationsProven UI/UX design experience with a strong portfolio demonstrating a history of innovative and user-centered design solutions, focused on mobile appsProficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma and PrincipalStrong knowledge of responsive design, mobile-first principles, and accessibility standardsExcellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interactionAbility to present and effectively communicate design ideas to team members and stakeholdersExperience in research practises and methodologies to gather user feedback and insightsExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processStrong problem-solving skills, self-motivated, and able to work in a fast-paced environmentExcellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skillsA degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Human Centered design, or a related field is preferredAre you a Dabbler?A Dabbler’s attitude is paramount, as the right person will be able to learn quickly and adapt to any skill gaps. A Dabbler is always a team player, with a willingness to share with and learn from others. Being a remote-first workplace, collaborative working styles are crucial to empower and grow each individual member (eg we prefer openness via public channels to problem solve or ideate on Slack).A Dabbler uses their freedom of autonomy to its absolute potential and enjoys contributing to the Dabble community. We hold respect for our peers very highly – there is no such thing as a bad idea. We encourage you to think differently, be brave and strive to always raise the bar. Dabble was born out of thought sharing and should tackle growth in the same way. Dabble embraces empowerment of all people at any level of seniority and experience to ‘own their work’ and ‘talk their book’ wherever they can.RemunerationThe advertised salary for this position is $115,000 - $135,000 + Super + Benefits with room to be flexible.How to ApplyIf Dabble sounds right for you, feel free to send an email tocareers@dabble.com.au with your CV, and tell us what stands out about this job opportunity.

Job DescriptionThis is your opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking, change-making individuals transforming healthcare experiences. Operating at the intersection of two fast-growing industries – health and tech – you’ll play an active role in shaping the future of healthcare in Australia.We're proud to share that Healthengine is certified as a Great Place to Work and ranked #19 in Australia’s Best Places to Work (medium category).Our MissionHealthengine is a purpose-led business, and Australia’s largest consumer healthcare platform, helping people navigate the complex world of healthcare. We’re on a mission to transform humanity’s health, one care experience at a time. Healthengine’s platform brings together a leading range of healthcare practices, healthcare specialties and health ecosystem partners in a suite of integrated offerings to help people get a better experience across each step of their healthcare journey.We’re all patients, right? So, it’s easy to get behind a mission that seeks to improve the healthcare experience for all Australians.The GigAs a UI Designer, you’ll shape the direction of our products, turning insights into innovative, transformative experiences. We understand that delivering positive user experiences is one of the key measures of digital maturity and is therefore at the heart of our business. We know that all good digital experiences are the result of delightful user centric designs and intuitive concepts which guide users to quickly and simply fulfil a specific need in a highly engaging way.(Some of) the responsibilities:Work closely with product managers, engineers, growth specialists, and business stakeholders to distil user insights, business requirements, and development needs. Plan and implement new web and app user interface designs. Optimise existing user interface designs. Move through sketching, wireframing, prototyping, and UI design with an emphasis on an iterative, collaborative design process. Take wireframes and concept designs through to finalised UI design to deliver delightful, functional product interfaces. Help to embed and drive the brand identity throughout our products. Ensure the maintenance and improvement of our design language. About YouYou flourish in a fast-moving, agile environment and thrive in a tech culture where growth is inevitable. You are smart, strong and passionate and always lead with head and heart. You are balanced; knowing how to have fun but how to focus and get things done. You speak openly, candidly and authentically to challenge yourself and others. You’re impact and results driven, with a ‘done is better than perfect’ attitude. You are a creative problem-solver, always seeking to find unique and valuable solutions.Experience you’ll bring:3+ years of design experience Demonstrable experience delivering positive results within a fast-moving environmentA folio of work demonstrating a track record of delivering high-quality user interface designs. Previous experience using Figma and Adobe Creative SuiteThe ability to deliver cross-platform design, including working knowledge of responsive design and grid principles, and experience designing for mobile with strong understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines & Google’s Material Design GuidelinesStrong typography, layout, and visual design skillsProficiency in design libraries, style guides, sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, lo-fi and hi-fi outputs, and visual prototypesAdditional InformationThe perks behind the workHealthengine is where you’ll be your best self. You’ll collaborate with smart, interesting people who will challenge you to be better. In addition to an array of growth opportunities, we also offer:Freedom and flexibility to work the way you want, with remote and hybrid opportunitiesGood mix of virtual and on-site events and celebrations, because we know how to have funFully stocked kitchen including coffee on tap and subsidised vending machine in our Perth spaceDiscounts, salary sacrifice and packaging options through our benefit partnersExtra leave so you can recharge and focus on your wellbeing Support for you when it comes time to grow your family with paid parental leaveDiversity and inclusionHealthengine believes in the power of a diverse work environment and are fully committed to building and maintaining an inclusive culture. We believe that our differences can create new ideas, offer unique perspectives and speak on behalf of all of our customers and consumers. If you think you have what it takes but don't check all the boxes, reach out anyway - we’d love to hear from you.We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Tryzens is an international digital commerce agency and our mission is to accelerate client success and growth across all channels, leveraging our expertise, insights, and digital-first principles, to deliver compelling experiences that delight and engage their customers.We are People First and believe that empowered happy people achieve more. We're Customer-Centric and our customers’ growth is our success. We believe that Collaboration and Innovation drive the greatest results and Integrity, Trust & Transparency build lasting relationships. We started in London, but have expanded to have operations in Melbourne, Sydney, Sofia, and Trivandrum with 200+ team members serving 45+ international brands.We are on the lookout for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team and work across the spectrum of UX / UI on e-commerce-focused websites and applications. This role can be based in either of our locations in either Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane. Tryzens is a hybrid workplace, so we're happy for you to work from our offices or from home.As a Senior UX/UI Designer at Tryzens, you will contribute to the initial discovery and planning phase of projects, collaborating with project managers, business analysts, developers and clients to engage in a range of activities – from user research to producing deliverables such as personas, user journeys, and wireframes right through to final hi-fi designs that are ready for development.It’s a collaborative role where you will have the chance to work closely with developers, business analysts, and of course, the client to craft engaging and high-converting experiences.The type of experience you’ll need should be in these areas:UX audits – reviewing existing sites and content and making justified recommendations on how to make them better, based on usability and eCommerce best practices, and online retail experience.Ability to define customer and business needs: Communicating with clients to gather requirements and advising on UX solutions.Knowledge of different UX research methodologies including qualitative and quantitative research.Working with project managers to help define the plan for the design project to align with scope - being confident about the time required for work and sticking to it.Wireframing, sketching, and prototyping user experiences in tools like Sketch, Figma, and Invision.Be able to produce UX deliverables such as UX audit reports, personas, synthesized insights, competitor analysis, and user journeys/flows.Be able to produce UI deliverables such as Design systems, style guides, and component libraries.Following best practices, usability, and accessibility for online shopping experiences. Keeping up to date with the latest UX trends and best practices.A great understanding of branding. Able to follow brand guidelines and apply them to an online shopping website, but also help clients to better communicate their brand online through the effective use of graphic design and branding principles.Working with task management and timesheet tools like JIRA and Trello.Handoff of annotated designs to developers using predominantly Figma but with some instances of using Zeplin.Quality assurance – reviewing the implementation of design and providing feedback to developers to ensure high-quality delivery to clients.Ideally, you will also have experience in these areas:Talking to and helping manage the relationship with the client.Be comfortable contributing to pitch work and presenting your ideas.Workshopping ideas and co-creating solutions and new ideas with the client.Be able to create customer journeys illustrating the requirements a customer has when facing a specific task, such as finding a product.Have experience working with eCommerce clients – preferred but not mandatory.Understanding benchmarks and best practices.Strong understanding of front-end code (HTML & CSS) to design viable responsive UI designs which utilise the inherent functionality and technology of the eCommerce platform.Be able to prioritise and manage your own time and highlight as soon as possible any ideas that you feel might improve the solution for the client.CRO experience is preferred but not mandatory.RequirementsBeautiful portfolio of digital design preferably in luxury & premium eCommerce brands.Passionate about design and customer experience and always keeping up to date with the latest design and UX trends.Excellent creative problem solver, always trying to come up with the best solution to a problem.A high level of attention to detail and accuracy. You take pride in the quality of your work from the research through to the implementation.Self-motivated and proactive. Keen to learn and continually improve workflow and team productivity, sharing your ideas with the team.Great communication skills for explaining ideas and discussing solutions with developers, clients, and other team members.BenefitsFlexible working hours.Flexibility to work hybrid - either from home or in our offices.Opportunities for training and development.Team social events.2 charity/volunteer days per year.25 annual leave days per employment year.Day off for your birthday.Enhanced parental leave policy.Client discounts.EOFY and Christmas parties each year.More info about Tryzens here: http://tryzens.com/We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity and encourage everyone to respond. Location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Description:
WHYTo create elegant, seamless and user-friendly experience and designs for our customers so that they continue to use our products with ease and achieve their business goalsJob DescriptionYou are responsible for the design and implementation of all the experiences a user has when interacting with Soprano products. You will work closely with our product team and/or development team to ensure seamless UI design and the successful implementation of UI/UX best practices and principles across all our Soprano products.You will liaise within the product team to ensure that the requirements are being met, achieving a deep understanding of customer needs, and engaging with the software development team to understand what is possible with the technology. Key element of the delivery includes wireframes, screen renders, screen text, navigation designs, artwork, and CSS to name a few.As a position of responsibility, it is expected that the duties of this role are conducted with limited direct and day to day supervision and are executed meeting Soprano quality, functional and schedule expectations.Key ResponsibilitiesPartner and collaborate with the product and engineering teams to build experiences and features which lead to customer success and delight.  Investigate and develop a deep understanding of customer needs to craft product changes that really have an impact to improve customer experience through UI. Move quickly, iterate rapidly, and expertly strike that important balance between art and data-driven decision-making. Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes. Prototyping, iterating designs based on feedback from customers and business stakeholdersUse paper, InVision and Sketch to create concepts and prototype product ideas to be able to test with customers and gain feedback from business stakeholders. Iterate designs based on feedback to ensure product changes have real impactCarrying out user testing, synthesising results to form design guidelinesDeeper understanding of designing UX considering Accessibility requirements adhering to WCAG 2.0 and other similar global standards. Prepare and perform WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 testing when requiredProvide advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyze and predict user behavior. Participate in and validate usability testing. Conduct usability labs if required. Visual thinking and problem-solving. Qualitative and quantitative research methods and know how to apply them in a Design Thinking-like process Understand how to navigate cognitive biases to drive the best outcomes for the businessSKILLS AND EXPERIENCEA bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2+ years UI/UX design experience for digital products or servicesYou're a strong all-rounder. From discovery and envisioning right through to working with engineering to get the product built. Design thinking is built into your DNA, but you also know how to execute and get things done. You'll be thinking about some of our trickiest and most interesting challenges, and constantly driving to improve the way we do things and improve our processes. You like to deliver real results and work fast. You know how to iterate quickly on concepts, and think in terms of “hours and days,” not “weeks and monthsYou should be comfortable with an evidence-based approach to product design. Experience designing and testing WCAG 2.0 and Section 508 compliant softwareA strong working knowledge of HTML, CSS and experience in using design software such as Sketch, InVision, Visio, iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative SuiteProficiency in relevant testing software (AMP, ANDI, aXe, WAVE, NVDA, JAWS)Excellent written and oral communication skills.

At Honeywell Sine, we're committed to being a part of a mission that matters. Striving to develop innovative, industry-leading solutions to everyday workplace challenges. We want to make our customers’ operations safer, simpler and more secure.That’s what gets us moving every day — we thrive on helping the largest corporations through to a local school find easier ways to streamline their workplace through visitor, contractor, staff and asset management.Sine has been rolled out to thousands of companies around the world and is used at locations such as schools, sports stadiums, offices, industrial, medical, retail and commercial facilities.Sine is a part of Honeywell Connected Enterprise. From our head office in Adelaide, South Australia we’re growing globally!As a UX Product Designer at Sine, you'll be responsible for designing exceptional digital experiences that meet the needs of our customers. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will contribute to the development of user-centered solutions that solve real problems and provide value to our users. With a focus on creating intuitive and accessible design, you will help to maintain and evolve our design system to ensure consistency across all of our products. Your ability to think critically and creatively will be a valuable asset as you work to design effective and engaging experiences for our users.This position is suitable for Junior to Mid-weight candidatesWhat you'll doLead the design process for key features and experiences from ideation to launch Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create development-ready UI and visual designs that differentiate our brand in the market Create user journey diagrams, low fidelity mockups, wireframes, and prototypes to communicate design concepts and solutions Participate in the development and maintenance of design systems and component libraries to ensure consistency across all products Develop a deep understanding of users' needs through user research and testing Collaborate with product leaders to align design solutions with business and customer goals Advocate for user-centred design practices and executing UXD best practices throughout the product development process Design and validate user interfaces for scalable programs and applications across desktop and mobile platforms Document functional user requirements to communicate design decisions and rationale Work collaboratively with other members of the design team to promote a culture of design excellence. What you'll have2-5 years of UX or related design experienceA Bachelors degree in Design, Interaction Design, Graphic design, a related discipline or equivalent professional experienceStrong knowledge of user-centred design principles and practices, including design thinking and agile methodologies. Proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and their impact on the design process. Experience conducting user research, testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and validate solutions. Familiarity with accessibility and inclusive design best practices. Solid understanding of design systems, component libraries, and design patterns and their role in creating consistent and scalable products. Proficiency in creating user journey maps, low fidelity mockups, wireframes, and prototypes to communicate design concepts and solutions. Experience with multi-platform development, including Native Mobile, Responsive Web and Desktop ApplicationsAbility to balance user needs with business requirements and constraints to deliver effective and valuable design solutions. Previous work within a SaaS and/or B2B organisationApplication requirementsA portfolio that demonstrates your experience in end-to-end product design must be submitted with your application to be consideredWhy work for us?We’re a diverse, global team committed to a product and mission we believe in. We have teams and offices in Australia, the US, UK, India and the Philippines!We’re now a Honeywell company (Fortune 100), growing quickly and expanding into countries all over the world. You’ll have the opportunity to play a key part in our global growth!We believe that everyone should love coming to work. There’s plenty of work to do, but we love to have fun along the way. Join us for Wednesday yoga, weekly team drinks on the deck, or a game of pool, foosball and ping-pong!We encourage innovation and creativity. We understand there’s more than one way to do things and encourage you to come up with new ideas and approaches.Like to work in a central & accessible location close to great food, coffee, parks and bars? Our new head office is located in the heart of Adelaide - the most liveable city in Australia! Enjoy our outdoor deck, unlimited coffee and snacks, and take advantage of reserved parking right next door!Value work-life balance? So do we! Our office hours are Monday to Friday, 9-5 and we offer both flexibility and hybrid working optionsIf you’re looking for a great working culture at a company building a cool product in the cloud - please apply!

**Please only apply if you currently have Eligibility to work in Australia**Here at DotDev, we think creatively about technology and eCommerce; delivering innovative digital solutions of all shapes and sizes. We love envisioning how people will experience eCommerce, allowing for more personalised; socially connected and smooth experiences.After launching in 2016, we’ve built hundreds of eCommerce sites for some of the best in the business - partnering with Australian and global retailers such as Decjuba, Aje, Incu, Tony Bianco, Scanlan Theodore, Viktoria & Woods and more. We’re passionate about creating amazing, pixel-perfect and meaningful digital experiences. Sounds exciting? That’s because it is! And it’s where you come in…Who is a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev?As a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev, you are excited by establishing brands as industry leaders in eCommerce through well-produced and intelligently designed stores.Working closely with the Design Lead and UI Designer or sometimes solo: you’ll help transform user insights into smart, innovative and creative concepts. You will thoughtfully design experiences that are clear, accessible and delightful; using data to make meaningful design choices.With your UX Design thinking, clients & the team at Dotdev will rely on your ability to think outside of the box. You are someone who can draw various sources of data to paint an empathetic picture of the customer and their user journey navigating through a website.As a senior, you’ll also naturally mentor other designers and share knowledge on design methods, tools and trends with the rest of your team. You’ll help our team navigate ambiguity; negotiate decisions and support our designers when they feel out of their depth in the space.You also enjoy taking an active role in contributing to our design culture and practices - with a 'here to help' attitude. You absolutely, fundamentally believe that we're better together.So, that all sounds nice, but what will you be doing day-to-day?RequirementsAs a Senior UI/UX’er you will be responsible for:Orchestrating what best practice design looks like within the teamCreating beautiful and functional websitesPartnering with our UX Lead and Tech Leads to come up with the best solutions to user problems and client needsUnderstanding user data to empathise with the end userJumping in UX/customer research to better understand how a customer navigates a websiteDeveloping high-quality and organised design systems and creative concepts (prototypes)Turning client brand guidelines and objectives into tangible on-brand designs, even when they don’t necessarily fit with your own personal aestheticLeading creative & UX workshops as well as reviewsAs the subject matter specialist, help educate clients on best practice UI & UX practicesHelping others’ in the team where necessary and also asking for help when you don’t know something yourselfWhat skills do you need?Eligibility to work in AustraliaMust be at a senior designer levelA user-centred, solution and result mindsetBe flexible in the face of changing requirements throughout the design processExpert knowledge of FigmaBenefitsWhy work with us?A career at DotDev stretches you in all the right places. That’s because we’re always looking forward – future-proofing ecommerce requires futuristic skills! You’ll flex and grow, here – we don’t believe in boxes. We’ll help you design the kind of role, career, and work-life where you can be your best.Also, when we say flex, we mean it. Work-from-home is here to stay. Which means if the world outside calls your name, you can plug in from anywhere – Melbourne, Rome, or Tokyo.We’re remote-first (and loving it!). But we also have co-working offices in Melbourne & Brisbane, so when you do want that face-to-face time we have a space ready to go.Do work you're proud of. Apply today.

What You Will DoAs our UI Designer, you will play a key role in creating a user-friendly interface for a complex engineering product. You will work closely with the UX designer to formalise conclusions drawn by research, and high level requirements. You will also exercise collaboration in a cross-functional team environment, with our product, engineering and marketing teams. The role requires consistency in design, attention to detail and exceptional creativity.As part of this, you will be required to:Create, build out and maintain design guidelines / pattern libraryExecute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineeringEmbed yourself into the development teams as the source of truth on the customer Advocate user-centred design principlesEnsure consistency and best practice across the product Turn UX research insights into productised components and reduce development effort through reusable components Who You AreYou're degree qualified in Design Computing, Industrial design or similar. You have a minimum of 3 years experience under your belt and can demonstrate your key achievements with a strong portfolio.You're a self-learner, with an innate intellectual curiosity as well as exceptional attention to detail. You're also an effective communicator and problem solver who is able to work cross-functionally within a complex domain.You have or will demonstrate the ability to be:Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolioSolid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site mapsProficient in Axure, Figma and Adobe Creative Suite or similarProficient in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript for rapid prototypingUp-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologiesA strong technical ability, practical approach and creative problem-solving aptitudeThe ability to work under pressure and be receptive to constructive criticism Exposure to Geospatial, Visual Mapping or Engineering is a plus, though not requiredExperience working in an Agile/Scrum development processWho We AreNeara is a high-growth, venture-backed Series B stage climate-tech company headquartered in Sydney, Australia. We work with 75% of the utilities in Australia and New Zealand and are growing rapidly across the US and Europe.Our mission is to help utilities future-proof their infrastructure and prepare for anything — from systematic risks to severe weather and a clean energy future, so that they can protect their assets, teams, and communities. Utilities count on our 3D digital network model to simulate hundreds of variables to help them understand how their network will respond to any scenario and prepare accordingly.We're proud to be helping utilities accelerate their clean energy transition by removing some of the biggest blockers to their decarbonization goals. With Neara, utilities can 2x their network capacity to make room for more clean energy, accelerate new transmission design by 85%, and reduce their carbon footprint by replacing field visits with stunningly accurate digital network surveys.What We Are Offering YouCompetitive salary, plus equity optionsFlexible hours and working arrangementsSignificant opportunity for career development and accelerationA dynamic environment, exceptional leadership team and high-performance culture A centrally located office, minutes from a train stationTo apply, please use the online application link below. For additional information or to arrange a confidential discussion, please email talent@neara.com.Neara values diversity, belonging and equal employment opportunities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. Please note, you will require current and unrestricted working rights. All applicants will receive an update on their application within 7-10 working days.No agencies or third party service providers please.

Our client’s success is our success. And you make it happen.We are an established market leading brand who are focused on driving client growth. We’re at the forefront of innovation punching above our weight. We’re enabling the future for our clients through tech as open banking.We are an unlisted public company and one of five licensed banks in Australia with full direct connectivity and production capability across all domestic payment systems. Whilst the major banks leverage this capability for their consumer and business clients, our B2B model focuses on enabling other banks, fintech’s and corporates to deliver innovative and competitive payment and digital solutions to their clients and customers.We are looking for a QA Engineer to join our Open Banking domain.Reporting to the QA Manager, the main purpose of this role is to ensure: Speed in quality assurance outcomes using principles as intelligent stubs and easy automation. Performance and resilience of the system are thoroughly evaluated.You must have testing experience with API’s to be considered for this roleAs Cuscal’s QA Engineer – Open Banking your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following: Participate in grooming sessions and defining/refining the acceptance criteria. Provide detailed estimates for building mocks, automating the tests, updating the regression automation suite, designing, and maintaining the performance scripts based on acceptance criteria of the requirement and impact assessment of the functions. Define the scenarios that can be run with mocks and the test that must be run end to end. Prepare mocks to align to the requirements to support early verification. Integrate the automation code to develop automation scripts that can be used for end-to-end verification. Define environment requirements for execution of performance and infrastructure resilience tests. Prepare and maintain scripts for verification of the performance against the NFR’s. Prepare tests and execute them to validate the infrastructure resilience.About YouThis is highly observable role within Cuscal, and it requires the ideal candidate to have thorough knowledge in API test automation and performance testing (minimum of at least 4 years as a guide) to be considered for this role. Your technical competencies in API testing and IAM testing will see you go far in this role.As a QA Engineer, you will bring with you your ability to create mocks for API using Lisa, mocklabs. Furthermore, you will have an ability to write cURLS based on swagger. You will be able to design, configure and execute performance scripts using tools as Jmeter and Loadrunner. Knowledge of codeless testing automation tools would be beneficial, and your understanding of CI/CD integration will be vital.As the ideal candidate, you will have strong analytical skills with the ability to grasp systems, processes, and operations effectively. Furthermore, your high level of accuracy and attention to detail will be essential to this role. With the ability to communicate effectively within a multi-layered stakeholder environment, you will be confident in building and maintaining positive relationships with key stakeholders internally and externally. Your ability to coach, mentor and guide other members of the team will see you reinforce your seniority in the team.Your knowledge of defect tracking process, JIRA and Confluence will be highly desirable. Likewise, a degree in Information Technology will be looked upon favourably.Why Cuscal?We are in the rapidly evolving world of payments, and we are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. We support our colleagues with flexible work arrangements through our hybrid model whilst also offering a wide range of educational, financial, lifestyle, health & wellbeing benefits.Next StepIf you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of payments sector. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.Cuscal does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any Cuscal employee, location or address.

Company DescriptionMake a difference in the world, be part of a software start-up that positively impacts our communities. Acusenus was founded in 2018. Our team is committed to using AI, software and in-house R&D to build and offer solutions that create behavioural change on the roads, reduce the instances of dangerous driving, and the deaths and serious injuries that result from it.Work in a company surrounded by first class engineers who want to make the world a better place. In 5 short years we’ve grown to a team of over 100, and now we are looking to onboard our first IT manager as part of the R&D Leadership team. Consider this role your blank canvas to establish the practice and principles that suit your expertise.You can learn more about Acusensus here.Job DescriptionWhat we offerThe opportunity to wake up each day and know that the work you are doing is impacting the lives of real people and increasing safety on the roads. Financial stability; we have long term contracts in place with government bodies. Competitive salary based on market data - We also want you to be part of the financial growth of the company so we grant annual shares and bonuses. Hybrid working model that supports work life balance. What We ValueIntegrity We pride ourselves on conducting our business ethically and responsibly. We keep our word; we deliver on our promises and we strive to earn the trust of our clients to support them in delivering on their unique public policy and business objectives.Collaboration We believe that solutions to any big challenge are best discovered through collaboration. We know we are more effective and innovative when we encourage and value different ideas, skills and perspectives allowing us to deliver customer-centric, tailored solutionsCare Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of our employees, our customers and the community drives us to deliver innovative and superior solutions.Impact We are driven by our mission to develop and deliver solutions that make a positive and sustainable impact, creating safer communities across the globe.What You’ll DoAcusensus have achieved significant growth and currently house a team of high quality engineers. We are looking to make our first QA hire as these responsibilities are currently shared amongst the developers. We are excited about bringing in a dedicated resource who can embed themselves and improve the production cycle.Our QA Engineer is primarily responsible for ensuring overall quality of our software products. This role plays a crucial part in the business by establishing appropriate quality control processes, procedures and strategies.This role will be a key contributor to Acusensus strategy to exceed customer expectations and be a pioneer in markets it chooses to pursue.We have identified several career path options for this role; either people management or individual contributor roles. We are also looking for a junior QA for you to manage, therefore people leadership opportunities are part of this role.Your day to day:Collaborate with Software Engineers to deliver quality products aligned to our strategic road map. Provide technical guidance and expertise on testing automation to other Engineers. Design and manage automation test frameworks and architecture, develop repeatable testing and application performance automation. Design testing scenarios and test cases that will demonstrate conformance and traceability to functional and non-functional requirements. Define and execute end-to-end testing of our detection and processing solutions, for each customer release, across all test cycles, including Integration, Verification, Regression and Validation. Develop test plans, test cases, test status to produce test summary reports and metrics. Collaborate effectively with the development team to identify, reproduce and isolate root cause for bugs. Coordinate acceptance testing activities with customers in their test environments. Develop technical documentation pertaining to software testing and quality assurance. Drive continuous improvement of software testing tools and quality assurance methodologies.  QualificationsA genuine connection to our mission. Please do not apply if you are an unsafe driver, possess a poor driving history or not aligned to road safety. 5+ years' experience in software testing, prior experience in a software developer role would be advantageous. Advanced knowledge of quality improvement, quality process, quality assurance methodologies and best practices. Ability to adapt frameworks and implementations based on feasibility and project requirements. Commercial experience in CI/CD tools to configure and execute test automation scripts. Previous experience in developing automation test suites for Linux. Previous experience in testing software that interfaces with Hardware sensors such as Cameras, Radar or other sensors would be advantageous. Previous experience working with one or more of following technologies is regarded highly: AWS, neural networks, machine vision, Docker, Terraform, Linux Operating Systems, Sensors, Image Processing and/or Machine Learning. Self-starter with ability to operate independently in a supportive environment. Prior experience in a startup environment; thriving as an all-rounder. Demonstrated expertise with agile engineering approaches. Ability to build positive working relationships with internal teams and customers. Additional InformationInterested?If working on complex challenges, in an established but growing business where technology underpins everything we do, sounds interesting to you then we’d love to talk to you! Apply today and let's start that conversation.Australia-based candidates are welcome for this full-time position, which will begin right away. To request further information, please email tom@wearecrew.io.Research shows that while men apply for jobs when they meet ~ 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but you don't meet every single point in this ad, please still get in touch we’d love to talk to you.

Company DescriptionIt all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 47 million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible. This is our mission, and it’s why working at Cash App means so much more than a job.Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.Check out our locations, benefits, and more at cash.app/careers!Job DescriptionAs a Mobile QA Engineer on Cash, you'll be responsible for the planning, design, development, and execution of manual and automated test suites for Cash. You'll work collaboratively with members of the release management organization, and product & engineering teams to create smoke, regression & feature test suites, and plan for automated solutions to execute and validate against every build.You will:Review PRDs, functional and design specifications and prepare test plansWork closely with cross-functional peers to develop manual and automated test suites for existing & new featuresStrategically introduce and optimize testing processes by defining testing standards and leading scalable solutions to testing bottlenecksIntegrate with CI systems, parallelize automated test execution, including execution in device cloudWork with QA & Release Managers to certify a release and investigate issues from Early Access ProgramBe a strong quality advocate on behalf of Cash App members, working closely with software engineers, DevOps, designers, and product managers to release high quality productsQualificationsYou have:Manual and automation testing experience across modern technology stacksA deep understanding of test plan creation, test suite development/execution and defect debugging/tracking/managementA commitment to creating clear and concise test suites from specifications or test caseProficiency with manual testing at different layer of the application (web, app, API, backend) across both desktop and mobile surfacesExperience developing and maintaining automated tests using UI and/or API based test frameworks, development environments, and CI/CD toolsA proven record of prioritizing and coordinating work across a large number of product teams (including Engineering, QA, Product Management and Design teams)Experience in code/scripting language such as Python or Ruby or JavaExperience working with CI systems in an Agile / Scrum development environmentTechnologies we use:Jira and TestRail for test/defect managementJava, Selenium WebDriver, Appium, JUnit, TestNG, and Gradle for UI test automationJenkins/CircleCI, GCP, Docker for infrastructure and CI/CD integrationSauceLab and AppliTool for cross platform and visual validationPAW/Postman, Cucumber, Gherkins, Hemcrest for API-based testingCharles Proxy, Android Studio, XCode, iOS/Android simulator/emulator for native testing and debuggingAdditional InformationWe’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace.Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.Learn more about our efforts to promote inclusion and diversity at block.xyz/inclusionBlock, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

About Woolworths GroupWoolworths Group is a food and everyday needs retailer united by the shared purpose of creating better experiences together for a better tomorrow. With more than 1,400 stores across its Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, and fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer. A top 10 company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX), Woolworths Group employs more than 180,000 team members and serves more than 20 million customers a week.The OpportunityJoin the founding team of a new, profit-for purpose startup solving food wasteCurrently in closed beta, launching in late 2023Backed by major investors, including W23, Woolworths Group’s venture capital fund About Us⅓ of all food produced in Australia is wasted, costing the economy billions, wasting land and water resources, and contributing excess greenhouse gas emissions. In addition, on any given day, hundreds of thousands of Australian households are facing food insecurity and are struggling to put food on the table. This problem is complex and driven by a variety of factors, such as on-farm damage, supply and demand mismatch, and unmet cosmetic standards. We’re Creating a Digital Platform That Will Unite The Ecosystem And Reduce Food Waste ByWe are a new, profit-for-purpose startup on a mission to solve the food waste problem.Providing food producers and buyers a simple and trustworthy way to buy, sell, move and donate excess produceAutomating logistics of produce from sellers to buyers, regardless of location within the countryIdentifying additional innovation opportunities through data & insightsWe are currently operating in private beta and will launch publicly in late 2023. We’re backed by a number of major investors, including W23, Woolworths Group’s venture capital fund.We’re currently looking to hire exceptional individuals to expand the founding team and join us on our journey to challenge the status quo in food waste and create a more sustainable future.This is a rare opportunity to work for an early stage, profit-for-purpose startup, backed by major investors.Make a positive impact on the world – Be a part of a purpose led organisation focused on creating positive change to the food industry, those facing food insecurity, as well as our planet!Fast-paced and challenging startup environment – Work on tricky problems and get in the trenches to make it all happenYour role is mission critical – As an early stage hire in a new team, the impact you create will directly translate to the success of the startupBe rewarded fairly – Enjoy a competitive salary and a range of benefits designed to allow you to be your best About The RoleThe QA Engineer role will be responsible for owning and running automated, manual, and exploratory testing of the platform. This is a hands-on role where you will also work closely with product and engineering stakeholders to define and improve development and implementation processes.In this role you will… Review Requirements, Develop Strategy & Execute TestsDesign and own a suitable QA strategy, updating it as the product and company growsCollaborate with Product & Engineering stakeholders to review system requirements and technical designs and agree on test strategyEnsure quality deliverables by designing and executing appropriate test cases Own and run automated test environmentsReport on status of tests and escalate issues as requiredIdentify risks and troubleshoot technical issuesIdentify testing related risks and recommend actions to minimise riskInvestigate and troubleshoot software defects and other technical issues Bug reporting and tracking About YouYou should have…3+ years in reviewing product requirements and design, creating test plans, and testing applicationsStrong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processesBe comfortable working in a startup environment owning QAExperience with testing frameworks and tools such as Selenium, Browserstack or SaucelabsExperience with native mobile app testingExperience with source control, defect tracking tools, and test management tools like bitbucket, JIRA, XYRAY etc.An eye for detail and ability to articulate problems wellExperience in Agile software development lifecycle environmentsGrow with the GroupAs an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.We’d love to hear from YouIf you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. The Role, At a GlanceThe Software QA Engineer is a test professional who has a strong grounding in manual software and firmware testing. The Software QA Engineer focuses on the testability, robustness, performance and stability of firmware/software products.  A strong candidate will also possess the skills necessary to develop, execute and maintain automated test suites and infrastructure.The Software QA Engineer will join a stellar team of software, firmware and QA professionals, as well as collaborate with Application and Support Engineers and Product Managers/Owners to better understand where the greatest value can be realised through a holistic QA strategy.How You’ll ContributeUnderstanding the flow of code and how it interacts with different components.   Working with development teams, coordinating on product design, and offering inputs on the testability of functional elements and product designs.  Defining and executing manual tests and test plans. Creating and maintaining test cases, executing test plans, reviewing and diagnosing reported bugs, and ensuring overall system quality prior to customer release. Reproducing, debugging, and isolating problems, and verifying fixes.   Executing test automation. Designing, developing, maintaining, and troubleshooting automated suites of tests through continuous integration for value added feedback. Creating and maintaining documentation for SQA automation tools and frameworks to make them digestible for technical and non-technical individuals.   Researching test tools, methodologies, and trends and upgrading existing practices and processes.   Developing and implementing automation frameworks, tools, and other scripts or code to assist development efforts.   Performing component, contract, integration, performance, stress, and other test at the lower level (White Box) testing.  Qualifications:   The successful candidate will possess the following combination of experience, knowledge and skills:  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering. Dual Engineering/Information Technology degree preferred. Commercial experience in test automation advantageous. Work Environment:  Ability to frequently lift 5 kg, and periodically up to 25 kg.   Sit or stand for long periods.  Benefits and perks:  Competitive salary commensurate with experience Paid time off and paid holidaysTuition reimbursement   Discretionary profit-sharing   Referral bonuses   Charitable donation matchingWho is Biamp?We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.As We Grow To Meet Our Customers’ Needs And Evolve To Address The Challenges Of Tomorrow, One Guiding Principle Remains The SameBiamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences. About Our CompanyAt Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decision even when they don’t succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.Biamp is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Be part of a growing health tech company that does meaningful work.T-shirt is a house of health technology brands with a central focus on forging pathways for people with disability and long-term health needs. We craft innovative, digital solutions intended to make a genuine difference to people seeking convenience, accessibility and inclusion.Part of T-shirt's business is Provider Choice, a high touch Plan Management business that allows us to focus on what is most important; the human connection and supporting our participants in achieving their goals. In this role you will:Be a key voice in helping us deliver high-quality software solutions at T-shirtMake a significant contribution to our Salesforce implementation within the businessCollaborate with the wider Tech and Product team as well as other key business stakeholders to identify and implement quality improvements needed across our digital product offeringsEstablish quality assurance criteria and measure quality improvementsReport risks and issues that might impact qualityDevelop test objectives, test approaches, and test plans. Measure and report on test progress and test resultsUnderstand when test automation is appropriate and when it is collaborate effectively with engineering team membersCreate and execute test cases to ensure optimal performance of our digital productsReview operational requirements and design specificationsLead and conduct UAT sessions with the businessPrepare, update and maintain user guides and training materials.  About You4+ years of experience as a QA TesterMust have experience working in a Salesforce environmentYou champion quality software delivery and you have a continuous improvement mindsetYou're a team player – you take pride in working with others to build 'high quality, high performance' products at scaleYou get a kick out of developing tools and practices that enable quality and make the engineering process betterExcellent communication skills – you have the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with all stakeholders Ability to work in a fast paced environment while maintaining quality standards. You are passionate about customer experience when it comes to digital productsOur ValuesWhy join us?Our mission is big and meaningful. It's about using smarts and heart to transform the lives of some of the most vulnerable Australians. We're a certified Great Place to Work - 2 years running!You'll be joining a startup that is shifting into scale up mode so it's a time of rapid and exciting growth! We have experienced 1,765% growth as a business since our first capital raise and our team grew 294% in 2021 and 118% in 2022!The NDIS is a part of the core government funding budget and is awarded over $30 billion annually. And that doesn't even measure the impact that we're having. We've helped over 15,000+ families navigate the NDIS and in some cases, it's life-changing. You'll be joining an amazing values and purpose driven team who are highly engaged (we have a eNPS of 57%) and love what they do!Balanced and inclusive teamAt T-shirt, we're from all over the world (17+ countries and counting), women make up more than 60% of our workforce and 68% of our leadership team. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns.More About T-shirtIn our world, everyone has the right to dream, hope and live the life they want.T-shirt is an innovative health tech company that helps people living with disability and long-term health needs to overcome their challenges, achieve their goals, and improve the quality of their everyday lives.Learn more about our story and we're excited to meet you!
