Description:
Full Time - Working from home or Hybrid role - your choice!Gain experience working for an industry leading global company!MUST be located in Australia or New Zealand to support business in this time zone.THE ROLEThis position will play a significant part in generating workforce reports and identifying people data trends for our managers and key stakeholders. Company DescriptionWe are a customer-obsessed, “one stop shop” for all things data-related. We are deliberately narrow in our focus areas but we go deep in each of them. We provide solutions, services and training in the data strategy, data governance, data security, data management, data classification, data wrangling, data lake, data analytics, data visualisation, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT areas. Our solutions and services help transform customer organisations by teaching them how to turn their data into insightWe build on AWS, using the latest AWS services, best practices and reference architectures. We deliberately focus on large public sector customers that are data-heavy but insight-light – federal & state government departments, universities, public sector agencies, public health organisations, and public utilities.We are an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner and an AWS Public Sector Partner, working towards our Data & Analytics and Government competencies. We are also a registered technology supplier to the Federal, New South Wales, Victorian and Western Australian governments and we have a Master Services Agreement in place with AWS Professional Services.Job DescriptionYour impact As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in working with customers to understand their business requirements, map these to their data capabilities, liaise with our internal Data Engineers to design and build elegant solutions, then partner with our customers to deploy those solutions in a way that allows them to turn data into insight. You will have 2-3 years’ experience working as a Data Analyst (or similar role) on data-related solutions, preferably using AWS, and will be comfortable working with business analysts, data visualisers, data engineers and data scientists, to enable customers to solve their data-related challenges.You will relish the opportunity to innovate, evolve and challenge existing assumptions and to develop the data-related requirements that feed into the design of solutions that solve real-world problems for customers. Your experience with large-scale data challenges and ability to analyse them as input into reliable, scalable cloud-based solutions, will see you thriving in this role!ExpectationsEnjoy honing your data-related analysis skills and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to solution discussions. Regularly take part in further education and training to help you hone and extend your data analysis skills. Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business, product, and technical challenges. Possess an innate awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT. Strong Analytics skills to collect, analyze and generate insight using data. Have a basic understanding of IT security and governance including security standards, access policies, and data classification schema. Love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun. Be dynamic, creative, and willing to take on challenges that have the potential to make a big impact. Relish a ground floor opportunity to work in a small, agile, friendly startup environment. A Graduate degree (or Masters) in a data or technology-related discipline is preferred.  An AWS Associate Solutions Architect certification is a bonus. QualificationsTechnical Requirements:2+ years of: Hands on, practical experience, in and around data-related solutions AWS experience (Desired) A basic understanding of software development tools and methodologies Data analysis experience Experience producing quality documentation and written communications Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jenkins or Ansible Some experience with both writing and interpreting SQL queries.  Experience building reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight.  A basic understanding of Infrastructure as Code, especially AWS Cloudformation.  Some programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, Node.js, .Net, PHP.  A basic understanding of data ingestion and transformation pipelines.  A basic understanding of fundamental data concepts including databases, data schema, data classification, data security, data governance, data analysis, data transformation, data engineering and data science.  A basic understanding of fundamental networking concepts. Additional InformationWe’re passionate about the technical community we are a part of, and believe in contributing to open source and AWS initiativesWe care about climate change and are always looking at ways to reduce our carbon footprintWe support and contribute to a different cause each quarterWe’re committed to developing your career with customised individual growth and development plansWe’re committed to ensuring all our staff feel welcome, included and respected every day they work for The Data Foundry

We offer gaming, streaming, crypto casino and sportsbook platforms which use cutting edge technologies aimed at ensuring provably fair outcomes for users. Our products are used by millions of people around the world including Drake and Sergio Agüero! Our core focus is in the online gaming space, building well-designed casino games, crypto platforms, and a huge sports book offering.The last 2 years have been huge for us, we have grown from 20 to 150+ team members. Whilst the products that we build are global, the majority of the team sits in Melbourne at our Australian headquarters in the heart of the CBD where we have 3 amazing offices in the same building with all the bells and whistles you could ever want. Including an in-house barista, pool and table tennis tables, PS5 and Nintendo Switches, a meditation room, help yourself drinks fridge and snack wall, catered breakfast daily, weekly massages and pub lunches.About you: Attention all data wizards and number nerds! Intelligence and other Data Analysts, you’ll be responsible for preparing reports and dashboards which would aid the overall risk management of the business and at the same time provide research, analysis and insights to support strategic initiatives.Working as part of a wider team, you’ll also work closely with other departments within the business should they require analysis on certain aspects of the product which could cover anything from recognising pain points, tracking certain metrics, identifying data trends and more.Role And ResponsibilitiesGathering, extracting and manipulating raw data from multiple databases to transform it into reporting solutions and insights, enabling informed decision making to drive improved performance across a broad range of business unitsDesigning, developing, reviewing and updating custom reports.Cleaning, transforming and structuring data to ensure quality, accuracy, and usability.Responding to requests for information by Heyyyyy! We're Cashrewards, Australia’s most loved cashback platform.Shoppers love us, but not just shoppers, our team think we’re pretty awesome too. So much so that they recently voted and now we’re a certified Great Place to Work. As they say, the proof is in the pudding socheck out this role to see if you fancy a slice yourself. About The RoleAs a Data Analyst you will work to create the best practice in delivering insights to support the end-to-end direct marketing campaign process, critical strategic insights. This includes discovering insights to support the marketing team in making strategic campaign decisions, developing customer segments to personalise communications to customers, measuring the impact of merchant campaigns and uncovering hidden treasures for our product and strategy decisions.You will work closely with internal business stakeholders such as the Marketing team, Client Services, Product Marketing and Strategy teams.Your FocusProviding data support, quality control and oversight for end-to-end campaign / direct marketing executionProactively engage and collaborate with key stakeholders to understand key business problems Translate business problems into data requirementsPerform complex data and commercial analysis to understand how customer behaviour and product changes affect the businessDeliver actionable insights and recommendation in the form of ad-hoc analysis, reporting or ongoing requests for multiple teams across the business (Product, Finance, Marketing, Operations, Member services, Board, CEO, etc.)Delivering actionable insight in the form of customer segmentations, propensity models, campaign targeting & evaluations and any other analysis required to improve marketing performanceLeverage analytics techniques to build models and segmentations to support more personalised direct marketing and optimise campaign activity About YouHighly proficient in SQL and querying relational databases, specially MS SQL. Experience in a similar role or delivering data insights and reportingPreferred experience/exposure to reporting platforms such as Tableau & PowerBIKnowledge of data analytics tools such as Python, R and Matlab is a nice to haveStrong understanding of customer databases and/or complex data sets, including segmentation, clustering, and predictive modellingAgile - ability to handle non-routine problems and situationsA team player - we have a great collaborative and open culture In the fast moving cashback category, Cashrewards has powered ahead of its rivals and taken the lead, serving over 1.8 million members with an enticing range of cashback offers from more than 2000 brand partners including Apple, Amazon, Myer, Liquorland, Adidas, Bonds, Target, Booking.com and The Iconic. As if that isn’t impressive enough, we’re fully Australian owned and operated, and backed by 1835i, one of Australia's leading venture funds. Who is QAL?Queensland Airports Limited (QAL) is an accomplished airport operator which owns and operates Gold Coast, Townsville, Longreach and Mount Isa airports – connecting the Gold Coast and northern NSW, along with regional Queensland, to the rest of the country and beyond. We are an Australian-owned company with a vision to engage customers, connect communities and deliver exceptional experiences – and a commitment to delivering for the communities where we operate. QAL is formally recognised as a ‘Great Place to Work – Certified’ organisation – currently the only airport operator in Australia with this certification. QAL is dedicated to a target of net zero Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions by 2030. With strong passenger numbers, and terminal upgrades underway - there has never been a better time to join QAL. What you’ll contribute to:An exciting opportunity has become available for a Data Analyst to join the QAL team!This role is a permanent opportunity and will be reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence and Data. The successful candidate will assist the Queensland Airports Limited Group in achieving its corporate objectives in relation to data analytics and interpretation. This role is also required to assist with broader business insights, and passenger forecasting & reporting.Finance & Capital Manager Cameron Molenda, who joined QAL in 2016 shares his unique experience working at QAL:“At QAL, I work with a diverse group of people who are committed to enhancing the customer experience for the Airport. We make a difference by working closely with both internal and external stakeholders. As a business enabling function, it’s important that we provide value to other departments, assisting decision-making processes in enabling better financial outcomes. I joined QAL due to the location initially, and I stayed because we have a great team. I can take up QAL’s flexible working offerings and this arrangement directly enables me to volunteer to coach my kid’s soccer team on two afternoons each week. I love the game and being able to transfer my passion to my kids, and their teammates, gives me significant personal reward/pride.In my role, I contribute by bringing both professionalism and humour to our team. I work closely with several areas of the business; I enjoy the relationships I have with many departments. QAL has provided me with challenging scenarios and significant opportunities to continually learn and grow. It’s a great company (and industry) to be a part of. We touch on the lives of many people yet strive to continually achieve the best commercial outcomes. The company has strong ethical foundations, the team is hard working and individuals are respected.”We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who has strong skills in interpreting large data sets and a high level of presentation skills while collaborating with multiple levels of the business.The successful candidate will have:A minimum of 2 years experience, preferably connected to the aviation industryKnowledge of BI Data Analysis tools such as Microsoft PowerBI and SSRS, or similar data visualisation tools.Exposure to Data Warehouse environments and analytical modelling An advanced understanding of Microsoft Excel.Experience with SQL Server Management Studio will also be highly regardedA qualification in /Data Science/Analytics is highly regarded, but not essentialKey deliverables/responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Provide BI Support to all areas of the QAL Group, including dealing with ad hoc requests.Manage the overall passenger reporting for QAL, to ensure accurate and timely Monthly passenger reporting to the business.Identify trends in passenger movements for forecasting.Monitor general aviation industry trends and report on significant issues, updating management on changes that impact the QAL Group.Seek to continuously improve processes and build strong working relationships with internal and external customers.What we offer you?This is an opportunity to be part of a progressive organisation with a great culture and assist in the transformation and growth of the business. Flexible working options are available for all employees. At QAL, we uphold the philosophy that the smooth integration of life and work benefits all. We call it ‘Living Well’.QAL supports an inclusive approach and values diversity within the workplace. We aim to provide opportunities that allow individuals to reach their full potential regardless of their background, gender, age, work status, religious or cultural identity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.The successful candidate will be required to adhere to QAL’s Drug and Alcohol Management Plan (DAMP, which includes pre-employment Drug and Alcohol Testing and have the ability to obtain an Aviation Security Identification Card (ASIC).Please obtain the Position Description by copying this location into your browser: https://qal.elmotalent.com.au/careers/QALcareers/jobs

DescriptionHeyyyyy! We're Cashrewards, a shopping gateway to cashback deals and more from Australia’s leading brands.We exist to make every day more rewarding for our members, for our brand partners, for sick kids and for each other.Australian-owned and operated, Cashrewards is the market leader in the exciting cashback category. We provide our 1.5 million members with awesome cashback deals, coupons and discounts on more than 2000 of the world’s biggest brands. Apple, Myer, Liquorland, Adidas, Bonds, Target, Booking.com, THE ICONIC and many many more call our platform home.Our brand partners work with us because our unique proposition delivers best-in-market returns on their marketing investment, growing sales and increasing customer loyalty. To date we have delivered more than $3 billion of sales for our brand partners, translating into over $100 million of real cash savings for members. Along the way we have donated more than $1 million to the Starlight Foundation, helping bring joy to more than 30,000 sick children and their families.We're backed by 1835i, one of Australia's leading venture funds, and we sit in their portfolio alongside some of Australia's most promising fintech and e-commerce companies including Airwallex, Valiant Finance, Divipay and Slyp.About The RoleAs a Data Analyst you will work to create the best practice in delivering insights to support the end-to-end direct marketing campaign process, critical strategic insights. This includes discovering insights to support the marketing team in making strategic campaign decisions, developing customer segments to personalise communications to customers, measuring the impact of merchant campaigns and uncovering hidden treasures for our product and strategy decisions.You will work closely with internal business stakeholders such as the Marketing team, Client Services, Product Marketing and Strategy teams.Additional InformationCome and join our teamWe have the opportunity to have a hugely positive impact on Australians. We are well-funded in a high growth category with proven product-market fit. We have a unique, vibrant and diverse culture and we encourage collaboration, pioneering new ideas and pushing the boundaries. We pride ourselves on having fun along the way.With our centrally located Sydney CBD (next to the QVB) and Chatswood office, we offer flexible working and empowerment (and we really mean it!) as well as other great benefits including: summer hours, double cashback, discounted gym and wellness offering with Class Pass, birthday leave, and 16 weeks parental leave, as well as countless social events. We’re experiencing amazing growth and we’re excited to welcome new members to our passionate, engaged and dedicated team. Join us for an amazing ride!Your FocusProviding data support, quality control and oversight for end-to-end campaign / direct marketing executionProactively engage and collaborate with key stakeholders to understand key business problemsTranslate business problems into data requirementsPerform complex data and commercial analysis to understand how customer behaviour and product changes affect the businessDeliver actionable insights and recommendation in the form of ad-hoc analysis, reporting or ongoing requests for multiple teams across the business (Product, Finance, Marketing, Operations, Member services, Board, CEO, etc.)Delivering actionable insight in the form of customer segmentations, propensity models, campaign targeting & evaluations and any other analysis required to improve marketing performanceLeverage analytics techniques to build models and segmentations to support more personalised direct marketing and optimise campaign activityAbout YouHighly proficient in SQL and querying relational databases, specially MS SQL.Experience in a similar role or delivering data insights and reportingPreferred experience/exposure to reporting platforms such as Tableau & PowerBIKnowledge of data analytics tools such as Python, R and Matlab is a nice to haveStrong understanding of customer databases and/or complex data sets, including segmentation, clustering, and predictive modellingAgile - ability to handle non-routine problems and situationsA team player - we have a great collaborative and open culture

About CapgeminiCapgemini is a diverse collective of more than 350,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. Job Title: Mid Level AND Senior React Front End Developer
Description: This opportunity would suit someone at Mid/Senior Level with great experience working as either a Full Stack Developer with React, Node or Java OR a more Front End Developer with React wanting to learn more of the Backend which is in Java and Node.   Work in a bigger team with other React Developers with lots of experience (most likely more experience than you). Work for a bigger company but not corporate to give you exposure to bigger projects with interesting problems to solve around scalability. Get a name on your resume that will be recognised and that is well known in the market for hiring the best Devs!   We are partnering with a well-known Australian business on an exclusive basis to help them hire a Developer for their team.  This team is very popular amongst Developers, and they are building Software that is used by millions of people.  The company has a Tech First approach and stability is not even a question! More about the role:     Enable the continued product and platform development of universal front-end by contributing to customer facing code in our React JS / React Native / TypeScript / NodeJS to meet the growing demand of a very large number of front-end clients. The successful candidate will work as a member of a cross-functional agile development team, contributing to the wider development lifecycle by submitting and reviewing pull requests and participating in continuous delivery and release management. Technical Competencies Required:   Strong React experience - 4+ years commercial experience Any backend experience with Java or Node would be an advantage Exposure to or keen interest to work with TypeScript Commercial experience in creating Single Page Applications, knowledge of adaptive and responsive web design principles Strong experience in common JS Libraries & Frameworks – especially React JS AND/OR React Native Git for version control. Able to resolve merge conflicts on your own and aware of git flow for branching / merging A strong focus on unit testing, integration testing and automation   This is a great opportunity for a Talented Mid-Level Dev or experienced Senior who is looking for a great culture and a tech environment that is always pushing limits!  Hybrid – WFH and some office days but has to be Melbourne based. $130K-$140K Package + Bonus Full time/Permanent role All APPLICANTS MUST BE MELBOURNE based and have full working rights.  Happy to share the full PD as well, or just have a confidential chat about this role - reach out to me here - Lindie.Graham@pra.com.au

LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering the market leading LEAP Legal Software. Founded 30 years ago, we have been helping small to medium sized law firms to be more productive and reduce their non-billable time so they can concentrate on what is important, their clients! We commit more than $20 million a year to research and development and our cloud-based products make it easy for our clients to operate anytime, from anywhere! We are looking for a Senior React Developer to join the Reporting team. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the frontend applications under the direction of the Software Development Manager and Team Leads. We practice continuous integration/continuous delivery utilizing AWS CodePipeline. We write clean, maintainable, consistent code, with a big emphasis on testing, quality and communication. We are full integrated with AWS products and are fully supported by a skilled dedicated DevOps team.  As a member of the LEAP Dev Core Product Reporting Team, you will be working with React, .Net Core Restful Web services, AWS ,DynamoDB, S3, OpenSearch, MySQL and MS SQL in an AWS environment. At LEAP Dev we seek employees who are enthusiastic, good team members, passionate about what they do and get things done!   Why join LEAP Dev?  We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland. We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience. Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you. We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these! We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary and bonus that is reviewed regularly, paid learning and development opportunities, access to an employee share scheme that has been highly profitable, free platinum gym membership, great parental leave policy, social events and MUCH MORE!  What will you be working on as Front End Developer?  Improving and maintaining existing software Integrating across a number of APIs Designing and implementing technical/design requirements Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features. Defining, documenting, designing and shipping new features Working with the QA personnel to reduce overall defects and regressions Continuously discovering, evaluating and implementing new technologies to maximise development efficiency. Testing and deploying applications and features  What experience do you need to become a Front End Developer at LEAP Dev?  Strong experience working on web based products Extensive experience on React / Redux / React hooks Strong experience with HTML/CSS/Typescript Experience in working in an Agile environment Confidence with Git version control and Git Flow A solid track record of producing clean, readable, self-documenting code Knowledge on best practices for both UI and UX development  We are in this together   At LEAP Dev, we promote equal opportunity. Creating a culture of diversity and inclusion not only promotes innovation but we believe is the right way to do business. Our LEAPsters bring different cultures, genders and perspectives to their days and we wouldn't have it any other way.   We welcome and encourage you to apply, no matter who you are or how you identify.   If you have the relevant experience (or close to it!) and like the sound of the role and LEAP Dev, we would love to see your application and continue your journey to joining us!

The company  Our client is a Melbourne based Medical Technology company on the rise. With an incredible product offering and a growing team, our client continues to break new ground in the medical industry. This unique business has carved out an untapped global market that is poised for long-term growth. Now with a solid foundation, the need has arisen to bring in a highly capable and autonomous Lead Frontend Developer that can take complete ownership over the Frontend technologies for the entire organisation.The role  Complete ownership and decision-making authority over Frontend technologies, including developing long life span UIs that are in line with customer requirements. Develop front-end code, using React libraries, and ensure the front-end UIs interact harmoniously with the back-end C# .Net infrastructure. Work closely with the Software Development Manager to help plan sizing requirements for tickets created, setting expectations of software deliverables, and maintaining accountability to these targets. Work closely with a team of hardware/firmware and other software developers, while mentoring a smaller team of developers, to provide optimisations & reworks across their current desktop & web-based systems. Actively involved in peer code reviews and retrospective reviews to uncover opportunities to improve coding practices in future developments.  Your background  Tertiary qualifications Computer Science or Software Engineering, where some experience developing software for cloud and IoT technologies is desirable, but not necessary.  Must have proven experience across front-end software development within highly regulated environments or products. Must have solid working knowledge of TypeScript and other JS technologies. Proven experience mentoring and guiding teams of developers on effective front-end processes. Understanding of how to translate UX designs into commercially viable and highly functional UIs. Must have exceptionally strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex solutions for a mixture of non-technical and technical audiences. Some experience of exposure to Cloud technologies will be desirable.  What’s on offer?The business is currently developing and scaling up next generational medical technology for a growing global market. This is seen as a ground level opportunity that will become a critical member of the software and wider engineering group. This person will have the opportunity to not only design incredibly advanced technology but will also be responsible for building a high performing frontend software team.If you would like to discuss this opportunity further, you can contact Lucas Shah at Blackbook Executive on (03) 9823 7407.

Hawksworth are partnering with a next generation esports, sports and racing betting platform and media brand. Australian owned & operated, they are set to become a major player, both in Australia and internationally. Their team is dedicated to building remarkable products for the betting community; designed to entertain and deliver fun, engaging experiences.After significant growth in 2022, they are looking to expand their development capabilities, for their in house technology stack. Joining as part of a growing team, they need smart, and self-motivated people to come along for the ride, to take them to the next level, and deliver on their mission.Purpose of this role:They are looking for a senior back end developer to work on their live, multi-platform, multi-user entertainment platform. You’ll work closely with the CTO, developers and other stakeholders in a highly collaborative and technical environment. Below are some of the traits and experience that will make you successful in this role:  API Development Experience - The primary focus of this role is developing the HTTP APIs and business logic to power their platform. The platform is built using Kotlin, experience with other JVM languages is valuable but Kotlin will be the language you use day to day. Proven ability to get things done - they are a small team that build and operate a complex and rapidly scaling betting platform. They are proud of the amount and quality of work they get out the door each week and are looking for someone with a similar attitude and ability.  End to end view of software development - You will be working closely with colleagues to deliver features from inception, design, implementation, QA to deployment and operation. Once live you will be monitoring, iterating and improving your solutions based on customer feedback. Scalable and Performant Solutions - the company is in an exciting transition phase, as their user base grows they are encountering those 'Nice to have' scaling problems start ups have. Experience and interest in solving those kinds of problems is a valuable asset in this role. Databases - they lean heavily on PostgreSQL database so strong SQL, database design and RDBMS knowledge is a must. Ability to work remotely.  Cloud experience - Experience building applications that run in a cloud environment is essential. Experience configuring and maintaining cloud environments is also valuable. Ability to work in a team - You need to be able to communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment.  Gambling Industry - Must be willing to work in the gambling industry, we understand that isn't for everyone. Knowledge and background in gambling would be a plus. Front End Web Development - Experience in this area is a bonus.  Education - A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent commercial experience.  If you have the skills above and looking for an exciting opportunity to work in an environment that will give you plenty of experience and opportunity, then certainly apply now or for further information please contact Talita Costa from Hawksworth via email talita@hawksworth.com.au for a confidential discussion.

Who are we?     We're here to help people live well and create a better and more sustainable future. We support healthy and liveable communities by delivering water, sewerage and recycled water services to 1.77 million people who rely on us every day and every night. At South East Water, we innovate with purpose and act with care to deliver healthy water for life. Fresh thinking and collaboration are at the heart of our organisation. We are constantly learning, embracing the challenges of today and excited by the opportunities that tomorrow will bring.      The role     Our Operational Technology team are seeking an experienced Senior Front End Developer to join the team on an ongoing basis. The Operational Technology branch is responsible for the delivery and support of Operational Technology within South East Water (SEW) and is aligned under SEW's Sustainability strategy.     The Senior Frontend Developer actively works across many business applications and projects to deliver software solutions for both SEW and external clients.  The role will primarily focus on front end development and the integration and development of back end data and systems. In addition, as a Senior member of the team, the role will be responsible for providing technical advice and support to other members of the team as well as actively leading projects.       Who are you?     To be considered for this opportunity, you'll hold a qualification in Computer Science, or similar, with at least 5 years of practical experience in related fields. We're looking for the following skills and experience to compliment this:    High level knowledge and demonstrated experience of front end software for web development using languages such as JavaScript/Angular and other libraries and frameworks. Knowledge and understanding of web services and architecture. Knowledge of database technologies (SQL etc.) Demonstrated experience in Microsoft technologies in particular C# in .NET. Good understanding of cloud services (i.e. Azure, Google Maps API) Demonstrated ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical problems in an agile environment. Demonstrated project management skills with experience in planning and project managing smaller projects. Experience in technical writing within a project environment. Experience in gathering business requirements and documenting findings. Experience in engaging with stakeholders, with sound communication skills to convey complex technical information.      What's in it for you?      A commitment to work-life balance with truly flexible working arrangements, including hybrid working, leave purchasing and RDO options.  14 weeks paid parental leave for all parents and paid super on unpaid parental leave  A range of benefits, including free on-site parking and cultural leave.  A great culture working in collaborative teams with strong work ethics.  Career focused learning and development opportunities.  The opportunity to be part of an organisation committed to environmental initiatives.  Enjoy modern office facilities with panoramic beachfront views.       We're for everyone     We do meaningful work, but how we do it is just as important. We're here to help people live well, protect the environment, and keep healthy water and resources accessible and affordable for all.  We know to make a positive difference we need to support our people to be their very best. Flexibility and innovation are at the heart of how we work.  But it's our people's collective ambition, authenticity and differences that bring our culture to life.     Our people are as diverse as the communities we serve. Everyone brings a unique voice and a refreshing perspective that keeps us innovating. It makes us better learners, thinkers and collaborators, helping create better outcomes for our customers. Even though we're all different, we still share a common goal to deliver healthy water for life.     We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, members of the LGBTIQ+ community, people with disability and from culturally diverse backgrounds. We aim to provide an inclusive and accessible workplace for everyone. If you need any help with the application process or would like to discuss your reasonable adjustments during interviews, or to learn more about the role, please contact: careers@southeastwater.com.au      Keen to make an impact?     Click here to check out the position description. We're accepting applications for this exciting opportunity until Sunday 23 April 2023.   Visit southeastwater.com.au to learn more about us and how we serve our customers.

LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering the market leading LEAP Legal Software. Founded 30 years ago, we have been helping small to medium sized law firms to be more productive and reduce their non-billable time so they can concentrate on what is important, their clients! We commit more than $20 million a year to research and development and our cloud-based products make it easy for our clients to operate anytime, from anywhere!We are looking for a Backend Developer to work on all of the backend APIs and services that make up the core of LEAP. Our backend is massively scalable and is designed to handle huge amounts of data from thousands of concurrent users each day. It is the backbone of our frontend applications including our desktop application, web applications and mobile apps. You will work closely with the backend development manager to help expand and improve all of our backend applications.Why join LEAP Dev?  We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland. We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience. We are committed to providing a hybrid work environment so our employees can enjoy a mixture of WFH as well as time collaborating in the office. We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these! We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary and bonus that is reviewed regularly, paid learning and development opportunities, access to an employee share plan that has been highly profitable, free platinum gym membership, great parental leave policy, social events and MUCH MORE!  What will you be working on as the Backend Developer?  Building backend reporting APIs and services Develop, implement and optimize stored procedures using T-SQL Working on AWS, in particular S3, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch Designing/implementing reports on web based front-end applications Collaborating with cross-functional teams in trouble shooting issues and shipping new features Working with the QA personnel to reduce overall defects and regressions  What experience do you need to become a Backened Developer at LEAP Dev?  Minimum 3 years’ commercial C# development experience Excellent knowledge of REST services and ASP.NET Web API Excellent knowledge of SQL Server Experience with AWS  We are in this togetherAt LEAP Dev, we promote equal opportunity. Creating a culture of diversity and inclusion not only promotes innovation but we believe is the right way to do business. Our LEAPsters bring different cultures, genders and perspectives to their days and we wouldn't have it any other way.We welcome and encourage you to apply, no matter who you are or how you identify.If you have the relevant experience (or close to it!) and like the sound of the role and LEAP Dev, we would love to see your application and continue your journey to joining us!

Hawksworth are partnering with a next generation esports, sports and racing betting platform and media brand. Australian owned & operated, they are set to become a major player, both in Australia and internationally. Their team is dedicated to building remarkable products for the betting community; designed to entertain and deliver fun, engaging experiences.After significant growth in 2022, they are looking to expand their development capabilities, for their in house technology stack. Joining as part of a growing team, they need smart, and self-motivated people to come along for the ride, to take them to the next level, and deliver on their mission.Purpose of this role:They are looking for a senior back end developer to work on their live, multi-platform, multi-user entertainment platform. You’ll work closely with the CTO, developers and other stakeholders in a highly collaborative and technical environment. Below are some of the traits and experience that will make you successful in this role:  API Development Experience - The primary focus of this role is developing the HTTP APIs and business logic to power their platform. The platform is built using Kotlin, experience with other JVM languages is valuable but Kotlin will be the language you use day to day. Proven ability to get things done - they are a small team that build and operate a complex and rapidly scaling betting platform. They are proud of the amount and quality of work they get out the door each week and are looking for someone with a similar attitude and ability.  End to end view of software development - You will be working closely with colleagues to deliver features from inception, design, implementation, QA to deployment and operation. Once live you will be monitoring, iterating and improving your solutions based on customer feedback. Scalable and Performant Solutions - the company is in an exciting transition phase, as their user base grows they are encountering those 'Nice to have' scaling problems start ups have. Experience and interest in solving those kinds of problems is a valuable asset in this role. Databases - they lean heavily on PostgreSQL database so strong SQL, database design and RDBMS knowledge is a must. Ability to work remotely.  Cloud experience - Experience building applications that run in a cloud environment is essential. Experience configuring and maintaining cloud environments is also valuable. Ability to work in a team - You need to be able to communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment.  Gambling Industry - Must be willing to work in the gambling industry, we understand that isn't for everyone. Knowledge and background in gambling would be a plus. Front End Web Development - Experience in this area is a bonus.  Education - A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent commercial experience.  If you have the skills above and looking for an exciting opportunity to work in an environment that will give you plenty of experience and opportunity, then certainly apply now or for further information please contact Talita Costa from Hawksworth via email talita@hawksworth.com.au for a confidential discussion.

About oOh!: oOh! is a leading operator in Australia and New Zealand’s fast-growing Out Of Home advertising industry and our purpose is to make public spaces better! We create deep engagement between people and brands through Unmissable location-based media solutions that inform, entertain and inspire. Our network is unparalleled, with a diverse portfolio of 37,000 classic and digital signs across roadside, retail, airport and place-based media offerings in CBD office towers and universities.Our Culture:Discover an organisation united by passion, respect, and imagination where you'll find rewarding opportunities, diverse experiences and an amazing culture. With 900+ professionals dispersed across Australia and New Zealand, we’re proud collaborators. You'll have the opportunity to work with talented and dedicated colleagues, while developing and expanding your career. In a community as diverse as ours, everyone here has an impact. You’re encouraged to be bold and brave, to push the boundaries, to celebrate wins and also to learn from mistakes which is integral to innovation. Become part of a fun, open family that’s unified and motivated by common goals and determination. You’re supported and encouraged at oOh!. There’s always someone to help you when you need it.The Role:  Are you looking for your next challenge and step in your career? Want to join a fun, innovative and passionate team of Engineers, and be supported by a highly experienced and nurturing Team Lead? We have an exciting opportunity for a mid level Engineer to join our team based in either in our North Sydney or South Melbourne office locations!As a predominantly Back End Developer (70% back end), you will be responsible for end-to-end software development in an Agile environment, requirement validation and documentation, technical estimations, manage and maintain API services and microservices architecture.This busy and rewarding role will see you working on our proprietary media/advertising trading platform (built on NodeJS, ReactJS, PostgreSQL, AWS) which manages advertising campaigns for 37,000+ assets across ANZ and has thousands of services running and scheduling at any one time!The ideal candidate will be an enthusiastic collaborator, eager to work closely with the Business Analyst (BA) and Quality Assurance (QA) team members to assess requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and participate in the testing process to ensure that project deliverables meet our high-quality standards. Additionally you’ll be expected to identify and implement improvements to our systems through refactoring of existing sites and transferring to microservices. Join us on our quest to create world-class digital experiences in an Agile environment!About you:If you’re the type of developer that enjoys bouncing ideas off like-minded developers, have a curious mindset, enjoy rolling up your sleeves and getting the job done then this is an excellent opportunity for you! At oOh! you’ll contribute to a long-term Tech vision, celebrate team wins (and learn from team misses) all while building systems of scale towards event-driven and microservices architecture.You’ll thrive in this role bringing the following skills and experience:3+ years’ experience in building, testing and deploying web applications using Nodejs, Reactjs, Redux, JavaScript and Typescript. Understanding of code refactoring, design patterns, continuous integration/deployment and application security. RESTful API design and development, and knowledge of event driven Microservice architecture. Experience with PostgreSQL, Docker and Amazon Web Services (or other cloud). Experience using AWS Lambda, SQS and Kinesis would be highly beneficial.Troubleshoot and remediate production incidents.Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. oOh! Benefits:Whether you’re in the office, or working from home, you’ll have the opportunity to work in a truly flexible capacity in an environment where you can bring your best self.Camaraderie comes first at oOh! and you’ll work in a collaborative, fun, creative team and a culture that fosters growth and belongingStrive for your best self - Internal and external training plus structured and defined career paths, NGEN memberships, peer mentoring, team shadow opportunitiesYour leave, your way - purchase additional annual leave, inclusive paid parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers, paid wellbeing day, paid community service and volunteering leave days, swap a public holiday for a day of significanceFree 24/7 medical and safety support including confidential counselling and mental health servicesActive Reward and Recognition Program for peer-to-peer kudos! Discounted gym memberships, clothing apparel, online wellbeing retailers + more! If you’re curious, brave, and ready to leap into a career like no other, then apply now!If you meet some of the role the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. oOh! actively seeks to include and value the unique talents, perspectives, experiences, and contributions of all people.

Job Title: Senior Software Developer (Back-end and / or Front End)
Description: TL;DRWe're looking for experienced senior back-end (Laravel) and / or front-end (Vue3) engineers to join our growing team (multiple roles are available). We're a fast-growing company with a sustainable revenue model and are looking to accelerate the development of our platform to better serve the thousands of customers a month that use Muval. Come join us!What is Muval?Muval is Australia’s biggest online booking platform for moving house and we consider ourselves the ‘new home of moving’. Over the past few years, we've helped over 30,000 Australians book quality moving services and relocate with ease, and are growing fast!What's the opportunity?This is an opportunity to take a senior position in a talented software development team building a product that thousands of people use every month. You'll report directly to the CTO who, frankly, is an absolute weapon of a developer.You'll enjoy using all the latest tooling as our product is brand new and uses the latest of everything (huzzah! no outdated legacy code / systems to maintain!)We believe that product-builders should feel ownership and share in the upside of what they're building. That's why as part of this role you'll be invited to participate in our Employee Share Option Program (ESOP).Candidate attributes5+ years of experience working in a product-focused company (not an agency) using Laravel and/or Vue.js. In the case of front-end experience, 3 years of experience with Vue and 2+ years of experience with another framework like React or Angular is sufficient.You enjoy coding to best-practice standardsYou know how to balance business needs with a deployment schedule to deliver resultsYou like simple solutions to problems and know how to avoid uneccesary complexityYou like mentoring and demonstrating best practices to other young, enthusiastic and skilled developersYou thrive in early-stage organisations that give you ownership, autonomy and a chance to have a real impact on the future of the companyYou know how to find solutions to problems you haven't faced beforeSkills requiredPHP (Laravel)Vue3.jsTailwindMySQLGitWriting unit testsOur ValuesOur values are really important to us. For you to love working with us, they’ll be really important to you too!Handle with care - Compassion, respect and candour. Keep moving - High performance, accountable and outcome-oriented. Concierge culture - Love the who and wow.Best and bravest - It takes bravery to be the best. The new different - Innovation grounded in reality. Slay, your way - Fun, funny but never flippant. We go to great lengths to maintain a happy, engaged team who are aligned with our vision and values. As a member of our team you’ll enjoy regular staff drinks, whole company town halls, team-building activities, flexible work arrangements and more!  LocationFlexible work arrangements are available with blended work from home and our Fortitude Valley-based office.

Company Descriptioni-Motor, as part of carsales, provides website solutions both here in Australia and internationally, to automotive OEM's & dealers, as well as dealers in other industries including caravans, bikes, boats, trucks and equipment.It has achieved excellent growth since its creation twelve years ago and currently has a team of 40+ employees managing 1,700+ websites.What’s on offer: A place where you can move your career forward, where you’ll be continuously backed to make new ideas happen, and the chance to do work that makes real, significant impact in the world. Hybrid working arrangements. We’re a certified Great Place to Work, Family Friendly Workplace and WGEA Employer of Choice. The support of a highly engaged, high-performing team including a leadership team that’s you’ll actually have face time with. Job DescriptionWhat you’ll do: As a junior front-end developer, this 12-month fixed term contract will allow you to build on your existing skills, joining our talented development team at i-Motor, you'll work across various projects that will challenge and excite you. Maintain responsive websites for our dealership customers. Assist with quality control and performance optimisation.Provide well documented, reliable and maintainable code. Research development improvements and keep up to date with best software practices.Collaborate and connect with our team of FE, BE and Full-Stack developers. QualificationsWhat are we looking for? Knowledge and experience with HTML, CSS (sass) and JS manipulation of the DOMSome knowledge of server-side scripting in any platformExperience with performance, optimisation and validation of HTML CSS and JSUnderstanding of browser developer toolsKeen eye for visual patterns and UI component modularityAny experience with AWS, Lambda functions, Node JS or React JS a bonus.Additional InformationA few other things we want to let you know about... i-Motor is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves onfostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage everyone of all ages, genders and backgrounds to apply. If you’re a candidate with a disability or you’ll need some adjustments to be at your best, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.We are a proud Circle Back Initiative Employer which means we are committed to responding to every job applicant.Successful candidates joining the i-Motor team are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis

JBS Australia is Australia's largest meat, pork and salmon processor. The Company has a strong portfolio of leading beef, lamb, pork, salmon and value-added branded products. In our Corporate Office we drive and foster the JBS culture of excellence and believe success is achieved through hard work. JBS can provide you with more than a job, it can provide a long term rewarding career.About UsJBS Australia is a part of the global JBS business, which is the largest animal protein business in the world, and second largest food company with operations in North America, South America, Europe, Australia and New Zealand. About the RoleDue to the continued growth of the JBS Australia business, we are currently recruiting a Backend Developer (Progress OpenEdge) to join the Group IT Team in a newly created position. Based at our Northern Operations Head Office (Riverview, QLD) and reporting to the IT Support Manager, this is a stand-out opportunity to join a team of experienced Developers, Business Analysts and Solution testers to work on creating, implementing and maintaining in-house developed solutions and future implementations, as well as development for a future JBS transformation project to deliver a new ERP.  Initially, you will join JBS as a Progress OpenEdge Developer and play a key role in providing front-line support of in-house developed/managed applications that run a large proportion of the operational side of the JBS business. Applications include sales, production scheduling, on-floor production management, procurement, forex management, inventory and warehouse management as well.  Future state, JBS will be embarking on a large ERP transformation journey to replace all legacy applications that currently support the business. With training, this role will play a significant part in the project and will be responsible for the backend and integration development on the new platform.  Analysis and design working with internal teams to produce the software design and architectures in line with business requirements for a suite of OpenEdge applications Building and maintaining business solutions (focus on value realization) with a focus on test and deployment activities Maintenance of existing systems developed in the suite of OpenEdge applications Support of business activities using in-house developed and 3rd-party applications as an expert providing technical support (some after-hours support may be required) Developing documentation throughout the software development lifecycle Continuous improvement initiatives Business Analysis, requirements gathering and writing specification Cross train to .NET technologies to support the development with new technology applications  About You  Degree qualifications in Information Technology or relevant discipline Previous experience in Progress OpenEdge version 10.c and later, working with GUI and CHUI applications as well as lifecycle management experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as the ability to write technical specifications and technical support documentation Agile software development experience (preferably SCRUM) Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team Requirements gathering and design experience, ensuring that you can work with business users to understand requirements and support the application Ability to communicate effectively with other IT business areas Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to provide meaningful and constructive feedback to ensure processes are continuously improved and problems are addressed proactively and efficiently Experience with .Net technologies (esp. C#), MS SQL Server 2008 onwards and SAP finance Experience in FMCG, manufacturing and/or supply chain environment highly regarded  Interested? APPLY NOW! If you have any queries regarding this opportunity, or would like to review a more detailed position description, please email the JBS Group Talent Acquisition team at jobs@jbssa.com.au [link removed]

- Are you a ASP.NET developer who loves building performant and robust microservices in Azure? 
- Are you tired of building boring line of business apps and are looking for your next challenge to broaden your skills and experience? 
- Do you like working in a small team and a fast-paced environment - where your work will have a large impact on your peers and customers?
- Do you want to work somewhere you can experiment and learn new technologies?

If you said yes to some of the above - this may be the right role for you!

We're looking for a .NET developer to design and build our backend APIs in the Azure cloud using the latest technologies and modern software engineering practices: cloud native (Azure) microservices, using Kubernetes, Redis, Cosmos DB, to name a few.

What's in it for you?

- A satisfying hands-on technical role where you'll brainstorm, design, develop systems that help customers transition towards a world without paper
- Learn from some of the best Windows, iOS and web developers in Australia
- Broaden your skills in a cloud-native modern software engineering practice
- Work with a fun-loving, international team that is diverse in both culture and skill-set
- And of course, good pay for the right person, and flexible remote work schedules (though we do like seeing you from time to time at one of our Australian offices)

Who are we?

We are Drawboard - a small and International team working mainly around Greater Melbourne.

We are a bunch of individuals that care deeply about the products we make and the impact these products have on our customers and the World.
 
Drawboard is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe that a diverse team makes for better products and a better workplace.

At Bunnings, you'll make a positive difference to our business and beyond.Bunnings is the leading retailer of home improvement and lifestyle products in Australia and New Zealand and a major supplier to project builders, commercial tradespeople and the housing industry. Operating from a network of stores, trade centres, frame and truss sites, and online, Bunnings caters for consumer and commercial customers.By joining our passionate and diverse team, you will have the opportunity to grow, develop, have fun and make a positive difference - to our customers and the communities where we live and work.We are seeking an experienced Mobile Backend Developer to join our growing Technology Team.About the roleAs a Mobile Backend Developer at Bunnings, you will be involved in the full Software Development Lifecycle where you will develop, test, run and deploy code in a variety of programming environments.You will join our broader Mobile Applications team who support a number of applications that assist our team in providing the best experience to our customers. Your role will have a direct impact on the work our team do in store on a day-to-day basis! You will have the opportunity to work within a collaborative team environment across a wide variety of projects.What's involved:Support the build and management of the infrastructure and implementation of new featuresContribute to a maintainable, high quality, and performant codebaseContribute to technical solution designs and product ideas with the team including writing testsCollaborate with other engineering team membersWho we're looking for:You are a Mobile Applications Developer who has demonstrated experience in backend development, specifically with C# and .NET. You will enjoy the challenge and satisfaction of writing elegant and efficient code. You will come with knowledge of software engineering best practices (e.g. agile software development, continuous deployment, code review, design documentation, infrastructure as code, etc.).You'll need experience with:C#.NET/.NET CoreEntity frameworkMicroservices and distributed systemsAzure (SQL and NoSQL Cosmos DB)Strong Agile and DevOps mindsetCI/CD automationApplication Logging, Monitoring and Alerting (ELK & PagerDuty or Similar)Test AutomationWorking with Atlassian tool set, Confluence and Jira Highly Regarded:Development using Xamarin or FlutterOAuth and OpenID ConnectSecure coding practicesPerformance Load TestingYou'll be part of a workplace where you'll feel like you belong.There's so much on offer when you're part of the team. Our flexible and informal work environment helps bring balance between work and home. Then there's the fun stuff like team discount at Bunnings and other Wesfarmers brands, incentives, discounts from corporate partners (such as private health insurance) and cost price food and drinks at the Bunnings café. We also offer 12 weeks paid parental leave, regardless of gender, and you will have the opportunity to create a real difference in your community and environment. Join us and experience Bunnings from the other side of the counter.Please note that if your application progresses to the reference check stage, you may be required to submit a police check. If your search returns a criminal record, Bunnings will assess whether the record impacts your ability to perform the key requirements of the role.

JBS can provide you with more than a job, it can provide a long term rewarding career.About UsJBS Australia is a part of the global JBS business, which is the largest animal protein business in the world, and second largest food company with operations in North America, South America, Europe, Australia and New Zealand. About the RoleDue to the continued growth of the JBS Australia business, we are currently recruiting a Back End Developer (.Net) to join the Group IT Team in a newly created position. Based at our Northern Operations Head Office (Riverview, QLD) and reporting to the IT Support Manager, this is a stand-out opportunity to join a team of experienced Developers, Business Analysts and Solution testers to work on creating, implementing and maintaining in-house developed solutions and future implementations, as well as development for a future JBS transformation project to deliver a new ERP.  Initially, this position's primary focus will build, enhance and support software using languages and technologies of the .NET framework.  There will opportunities to build new applications and well as support and enhance several existing applications and platform upgrades.  Future state, JBS will be embarking on a large ERP transformation journey to replace all legacy applications that currently support the business. With training, this role will play a significant part in the project and will be responsible for the backend and integration development on the new platform.  Analysis and design, working with internal teams to produce the software design and architectures in line with business requirements Programming in the latest .Net technologies with a key focus on writing clean, scalable code Building and maintaining business solutions (focus on value realization) with a focus on test and deployment activities to ensure success and operational stability Maintenance of existing systems in a variety of technologies (ASP.Net, c#.Net, VB6) SME support of business activities using in-house developed and 3rd-party applications (some after-hours support may be required) Developing documentation throughout the software development lifecycle Continuous improvement initiatives Business analysis Requirements gathering and writing specifications  About You  Degree in Information Technology or relevant discipline Previous experience in .Net technologies, particularly C# and ASP Previous experience with SQL Server Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Ability to write technical specifications and technical support documentation Agile software development experience (preferably SCRUM) Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team Requirements gathering and design experience Ability to work with business users to understand requirements and support the application Ability to communicate effectively with other IT business areas Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Experience in FMCG, manufacturing and/or supply chain highly regarded  Interested? APPLY NOW! If you have any queries regarding this opportunity, or would like to review a more detailed position description, please email the JBS Group Talent Acquisition team at jobs@jbssa.com.au [link removed]

Findex is building a workplace that is unrestrained by geography and hierarchy. A workplace that is connected through technology. A workplace that values your needs and allows you to be the best version of yourself.

With a focus on empowering, you to work in a way that best meets your needs and those of your team and clients, your career growth isn’t limited by your location. With more than 100 offices throughout metropolitan, regional and rural Australasia, we provide you with opportunities to pursue your dreams, wake up every day in a place you love and surround yourself with people who inspire and challenge you.

We attract, retain, and promote people who share a sense of purpose and belonging. And we come together to achieve amazing outcomes for our clients and communities. We share a sense of purpose and belonging that goes beyond the day to day. And we have a passion for creating opportunities for growth and sustainability that ripple throughout metropolitan and regional communities.

Write your next chapter with Findex where you can grow your career with us from anywhere and be empowered to work in a way that best meets your needs and those of your team and clients. 

What will your typical week look like?

Unlock your full potential as a Senior Developer with us! We are seeking a seasoned developer to join our fast-paced and agile team where you'll have the opportunity to deliver innovative, cutting-edge solutions that our customers love. With your expertise, you'll be able to contribute to blue-sky prototypes, build new features, utilize the latest technologies, and push the boundaries of what's possible.

As an AWS serverless shop, we work with Node, Typescript, and Angular to develop complex web applications utilizing cutting-edge cloud technology. 

As a Senior Developer, you'll be expected to:

Lead the expansion of our internal libraries for reusable application development and ensure the continual improvement of quality through maintenance of unit tests and other testing.
	Be a key player in delivering product deployments, participating in run sheet preparations and execution.


Our team is dedicated to collaboration and continuous improvement, and as a Senior Developer, you'll have the opportunity to:

Lead sprint planning, execution, retrospectives, and backlog grooming.
	Drive the product development direction by providing technical and non-technical feedback on the product backlog
	Ensure development follows systems and solutions architectures in support of the product roadmap and company vision.
	Collaborate with the team to create supporting documentation around software solutions, contribute to the evolving company best practice approaches to software development, and assist in providing collateral to support project meetings and stakeholder updates.


Join us as a Senior Developer and shape the future of our product with your expertise and experience

More about the perks

Starting a new job can be daunting, but with us, you'll have a dedicated buddy to guide you through your training and ensure you get off to the right start. Our well-established Digital team will provide ongoing support and opportunities for career development.

We understand that work-life balance is important, so we offer flexible working arrangements, including the option to work 100% from home. We also provide access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to support your overall well-being. Join us and take your career to the next level while enjoying a healthy work-life balance.

Let’s talk about you!

Motivated & comfortable working in a full-stack capacity 
	Lead a team, run a stream disciple or be a technical mentor…..or all of the above
	Experience using Typescript and NodeJS is ideal, however, a willingness to learn and applicable experience in another language is all that’s needed
	Experience as a commercial developer working within 'product' oriented teams
	Knowledge of 'Serverless' technologies such as AWS S3, AWS Lambda, AWS SAM, and Serverless Framework.
	Exposure to cloud providers such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud & Web frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue


Let’s talk about our team

You will be joining the Digital & Technology (DigiTech) arm of Findex creating fintech software for the wider financial services market. We are out to challenge the status quo and transform ways of working so that together we can create new value and help people thrive. 

We build disruptive custom software for gaps in the fintech market, enabling efficiencies and bespoke solutions for customers.

Outside of crunching lines of code, you will find our dev team celebrating successful deployments, toppling giants in esports tournaments, getting creative in dungeons and dragons game nights, or immersed in robust discussion regarding the future of technology and its role in society in our Streams.

More about Findex

Why Findex? #writeyournextchapter

With a focus on empowering our people to work in a way that best meets their needs and those of their team and clients, the career growth of Findex employees isn’t limited by their location. We attract, retain, and promote people who share a sense of purpose and belonging. And we have a passion for creating opportunities for growth and sustainability that ripple throughout metropolitan and regional communities.

Next Steps?

Apply now – we can’t wait to hear from you!  Please note, you will be directed to our careers page to apply.





Please note:

Only candidates with valid work rights within Australia/New Zealand in which this position is based will be considered.

This role is being managed by Findex Talent Acquisition and we will not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment Agencies.

SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER 

Work across various Suncorp Insurance brands including AAMI, GIO, Shannon's & more
Grow your digital career in a Top 50 ASX listed company & enjoy extensive staff benefits
Provide technical advice and drive the development of digital applications

The Role
A skilled Full Stack Developer is needed to work in a high performing development team in Service Channels within the Technology & Transformation division. Your role is to build Web applications, API or microservice capabilities for Digital Service in support of key strategic initiatives all aimed at uplifting our Digital Insurance self-service capabilities. 
You will be an active contributor to the Agile software development lifecycle and be familiar with DevOps/Continuous Integration and production deployment processes. The role will also include leading systems analysis, design, development, maintenance & ongoing support to ensure that the quality of the solutions and artefacts you produce meet the defined needs relative to Suncorp’s environment. 
Key Responsibilities

Lead design, development and implementation of consistent guidelines and frameworks that build quality, automation and security into Continuous Delivery and Continuous Integration pipelines
Provide technical leadership in designing and implementing automation, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Integration, config management and monitoring practices in teams across portfolio
Provide guidance and feedback for delivery teams to implement best practices and operational requirements such as high availability, disaster recovery and security compliance
Analyse system requirements and develop technical design
Develop and maintains Digital applications
Perform unit and integration testing on developed code including the execution of thorough and effective unit and system test plans and participate and/or support further testing phases

Skills & Experience 

Full stack development expertise including previous working experience in a senior role (i.e. 5+ years’ experience leading/mentoring engineering teams)
Strong programming skills and technical knowledge of React, Java, JavaScript, Spring Boot, Gradle or similar
Experience supporting high availability production systems
Experience in employing CI/CD techniques in utilising Serverless computing concepts and container platforms (ideally AWS and/or Openshift)
Experienced in source code management, configuration management, build and dependency management tools, web frameworks, API frameworks & testing frameworks
Excellent knowledge/experience in the application of Agile approaches

Our Benefits 

Competitive benefits package and excellent work culture
Excellent discounts on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products
A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs
Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave

Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-50 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. We offer banking, wealth management and insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands including Suncorp, AAMI, GIO, Apia, Shannons and Vero, as well as those from our partners.
