Role & Responsibilities:Develop new features for their award-winning technology platformWork collaboratively with Senior Developers to continuously improve product and fix bugsUpskill across their modern tech stack and stay up to date with modern trendsContribute to team discussions and work in an Agile teamRequired Skills:3+ years commercial working experience with Java and open to working across the full stackAn understanding of the full SDLC Strong communication skills and the passion to build a product and take ownership of your workPassionate about technology and keen to learn What's on offer:Competitive salary - $110,000 +superWork with new and exciting technologies across React, Java1 day a fortnight dedicated to professional developmentA genuinely supportive team and great office cultureApply Now  If you are looking for your next career opportunity as a Software Developer, then click on the APPLY NOW tab and send through an updated copy of your CV.

Senior Full Stack .Net Developer - CBD - $150,000 - $160,000 + Super + BonusMy client are currently growing their development team after a big acquisition and seeking full-stack .NET/Angular developers to help build the next generation of their product. This will be part of a cross functional team of developers, front end developers, product managers, data analysts and data scientists. You will be surrounded by people with a proven track record of delivering products that move the industry forward. In the process, you will meaningfully contribute to the improvement of an essential government service through innovation, as they create a national platform for them. Key skills:  Expertise with ASP .NET (C#), including exposure to ORMs such as Entity Framework or NHibernate Expertise with cloud-based systems, preferably AWS but open to Azure Expertise with relational databases, such as Postgres or SQL Server Expertise with modern, component-based front-end development (ideally Angular but open to other frameworks, preferably in TypeScript) A strong preference for test automation and test-driven development Able to design loosely coupled and easy-to-maintain solutions and to help lead architectural decision making Experience with RESTful APIs  FourQuarters Recruitment ContactMatthew BeckEmail: mbeck@fourquarters.com.au

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer - Software Developer/AI/Machine Learning
Description: Full Time / Work from HomeAre you a software engineer with 7 to 10 years of proven ability in software development & production of trained AI models?  We are seeking a talented software engineer to assist us in the continued development of our innovative software solutions, which includes the use of artificial intelligence in the field of imagery.About the RoleSHEPHERD is offering an exciting opportunity to work with a highly motivated and innovative team of engineers and technical staff to enhance our unique Road Asset Condition Assessment System (RACAS) by automating defect assessment, asset identification and software automation and integration. Key accountabilities include:Further Development of our RACAS suite of products including our trained AI model from our extensive database of road captured images by RACAS.Development of new trained AI models for road related defects and assets.Solve complex software problems with the ability to write code in several languages as required.Recommend and develop software design concepts to enhance the usability and end-user experience to meet the changing needs of clients.Development of automation and integration with other software.Manage our GIT hub environment.Familiarity with Linux and window environments.RemunerationSHEPHERD offers excellent work life balance including the flexibility of working from home. The annual full-time base salary range is $126K to $152K including super and working from home allowances, depending on level of skill and experience. About UsAt SHEPHERD we believe our purpose is to use our expertise, systems and specialised asset management tools to make a positive impact on our clients throughout Australia.  We offer integrated and specialist products and services across eight key areas including Asset Management Services, GIS, Road Asset Condition Assessment (RACAS), Valuations, Roads Maintenance Management Systems, Project Management Services (Civil), Flood Restoration, and a variety of training services.Apply HereAll applications must be submitted by clicking the 'Apply' button and following the prompts. Full Position Description available on our website https://www.shepherdservices.com.au/join-us/ Applications close Tuesday 2 May 2023.  Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Graduate Software Engineer - Mid-Year and End-of-Year
Description: Looking to kickstart your career?  Opengear is looking to hire talented software engineers in two intakes throughout the year to join us as we expand our offerings to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers.  The first intake is for mid-year graduates in July, whilst the second will be for those graudating at the end of the year with an expected start date of December / January.What We Offer:Being part of a growing company with in-demand productsA competitive salary and benefits package, including:Quarterly BonusesLife and TPD InsurancePaid Parental LeaveOptional 9 Day FortnightFlexible working conditionsMentoring and career progressionWhat You Will Do:Work as a member of one of our scrum teams building features:Firmware and software development on our Operations Manager and Console Server product lines, orApplication level development on our Lighthouse Centralised Management and Network Automation platformWrite code across the whole stack as requiredBe part of the whole software process, from design right through to testing and deploymentWho You Are:RequiredGraduating either mid-year 2023, or end-of-year 2023 from a relevent disciplineExperience in either Python, Javascript, or CComfortable in Linux environmentsHave permanent rights to work in AustraliaBonusExperience with networking technologies and DockerExperience with cloud technologies, preferably in AWS and/or AzureAbout OpengearOpengear is a rapidly growing global supplier of sophisticated data centre, network and remote site management products. Our customers include tech unicorns and Fortune 100 companies. We are the leading supplier of out-of-band solutions for IT infrastructure management and are actively exploring new solutions for network automation and management. We are part of Digi, a global company with offices in Australia, the US, and Europe. The Opengear engineering headquarters is in Brisbane, Australia. Our modern Milton office provides the option of a full-time office environment for those who prefer the activity and interaction that a busy work environment provides, and we supply free coffee, soft drinks, breakfast, and snacks to sweeten the deal!  We also offer flexible working conditions to support those employees who need a more balanced work / home arrangement.  It’s your choice!

Company Overview: AVS is a leading provider of simulation products to the Australian Defence Force. Our simulation products enable military personnel to train for a wide range of scenarios in a safe and realistic environment. After a recent re-org in technology that allows the tech division to embed and build new engineering teams in all enterprise and divisional programs of work, our client is now looking to ramp-up headcount in a critical client facing business unit.This particular program of work is aimed at ensuring a seamless and intuitive experience for their partners (B2B), where they can easily access products and write new business, whilst being able to offer ongoing support through this channel to the end customer when the situation demands it.As a result they’re looking to hire Engineers with exposure to the following areas:.Net / .Net Core Front-end fundamentals: Angular OR React, HTML5, CSS3 Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP)Functional programming and standard development processesAdditional information:Remote working flexibility6 month salary review cycles If this sounds like the next step in your career, please contact me with your resume for a confidential discussion at martin.connell@tomexecutive.com

About the businessNQRY™ specialises in investigative tools, enterprise search and case management software solutions for public safety and security organisations. We work closely with our customers to build the solutions they want. We have a highly capable software team and everyone contributes directly to our success. There are opportunities to shape the future directions of our products, while also growing your skills and experience in a leading technical environment. Our offices are within the Lot Fourteen innovation precinct in Adelaide's CBD - a unique, friendly community for a range of technology businesses.About the roleWe're looking for experienced software engineers and full-stack (Java and React) developers to work with us from our Adelaide office to develop and deliver modern and appealing products and solutions.You'll be working in an Agile development environment on one or more of our web-based applications, which include case management software and federated search solutions. Your key responsibilities include:Designing, developing and implementing quality software that meets customer requirements and industry standards;Working collaboratively on building and maintaining back-end web services and designing front-end user interfaces;Designing, planning and trialling novel technologies and architectural approaches to solve technical problems in a disciplined manner;Writing unit, system, and integration tests for various software components; andContributing to automation and deployment of software (DevOps).Benefits and work environmentLocated next to the Botanic Gardens on the edge of the Adelaide CBD, our office is within the revitalised Lot Fourteen precinct - working alongside a range of interesting companies at the forefront of their industries. You'll be a good team player, willing to share ideas, and motivated to get things done. Additionally, experience with containerisation, virtualisation, or QA / testing would all be relevant, as would experience with relational databases, data storage technologies and Elasticsearch.

As part of our commitment to supporting women in technology, we have the Women in Technology (WiT) Program, which provides opportunities for growth and development in technology roles. What will your key responsibilities include?Provide operational support for production (and non-production) systems running in GCPContinuously develop and mature Kubernetes clusters hosting critical systems on GKEProactively engage with stakeholders to clarify, challenge requirements, and suggest alternative ideasContribute to the research, design, prototype, and innovate new technologies and solutionsEnsure quality, availability, security, and reliability of technology platforms and solutions with appropriate monitoring and controlsImplement infrastructure as code and automated deployment pipelines What are we looking for?Containerisation, Orchestration, and automation platforms such as Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab, Jenkins, and TerraformSoftware engineering practices, including version control/git and SDLCOperating system administration for Linux and WindowsCloud service providers, including Google Cloud Platform, AWS, and AzureWork with critical 24/7 systems and take on-call responsibilities What can you expect from us?NGM Group employees can take advantage of the following work perks:Health and wellbeing; Fitness passport, corporate health insurance and annual flu vaccination.Lifestyle and giving back; Hotel discounts, 14 weeks paid parental leave, two community volunteers days and three recreational leave days per year.Professional advancement; Flexible work arrangements, recognition programs and employee referral program. About usWe’re NGM Group, and we offer retail banking services to more than half a million Australians under the brands Greater Bank and Newcastle Permanent.We have fresh energy and big goals for our customers, and our people are key to us achieving this success. A financial powerhouse headquartered in the Hunter, we have a workforce of more than 1,600 people and total assets of more than $20 billion.

DevOps Engineer (Contract)    Location: Adelaide (remote, but need to be in SA) Client: ATO (AEC) Rate: $800 - $900 per day Expected Start Date: ASAP (2–4-week onboarding) Duration: 24 Months       Role Requirements  Citizenship Required: Yes Security Clearance: Baseline Notice period: 2 weeks Working Hrs / Week: 40 hours     Job Description  Want more time to focus on the things that matter to you? So do we. About The Opportunity  As a DevOps Engineer within our Software Engineering practice, you’ll have the opportunity to operate at the forefront of technology, working with some of the world's best clients and helping solve some of their most challenging problems. With the agility and energy of a start-up backed by the resources of Accenture and Microsoft, you’ll collaborate with a team of people who thrive on turning ideas and innovations into breakthrough results for leading organisations around the globe. Ultimately, we’re not just making business better. We’re making life better for our client partners and their customers.  What You Will Love Doing  As a DevOps Engineer within our Software Engineering practice, you will focus on cloud, hybrid and on-premises DevOps toolsets. You will work with our clients to provide relentless development, build & deployment automation. You will apply your expertise in advising clients and designing systems to support customer needs. This role also assists with customer relationships, proposing technical resolutions and system automation.  Whom You’ll Love Working With  As part of the Software Engineering Team, you’ll love the supportive culture. We have a Forward-thinking and Inclusive leadership style and is all about Empowering. And in terms of the big picture, We proudly celebrates the leadership of the Global CEO, who has brought our purpose of making a genuine human impact to the forefront of our work for our clients, their employees and their customers.  What technical skills are we interested in you having?  Be part of a collaborative team of highly skilled consultants who share a passion for Microsoft technology and development. You will have access to all the newest technologies and services within the Microsoft stack. Be part of the development team onshore, sometimes working with offshore delivery centres. Tenaciously champion core DevOps behaviours like collaboration, communication, and ownership Work with development, quality assurance, and infrastructure team members to build an effective continuous integration / continuous delivery pipeline. Share best practices for build and deployment across several technologies (Azure DevOps, GitHub Enterprise) Drive the team’s triaging capability by taking on challenging problems not understood by front-line support teams. Collaborate and communicate with customers and colleagues in the projects to ensure the delivery of quality solutions. You will work with some of the absolute best Microsoft consultants in the industry in Australia and our global community.  Experience Required for Success:   Experience in Microsoft Clouds and platforms Experience in configuring/administering CI/CD for Azure DevOps or GitHub Enterprise Scripting in languages such as PowerShell, Bash, or JavaScript Proficient with git and enterprise branching strategies Experience with enterprise-level software delivery and release management practices Experience with micro-services or cloud-based architectures for web or mobile applications Experience with securing DevOps and applications with Azure Key Vault, Azure Active Directory Experience/Exposure on DevOps oriented security approaches (DevSecOps) Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g. C#, Java, etc.) Experience in containerisation with Azure Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, etc. Experience in Authoring custom pipeline tasks for Azure Pipelines or GitHub Actions, Infrastructure as Code such as Azure ARM Templates, Terraform, Ansible Experience in Code quality and security tools such as SonarQube, Checkmarx, Fortify Experience/Strong Knowledge with artifact repositories, such as Artifactory, Nexus, and Monitoring tools, such as Azure Monitor, Application Insights, Splunk Experience with collaboration tools such as JIRA, Confluence

We value collaboration and innovation and have lots of projects kickstarting and in play here at Latitude financial services. We have an immediate need for a Cloud Engineer to join us. The Cloud and Site Reliability (CSRE) Engineering team has a mission of enabling teams and initiatives to best utilise cloud, with a key focus on business objectives and customer experience.  The team leverages the best of breed cloud native platform capability, and often is involved in extending these platform capabilities as the needs arise and facilitates establishing and improving on patterns and reference architecture for cloud-based infrastructure solutions.  As a CSRE Cloud Engineer team member you will be working within a team under the guidance of the Lead Tech Cloud Engineers within streams, building and delivering platform capabilities to tenants and ensuring that the roll out is seamless and appropriate channels for assistance is provided.  Key Responsibilities/AccountabilitiesContribute to solution design in a tribe or initiative, in relation to cloud & site reliability domain concerns.Help with troubleshooting and debugging AWS and CSRE platform issues.Automate all-the-things via infrastructure-as-code, observability-as-code, security-as-code, etc. Code is to be robust and containing appropriate tests (eg, unit tests, integration tests) as part of delivery.Solve technical problems, deliver technical solutions, and self-manage workload.Utilise frameworks (e.g. AWS Well-Architected) in order to help key stakeholders analytically approach prioritization and trade-offsDocument and socialize new design patterns in relation to cloud & site reliability domain concerns.Identify areas of improvement and creating backlog items to address these issues.Contribute to the wider CSRE Solutions Engineering practice to amplify impact and improve productivity.Evangelising the different CSRE practices to the wider engineering community at LFS promoting consistency of engineering practices We use the following Tech: AWS components such as EC2, RDS, S3, VPC, Route53, Lambda, SNS, SQS, API Gateway, and cloud friendly languages e.g. CloudFormation.Application patterns, SOA, 12-factor, Lambda, microservices, serverless & distributed architecturesApplication patterns, SOA, 12-factor, Lambda, microservices, serverless & distributed architecturesMultiple software development languages like Node, Go, JavaMultiple types of datastores & streams (RDBMS, NoSql, search, analytics, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Oracle, MS SQL, Kinesis, Kafka)AWS components such as EC2, RDS, S3, VPC, Route53, Lambda, SNS, SQS, API Gateway, and cloud friendly languages e.g. CloudFormation, TerraformContainerization technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or ECSAWS connectivity capabilities such as Transit Gateway, Transfer family  Let's talk about you! Experience in CI/CD pipelines and practices and tool exposure (e.g. GitHub and Buildkite)Strong stakeholder management experience including excellent written and verbal communication.Strong monitoring and alerting practice experience and tool exposure (e.g. DataDog, Dynatrace, AWS CloudWatch, Sumo Logic, PagerDuty).Prior experience with multiple types of datastores & streams (RDBMS, NoSql, search, analytics, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Oracle, MS SQL, Kinesis, Kafka)Any prior knowledge of containerization technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or ECSAdvanced scripting and coding skills (e.g. AWS CloudFormation, CDK, python, Go, bash etc)Experience with Agile and Lean methodologies is essential.Any experience within Fintech is regarded well.AWS Certified (Associate, Professional or Specialty) - working towards or interested in working towards, we will support you with training and certification.  Sound like you? That's a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas, we offer a flexible working environment and great compensation. We always support a safe, healthy, engaging, and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home and office, or a combination of both.   We're Latitude, partners in money. Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it's taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans, and insurance is what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better. Always living and breathing our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious.   We're not engaging any recruitment agencies for this role, so if you're interested. Please apply directly!Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens.

Hello, Hej, 你好, Salut! 
Flight Centre Travel Group are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to join the team. In this role you will be responsible for the design, implementation and operation of our shared build and hosting platforms. The DevOps Engineer will support and enable engineering teams with our DevOps practices and tooling and help drive the best solution for our customers whilst maintaining the integrity, performance and security of our platform.
 
Key Responsibilities...

Contribute to DevOps initiatives and priorities across our agile product teams
Contribute to the adoption of DevOps practices and tooling such as CI/CD, Infrastructure-as-Code, AWS Cloud Computing & Cloud Native architectures, secure by design and, improving agile software development practices, quality engineering and smart ways to build, deploy and monitor our software
Identify opportunities and execute the automation and consolidation of processes in our DevOps ecosystem
Ensure that our platform and tools adhere to relevant security standards
Lead by example and support teams in DevOps practices & tooling
Be an expert in your domain, live and breathe the product, advocating the customers voice
Craft high quality, secure, testable, maintainable code that is not over engineered
Own the quality of what we build, through automation and observability to ensure operational reliability and performance
Work closely with engineering and product teams to ensure timely delivery of technical solutions to address business objectives

 
Who you are... 

You are experienced working as a DevOps Engineer
You have proven experience in AWS cloud
You have a strong understanding of Cloud Security concepts and experience delivering solutions that conform to AWS security best practice and relevant data handling policies
Understanding and proven experience in implementing Continuous Delivery
Hand-on experience running containerised applications with Docker that are built for scale using AWS services such as ECS/EKS
Experience with serverless platforms such as AWS Lambda
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as CloudFormation, CDK & Terraform
Experience with observability tools, such as logging (Splunk, Kibana) and monitoring (New Relic, Data Dog)
Experience with Linux and shell / scripting languages (bash/Python)

 
What you'll enjoy...

Tick destinations off your bucket list with our discounts on travel and accommodation
Employee Share Scheme through EquatePlus
Access to in-house financial and health services, internal 24/7 gym and End-of-Trip Facility
Receive ongoing training and professional development through the Flight Centre Landing
Excellent hybrid working model
Preference for internal progression through Brightness of Future: Employees have the right to see a clear pathway to achieving career ambitions
Global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses at your fingertips 
Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation, and Brighter Futures programs
Opportunity to attend global awards events, including Global Gathering (Las Vegas 2022 and Bali 2023) 
Various social events to promote networking, the celebration of wins, and sometimes just for fun! 

 
We value you...
Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace that supports your unique identity to create better, safer experiences for everyone.​ We encourage you to come as you are; to foster inclusivity and collaboration. We celebrate you. 
 
Who we are...
Since our beginning, our vision has always been to open up the world for those who want to see.
As a global travel retailer, our people come from all different backgrounds, and our connections spread to the far reaches of the globe - 20+ countries and counting! Together, we are a family (we call ourselves Flighties). 
We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve. We embrace new experiences, we celebrate the wins, seize all opportunities, and empower all of our people to find their Brightness of Future.
We encourage you to DREAM BIG through collaboration and innovation, and make sure you are supported to make incredible ideas a reality. Together, we deliver quality, innovative solutions that delight our customers and achieve our strategic priorities.
Irreverence. Ownership. Egalitarianism.

About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Apply your expert knowledge and proven experience to assist our A-Grade client with their Azure implementation.The Role This position is primarily responsible for managing support for AIHW’s Azure platform and DevOps projects, and is proficient in tools for Azure portal management, source control, continuous integration, Infrastructure as Code, containerisation and team management. This role is a technical, services-orientated role that collaborates closely with architects, developers, and on-premises operations staff. This role is responsible for automating and supporting Azure testing, development, administration, and maintenance. Automation and Integration Engineers are responsible for scripting/automating tasks wherever possible, continuous delivery, configuration management, and the deployment of modules, upgrades and hot fixes within production environments. Routine maintenance is an ongoing task, therefore, engineers of this discipline are often the same technicians performing second or third level support on systems and applications. Their primary functions cross and merge the barriers that exist between traditional software development, testing and operations teams and keep existing networks in mind as they design, plan and test. This role has experience with Azure DevOps and GitHub.  Responsibilities Identify and automate manual processes for new systems and products.Maintain existing integration and delivery pipelines, ensuring processes are standardised and reused.Provide Infrastructure as Code (IaC) support to all development and production environments.Maintain, configure and develop dynamic containerised environments in support of development and production.  This ranges from greenfield serverless environments to full stack brownfield environments.Reduce the time it takes to build, deploy, and configure software to all environments.Joint owner of all development and release tooling, processes and architecture.Assists in developing application monitoring solutions across cloud and on-prem solutions.Work with development and operations teams to offer automation as a service across domains, products and services.Document processes and work on handover materials for other IT staff. Technical Skills (Experience and/or clear understanding) Application architecture, application lifecycle management (ALM), Azure cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and FaaS), cloud disaster recovery, cloud storage, cloud systems management and operations, cloud migration, compliance (GDPR, Privacy Act, PSPF, ISM, etc.), data migration (cross platform / upgrade), containerisation, container orchestration, resiliency (clustering, etc.), scalability (up and out, high performance), database and server virtualization, DevOps, diagnostics and monitoring, modern application architecture, package management (npm, NuGet, OneGet, etc.), performance tuning, reporting services, desired state configuration, RESTful services, security architecture, security compliance, source code repository (git, TFS, svn, etc.), technology architecture, testing (TDD), unstructured data formats (e.g. JSON, YAML).  TechnologiesRequired Azure DevOps, Docker, GitHub, Virtualisation, Web services, REST, Gateways and Proxies, API Gateways, DNS, CloudFlare, Azure Resource Manager, Application Insights. Highly Desirable Splunk, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker Compose  Programming/Scripting languages PowerShell, familiarity with .Net (C#, VB.Net), ARM templates, YAML pipelines. Platforms  Linux (Red Hat, Ubuntu, Debian), WindowsPlease note to be considered for this opportunity you must be an Australian citizen as it sits in the  federal public sector space. Only applicants from Australian citizens will be considered.

Company: Department of Transport and Main Roads
Description: TMR, within the Infrastructure Management and Delivery (IMD) Division are leading a strategic program to enable a collaborative transport infrastructure environment and help the procurement and delivery of a record infrastructure program and facilitate the implementation of Queensland Government's priorities.The program will deliver:• An enhanced collaborative procurement and contracting framework for the delivery of transport civil construction projects.• Implementation of key result areas (KRAs) for major and other designated projects, including the Transport Best Practice Industry Conditions (BPIC), and KRA measures that are aligned to government priorities.• A strengthened focus on performance and assurance to optimise project delivery and reward good performance• A lasting legacy of a safer, inclusive and more sustainable industry - starting with a TMR-Infrastructure Industry Engagement Charter.In the role of Principal Data Engineer, you will contribute to the effective identification, extraction & management of data, and analysis and reporting of this data, as relevant to the activities of the Best Practice Principles (BPP) and Key Result Areas including implementing and maintaining the systems and processes for the building of capacity and capabilityA key element of this role is to improve the use of data associated with TMR infrastructure to enable better visibility, reporting and decision making both internally and externally. You will be responsible for developing and managing cloud-enabled data management and analytics environment, contributing to PAT's strategic purpose in delivering infrastructure programs.Accountabilities include:• Assist in the investigation, analysis, design and implementation of cloud data architecture and warehousing solutions for data dissemination and analytics to suite PAT's strategic needs, including processes to maximise cost optimisation.• Develop and implement solutions to ingest, store, transform, integrate and make available data from a range of source systems, including high quality and secure data models and data marts for enterprise-wide use.• Conduct ongoing technical mentoring and training of peers, related to cloud-based systems integration, software management, data management and business intelligence tools.• Support projects, including procurement activities when required, as a subject matter expert on cloud architecture and data modelling, ensuring business requirements are met and maintain a high-quality standard in alignment with PAT's data analytics platform design and data management plan.• Manage team outputs and deliverables relating to data, management, and analysis relates to the TMR Collaborative Transport Infrastructure (CTI) program• Provide expert advice on data management and analysis approaches and gain greater value and insights from existing and emerging data sources to ensure a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration.• Actively seek to understand the IMD business, how it operates, the supply chains and how decisions are made or influenced, to generate valuable outcomes through data and analytics.This position reports to the Manager (Data and Reporting), Performance and Assurance Team, Office of the Deputy-Director General Infrastructure Management & Delivery.Applications to remain current for 12 months.Job Ad Reference: QLD/484368/23Closing Date: Tuesday, 08 May 2023

yourtown is a trusted provider of services for young people, with a focus on mental health and wellbeing, long-term unemployment, prevention of youth suicide, child protection, as well as support for those experiencing domestic and family violence.
yourtown helps children and young people realise they have the ability to tackle whatever life throws at them. We help them to believe in their unique strengths, tenacity and self-determination. We recognise the courage and determination of children and young people when they reach out to yourtown for support.
Realise your potential at yourtown
your opportunity
The Data Engineer is responsible for designing, constructing, testing, and maintaining yourtown’s data pipelines and optimising data flows and collection for cross functional teams. In this role, you will be responsible for data extraction, ingestion, and transformation using Azure technologies like Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, and PowerApps.
Your role will include:
• develop and support data integration and storage solutions, including Azure Synapse Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Logic App based integrations and service orchestrations. • create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture to support the Data and Analytics environment.• identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing data infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.• create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.• assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.• develop and operate Data Factory pipelines to extract load and transform data for subsequent data analytics.
what we are looking for
• tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, Engineering or another relevant field, and a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role; or extensive & demonstrated experience in a similar role.• experience using Cloud migration methodologies and processes including tools like Azure Data Factory, Event Hub, etc.• advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.• strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.• experience building and optimising ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.• strong project management and organisational skills.
your benefits
When you join yourtown you will be welcomed into a safe, inclusive, and diverse community and an established and reputable national organisation. We are a resilient, resourceful, and dedicated team who strive to make a difference and not accept the status quo.
Your employment experience will include:
• salary sacrifice options to increase your take home pay• opportunities for internal and external professional development• free access to LinkedIn Learning including over 16,000 learning modules• a genuine focus on employee health and wellbeing• yourWellness program includes free access to Calm & Centr Apps• access to free and confidential counselling sessions for you and members of your immediate family• access to discounted private health insurance, banking and finance, insurance, and superannuation through our partner organisations• an environment that genuinely values diversity and cultural capability and is an equal opportunity employer
how to apply
If you believe in the power of young people and in yourself, join team yourtown and have an amazing impact on the lives of young people, their families, neighbourhoods and the wider community in Australia.
To apply, and for a full Position Description please visit: https://careers.yourtown.com.au/
Contact: Lily Welch | Talent Acquisition Specialist | lwelch@yourtown.com.au
yourtown is committed to providing services that protect and keep children, young people and adults at risk free from harm. The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory screening for child-related employment including the completion of a National Criminal History Check and retention of a valid Working with Children Check.
yourtown supports vaccination as the best way to keep our people and our communities safe from Covid-19. We require all employees, volunteers, students and contractors to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of employment.
"In our team we value diversity, inclusivity and people who want to make a difference"

Senior Data Engineer  6 months contract  Remote within AU  Please note there is a deadline for applicant (see bottom of page)  Immediate start, OR within 2 weeks notice  I am pleased to advertise the role of Senior Data Engineer with a fantastic client of ours who are building out their infrastructure in AWS, providing valuable analytical insights on their product. This is a vital position within the team, and the ideal candidate is someone who is enthusiastic about building scalable big-data pipelines to optimise BI insights and product development opportunities.  Additionally, you are a communicative, collaborative, and positive minded individual who has proven experience identifying areas of possibility and improvement. You can motivate others, and at the same time you rely on taking full ownership of your work with a focus on delivery.  Key Responsibilities  Focus on delivery in an agile fast-paced environment  Optimalisation of databases Build scalable data pipelines using Spark, PySpark, Airflow, AWS (Bath, Glue) and Kubernetes Build CI/CD pipelines  Implement and ensure secure and resilient internal systems Contribute to the technology strategy  Implement dimensional modelling  Following Data Engineering best practises   Key Qualification to APPLY:   Experience in software engineering previously  Building data pipelines using Python, Spark, Airflow, Kubernetes, AWS Dimensional modelling  Splunk or Datadog is desirable  CI/CD pipelines using BuildKite  APPLY your intrest via the link below, alt. email your resume to: claudia.f@circuitrec.com.au Application Deadline: 21st April 2023, at 12 pm. Given the urgency of the role, here is what to expect: Candidates will be contacted within 2 days of applying should they qualify across the areas above.Once you have applied, my team and I will be in touch to run your through the client and project details to ensure that both sides are happy to proceed. Unsuccessful candidates will be contacted immediately up to within a week of applying.  If you apply past deadline of this role, we will consider you for similar opportunities in the future. Good luck! Claudia

A smart human once said, “Do things you 💙 with people you care about and good things happen”, and at BlueRock, we are a growing team who love what we do.  We’re B-Corp certified and a Great Place to Work - we take the responsibility of having fun seriously.  BlueRock is a place for innovators and tech-savvy, creative minds and “moon shot” thinkers.Do you love making things run like clockwork? Are you a pro at automating data pipelines and finding ways to make data flows more efficient? We need someone just like you! About the role  Our 3030 team is seeking a Senior Data Engineer who is a master of data manipulation and transformation, with the ability to design and implement complex data solutions that drive business decisions.  As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining scalable data pipelines and storage solutions, as well as developing advanced algorithms to extract insights from vast and complex datasets. Your expertise in data architecture and cloud infrastructure will enable you to design and implement innovative solutions that optimize data processing and delivery. You will also be working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where your skills will be put to the test. You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data that is critical to the success of our business.  If you are a self-starter who thrives in a collaborative environment and has a passion for using data to drive business decisions, we want to hear from you. Join our team of talented data engineers and help us build the next generation of data-driven products and services. About the 3030 team You'll be joining our global growth team. Our purpose is to improve processes so our teams can get back to the important stuff, supporting our clients. We are passionate about empowering the broader BlueRock community with tech-driven operating efficiencies.  What you’ll be doing    Design and build scalable and robust data pipelines and storage solutions that can handle large and complex data sets  Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to understand their data needs and provide technical solutions to support their objectives  Lead and mentor a team of data engineers, guiding them through the development process and ensuring best practices are followed Design and implement data architecture and cloud infrastructure that optimize data processing and delivery Evaluate and recommend new tools and technologies to enhance the data engineering process  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources into a single data warehouse or data lake  And more!  RequirementsWe want to hear from people who have expertise in: Azure infrastructure  Data lake / lakehouse architecture  Databricks, Spark, Delta tables DBT Python, Scala, SQL PostgreSQL  Git  Desirable skills include:  Azure Data Factory DevOps  Medallion architecture  Fivetran  Docker  BenefitsOur people love to work for us, here’s why! Certified B-Corp & Great Place to Work 2023, 2021 Best Workplaces winner!  Competitive salary, free weekly lunches, awesome social events  Flexible working arrangements and amazing headquarters in the CBD Receive mentoring and coaching from industry leaders and plenty of opportunities for growth and promotion Learning and development including internal and external training programs to build your career skills  An inclusive and diverse workplace culture centred on health, wellbeing and fun  How to apply If this sounds like you, then please click on the "Apply" button and follow the prompts. If you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single point on the job description – please still apply. We’d love to see if you could be a great fit and we can't wait to meet you!   For any questions regarding this opportunity or if you require any adjustments to participate in this process, please reach out to Emily, Talent Acquisition Coordinator, at Emily.papas@thebluerock.com.au [link removed].  BlueRock is a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we respond to every applicant. Please be advised that BlueRock or any of its related or controlled entities do not accept unsolicited contact or resumes from recruitment agencies.  For this role, only candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered. Even in 2023 it needs to be said, BlueRock is a workplace committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of age, citizenship, colour, disability, gender and gender identity, marital status, nationality, race, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

The Company: Cadence Connect have partnered with a global market leader with its HQ based in Brisbane CBD. This is a business-critical role, and you will be given the freedom to implement the latest and greatest technology to build a sustainable data platform that supports business strategy. The role: You will be joining a small highly skilled Data & Analytics team. Stakeholder engagement is key to provide leading edge dashboards and analytics to allow the business to make informed decisions based on data. Duties and responsibilities: This is a varied role where you will be encourages to come up with innovative solutions to empower the strategic direction of the business. You will be responsible for:  Developing and maintaining the Azure based reporting platform Manage the data platform required to deliver strategic analysis to help with performance tracking and support future business planning Gathering technical requirements, designing solutions, documentation, and testing Assisting with the design and architecture of a data platform that enables advanced analytics solutions (think statistical and Machine Learning), acquiring, preparing, transforming and serving a combination of high-volume streaming and batch datasets Database Modelling – both relational and dimensional models Troubleshooting production issues and implementing fixes Managing and coordinating release processes, including improving and extending CI/CD Providing technical expertise on data integration pipelines, data storage structures and data cleansing  Your background: With a proven history in the Data Engineering space, you will have experience with Data Processing and Modelling and/or Programming and Automation utilising Cloud DevOps and Azure Cloud technology. You will possess strong business acumen and feel comfortable promoting the value of technology through exceptional communication. Drive a strategic vision and articulate the benefits of technology across the business. With multiple projects approved going in to 2023/2024 you will be heavily involved in the delivery of business-critical projects. This global force firmly believes technology is an enabler to accelerate the business to their next growth phase. For more information, please contact tom@cadenceconnect.com.au 0499 268 599

As the needs of our customers change, so do we. At AGL, we believe progress is powered by our people.  If you're set on making real change for tomorrow, we have the scale, resources and ambition to get it started today.  Now's an extraordinary time to work with us. We're taking the lead on renewables and expanding our products to make them more sustainable, affordable and useful for all Australians.  That's what we call progress. To achieve it, we're bringing together people with unique stories, perspectives, backgrounds and talent - and we need yours too!  About the role: The Data Engineering role is responsible for leading Data Engineering in cross-functional agile delivery team for initiatives and use cases within the Chargers VPP team. By providing technical thought leadership to align with current work practices and drive innovation and improvement to contribute to the design, build and support of the Data Platform  What you'll be doing: Be an advisor, guide and coach to team members Remove blockers - support the delivery teams through servant leadership to optimise velocity, includes getting hands on with code Empower teams through a focus on engagement, embedded agile practices, continual improvement, team performance and transparency Coach and lead data engineers to take accountability for delivery, risks and issues Provide technical advice and thought and innovation leadership that will inform data product design and business strategy and improve ways of working Design, Build and Support the VPP Platform Collaborate with Data Engineers and Data Architects on solution designs and participate in defining and implementing solutions for large scale analytics platforms Support and enable the business in analysing, modelling, interpreting and deploying advanced, scalable and effective data and analytics solutions. Manage team assets to agreed tech roadmaps Manage team asset capability to meet business demand Manage team asset and delivery risks Manage team asset to meet AGLs Security & IT policies  About you: A self starter by nature, enthusiastic about collaborating and leading data engineering initiatives across the organisation.   What you'll bring to the role: Operating in a data engineering leadership role or leading data delivery teams Experience leading agile delivery teams Experience designing and building data platforms Experience working in cloud data platforms ideally in the Azure / Microsoft stack Strong SQL and data analysis skills Strong ETL / ELT skills Exposure to a variety of Azure data technologies is highly desirable - Azure SQL, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Data Lake, Power BI, Analysis Services Exposure to other programming languages and tools is desirable - Python, Scala, Kusto Stakeholder relationship development experience, with an ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience. A passion for new technologies and how these could be leveraged to enable strategic outcomes and solve complex business problems.   We'd love to see your application, submitted by 5th May 2-23  Please note - unsolicited resumes from agencies will not be accepted by AGL. #LI-Hybrid    Inclusion at AGL At AGL, all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people.  AGL has a commitment to maintain a diverse workforce, and welcomes the opportunity for applicants to share their lived experiences. We also recognise that some applicants may not wish to disclose, and we respect their decision. The purpose of the role and your unique contribution to this financial services company is to further develop and enhance our client's Data Lake, Cloud Data Warehouses and streaming capabilities.You will use your knowledge and expertise to build Data Platforms in a cloud environment that are aligned to the data strategy and that enable and enhance our data products, providing acceleration and outcome assurance to stakeholders. Your new role:• Maintain and operate our client's Data Lake.• Develop high-quality scalable Data Platforms based on their designated cloud platform in line with the domain/product/feature roadmap.• Design and develop modernized data pipelines for customers, colleagues, and partners, that are more secure, robust, and scalable than ever before.• Collaborate with Data SME’s to build self-service capability through delivery of consistent, re-usable, and fit for purpose data interfaces/APIs.• Contribute to the maintenance of Confluent Kafka environments including VM and Kubernetes based deployments in a cloud environment. What you’ll need to succeed:• Experience developing highly-scalable Cloud Data Platforms.• Experience on any Cloud Platform (AWS, GCP or Azure).• Experience with Apache Spark.  For other exciting job opportunities and to keep up-to-date with the IT world, please 'Follow' Halcyon Knights on LinkedIn @www.linkedin.com/company/halcyon-knights.Halcyon Knights is an equal opportunities employment agency, valuing the contributions made by all people and welcomes applications from people with disability, Aboriginal Australians, people of all ages and from culturally diverse backgrounds.

Company DescriptionAbout SEEKSEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.Life at SEEKSEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principals that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named 2022 Top 10 Best Place to Work In Tech. We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. Job Reference: 1060119    Your new role    We are currently seeking a talented and ambitious UX Designer to analyse, identify and provide solutions to optimise the user experience for Curtin’s corporate external websites. As the ideal candidate, you will have the opportunity to conduct user research, testing, interviews, and surveys to gain a deep understanding of the user experience. Using your creative skills, you will translate these insights and design compelling experiences, wireframes, and prototypes that balance the needs of our audiences. You will also manage junior UX/UI designers who will assist you in your research methods and design developments. This is an excellent opportunity to build on your existing experience and skillset and utilise Curtin’s available resources to become a specialist in this field. You will have the creative freedom to implement influential change and set the strategy to identify user needs and optimise business processes. To be successful, you will ideally have:  A relevant degree and experience in UX and UI design for web, mobile applications, and digital products. Expertise working with UX applications such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma and InVision, and experience in usability testing with end users of digital services. Demonstrated experience working with qualitative and quantitative user research, coupled with strong conceptualisation skills and the ability to develop wireframes/storyboards, user flows, process flows and user interface designs. A basic level of understanding of online technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript  As this is a continuing (permanent) role, you will require permanent work rights in Australia to be considered. To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Teresa Gumina, Marketing & UX Manager at teresa.gumina@curtin.edu.au. About us     The University Marketing team supports Curtin's strategic vision to be a recognised international leader in research and education. To achieve this, our marketing and engagement strategies and initiatives are built around three areas of focus: brand and reputation, student recruitment, and engagement. We work closely with our stakeholders and partners to help the University achieve its goals and targets and to inspire people to choose Curtin. Curtin University offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package, a friendly and collaborative work environment, generous leave entitlements and superannuation, flexible working arrangements, and salary-packaging. Our vibrant campus includes an art gallery, gym, childcare and medical centre, and endless food options including a supermarket.    For more information about our university, please visit www.curtin.edu.au    Join us!   Please provide a cover letter and your CV to allow us to assess your suitability for this role. If you feel comfortable sharing examples of your previous work, we would love to see it! Please provide a link to your portfolio in your application.    To view a copy of the Position Description, please copy and paste the following link into your web browser.    https://cloudstor.aarnet.edu.au/plus/s/xsUxGlEZ50AFE1J    Applications close: 10pm AWST Sunday 30 April 2023    Applicants should note that prior to appointment, you will need to have a current National Police Records check, undergo character, integrity, and reference checks. If you have any queries in relation to this application process, please contact our careers team on 08 9266 9000 (option 3,1). Please note we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies at this time.

User Experience Designer   Here at Maitland City Council, we are going through an exciting period of change with a focus on Customer Driven Transformation, where it's our vision to 'deliver un-Council like services'. As part of this we're seeking a User Experience Designer, to join the team and help shape Maitland's future. Your challengeYour challenge will be to design reimagined digital experiences, that deliver on our transformational vision and make things easier for our customers. You will be responsible for designing our user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) for all current and future customer facing digital experiences at Council (websites, portals, intranet, phone, mobile, apps), with a particular emphasis on the introduction of new or redesigned self-service options for our customers. You will take validated customer needs and use your creativity and skills to craft amazing designs, while continuously responding to an ever-changing digital landscape. The UX Designer will take ownership of Council's Digital Design System, have the ability to undertake user research, and develop design artefacts that guide their thinking. While you are doing all that you will partner and build relationships across the organisation with key stakeholders including Service Designers, Digital Transformation team members, developers, and delivery teams to design, test and validate fit for purpose solutions that deliver on Council's digital experience ambitions.  This is an exciting opportunity where great work gets noticed, and it will have a real impact on both our fast-growing community and Maitland City Council. About You You will have a design thinking mindset, coupled with previous experience as a UX/UI Designer with an exciting portfolio that showcases your talent. You will be a creative, curious, empathetic, willing to roll your sleeves up, have fun along the way and deliver at pace. You will have the ability to undertake iterative design, apply heuristics and design principles and complete user testing with your design work. You will be experienced with design tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud with the ability to coach, mentor and guide others whilst increasing the organisations digital prototyping and UX/UI capability. Living and breathing our Guiding Principles, your main focus will be the customer experience. You will work with stakeholders to bring about improved digital services and experiences that lift digital uptake and makes it easier for our customers to engage with Council. You will champion the latest design trends and best practice and inspire others within the organisation about what great design looks and feels like.If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.  Benefits This is a permanent full time role, working 35 hours per week with a competitive salary on offer.Council also offers a range of other benefits for its employees including: Flexible work arrangements with a range of options to suit.Great leave entitlements including long service leave after five years, Health and Wellbeing leave and Paid Parental LeaveOngoing training and development including access to Council's Educational Assistance Program, that can provide financial support for study costs and up to 6 study leave days per year.If you're seeking a great team, progressive culture, rewarding work and career development opportunities then this is for you.   Questions?Should you have any questions, please contact Bridget Wilks, Coordinator Customer Experience, on 02 4939 1024.   To Apply To apply for this opportunity, please click 'Apply Now' and submit your resume and cover letter. In the application process for this role you will be required to address targeted questions, with each response limited to 400 words, in place of addressing the entire essential criteria.Applications close: Sunday 30 April 2023Please note, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates will be required to undertake a medical assessment (including drug and alcohol testing). Council also completes a range of other pre-employment checks which may include reference checks, psychometric testing or a criminal history check. For more information about the recruitment process, visit our website and search 'work with us'.We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant

An exciting opportunity has been created to join our Growth Marketing team in Banking & Financial Services (BFS). In this role you will create intuitive, innovative and beautiful digital experiences that support growth and new client acquisition for a variety of retail banking products, including home loans, transaction and savings accounts, business lending & deposits and (in an Australian-first) electric vehicle loans. 
 
This role is for our customer facing website, Macquarie.com.au, and is primarily a UX role, but with the ability to produce high-fidelity wireframes, a strong eye for visual design and the ability to reference brand guidelines. 

You will be joining our collaborative team whose winning aspiration is to become a highly loved, iconic consumer brand by capturing the hearts and mind of our customers, giving them confidence in their financial lives. You will work with a cross functional team of Marketing Managers, Web Producers, Engineers, other UX/UI Designers, as well as Product Owners & other stakeholders/experts across the business. Together, you will design and implement innovative solutions for the direction, visuals and experience of a client-facing product. 
 



In this role you will: 




Create new web-based experiences that promote our products and services from discovery through to delivery – owning and executing all experience design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering. This will include: 


Research and apply new methods and innovations, conduct user testing to ensure great usability of your designs, and balance this against a strong bias to action and reputation for delivery 


Create wireframes when needed, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas. 








Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders 


Gather insights, lead research, analyse results of customer and in-market testing and prioritise insights in order to optimise designs for user experience & conversion. 


Work with the broader design community to understand our various platforms and ensure a considered, consistent, and integrated customer experience. 


Continue to develop and evangelise for design guidelines, best practices and standards. 


 




Our ideal candidate might have: 




Mid- to senior- level design experience with consumer brands, with a strong portfolio that demonstrates your UX/UI design skills and innovative thinking 


Proficiency in Digital Design tools like Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, prototyping and collaboration tools such as Mural.   


A passion for learning, and are always up to date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies 


Experience in and passion for working in a high-performing Agile environment  








Good understanding of sales and marketing concepts and principles preferable 


 



About Banking and Financial Services
Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients. 
Design at Macquarie Bank / BFS
The design function and Macquarie, headed by our Chief Design Officer, helps envision and deliver how customers experience our various products and services across multiple digital channels. We span across the full design spectrum, from early-stage conceptual design and research to delivering pixel-perfect interfaces on our digital platforms. We follow a human-centered, data-led approach to design and seek to win by collaborating with our partners and helping deliver exceptional customer experiences as a team.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Who We AreMarmalade is obsessed with solving the cash flow problem for small to medium sized businesses - once and for all. We know getting paid on time is an age-old problem that often hinders businesses’ ability to secure and serve customers in a timely manner. That’s why Marmalade was founded - we want to take the cash flow pressure off businesses and help them thrive.  Marmalade enables suppliers to “cash-in” invoices early without incurring any debt or risk. We provide customers with flexible payment options, and we handle all administration of collecting payments, which means businesses can focus on what they do best. The RoleYou’ll work in a cross functional team that looks after multiple systems across risk decisioning, payment processing and customer experience.  As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you’ll support Marmalade by:Being a key stakeholder in the quality assurance of our core product and are expected to proactively contribute in all agile ceremonies to ensure user stories satisfy their acceptance criteriaParticipating in story reviews to ensure that the requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable. Ensure that test cases are documentedProviding guidance to our squads on how to take their quality maturity to the next level, so we can ship software fast and with high confidenceRaise any defects found during testing and escalate as necessaryManage test infrastructure and execution of automated tests, and continuously maintain automated test casesWork closely with stakeholders across the business. You will be the go-to person that brings teams together to test and hold us to the highest quality standards What You’ll NeedMinimum of 3 years experience in the software quality industryExperience with testing web applicationsAbility to work productively in a fast paced environment that pivots quickly as we learnExperience with financial systems (nice to have)Self-motivated and self-managing, with strong communication and organisational skills. What We OfferYou get to work in the fintech space - an industry that is full of innovation and disruptorsYou get to work remotely! Our team is based across Sydney, Melbourne, Christchurch, Wellington and Queenstown (we are a bit jealous of that last one)We love those that think differently and want a challenge - we’re here to change the gameCompetitive salary including equity.

Description: Company description:Australian Nuclear ScienceJob description:   Position Overview    Ongoing | Full Time | $92k - $98k +15.4% super Work-life balance | Flexible working arrangements Free onsite parking. Cafe onsite (Clayton - South East Melbourne location) Working along-side teams that support leading-edge research and development      About the Opportunity   We are seeking a self-motivated Quality Engineer to join our team at ANSTO's Australian Synchrotron based in Clayton, reporting to the Quality and Risk Manager. You will need to be hands-on, have an eye for detail, and be able to work closely with engineering and science teams to solve problems and ensure compliance to management system requirements.     About You   Ideally you will have the following qualifications and skills:  A Bachelor degree qualification in Engineering or Quality Assurance. Quality Assurance  experience in Manufacturing/ Engineering industry Experience in developing equipment inspection and test plans and ensuring equipment calibration. High level of computer literacy (mainly Word, Excel and databases). Certificate in internal auditing or a recognised auditor certification Experience in conducting effective internal audits      Your Duties and Responsibilities    Oversee and support testing, inspection, and validation of critical equipment and technical systems, spares, plant and facilities. Ensure equipment is calibrated by external service providers and equipment owners, with the level and frequency of calibration appropriate to the intended use of the equipment, and with suitable traceability. Provide expert advice in tender review processes as an SME for project quality planning and supplier quality assurance. Develop and improve management system procedures, tools and templates to support operations and quality planning for projects. Conduct process, inventory and compliance inspections and internal audits and identify any need for improvement and/or corrective action. Lead complex investigations for the resolution of quality issues in a timely manner. Occasionally witness factory acceptance testing or first article inspections at the supplier locations, as required for operational, capital and major projects. Assist with external management system audits.    Please click here to view the Position Description.   Please click here to view the Position Description. Thousands of scientists from industry and academia benefit from gaining access to state-of-the-art instruments every year. For all other queries please contact Talent Acquisition on (02) 9717 3359. To be eligible for appointment, applicants will require a security and pre-employment medical assessment.   Application closing date:  1 May 2023 at 11.59pm   In order to solve great challenges, we need great minds and great teams. At ANSTO, we understand that diverse teams produce better outcomes and we value the merit that a diverse perspective can bring to our team. We encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, primary carers, those with a disability, and women in STEM. ANSTO is a charter member of the Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE) initiative and is proudly taking action to create a gender-inclusive workforce. Who We AreMarmalade is obsessed with solving the cash flow problem for small to medium sized businesses - once and for all. We know getting paid on time is an age-old problem that often hinders businesses’ ability to secure and serve customers in a timely manner. That’s why Marmalade was founded - we want to take the cash flow pressure off businesses and help them thrive.  Marmalade enables suppliers to “cash-in” invoices early without incurring any debt or risk. We provide customers with flexible payment options, and we handle all administration of collecting payments, which means businesses can focus on what they do best. The RoleYou’ll work in a cross functional team that looks after multiple systems across risk decisioning, payment processing and customer experience.  As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you’ll support Marmalade by:Being a key stakeholder in the quality assurance of our core product and are expected to proactively contribute in all agile ceremonies to ensure user stories satisfy their acceptance criteriaParticipating in story reviews to ensure that the requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable. Ensure that test cases are documentedProviding guidance to our squads on how to take their quality maturity to the next level, so we can ship software fast and with high confidenceRaise any defects found during testing and escalate as necessaryManage test infrastructure and execution of automated tests, and continuously maintain automated test casesWork closely with stakeholders across the business. You will be the go-to person that brings teams together to test and hold us to the highest quality standards What You’ll NeedMinimum of 3 years experience in the software quality industryExperience with testing web applicationsAbility to work productively in a fast paced environment that pivots quickly as we learnExperience with financial systems (nice to have)Self-motivated and self-managing, with strong communication and organisational skills. What We OfferYou get to work in the fintech space - an industry that is full of innovation and disruptorsYou get to work remotely! Our team is based across Sydney, Melbourne, Christchurch, Wellington and Queenstown (we are a bit jealous of that last one)We love those that think differently and want a challenge - we’re here to change the gameCompetitive salary including equity.
