Gold Coast hinterland TMR recovery works  5:2 roster & vehicle or allowance provided  Leading mid-tier civil contractor with a strong presence  This favorable national civil contractor is a leading Tier 2 contractor who work within resources, local authorities and main road projects across Australia. Led by a team of highly skilled professionals within the industry, this contactor is experienced across multiple disciplines including roads, earthworks, drainage and concrete structures. They have a number of major TMR/BCC roadwork projects valued anywhere between $50M - $400M around Brisbane & Gold Coast. They are currently looking to secure a CQR (Client Quality Representative) or Site Engineer with strong quality assurance management experience on TMR projects. This CQR will have the opportunity to work on landmark projects, working in the delivery team and closely with the client. Scope of works include relocation of soil, stabilistion and shotcrete works on flood recovery works. To be successful you must have a minimum of 2- 3 years civil construction experience, strong quality management, ideally across main road projects for a contractor in similar conditions. Reporting to the Project Manager your responsibilities will include: Quality Assurance management, ensuring the project is operating in compliance with ISO 9001 Maintaining strong relationships with the client, subcontractors, and stakeholders Monitor and close out work lot documentation and ensure compliance to the project specifications and standards Contribute to and review documentation, including ITPs and NCR’s Optimise the use of project resources including materials and equipment Ensuring Safety and Environmental standards are met in line with Government legislations To be successful you must have a proven track record of managing quality assurance across large scale DTMR projects or alike with a principal civil contractor. The successful individual must have at least 3 years civil construction experience including 1 - 2 years on main roads / TMR large scale projects. This role is based in Hinterland of Gold Coast. Depending on your location and if you are local, it will be a daily commute, otherwise 5:2 roster & a vehicle or allowance will be provided, your choice! The successful Engineer will have the opportunity to progress their career, working with experienced professionals and a tailored career development plan. Please apply if this opportunity sounds like you!

A little about us at EFFISIONWalk into our North Sydney office around noon, and you’ll find some of us sitting around a communal dining table, noisily playing a game of lunchtime Uno, while others prepare to join in on the next game. We love what we do, and we like to have fun doing it! We, at EFFISION, are a team of innovators leading the delivery of cutting-edge solutions that make a difference to the lives of millions around the world. You’ll have encountered what we do – while buying your morning coffee, doing your weekly grocery run, filling up fuel in your car or renewing your streaming service subscription – without even realising it! We provide enhanced Point of Sale technologies, hardware, software and professional services to some of the largest financial institutions around the world. By joining our team, you’ll be contributing in some way to the solutions and services we provide, which enable billions of payment transactions every year across e-commerce, card-present and alternative payment channels.  A little about what you’ll do at EFFISIONWe’re a growing, passionate team seeking individuals who can be advocates of our supportive culture and enthusiasm for our work.Your role as a QA Engineer will be responsible for the quality of software development and deployment. You will be involved in performing automated and manual tests to ensure the software created by developers is fit for purpose. You will support the development of a DevOps culture and mindset in the organisation. A little about what you’ll bring to EFFISIONYou have at least 5 years’ experience in a similar role You have a broad understanding of programming languages such as Python, C/C++, and SQLYou have a strong understanding of testing process and SDLCYou have experience with test environments and test tools You have experience in writing test plans and test scripts for software componentsYou have experience working with a SCM - preferably GitYou have experience with Linux, including shell scriptingYou have experience with the Agile development methodologyThis is a critical role requiring you to have excellent attention to detail and the ability to be prompt and responsive in a demanding environment. Strong analytical skills combined with the ability to identify tests from business requirements and technical specifications are essential, as is the commitment and drive to adhere to processes and testing methodology. A little about what it’s like working at EFFISIONWhen you join EFFISION, you’re joining a community of people who are truly talented, switched on and collaborative; and genuinely care for each other. You’re joining a growing and innovative company that values integrity, respect, accountability, creativity and fun. These values make us who we are and drive the decisions we make and actions we take to set ourselves and our clients up for success.We at EFFISION offer all our employees flexible working arrangements and a warm, light-hearted office environment. With our fixed hybrid working model, you’ll be able to enjoy all the activities, fun and games while working in the office (like an in-house pool table, daily lunch-table games and team social events) balanced with working away from the office. We give high importance to all aspects of wellness. We promote regular health initiatives, like team step challenges, and provide employees access to a benefits platform that includes wellness and retail perks.If this sounds like a place you want to work, submit your resume and cover letter. Please don’t forget to tell us how you’ll contribute and add to the role and to EFFISION. A few important things we ask that you kindly note before you applyEFFISION will only accept applications from persons with unrestricted Australin work right and/or who reside in Sydney. As part of our recruitment process and per company policy, we will verify your work rights in Australia and request you undertake a police check.EFFISION will not accept applications submitted by Recruitment/Placement Agencies. All recruitment is conducted in-house, and we ask that you please respect our request.***We thank you in advance for your application and advise that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted***

Come aboard… Naval Vessels Lurssen (N V L) is a global leader in designing and building ships of the highest quality for demanding customers all over the world. For more than 140 years we have earned the experience and expertise required to create vessels that meet virtually any set of individual wishes and different demands. The legendary quality of Lürssen stands for satisfied customers and ships that can be completely relied on in any situation.  We are a fourth generation family owned business and we are very proud of our history and reputation in the market. Luerssen Australia was established in 2018 to commence construction of 12 Offshore Patrol Vessels for the Royal Australian Navy over a 12 year period.  We work closely with our customer and stakeholders to deliver excellence in service. The RoleThis role exists to support the delivery of the quality assurance systems in line with Luerssen’s quality philosophy and service standards for the design and construction of twelve Off-Shore Patrol Vessels. This role will conduct quality assurance and control activities and support the implementaion of Quality plans within the SEA1180 Program.  As part of continual improvement this role shall applying lean methodologies and problem-solving techniques to identify opportunities for improvements and to lead subsequent initiatives to convert these into tangible results. This role also focuses on improving both operational and quality performance in a sustainable, long term manner across Luerssen Australia’s operations. This role will be required to co-ordinate with multiple stakeholders to ensure consistency of approach and successful delivery of the SEA1180 Program. ResponsibilitiesEnsure SEA1180 Program products meet quality requirements and standardsIdentify and raise Non-Conformances on products and manage stakeholders deliverables to closurePlanning, co-ordinating, and conducting internal and external auditsMonitoring and implementing quality assurance and control processes to improve governance compliance and effectivenessEnsure all activities undertaken and/or reviewed comply with all relevant legal/regulatory requirements including the (Relevant Industry Acts) and Regulations and Luerssen Australia internal policies and proceduresIdentify, develop, and implement improvement opportunitiesPractice and promote two-way communication within the Quality teamEngage in open, honest and timely communication across the business focussing on two- way communication to better achieve business goals. RequirementsRelevant tertiary qualifications in Engineering (Marine or Structural), business performance, governance, auditing)Auditor qualificationProven experience within ISO 9001 Quality ManagementQuality assurance or business and process analysis experienceExperience in quality management of sub-contractors and suppliers in ship building (supplier evaluation, and monitoring)Demonstrated experience in procurement and contract managementExperience in working in large and complex programsExperience in managing multiple activities and priorities and affectively managing these timeframesDemonstrated experience in report writingWorking knowledge Statistical Process Control toolsIntermediate to advanced skills in the Office 365 suite of productsWell-developed communication and interpersonal skills How to ApplyTo be considered for this role, please click the 'Apply for this job' link and upload your resume and a cover letter explaining why you'd be perfect for this role.  You will be contacted directly if we wish to progress you to shortlisting.  The successful candidate will need to undergo the Defence Security Vetting process, for which Australian Citizenship is a mandatory requirement. For further company information please visit: www.luerssen.com.au and www.luerssen.de/en/ Luerssen Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome applications from Australian Defence Force Veterans.

We are hybrid working that supports your emotional and mental well-being  An inclusive team culture that promotes collaboration and innovation at their core  Amazing development and career progression programs to help you grow!   Let's start by introducing ourselves  We're Unloan, a new digital lending business, backed by x15 and CommBank.   We're looking for smart people who think differently and want to make a difference. We're a tech-first team with a big vision to give Australians a better deal in an important financial category.   We're nominally based in CommBank's amazing new facilities at South Eveleigh, and we are proud to have a remote-first culture.    What about your team?  Our hands-on leadership team is responsible for shaping our strategy and culture; and growing a successful business that achieves our mission.   Our product vision is to create the most loved digital home loan in Australia. A core pillar in achieving this is ensuring we have efficient operational processes that deliver consistently great service quality.    What will you do?  Test planning: perform Static Test reviews of the Business Requirements/ User Stories documents and recommend the most effective way to verify the requirements. Execute test effort and ensure test results are recorded in appropriate system and defects are identified and managed. Develop test conditions and build automated test cases for phase level testing using appropriate tools and techniques. Create comprehensive test data combinations to ensure the correct test coverage. Strong contributor to overall automation framework designs - API , UI and stubbing solutions to ensure effective automation scenarios are built and maintained. Develop a continuous improvement mindset in team and project interactions. Apply a risk management approach to achieve consistency and compliance to CBA testing standards. Collaborate with other disciplines to ensure that test outcomes are achieved in the most efficient way. Provide accurate and timely status reporting to ensure that test progress and issues are understood by all relevant Stakeholders. Create Test Recommendation report to outline the status of all completed work to highlight and accept outstanding issues prior to next testing phase or production. Contribute to the strategic engineering goals within own team to promote the use of industry best patterns and practices. Your Skills and Experience:  Technical Skills: Have solid understanding of Testing process, Requirement understanding and Test case writing and execution. Able to communicate to get requirement clarifications from Dev/BA/PM and articulate them in to Test Scenarios. Experience in executing Manual testing in Cross Browsers and report defect effectively. Able to debug Automation failures by evaluating reports and server logs. Hands on experience in API testing Rest/GraphQL/Soap and working knowledge of Postman or any similar tool. Hands on experience in typescript type Automation framework Experience in frameworks like CodeceptJS, WebdrioverIO, Cypress, Jest etc Hands on in writing UI automation tests, Native web Browsers and Mobiles. ​Desired Skills:  Experience in Playwright Hands on in using GitHub/Bitbucket Hands on working in CI/CD pipelines with Various tech stack What is in it for you? Working with a modern tech stack and forward-thinking engineers. Working side by side with leadership, making big decisions, and solving important challenges in this tech-centric venture. The role will lead to some challenging situations, where you, your work and your actions are highly visible. And that's exciting, right? We hope you think so. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Pty Ltd are seeking a Quality Engineer interested in working on the Archer River Bridge project in Far North Queensland.We understand your time is valuable and that working hours need to be fulfilling, with challenging yet meaningful work. That’s why we’re offering a 2 & 1 roster with 30% project allowances payable on base while working on roster.  You will be responsible for:  Providing advice and support to the Quality Manager for the development, implementation, review and revision of the Project Execution Plan (PEP) and attachments. Interacting with Managers and Engineers to implement and coordinate the Project Execution Plan (PEP) and attachments. Reviewing subcontractor / supplier quality systems. LEAP Dev is the “Software House” powering the market leading LEAP Legal Software. Founded 30 years ago, we have been helping small to medium sized law firms to be more productive and reduce their non-billable time so they can concentrate on what is important, their clients! We commit more than $20 million a year to research and development and our cloud-based products make it easy for our clients to operate anytime, from anywhere!   We are looking for a Quality Engineer to join the Development team. In this role, you will work with a mixture of test automation approaches and tools and be involved in the development and implementation of continuous testing, both Functional and Non-Functional.   Why join LEAP Dev?  We build and develop a market leading, “Legal Tech” product, with offices in Australia, New Zealand, United States, Canada, United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland. We are committed to innovation and global expansion of our products and are constantly utilising new technologies to better our client experience. Our hybrid work environment offers the best of both worlds, whether you prefer to be in the office or work from home you have the flexibility to work however suits you. We encourage our employees to have a voice and to collaborate with each other to work on technical solutions, of course we have company visions and goals, but we want you to help us achieve these! We will invest our time and money in you to help develop your career. Open discussions and reviews will help us understand your career aspirations, maybe it’s a new AWS certification you are after or an internal move to a new area, we will support you and your goals As a LEAP Dev employee, you will receive a competitive salary, paid learning and development opportunities, access to an employee share system that has been highly profitable, free platinum gym membership, above standard parental leave policy, social events and MUCH MORE!  What will you be working on as the Quality Engineer at LEAP Dev?  Create test code for product(s), preferably in a BDD or TDD fashion. Code reviews via pull requests System, System Integration and Exploratory testing Documentation of test coverage & cases Use of JIRA for quality assurance Assist with process improvements to help increase efficiency in software delivery.  What do you need to become a Quality Engineer at LEAP Dev?  4+ years experience in a Quality/Test Engineering role Clear and concise communication skills Good team player Self-starter with a pro-active can do attitude. Problem solving and analytical skills. Experience with Puppeteer / Playwright preferred but not necessary. Proficiency in languages like C#, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript. C# and JavaScript/Typescript are preferable. Ability to apply the Page Object Model for Web automation. Knowledge of other design patterns are preferable (factory and abstract factory patterns) Proficiency in middleware testing and associated tools Knowledge of developing Mock Services Proficiency in writing SQL Knowledge of BDD and TDD techniques Proficiency using testing frameworks. Proficiency in using distributed source and version control tools. Knowledge of session-based testing.  We are in this together   At LEAP Dev, we promote equal opportunity. Creating a culture of diversity and inclusion not only promotes innovation but we believe is the right way to do business. Our LEAPsters bring different cultures, genders and perspectives to their days and we wouldn't have it any other way.   We welcome and encourage you to apply, no matter who you are or how you identify.   If you have the relevant experience (or close to it!) and like the sound of the role and LEAP Dev, we would love to see your application and continue your journey to joining us!

Company: Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation
Description: Company description:Australian Nuclear ScienceJob description:   Position Overview    Ongoing | Full Time | $92k - $98k +15.4% super Work-life balance | Flexible working arrangements Free onsite parking. Cafe onsite (Clayton - South East Melbourne location) Working along-side teams that support leading-edge research and development      About the Opportunity   We are seeking a self-motivated Quality Engineer to join our team at ANSTO's Australian Synchrotron based in Clayton, reporting to the Quality and Risk Manager. You will need to be hands-on, have an eye for detail, and be able to work closely with engineering and science teams to solve problems and ensure compliance to management system requirements.     About You   Ideally you will have the following qualifications and skills:  A Bachelor degree qualification in Engineering or Quality Assurance. Quality Assurance  experience in Manufacturing/ Engineering industry Experience in developing equipment inspection and test plans and ensuring equipment calibration. High level of computer literacy (mainly Word, Excel and databases). Certificate in internal auditing or a recognised auditor certification Experience in conducting effective internal audits      Your Duties and Responsibilities    Oversee and support testing, inspection, and validation of critical equipment and technical systems, spares, plant and facilities. Ensure equipment is calibrated by external service providers and equipment owners, with the level and frequency of calibration appropriate to the intended use of the equipment, and with suitable traceability. Provide expert advice in tender review processes as an SME for project quality planning and supplier quality assurance. Develop and improve management system procedures, tools and templates to support operations and quality planning for projects. Conduct process, inventory and compliance inspections and internal audits and identify any need for improvement and/or corrective action. Lead complex investigations for the resolution of quality issues in a timely manner. Occasionally witness factory acceptance testing or first article inspections at the supplier locations, as required for operational, capital and major projects. Assist with external management system audits.    Please click here to view the Position Description.   Please click here to view the Position Description.     About Us   ANSTO leverages great science to deliver big outcomes.  We partner with scientists and engineers and apply new technologies to provide real-world benefits.  Our work improves human health, saves lives, builds our industries and protects the environment.  ANSTO is the home of Australia's most significant landmark and national infrastructure for research.  Thousands of scientists from industry and academia benefit from gaining access to state-of-the-art instruments every year.      Benefits of Working with Us   ANSTO employees are passionate about what they do. We enjoy being part of an organisation making a difference in the lives of Australians.  We support and reward our employees through eligibility for:  Training, development and mentoring opportunities  Performance based salary increases  Work-life balance with generous leave entitlements and flexible conditions    If you want to join a world class organisation that's making a difference in the lives of Australians, apply now!     How to Apply   For further technical information relating to this position please refer to the Position Description or contact Kathleen Riches, Quality Risk Manager on kathleer@ansto.gov.au.  For all other queries please contact Talent Acquisition on (02) 9717 3359. To be eligible for appointment, applicants will require a security and pre-employment medical assessment.   Application closing date:  1 May 2023 at 11.59pm   In order to solve great challenges, we need great minds and great teams. At ANSTO, we understand that diverse teams produce better outcomes and we value the merit that a diverse perspective can bring to our team. We encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, primary carers, those with a disability, and women in STEM. ANSTO is a charter member of the Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE) initiative and is proudly taking action to create a gender-inclusive workforce. We enjoy being part of an organisation making a difference in the lives of Australians.  We support and reward our employees through eligibility for:  Training, development and mentoring opportunities  Performance based salary increases  Work-life balance with generous leave entitlements and flexible conditions    If you want to join a world class organisation that's making a difference in the lives of Australians, apply now!

ERTECH is an Australian and employee owned Civil and Electrical Construction business with a solid 40 years delivering our services to private, local, State and Federal Government sectors across Australia. This is an exciting time to join our business as we continue to grow our capability in Transport, Mining, Oil & Gas, Water, Defence, Waste & Environment, Power, Aviation and Community infrastructure.
We are proud of the work we produce and the long-standing relationships we build and are now recruiting for a Quality Engineer to be part of our team and ongoing success. Our project delivery experience within the oil & gas sector is diverse and includes delivering construct only, design and construct and minor works, as well as operational and maintenance services across a range of works including both civil and structural works.
Your role:

Administration of project quality documentation, processes and system improvements
Managing subcontract quality systems including audits and inspections
Complying with specifications, testing requirements, drawing specifications
Work towards the delivery of the assigned scope of work, within budget constraints, contract requirements and quality assurance guidelines.
Work closely with field staff, including Engineers and Supervisors.

 Your background 

You love all things QA/QC!
B.Eng (Civil) preferred but other qualifications considered along with relevant experience
Strong understanding of AS/NZS 4801, ISO 9001 and 14001
A good blend of experience; hungry to expand your knowledge, and a desire to work hard with the project team

At Ertech we lay a foundation centred around core values, positive interactions and a good culture and our leaders stay connected to employees. This is a great opportunity! If you’re looking to go to work because the atmosphere is one in which you can flourish whilst building on your career there’s no better time to join the Ertech team than now!
To apply for this position, please click the ‘Apply’ button today. All applications will be treated with strict confidence. 
 We actively support and encourage applications from a wide sector of the community.

Company: Resource Services Group X Pty Ltd
Description: RSGx invites applications from Returned Assets Engineers to join us on a Permanent basis in Melbourne. The Company:    RSGx are an established management and engineering consultancy that have a portfolio of projects across the Infrastructure, Mining, Oil & Gas and Telecommunication sectors. With multidisciplinary capabilities in design, construction, commissioning, operations and maintenance RSGx provide services to a wide range of clients both nationally and internationally.     The Position:  Resource Services Group X are currently seeking Returned Asset’s Engineer to join us in Melbourne Central.      The Key Responsibilities:     Collaborate with the project team to develop a comprehensive asset handover plan, including clear timelines and key milestones, and ensure its effective implementation. Engage with various stakeholders to identify specific asset handover requirements and ensure their successful execution. Oversee the installation of all assets in compliance with project specifications, ensuring the timely completion of all required documentation, such as as-built drawings, operation and maintenance manuals, and safety certificates. Coordinate with stakeholders to facilitate the smooth handover of assets, ensuring adherence to agreed-upon handover procedures and timely completion of all necessary documentation. Provide comprehensive training and support to stakeholders, as needed, to ensure the proper operation and maintenance of all assets. Establish and maintain an effective asset management system to track, monitor, and document asset performance throughout their life cycle.   Qualifications and Experience:   Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, construction management or a related field with a Science or Quality focus.  At least 3 years' experience in a project-focused quality role in the construction or major infrastructure industries. Relevant Earthworks and/or Tunneling experience in a project-focused quality role in the construction or major infrastructure industries.  Interest and exposure to construction project quality management and controls.       If successful, you will find yourself working within an experienced, energetic, and collaborative team environment, with a great focus on stability, and career development. Job Title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence and Data Manager
Description: ABOUT THE COMPANYCapital Logistics is a leading freight management and supply chain consultancy company, working across all industries and freight profiles. Part of the Capital Group (operating for 30 years as Australia’s largest privately owned metropolitan transport company) The Logistics division designs, deploys and manages supply chain and distribution solutions for it’s diverse range of clients. Our Mulgrave based head office provides a warm, family friendly and close knit working environment. The business prides itself on developing and acquiring market leading technology and employs it’s people from a diverse range of backgrounds. ABOUT THE ROLE Reporting directly to the National Supply Chain Manager, The Data Analyst (Business Intelligence) is responsible for business intelligence development and management. The Data Analyst is supported by the Supply Chain, Software Development and Executive teams to create data channels, enforce data governance, design insightful reports and develop data innovations. Using our data-warehouse infrastructure and multiple data sources (both internal and external) you will utilise reporting software such as Power BI and other visualisation tools to build and develop insightful reports.  The Data Analyst (Business Intelligence) will help provide insights to drive growth in new services, regions and industries. This is an exciting role for an analyst with a growth attitude and a willingness to learn and be challenged.  WHAT YOU WILL DODesign, generate and maintain insightful business intelligence reportsFind and fill data gaps and develop new data channelsUtilise industry data to assist with forecasting, planning and wider business reviewsAssist in data integrity design and train others on proper data managementInnovate for new valuable insights and design new methods to provide key insightsAssist executive team with ad-hoc data requirements Maintain scheduling of reports and ensure accuracyWork with department heads and stakeholders to ensure data needs are been fulfilledAssist the National Supply Chain Manager with data innovation and data planningPerform data gathering exercises from external sources when required to gain industry insightsPresent data findings and summarise for key stakeholders  WHAT YOU WILL BRINGSQL skills and knowledgeMicrosoft Power BI reporting design skillsPython and basic program design skills (desirable)Ability to work autonomously on projects with regular check-insTime management skills to plan for simultaneous long term and short term projectsAbility to communicate well with stakeholders and understand varying needs in relation to data outcomesAbility to manage a small team of direct reportsUnderstanding of wider business data connections WHAT IS ON OFFEROnsite parking at our Mulgrave head officeCompany laptopWork from home when appropriateExceptional growth opportunitiesOwnership of your role and autonomy to innovateTraining, mentoring and guidance Access to industry leading data systemsA position in a well established and still rapidly growing organisationExceptional exposure to one of the worlds largest industries and a diverse range of clients and challengesThis is a rare opportunity for an analyst to join an established, yet rapidly organisation and become part of the growth journey. If you believe you are suited for this opportunity, please address your resume and cover letter to Daniel Kelly – National Supply Chain Manager.

THE OPPORTUNITYPryan is seeking experienced Data Analysts, for our federal Government client, to extract and integrate data from a variety of sources to develop and maintain a range of reports and analytics products for both internal and external stakeholders.12-month daily rate contract with a view to extendOpen to Australian Citizens with a minimum Baseline ClearanceLocated in ACT, NSW or VICABOUT YOUThe successful candidate will have all current and relevant qualifications required for the role in addition to the following:Proficiency in one or more programming languages (particularly SQL, R and/or Python) and the use of Excel to conduct analysis, and access to ABS DataLab environment.Demonstrated experience working with big data sets from a range of structured unstructured sources to draw insights and develop visualisation.Proven ability to interrogate modelling inputs and outputs and prepare analysis and advice.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with senior stakeholders and both technical and non-technical audiences.Ability to work collaboratively and building technical capability and knowledge in a cross-functional team on multiple competing priorities of varying complexity and urgency while sustaining positive team culture.Demonstrated experience in understanding business needs, technical requirements, undertaking business analysis and advising on business process improvements.It is a requirement of the role to hold a current Australian Government Security Clearance (AGSVA) at the minimum Baseline level.ABOUT USPryan is a Canberra based consultancy with a focus on delivering ICT professional services to Federal and State Government in Canberra and across Australia. About US  UniSuper is a place where brilliant thinkers and passionate people come together. As one of Australia's largest super funds, the work you'll do with us makes a meaningful difference today and tomorrow for our members, the planet and for you.   The opportunity  We're all here to help deliver great retirement outcomes for our members. Your role as a Senior Data Analyst supports UniSuper doing this by providing expertise and guidance on all things data analysis - assisting our stakeholders to meet their objectives by enabling trustworthy, valuable, and easily consumable data and insights. Besides, you will be supporting the business to make better decisions through reporting, self-service data access and analysis.  In this amazing role, you will need to:Understand, evaluate and translate business needs to data/technical needs through proactive discussions with Business SMEs and stakeholdersTriage and prioritise data requests effectively based on policies & processes and manage stakeholder expectations accordinglySource and build relationships between data sets and different data sourcesDesign and build reports, visualisations and dashboards with the target audience in mindDevelop complex datasets and modelsPresent high-quality insights and recommendations to help meet the business needsIdentify opportunities to improve and enhance BI processes, practices and self-serviceCreating dynamic on-demand and bespoke analysis, models, reports and dashboards that are digestible and easily understood by all relevant stakeholdersEnabling Business Unit(s) to deliver on their core business and priorities by leveraging data outputs and telling stories through dataTraining, coaching and creating learning opportunities to share knowledge and experiences within the Insights and wider Data Office teams. In addition, you will work closely with all other Data Office team members, and will excel inBeing an ambassador for the Data OfficePromoting data literacy and a data culture during interactions with stakeholders at all levelsEmbracing Agile concepts, ways of working and transparencyProactively identifying potential opportunities for the Data Office and stakeholders to derive value from data via reporting, analytics and data scienceWhat capabilities will set you up for success  We are looking for an individual who has worked in fast moving transformation environment and is comfortable working with a degree of ambiguity. Besides, you will bring:Intermediate to advanced level in Business Intelligence - Developing, producing and delivering management information to provide insights and aid decision-makingIntermediate to advanced level in Data Modelling - Developing models to represent and communicate data requirements and data assetsIntermediate to advanced level in Data Visualisation - Facilitating understanding of data by displaying concepts, ideas, and facts using graphical representations for technical and non-technical audiencesIntermediate to advanced level in Understanding Needs & Insights - Translating and communicating data outputs in an intuitive and insightful way to help BUs make data-driven decisionsIntermediate to advanced level in Stakeholder Management - Achieving a proactive partnership relationship and influencing stakeholder attitudes, decisions, and actions for mutual benefitBachelor's degree or equivalent in business, computer science, statistics, or another related field, Masters or advanced degree a plusExtensive experience in data/business analytics with some supervisory dutiesExperience in a variety of insights related tools and techniques including SQL Server / SSRS / SSIS / SSAS; Power BI; Python and CognosHigh levels of attention to detail and the ability to critically assess analytics and insightsAn analytical mind and inclination for problem-solvingExcellent written and oral communications skillsExperience within Financial Services and particularly superannuation (Highly Desirable)Experience in Agile delivery models (Desirable)Experience of contemporary cloud-native analytics platforms in Azure or AWS (Desirable)What US offer  We're passionate about knowledge and sharing it amongst our members and our employees. We believe that a better future is ours to make. We take a long-term outlook and will invest in our employee's development and training. With an open culture where all roles can flex you will also receive:A personal development plan and yearly funding to support your career goalsCompetitive salary with 17% super and highly achievable performance incentiveAdditional 3 days paid leave over the Christmas period - equating to 5 weeks leaveGenerous well-being programPaid volunteer days and flexible working options.Look forward. Think Great.

About UsThe Environment Protection Authority (EPA) is South Australia’s independent environment protection regulator. The organisation works to protect, restore and improve the environment through the risk-based regulation of pollution, waste, noise and radiation. The EPA works closely with industry, the community and government to protect the unique natural environment while supporting economic growth and improving wellbeing. The EPA is responsible for the administration of the Environment Protection Act 1993 (EP Act) and the Radiation Protection and Control Act 2021 (RPC Act) and also exercises responsibilities under other South Australian planning and environmental legislation.About the RoleThe Senior Adviser – Data Analyst is responsible for developing and implementing data collection and analysis techniques and undertaking data analysis to inform the EPA’s strategic decision making capability. The role involves the collection, analysis and interpretation of material flow and waste levy data to inform the EPA’s regulatory and monitoring requirements around resource recovery as well as a broader range of regulated activities.Please note that the contract being offered for this role is a backfill contract whilst the substantive employee is on maternity leave.What the EPA OffersThe EPA boasts a range of different flexible working arrangements which include flexitime (flexible start and finish times), working from home, compressed weeks and purchased leave.The EPA understands that there is more to life than working and as such prioritise people first. We want our employees to feel that their working needs will be met in this modern and ever-evolving working landscape.Desirable QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematical Sciences/Statistics, Economics or related discipline.Special ConditionsInter and intra state travel and some out of hours work may be required.RemunerationASO6 ($95,588 - $101,109 per annum) + 10.5% super to your choice of superfund.ContractLong term contract (maternity leave backfill contract until 30 January 2025) and full time (37.5 hours per week).EnquiriesKate HamerPrincipal Adviser Regulatory Strategy and IntelligencePhone Enquiries: (08) 8429 2604Email Enquiries: kate.hamer@sa.gov.au Applications ToEPAApply@sa.gov.au (via the I Work For SA website) Vacancy Number529372Applications Close Date04/05/2023 (11.45PM ACST)

Job Title: Data Analyst - Mid and Senior levels
Description:
Join a high performing Data Team to work on exciting pieces of work and collaborate on transformative projects within the Commodities and Global Markets Group. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to work on a significant program of work at Macquarie. We are open to candidates at varying levels for this role and would love to hear from you if you have experience as a Data Analyst, and enjoy working with complex datasets and challenging work.
You will be someone who thinks strategically, challenges the norm, collaborates efficiently, and has an eye for detail. You will be able to break down complex problems and offer implementable, innovative, and intuitive solutions.
 
As a Data Analyst, you will: 

Work closely with stakeholders to understand the business, capture data requirements and data consumption use cases
Synthesize disparate requirements and translate business concepts into understandable and usable strategic data models, optimising the accessibility and usage of data
Publish models using standardised methods and effectively communicate these models to a diverse audience
Work collaboratively with data architects and system stakeholders to develop and maintain data models across all lines of business
Interpret and analyse trade data in relation to regulatory reporting

What skills will you use?

Ability to work with business stakeholders to understand and translate business requirements and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models
Excellent analytical capacity supported by clear and concise communication skills
experience interpreting and wrangling data, with experience with at least two coding languages such as python and SQL.
Ability to embrace change, flex, and adapt to the changing needs of our dynamic business
Understanding of end-to-end processing of data from ingestion through to reporting and analytics
Experience using Dataiku would be a bonus, along with finance domain knowledge - particularly related to commodities, financial markets, regulatory, risk, or financial transformation

At Macquarie, we work to a hybrid model. Successful candidates have the option to work from home 1-2x days per week and from our Sydney office for the remainder, to strengthen your working relationships while supporting your development and wellbeing. If you are located outside of Sydney, please highlight on your CV if you are wishing to relocate or otherwise.
If you are looking to grow your career in data and projects with a desire to leverage your technical skills and learn more about the Commodities and Global Markets business domain in a dynamic and professional environment then please apply via the link below.
 
About Commodities and Global Markets
In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About the RoleYou will be based in our Operations Control Centre in Canberra. You will work as part of a highly motivated team responsible for the safe and efficient monitoring and control of our renewable energy assets. You will be a dedicated team player with high standards and attention to detail, motivated to deliver a first-class professional monitoring and control service. Responsibilities  Monitoring & Controlling the assets via SCADA Systems, reacting to new and developing events in the Australian National Electricity Market; Reacting to plant and market notifications and alerts, including working closely with the wider operational team as required; Interfacing with Transmission and Network Service Providers (TNSP), AEMO and other applicable entities regarding asset outages, generation constraints (curtailment) or specific production/network conditions; Monitoring weather forecast systems and issuing alerts, handling emergency calls from asset personnel or other stakeholders; Contribution/production of daily, week, monthly & quarterly operational reports; Liaising with O&M Contractors to maximise availability. Maintaining operational relationships with O&M Contractors, AEMO, TNSPs, Governments, off takers and PPA representatives, as required Coordinating specific maintenance and outage performance on behalf of the Asset Manager, including communication with Contractor,  TNSP and AEMO; Continuous improvement of OCC systems, functions and procedures to deliver increased performance based on Key Performance Indicators.  Skills & Experience    You hold a relevant degree in engineering, data science, commerce or a similar field; You are comfortable with Excel, analysing data and communicating your results. You are rigorous and analytical; You are reliable, organised and team focused;  You are experienced and/or comfortable with working in a 24/7/365 shift-based team; You have a capacity to work under intense and constant operational pressure. Therefore, you can sustain the necessary concentration levels for long periods of time; Your English is fluent (written and spoken); Previous experience in a trading desk or a control centre would be highly regarded.  How to applyIf you are interested, and believe you have the required skill set and experience, please apply now with your updated CV. You can also email tom.hamilton@acrworld.com or call 02 8079 0900 for a confidential discussion.

Permanent - Full-time position – St Kilda Road, VIC
Supportive team environment; Flexible work balance (WFH/Office)
High growth business, ASX 100 listed

Who we are
When you start to think of waste as a resource, it opens up a world of possibilities. Cleanaway is the largest waste management company in Australia providing sustainable waste management solutions to a range of customers including councils, small businesses, large corporate entities and government agencies.
About the role:
Cleanaway is an ASX100 company with a strong focus on sustainability, making it an exciting place to work for those who are passionate about environmental causes.
As a Business Analyst, with at least 4 years of experience, you will be responsible for leading cross-company projects in the Data & Analytics space, working with data from a wide range of sources, including everything from Telemetry, IoT and GPS, to HR systems, ERP, and more.
You will use your expertise to create data assets in Cleanaway's Enterprise Data Warehouse and deliver reporting and Business Intelligence solutions for both internal and external stakeholders. You will be an advocate of the Data & Analytics team and and help to improve data quality and governance processes across the business.
If you have a passion for Data & Analytics, this is an exciting opportunity for you to work alongside a diverse team of talented individuals who value collaboration and support, and are focused on making a real impact at Cleanaway
The position

Collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders to gather comprehensive requirements that underpin the creation of data assets in the EDW, data science features and reporting solutions
Analyse source systems, legacy reports and identify overlapping concepts and attributes to build optimal solutions in Power BI that meet business requirements
Conduct impact assessments and root cause analysis to identify and troubleshoot data issues, and perform rigorous testing and data reconciliation
Create and maintain technical specification documents such as business requirements documentation, report functional specifications, data transformation, source to target mappings, data dictionary etc
Liaise with solutions architects, data analysts and engieneers to ensure solutions are of a high standard and meet the needs of our stakeholders
Support backlog grooming and requirement refinement sessions, and play an active role in scoping new projects while prioritising projects on the team's roadmap
Support the business with transition to Power BI reporting and self-serve capability

Required Skills

In-depth experience working as a Business Analyst in the data and analytics field to deliver insightful analysis and reporting solutions
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills to support negotiation, conflict resolution and prioritization discussions
Experience gathering requirements and challenging existing ways of thinking to identify the most efficient method of design. Adept at documenting functional and non-functional requirements in a data landscape
Strong problem-solving capabilities and demonstrated experience in working independently and handling tasks with analytical skills
Excellent SQL knowledge and practical experience of data exploration, data quality analysis, testing and data reconciliation
Knowledge of ERD, Data Modelling and Data Warehouse principals
Demonstrated ability to self-manage with competing priorities; High attention to detail and well organised
Experience participating in scrum-based agile teams
Degree qualified in a relevant commercial, analytical or mathematical discipline
ITIL or ITSM certification or equivalent experience; Multiple elicitation techniques knowledge

Desirable Skills

Understanding of the services industry, preferably with applicable experience
Experience with one or more analysis tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlilk, Looker, Cognos, SSRS or equivalent
Knowledge of ETL process and tools (Informatica, Talend, Alteryx)
Knowledge of Data Governance concepts including Privacy and Security considerations
Experience with business change management
Experience with visualization story telling and and using data to support business decisions
Knowledge of Cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure or AWS
